original: so so'i skye bo nges par 'byung ba'i 'du shes can dag ni de la snyoms par 'jug ste /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo nges par 'byung ba'i 'du shes can dag ni de la snyoms par 'jug ste /
translated: Ordinary worldlings who possess the idea of deliverance enter it.

original: thar par 'du shes pa dag ces bya @147b ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: thar par 'du shes pa dag ces bya @147b ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The idea of liberation is the idea of nirvana.

original: 'phags pa dag ni de ltar 'du shes phyin ci log pa can ma yin no //
analyzed: 'phags pa dag ni de ltar 'du shes phyin ci log pa can ma yin no //
translated: But noble ones do not possess the idea of error.üîΩObjection: Just as one obtains the meditative attainment of cessation, so too one obtains the meditative attainments of the four meditations.

original: bsam gtan bzhin du 'thob ma zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor pa dag bsam gtan bzhi pa thob nas thog ma med pa can gyi 'khor ba nas bsam gtan bzhi pa sngon thob pa 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa so sor 'thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhin du 'thob ma zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor pa dag bsam gtan bzhi pa thob nas thog ma med pa can gyi 'khor ba nas bsam gtan bzhi pa sngon thob pa 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa so sor 'thob par 'gyur te /
translated: When yogins obtain the fourth meditation, they obtain the past and future fourth meditations that they have previously obtained and not previously obtained, respectively, since beginningless samsara.

original: de lta bas na ci de dang 'dra ba kho nar 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag kyang 'thob bam zhes 'dri bar byed do //
analyzed: de lta bas na ci de dang 'dra ba kho nar 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag kyang 'thob bam zhes 'dri bar byed do //
translated: Thus, one asks: Is it in the same way that one obtains the past and future meditative attainments of the four meditations?

original: re zhig gzhan dag gis kyang mi 'thob bo zhes bya ba ni re zhig snyoms par 'jug pa 'di gang dag gis bdag nyid kyi yin pa so so'i skye bo dag gis kyang 'das pa mi 'thob na /
analyzed: re zhig gzhan dag gis kyang mi 'thob bo zhes bya ba ni re zhig snyoms par 'jug pa 'di gang dag gis bdag nyid kyi yin pa so so'i skye bo dag gis kyang 'das pa mi 'thob na /
translated: Objection: One does not obtain the meditative attainment of cessation in the same way that one obtains the meditative attainment of the four meditations.

original: 'di gang dag gi bdag nyid kyi ma yin pa 'phags pa dag gis lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di gang dag gi bdag nyid kyi ma yin pa 'phags pa dag gis lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: What need is there to speak of ƒÅryas, who are not of the nature of those?

original: 'di ni 'dris pa yin yang zhes bya ba ni thog ma med pa can gyi 'khor ba na sngon thob pa yin yang ngo //
analyzed: 'di ni 'dris pa yin yang zhes bya ba ni thog ma med pa can gyi 'khor ba na sngon thob pa yin yang ngo //
translated: Even though it is familiar means even though it was obtained previously in beginningless cyclic existence.

original: mngon par 'du bya ba chen pos bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir dang / sems med pa pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'bad pa chen pos bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mngon par 'du bya ba chen pos bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir dang / sems med pa pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'bad pa chen pos bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Because it is accomplished through great effort and because it is mindless means because it is accomplished through great exertion.

original: dus gcig 'thob ces bya ba ni dus mnyam pa 'thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dus gcig 'thob ces bya ba ni dus mnyam pa 'thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Obtained simultaneously means obtained at the same time.

original: so sor thar pa'i sdom pa ji lta ba bzhin zhes bya ba ni rnam pa brgyad car yang gang gi tshe yang dag par nod pa de'i tshe de 'thob la de'i 'thob pa yang skad cig ma de nyid kyi tshe skye ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: so sor thar pa'i sdom pa ji lta ba bzhin zhes bya ba ni rnam pa brgyad car yang gang gi tshe yang dag par nod pa de'i tshe de 'thob la de'i 'thob pa yang skad cig ma de nyid kyi tshe skye ba lta bu'o //
translated: Just as the vows of individual liberation are obtained means just as the eight types of vows of individual liberation are obtained when they are properly received, and their obtainment arises at the time of the instant they are received.

original: skad cig ma gnyis pa la sogs par ni ji srid snyoms par 'jug pa de mi gtong ba de srid du snyoms par 'jug pa thob pa de dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: skad cig ma gnyis pa la sogs par ni ji srid snyoms par 'jug pa de mi gtong ba de srid du snyoms par 'jug pa thob pa de dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: In the second moment and so on, as long as one does not rise from meditative attainment, one possesses the meditative attainment that was obtained.

original: de gtong ba ni yongs su nyams pa 'am 'phos pa'i sgo nas yin no //
analyzed: de gtong ba ni yongs su nyams pa 'am 'phos pa'i sgo nas yin no //
translated: One relinquishes it through retrogressing or through transference to another stage.

original: sems med pa pa yin pa'i phyir ma 'ongs pa ni mi 'thob ste dge ba'i sems ni ma 'ongs pa thob par 'gyur gyi sems med pa 'di ni ma yin pas de dang 'dra bar ma 'ongs pa 'thob par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems med pa pa yin pa'i phyir ma 'ongs pa ni mi 'thob ste dge ba'i sems ni ma 'ongs pa thob par 'gyur gyi sems med pa 'di ni ma yin pas de dang 'dra bar ma 'ongs pa 'thob par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: One does not obtain future meditative attainment because it is devoid of mind, for one obtains a virtuous mind in the future, but not this meditative attainment devoid of mind.

original: 'gog pa zhes pa'ang de bzhin nyid ces bya ba ni snyoms par 'jug pa zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'gog pa zhes pa'ang de bzhin nyid ces bya ba ni snyoms par 'jug pa zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúit is also called cessation‚Äù is connected to the phrase ‚Äúit is also called meditative attainment.‚Äù

original: nyid ces bya ba'i sgra ni nges par gzung ba yin te /
analyzed: nyid ces bya ba'i sgra ni nges par gzung ba yin te /
translated: The word also indicates that it is definitely both.

original: ji ltar 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bstan pa de bzhin zhes bya ba'i sgras /
analyzed: ji ltar 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bstan pa de bzhin zhes bya ba'i sgras /
translated: The phrase ‚Äújust as the meditative attainment of nonperception‚Äù indicates that the meditative attainment of cessation is also like the meditative attainment of nonperception.

original: sems dang sems pa las byung rnams //
analyzed: sems dang sems pa las byung rnams //
translated: The root text states, ‚ÄúIt is the cessation of mind and mental factors.‚Äù

original: 'gog pa'o zhes bya ba mthun par bsgres pa de @148a * //
analyzed: 'gog pa'o zhes bya ba mthun par bsgres pa de @148a * //
translated: The meditative attainment of cessation is similar to that.

original: bzhin du 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bstan pa 'di yang rnam pa de nyid mthun par bsgre'o zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: bzhin du 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bstan pa 'di yang rnam pa de nyid mthun par bsgre'o zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Just as the meditative attainment of non-perception is similar to the meditative attainment of unconsciousness, so too is the teaching of the meditative attainment of cessation similar to that.

original: zhi bar gnas pa'i 'du shes sngon du btang ba'i yid la byed pas zhes bya ba la /üîΩgnas pa ni rtsed mos gnas pa dang 'dra bar gnas pa ste /
analyzed: zhi bar gnas pa'i 'du shes sngon du btang ba'i yid la byed pas zhes bya ba la / gnas pa ni rtsed mos gnas pa dang 'dra bar gnas pa ste /
translated: It is a meditative attainment preceded by the attention of the perception of peaceful abiding.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par yin no //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par yin no //
translated: Abiding is like abiding in play, it is a special meditative stabilization.

original: gnas pa zhi ba ni zhi bar gnas pa'o //
analyzed: gnas pa zhi ba ni zhi bar gnas pa'o //
translated: Peaceful abiding is peaceful abiding.

original: zhi bar gnas par bya bar 'du shes pa ni zhi bar gnas par 'du shes pa'o //
analyzed: zhi bar gnas par bya bar 'du shes pa ni zhi bar gnas par 'du shes pa'o //
translated: The perception of peaceful abiding is the perception of peaceful abiding.

original: 'di la de sngon du 'gro ba yod pas na zhi bar gnas pa'i 'du shes sngon du 'gro ba'i yid la byed pa ste /
analyzed: 'di la de sngon du 'gro ba yod pas na zhi bar gnas pa'i 'du shes sngon du 'gro ba'i yid la byed pa ste /
translated: Since it is preceded by that, it is the attention of the perception of peaceful abiding.

original: yid la sems pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yid la sems pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is synonymous with mental attention.

original: 'du shes dang tshor ba kun du 'byung bas yongs su skyo ba rnams ni de la zhi bar gnas pa'i 'du shes su 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'du shes dang tshor ba kun du 'byung bas yongs su skyo ba rnams ni de la zhi bar gnas pa'i 'du shes su 'gyur te /
translated: Those who are weary of the occurrence of ideation and sensation have the ideation of peace in regard to this attainment.

original: yid la byed pa de lta bus 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa 'di la snyoms par 'jug go //
analyzed: yid la byed pa de lta bus 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa 'di la snyoms par 'jug go //
translated: By this type of attention, they enter into the attainment of cessation.

original: 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa de la ni 'byung ba'i 'du shes sngon du btang bas te thar pa'i 'du shes sngon du btang bas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa de la ni 'byung ba'i 'du shes sngon du btang bas te thar pa'i 'du shes sngon du btang bas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: As for the attainment of non-ideation, it is preceded by the ideation of emergence, that is to say, by the ideation of deliverance.

original: lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba la /
translated: Karma to be experienced in the next life, etc.

original: lan grangs gzhan ni tshe rabs gsum pa la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: lan grangs gzhan ni tshe rabs gsum pa la sogs pa yin te /
translated: The next life is the third lifetime, etc.

original: de la myong bar 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de la myong bar 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Karma is to be experienced in it.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: 'phags pa gang zhig 'dod pa'i khams su 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bskyed nas srid pa'i rtse mor skye bar 'gyur ba de'i de ni skyes nas myong bar 'gyur ba yongs su rdzogs par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'phags pa gang zhig 'dod pa'i khams su 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bskyed nas srid pa'i rtse mor skye bar 'gyur ba de'i de ni skyes nas myong bar 'gyur ba yongs su rdzogs par byed pa yin no //
translated: The noble one who generates the meditative attainment of cessation in the desire realm and is then born in the summit of existence perfects the meditative attainment of cessation to be experienced after rebirth.

original: gang zhig de las yongs su nyams nas gzugs kyi khams su skyes te dus gzhan zhig na yang srid pa'i rtse mo thob nas 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bskyed dam ma bskyed kyang rung srid pa'i rtse mor skye bar 'gyur ba de ni lan grangs gzhan laüîΩmyong bar 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig de las yongs su nyams nas gzugs kyi khams su skyes te dus gzhan zhig na yang srid pa'i rtse mo thob nas 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bskyed dam ma bskyed kyang rung srid pa'i rtse mor skye bar 'gyur ba de ni lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: The noble one who degenerates from that meditative attainment of cessation and is born in the form realm, and at another time attains the summit of existence and generates the meditative attainment of cessation, or does not generate it, and is born in the summit of existence, perfects the meditative attainment of cessation to be experienced in a third life.üîΩThe noble one who attains nirvana in this life perfects the meditative attainment of cessation to be experienced in this life.

original: gang zhig 'dir yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ba de'i ni ma nges pa yin no //üîΩchad pas 'jigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bdag gi ngo bo thams cad chad pas 'jigs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gang zhig 'dir yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ba de'i ni ma nges pa yin no // chad pas 'jigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bdag gi ngo bo thams cad chad pas 'jigs pa'i phyir te /
translated: The noble one who attains nirvana in the intermediate state perfects the meditative attainment of cessation to be experienced in the intermediate state.üîΩThe noble one who attains nirvana after rebirth perfects the meditative attainment of cessation to be experienced after rebirth.

original: yang srid med pas gnod 'gyur te //
analyzed: yang srid med pas gnod 'gyur te //
translated: The noble one who attains nirvana without application perfects the meditative attainment of cessation to be experienced without application.üîΩThe noble one who attains nirvana through application perfects the meditative attainment of cessation to be experienced through application.üîΩThe noble one who attains nirvana in the formless realm perfects the meditative attainment of cessation to be experienced in the formless realm.üîΩThe noble one who attains nirvana in the form realm perfects the meditative attainment of cessation to be experienced in the form realm.üîΩThe noble one who attains nirvana in the desire realm perfects the meditative attainment of cessation to be experienced in the desire realm.üîΩThe noble one who attains nirvana in the desire realm perfects the meditative attainment of cessation to be experienced in the desire realm.üîΩThe noble one who attains nirvana in the desire realm perfects the meditative attainment of cessation to be experienced in the desire realm.üîΩThe noble one who attains nirvana in the desire realm perfects the meditative attainment of cessation to be experienced in the desire realm.üîΩThe noble one who attains nirvana in the desire realm perfects the meditative attainment of cessation to be experienced in the desire realm.üîΩThe noble one who attains nirvana in the desire realm perfects the meditative attainment of cessation to be experienced in the desire realm.üîΩThe noble one who attains nirvana in the desire realm perfects the meditative attainment of cessation to be experienced in the desire realm.üîΩThe noble one who attains nirvana in the desire realm perfects the meditative attainment of cessation to be experienced in the desire realm.üîΩThe noble one who attains nirvana in the desire realm perfects the meditative attainment of cessation to be experienced in the desire realm.üîΩThe noble one

original: g-yang sas byis pa rnams bzhin no //
analyzed: g-yang sas byis pa rnams bzhin no //
translated: like children in a pit.

original: ci'i phyir 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la chad pas 'jigs par mi 'gyur @148b zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la chad pas 'jigs par mi 'gyur @148b zhe na /
translated: Why is there no fear of annihilation in the attainment of non-perception?

original: de la gzugs yod pa'i phyir te gzugs pa la bdag tu 'du shes pa la mngon par zhen nas de la snyoms par 'jug go //
analyzed: de la gzugs yod pa'i phyir te gzugs pa la bdag tu 'du shes pa la mngon par zhen nas de la snyoms par 'jug go //
translated: Because there is form there, for one enters that attainment by conceiving the form of the self.

original: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la ni gzugs med pa'i sa pa yin pa'i phyir gzugs kyang med pas bdag gi ngo bo thams cad med par mthong nas de la snyoms par 'jug par spro ba med do //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la ni gzugs med pa'i sa pa yin pa'i phyir gzugs kyang med pas bdag gi ngo bo thams cad med par mthong nas de la snyoms par 'jug par spro ba med do //
translated: But in the attainment of cessation, there is no form because it is of the formless realm. Thus, seeing that the entire nature of the self is absent, one has no interest in entering that attainment.

original: gzugs med pa dag na ris mthun pa dang srog gi dbang po la sogs pa sems dang ldan pa ma yin pa dag yod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gzugs med pa dag na ris mthun pa dang srog gi dbang po la sogs pa sems dang ldan pa ma yin pa dag yod pa ma yin nam /
translated: But aren‚Äôt there also non-mental factors such as the life faculty and homogeneity in the formless realm?

original: ci'i phyir de la bdag gi 'du shes su mngon par zhen nas de la snyoms par mi 'jug ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de la bdag gi 'du shes su mngon par zhen nas de la snyoms par mi 'jug ce na /
translated: Why, then, does one not enter that attainment by conceiving the self in those?

original: ldan pa ma yin pa rnams ni bltar mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ldan pa ma yin pa rnams ni bltar mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because non-mental factors are not visible.

original: 'phags pa'i lam gyi stobs kyis bskyed pa'i yang phyir ro zhes bya ba yang de 'phags pa'i lam gyis skyed do zhes bya ba ji ltar shes she na /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam gyi stobs kyis bskyed pa'i yang phyir ro zhes bya ba yang de 'phags pa'i lam gyis skyed do zhes bya ba ji ltar shes she na /
translated: How do you know that it is generated by the ƒÅrya path?

original: de'i phyir mthong ba'i chos la mya ngan las 'das pa ni de la mos pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir mthong ba'i chos la mya ngan las 'das pa ni de la mos pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore it says, ‚ÄúBecause nirvana in this life is attained through aspiration for it.‚Äù

original: mthong ba'i tshe la mya ngan las 'das pa ni mthong ba'i chos mya ngan las 'das pa ste /üîΩde na'o // de la mos pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mthong ba'i tshe la mya ngan las 'das pa ni mthong ba'i chos mya ngan las 'das pa ste / de na'o // de la mos pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: Nirvana in this life is nirvana in the life in which it is seen.üîΩAttaining it is attaining it in this life.

original: de yin no snyam du smos pa ni de la mos pa'o //
analyzed: de yin no snyam du smos pa ni de la mos pa'o //
translated: Aspiration for it is thinking ‚ÄúThat is it.‚Äù

original: yang na des smos pa ni de la mos pa'o //
analyzed: yang na des smos pa ni de la mos pa'o //
translated: Or, aspiration for it is thinking ‚ÄúThat is it.‚Äù

original: de la mos pas na de la mos pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de la mos pas na de la mos pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because of aspiration for it, it is attained through aspiration for it.

original: 'phags pa rnams ni mthong ba'i tshe mya ngan las 'das pa ni 'di yin no zhes de la mos so //
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams ni mthong ba'i tshe mya ngan las 'das pa ni 'di yin no zhes de la mos so //
translated: ƒÄryas aspire for nirvana in this life, thinking ‚ÄúThat is it.‚Äù

original: yang kha cig ni 'di skad du mya ngan las 'das pa mthong ba de la mos pa'i phyir ro zhes 'don cing 'di skad du 'dis mya ngan las 'das pa mthong bas na mya ngan las 'das pa mthong ba'o //
analyzed: yang kha cig ni 'di skad du mya ngan las 'das pa mthong ba de la mos pa'i phyir ro zhes 'don cing 'di skad du 'dis mya ngan las 'das pa mthong bas na mya ngan las 'das pa mthong ba'o //
translated: Because he has conviction in the vision of nirvana.

original: 'phags pa de de la mos pa ni de la mos pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa de de la mos pa ni de la mos pa'o //
translated: The noble one has conviction in that vision, and he has conviction in that.

original: de la mos na de la mos pa'i phyir ro zhes 'chad de /
analyzed: de la mos na de la mos pa'i phyir ro zhes 'chad de /
translated: If he has conviction in that, he has conviction in that.

original: 'di skad du 'phags pa chos mthong ba de la mos kyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di skad du 'phags pa chos mthong ba de la mos kyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: This means that the noble one has conviction in the vision of the Dharma, but not in others.

original: so so'i skye bo yang 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis mya ngan las 'das pa mthong ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo yang 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis mya ngan las 'das pa mthong ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But isn‚Äôt it the case that ordinary beings also see nirvana through the mundane path?

original: so so'i skye bos ni mya ngan las 'das pa mthong ba ma yin gyi mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa yin te /
analyzed: so so'i skye bos ni mya ngan las 'das pa mthong ba ma yin gyi mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa yin te /
translated: Ordinary beings do not see nirvana, but they do attain nirvana.

original: so so'i skye bo ni de'i gong ma'i sa la zhi bar lta bas 'dod chags dang bral ba thob kyi mya ngan las 'das par ni ma yin pas 'di ni klan kar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo ni de'i gong ma'i sa la zhi bar lta bas 'dod chags dang bral ba thob kyi mya ngan las 'das par ni ma yin pas 'di ni klan kar mi rung ngo //
translated: Ordinary beings do not attain nirvana, since they view the higher realms as peace.

original: 'di ni sbyor bas thob par bya ba kho na yin zhes bya ba ni @149a * //
analyzed: 'di ni sbyor bas thob par bya ba kho na yin zhes bya ba ni @149a * //
translated: This is only attained through preparation.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa 'di yang 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa kho na bzhin du mngon par 'du bya ba chen pos bsgrub par bya ba yin pas de kho na bzhin du dus gcig 'thob bo //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa 'di yang 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa kho na bzhin du mngon par 'du bya ba chen pos bsgrub par bya ba yin pas de kho na bzhin du dus gcig 'thob bo //
translated: This meditative attainment is only attained in one moment, just like the meditative attainment of nonperception, since it is accomplished through great effort.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is it attained?

original: 'das pa yang mi 'thob la zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'das pa yang mi 'thob la zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is said: One does not obtain it in the past.

original: gang gi tshe yongs su nyams nas yang de skyed par byed pa de'i tshe yang sbyor bas sngon med pa kho na zhig 'thob ste /
analyzed: gang gi tshe yongs su nyams nas yang de skyed par byed pa de'i tshe yang sbyor bas sngon med pa kho na zhig 'thob ste /
translated: When one regresses and again generates it, one obtains it anew through preparation, just as the vows of individual liberation.

original: so sor thar pa'i sdom pa bzhin no zhes bya ba rgyas par rnam par bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: so sor thar pa'i sdom pa bzhin no zhes bya ba rgyas par rnam par bshad par bya'o //
translated: This should be explained in detail.

original: de ni sems kyi stobs kyis 'thob pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni sems kyi stobs kyis ma 'ongs pa 'thob pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de ni sems kyi stobs kyis 'thob pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni sems kyi stobs kyis ma 'ongs pa 'thob pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that it is obtained in the future by the power of mind.

original: thub pa'i byang chub kyis thob bya //
analyzed: thub pa'i byang chub kyis thob bya //
translated: The enlightenment of the Muni is obtained by the power of preparation.

original: zhes bya ba 'di ni sbyor bas thob par bya ba kho na yin no zhes bya ba spyir bstan pa'i dmigs kyis bsal ba yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di ni sbyor bas thob par bya ba kho na yin no zhes bya ba spyir bstan pa'i dmigs kyis bsal ba yin te /
translated: This is a general statement, and the following is an exception to it.

original: de ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi tshul yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi tshul yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the method of the ≈õrƒÅvaka and pratyekabuddha.

original: zad dang mi skyes shes byang chub //
analyzed: zad dang mi skyes shes byang chub //
translated: The knowledge of elimination and nonarising is enlightenment.

original: ces 'chad par 'gyur ba de'i phyir /
analyzed: ces 'chad par 'gyur ba de'i phyir /
translated: This will be explained later.

original: zad pa mkhyen pa dang dus mnyam du zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
analyzed: zad pa mkhyen pa dang dus mnyam du zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
translated: Therefore it is said, ‚ÄúAt the time of the knowledge of elimination,‚Äù and so on.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis ni zad pa mkhyen pa na zag pa dang bcas pa 'di dag kyang 'thob bo /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis ni zad pa mkhyen pa na zag pa dang bcas pa 'di dag kyang 'thob bo /
translated: The BhagavƒÅn Buddhas obtain this knowledge of elimination and nonarising at the time of the knowledge of elimination.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi ni sbyor ba las byung ba cung zad kyang med ces bya ba ni bstod pa byed pas ji skad du /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi ni sbyor ba las byung ba cung zad kyang med ces bya ba ni bstod pa byed pas ji skad du /
translated: This is as explained in the praise:

original: dge ba'i mthar phyin khyod kyis ni //
analyzed: dge ba'i mthar phyin khyod kyis ni //
translated: You have perfected virtue

original: sbyor ba las byung cung zad med //
analyzed: sbyor ba las byung cung zad med //
translated: and have no slightest attainment through practice.

original: khyod kyi gang du bzhed nges pa //
analyzed: khyod kyi gang du bzhed nges pa //
translated: Whatever you wish to do

original: bzhed pa tsam la rag las lags //üîΩzhes bshad pa lta bu yin no //
analyzed: bzhed pa tsam la rag las lags // zhes bshad pa lta bu yin no //
translated: depends only on your wish.

original: bcom ldan 'das gnyi ga'i cha las rnam par grol bar ji ltar 'grub ces bya ba la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gnyi ga'i cha las rnam par grol bar ji ltar 'grub ces bya ba la /
translated: How is it established that the Lord is liberated from both aspects?

original: gnyi ga'i cha ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang snyoms par 'jug pa'i sgrib pa ste /
analyzed: gnyi ga'i cha ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang snyoms par 'jug pa'i sgrib pa ste /
translated: The two aspects are the obstruction of afflictions and the obstruction of meditative attainment.

original: de las rnam par grol ba'o //
analyzed: de las rnam par grol ba'o //
translated: He is liberated from them.

original: 'grub ste de bskyed zin pa bzhin du zhes bya ba'i gnyi ga'i cha las rnam par grol ba 'grub ste /
analyzed: 'grub ste de bskyed zin pa bzhin du zhes bya ba'i gnyi ga'i cha las rnam par grol ba 'grub ste /
translated: It is established that he is liberated from both aspects, just as if he had already generated them.

original: bcom ldan 'das ni sngon mngon du byas pa bzhin du de la mnga' brnyes pa'i phyir de mngon du bya ba'i mthu dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni sngon mngon du byas pa bzhin du de la mnga' brnyes pa'i phyir de mngon du bya ba'i mthu dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the Lord has mastery over them, just as if he had already actualized them, he has the power to actualize them.

original: 'di ni dang po kho nar zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni nub phyogs pa dag na re gang byang chub sems dpa' srid pa tham pa srid pa'i rtse mo thob par 'gyur nas bsam gtan bzhi pa la brten te mthong ba'i @149b lam bskyed nas /
analyzed: 'di ni dang po kho nar zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni nub phyogs pa dag na re gang byang chub sems dpa' srid pa tham pa srid pa'i rtse mo thob par 'gyur nas bsam gtan bzhi pa la brten te mthong ba'i @149b lam bskyed nas /
translated: The Vaibhasikas say: When a bodhisattva obtains the summit of existence, he generates the path of seeing in dependence on the fourth absorption.

original: de las langs te srid pa'i rtse mo la snyoms par 'jug cing de nas 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par 'jug go //
analyzed: de las langs te srid pa'i rtse mo la snyoms par 'jug cing de nas 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par 'jug go //
translated: Then he rises from that and enters meditative attainment on the summit of existence, and from that he enters meditative attainment in the meditative attainment of cessation.

original: de las langs nas yang bsam gtan bzhi pa la brten te srid pa'i rtse mo pa'i bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spangs par byas nas /
analyzed: de las langs nas yang bsam gtan bzhi pa la brten te srid pa'i rtse mo pa'i bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spangs par byas nas /
translated: Rising from that, he again generates the path of seeing in dependence on the fourth absorption and abandons afflictions to be abandoned by the path of meditation that exist in the summit of existence.

original: zad pa mkhyen pa phyin chad bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni chos nyid yin te /
analyzed: zad pa mkhyen pa phyin chad bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni chos nyid yin te /
translated: After the knowledge of elimination, he is an unsurpassed, perfect buddha.

original: de lta bas na des slob pa'i gnas skabs na skyed par byed do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de lta bas na des slob pa'i gnas skabs na skyed par byed do zhes zer ro //
translated: This is the nature of reality, and therefore he generates it in the state of being a learner.

original: kha che'i yul gyi nub phyogs na 'khod pa rnams ni nub phyogs pa dag go //
analyzed: kha che'i yul gyi nub phyogs na 'khod pa rnams ni nub phyogs pa dag go //
translated: Those who live in the west of Kashmir are Westerners.

original: lugs kyi tshig ces bya ba ni gnas brtan nye srungs kyi bstan bcos te /
analyzed: lugs kyi tshig ces bya ba ni gnas brtan nye srungs kyi bstan bcos te /
translated: The treatise of the elder Upagupta is called the Mƒ´mƒÅ·πÉsƒÅ-pada.

original: gang las de bzhin gshegs pa ni 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bskyed nas zad pa mkhyen pa bskyed par mdzad do zhes brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig 'di 'byung ba yin no //üîΩbden pa mngon par rtogs na bcu drug ces bya ba ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa nas bzung ste /
analyzed: gang las de bzhin gshegs pa ni 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bskyed nas zad pa mkhyen pa bskyed par mdzad do zhes brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig 'di 'byung ba yin no // bden pa mngon par rtogs na bcu drug ces bya ba ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa nas bzung ste /
translated: The meaning of the passage is that the TathƒÅgata generates the knowledge of elimination after generating the meditative attainment of cessation.üîΩWhen the truths are directly realized, there are sixteen moments.

original: lam la rjes su shes pa zhes bya ba'i bar sems kyi skad cig ma bcu drug go //
analyzed: lam la rjes su shes pa zhes bya ba'i bar sems kyi skad cig ma bcu drug go //
translated: From the perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering up to the subsequent knowledge of the truth of the path, there are sixteen moments of mind.

original: srid pa'i rtse mo la 'dod chags dang bral ba na bco brgyad ces bya ba ni srid pa'i rtse mo pa'i bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa dgu spong bar byed pa bar chad med pa'i lam dgu dang / rnam par grol ba'i lam dgu ste /
analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mo la 'dod chags dang bral ba na bco brgyad ces bya ba ni srid pa'i rtse mo pa'i bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa dgu spong bar byed pa bar chad med pa'i lam dgu dang / rnam par grol ba'i lam dgu ste /
translated: The eighteen are the nine uninterrupted paths and the nine liberated paths that abandon the nine types of affliction to be abandoned by the path of meditation of the summit of existence.

original: de ltar na bco brgyad do //
analyzed: de ltar na bco brgyad do //
translated: Thus there are eighteen.

original: bcu drug dang bco brgyad po de dag ni sum cu rtsa bzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bcu drug dang bco brgyad po de dag ni sum cu rtsa bzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: Those sixteen and eighteen make thirty-four.üîΩAfflictions of lower levels are not to be abandoned again.

original: sa 'og ma pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams ni yang spang bar bya ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa na spyod pa la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams ni so so'i skye bo'i gnas skabs nyid na 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis spangs zin pa'i phyir
analyzed: sa 'og ma pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams ni yang spang bar bya ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa na spyod pa la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams ni so so'i skye bo'i gnas skabs nyid na 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis spangs zin pa'i phyir
translated: Afflictions of the desire realm and so on are already abandoned by the mundane path in the state of an ordinary being.

original: ro // gal te nyon mongs pa spangs zin pa'i gnyen po bskyed par mi bya'o zhes bya ba 'di nges pa yin no //
analyzed: ro // gal te nyon mongs pa spangs zin pa'i gnyen po bskyed par mi bya'o zhes bya ba 'di nges pa yin no //
translated: If this is definite, then the antidote to already abandoned afflictions is not generated.

original: 'o na ci'i phyir 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams spangs zin pa las mngon par rtogs pa'i dus na nyes pa de dag gi gnyen po chos shas pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i lam skyed par byed ce na /
analyzed: 'o na ci'i phyir 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams spangs zin pa las mngon par rtogs pa'i dus na nyes pa de dag gi gnyen po chos shas pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i lam skyed par byed ce na /
translated: Why does one generate the path that is compatible with the side of discernment of dharmas, which is the antidote to those faults, at the time of realization, having already abandoned the afflictions that are objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing?

original: rjes su shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i lam ni de med na @150a * //üîΩmed pa yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rjes su shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i lam ni de med na @150a * // med pa yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the path that is compatible with subsequent knowledge does not occur without it.

original: chos shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa skye ba med par ni rjes su shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa mngon du 'gyur ba mi srid do //
analyzed: chos shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa skye ba med par ni rjes su shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa mngon du 'gyur ba mi srid do //
translated: Without the generation of the path that is compatible with the knowledge of dharmas, the manifestation of the path that is compatible with subsequent knowledge is impossible.

original: shes pa'i rjes su shes pa nyid ni gang de'i rjes la 'byung ba 'di yin no //
analyzed: shes pa'i rjes su shes pa nyid ni gang de'i rjes la 'byung ba 'di yin no //
translated: Subsequent knowledge is that which occurs after the knowledge of dharmas.

original: nub phyogs pa dag dang cir 'gyur zhes bya ba rgyas par smras te /
analyzed: nub phyogs pa dag dang cir 'gyur zhes bya ba rgyas par smras te /
translated: What would happen if one were to do that?

original: gal te bar skabs su mi 'dra ba zag pa dang bcas pa'i sems mngon du byas na'o //
analyzed: gal te bar skabs su mi 'dra ba zag pa dang bcas pa'i sems mngon du byas na'o //
translated: If one manifests a different contaminated mind in the interim, then the path that is compatible with subsequent knowledge would be lost.

original: bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyis bsam pa ldang ba can du 'gyur te zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyis bsam pa ldang ba can du 'gyur te zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
translated: The VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas say: The bodhisattva would have a fluctuating thought.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de bsam pa ldang ba can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de bsam pa ldang ba can du 'gyur ro //
translated: The bodhisattva would have a fluctuating thought.

original: gzhan dag na re dge ba'i rtsa ba las ldang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re dge ba'i rtsa ba las ldang bar 'gyur te /
translated: Others say: He would rise from the root of virtue.

original: bsam pa'i don ni dge ba'i rtsa ba'i don yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: bsam pa'i don ni dge ba'i rtsa ba'i don yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: The meaning of thought is the meaning of root of virtue.

original: 'di skad du byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba ni gang dag mngon du gyur pas ji srid du skad cig kho na la bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob kyi bar de srid du ldang bar mi 'gyur ba deüîΩlta bu yin no zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di skad du byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba ni gang dag mngon du gyur pas ji srid du skad cig kho na la bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob kyi bar de srid du ldang bar mi 'gyur ba de lta bu yin no zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: This is what is said: The root of virtue of the bodhisattvas is such that until they attain unsurpassed perfect enlightenment in just an instant, it does not rise.

original: nyi 'og pa dag gis bsam pa mi ldang ba can yin pa bden mod kyi khyed brjod pa lta bu ni ma yin no zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: nyi 'og pa dag gis bsam pa mi ldang ba can yin pa bden mod kyi khyed brjod pa lta bu ni ma yin no zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: The outsiders say: It is true that it does not fluctuate, but it is not as you describe.

original: snga ma kho na yin no brjod do zhes bya ba ni zad pa med pa mkhyen pa dang dus mnyam du zhes bya ba'i phyogs gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: snga ma kho na yin no brjod do zhes bya ba ni zad pa med pa mkhyen pa dang dus mnyam du zhes bya ba'i phyogs gang yin pa'o //
translated: This is the position of those who say that the knowledge of nonarising is simultaneous with the knowledge of elimination.üîΩAlthough there are many different types of aspects,

original: gnyis kyi rnam pa'i bye brag mang po zhig yod mod kyi zhes bya ba ni gcig ni bsam gtan tha ma na yod pa yin la cig shos ni srid pa'i rtse mo las skyes pa yin no //
analyzed: gnyis kyi rnam pa'i bye brag mang po zhig yod mod kyi zhes bya ba ni gcig ni bsam gtan tha ma na yod pa yin la cig shos ni srid pa'i rtse mo las skyes pa yin no //
translated: one exists in the final absorption and the other arises from the summit of existence.üîΩOne enters meditative attainment through the discernment of definite emergence and the other through the desire to abide there.

original: gcig la ni nges par 'byung ba'i 'du shes kyis snyoms par 'jug la cig shos la ni gnas par 'dod pas so zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'i rnam pa'i bye brag mang po zhig yod pa'o //
analyzed: gcig la ni nges par 'byung ba'i 'du shes kyis snyoms par 'jug la cig shos la ni gnas par 'dod pas so zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'i rnam pa'i bye brag mang po zhig yod pa'o //
translated: There are many different types of aspects such as these.

original: 'di gnyis kyi mtshungs pa ni /
analyzed: 'di gnyis kyi mtshungs pa ni /
translated: The similarity of these two is

original: gnyi ga 'dod dang gzugs bsten can //üîΩzhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gnyi ga 'dod dang gzugs bsten can //üîΩzhes bya ba yin no //
translated: both exist in the desire and form realms.

original: gzugs kyi srid pa yin la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gang la la gzugs kyi srid pa yin pa'i srid pa 'di thams cad rnam par 'drid pa can lnga'i srid pa yang yin nam zhes bya ba mu bzhi pa yin no //üîΩgzugs kyi srid pa yin la srid pa 'di rnam par 'drid pa can lnga ma yin pa yang yod de @150b gzugs na spyod pa'i sems can lha 'du shes can sems mi 'dra ba la gnas pa rnams dang 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang /
analyzed: gzugs kyi srid pa yin la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gang la la gzugs kyi srid pa yin pa'i srid pa 'di thams cad rnam par 'drid pa can lnga'i srid pa yang yin nam zhes bya ba mu bzhi pa yin no // gzugs kyi srid pa yin la srid pa 'di rnam par 'drid pa can lnga ma yin pa yang yod de @150b gzugs na spyod pa'i sems can lha 'du shes can sems mi 'dra ba la gnas pa rnams dang 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang /
translated: There is the existence of form that is not the existence of the five that deceive.üîΩThis is the existence of gods in the form realm who are sentient beings with discernment, but who abide in a dissimilar mind, or who are absorbed in the meditative attainment of nondiscernment or the meditative attainment of cessation, or the existence of gods who have attained the state of nondiscernment.üîΩThere is the existence of the five that deceive that is not the existence of form.üîΩThis is the existence of sentient beings in the formless realm.

original: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par zhugs pa rnams dang / lha 'du shes med pas thob pa rnams kyi srid pa gang yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par zhugs pa rnams dang / lha 'du shes med pas thob pa rnams kyi srid pa gang yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: There is the existence of form that is also the existence of the five that deceive.üîΩThis is the existence of sentient beings in the desire realm.

original: rnam par 'drid pa can lnga'i srid pa yin la 'di gzugs kyi srid pa ma yin pa yang yod de /
analyzed: rnam par 'drid pa can lnga'i srid pa yin la 'di gzugs kyi srid pa ma yin pa yang yod de /
translated: There is the existence that is neither the existence of form nor the existence of the five that deceive.üîΩThis is the meditative attainment of nondiscernment.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sems can sems 'dra ba la gnas pa rnams kyi srid pa gang yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sems can sems 'dra ba la gnas pa rnams kyi srid pa gang yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: It is the existence of sentient beings in the realm of desire who are of similar thoughts and ideas.

original: gzugs kyi srid pa yin la srid pa de yang rnam par 'drid pa can lnga yin pa yang yod do //
analyzed: gzugs kyi srid pa yin la srid pa de yang rnam par 'drid pa can lnga yin pa yang yod do //
translated: There is a form existence that is also one of the five forms of existence that are deceptive.

original: gzugs na spyod pa'i lha 'du shes can sems 'dra ba la gnas pa rnams dang / 'du shes med pa'i lha rnams kyi 'du shes med pa pa ma thob pa'i srid pa gang yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: gzugs na spyod pa'i lha 'du shes can sems 'dra ba la gnas pa rnams dang / 'du shes med pa'i lha rnams kyi 'du shes med pa pa ma thob pa'i srid pa gang yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: It is the existence of the gods in the realm of form who are endowed with ideation and who are of similar thoughts and ideas, and the existence of the gods who are without ideation, except for those gods who are without ideation and who have not yet obtained the attainment of the cessation of ideation and sensation.

original: gzugs kyi srid pa yang ma yin la srid pa 'di rnam par 'drid pa can lnga yang ma yin pa yang yod de /
analyzed: gzugs kyi srid pa yang ma yin la srid pa 'di rnam par 'drid pa can lnga yang ma yin pa yang yod de /
translated: There is a form existence that is not one of the five forms of existence that are deceptive.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sems can sems mi 'dra ba la gnas pa rnams la 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par zhugs pa rnams kyi srid pa gang yin pa dang / gzugs med pa'i srid pa gang yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sems can sems mi 'dra ba la gnas pa rnams la 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par zhugs pa rnams kyi srid pa gang yin pa dang / gzugs med pa'i srid pa gang yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: The existence of sentient beings in the realm of desire who are in a state of mind that is not similar, who are absorbed in the attainment of non-perception or the attainment of cessation, and the existence of the formless realm.

original: 'dir dper brjod pa ni mu dang po yin no //
analyzed: 'dir dper brjod pa ni mu dang po yin no //
translated: Here, the first alternative is an example.

original: gzugs kyi srid pa ni gzugs na spyod pa'i phung po yin no //
analyzed: gzugs kyi srid pa ni gzugs na spyod pa'i phung po yin no //
translated: The existence of form is the aggregates in the form realm.

original: rnam par 'drid pa can lnga ni phung po lnga zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: rnam par 'drid pa can lnga ni phung po lnga zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: The five that deceive are synonymous with the five aggregates.

original: rnam par 'drid pa zhes bya ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa 'od srungs kyi rang gi phung po'i ming yin no //üîΩkhyad par du 'drid pas na rnam par 'drid pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par 'drid pa zhes bya ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa 'od srungs kyi rang gi phung po'i ming yin no // khyad par du 'drid pas na rnam par 'drid pa ste /
translated: The TathƒÅgata KƒÅ≈õyapa's own name for the aggregates is deceptive.üîΩThey deceive by being different.

original: gzhan du 'gyur bas rnam par slu ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzhan du 'gyur bas rnam par slu ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that they deceive by being different.

original: de 'di la yod pas na rnam par 'drid pa can no //
analyzed: de 'di la yod pas na rnam par 'drid pa can no //
translated: Because they exist in this way, they are deceptive.

original: rnam par slu bar byed pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: rnam par slu bar byed pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: The meaning of the term is ‚Äúthat which deceives.‚Äù

original: gzugs ni dbu ba rdos pa 'dra //
analyzed: gzugs ni dbu ba rdos pa 'dra //
translated: Form is like a mass of foam,

original: tshor ba chu yi chu bur bzhin //
analyzed: tshor ba chu yi chu bur bzhin //
translated: feeling is like a water bubble,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu yin pas rnam par slu ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu yin pas rnam par slu ba'i phyir ro //
translated: and so on.

original: de la gal te gzugs kyi khams na 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa yod par mi bzhed na /üîΩ'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang 'gog @151a * //
analyzed: de la gal te gzugs kyi khams na 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa yod par mi bzhed na / 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang 'gog @151a * //
translated: If you do not accept that the meditative attainment of non-apperception exists in the form realm,

original: pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la sogs pa la snyoms par zhugs pa rnams zhes gsungs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la sogs pa la snyoms par zhugs pa rnams zhes gsungs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then you should not say that those who are absorbed in the meditative attainment of non-apperception,üîΩthe meditative attainment of cessation, and so on are still sentient beings.

original: des na 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa gzugs na spyod pa yin no zhes bya bar shes so //
analyzed: des na 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa gzugs na spyod pa yin no zhes bya bar shes so //
translated: Therefore you should understand that the meditative attainment of non-apperception exists in the form realm.üîΩThere is this difference between them:

original: de la yang khyad par ni 'di yod de zhes bya ba ni chos mtshungs pa de la yang khyad par yod pa yin no //
analyzed: de la yang khyad par ni 'di yod de zhes bya ba ni chos mtshungs pa de la yang khyad par yod pa yin no //
translated: Even though they are similar in this respect, there is a difference.

original: phyis ni gzugs kyi khams su yang //
analyzed: phyis ni gzugs kyi khams su yang //
translated: Later, in the form realm,

original: zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa gang dag gis 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bskyed de de las yongs su nyams pa las bsam gtan thob nas gzugs kyi khams su skye ba sngar yongs su nyams pa de dag gis sngon goms pa'i dbang gis gzugs kyi khams su
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa gang dag gis 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bskyed de de las yongs su nyams pa las bsam gtan thob nas gzugs kyi khams su skye ba sngar yongs su nyams pa de dag gis sngon goms pa'i dbang gis gzugs kyi khams su
translated: This is because those ƒÅryas who generate the meditative attainment of cessation and then retrogress from it obtain the absorptions and are born in the form realm.

original: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bskyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bskyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: Those who previously retrogress generate the meditative attainment of cessation in the form realm through the power of prior habituation.

original: 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni so so'i skye bo dag gis dang po nas kyang gzugs kyi khams su skye bar 'gyur bas khyad par ni 'di yod do //
analyzed: 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni so so'i skye bo dag gis dang po nas kyang gzugs kyi khams su skye bar 'gyur bas khyad par ni 'di yod do //
translated: But the meditative attainment of nondiscernment is generated in the form realm from the beginning by ordinary beings who are born in the form realm. This is the difference.üîΩDoes one also retrogress from this?

original: ci 'di las kyang yongs su nyams pa yod dam zhes bya ba ni snyoms par 'jug pa 'di ni mya ngan las 'das pa dang 'dra ba yin na ji ltar yongs su nyams par 'gyur snyam nas yid mi ches te 'dri ba yin no //
analyzed: ci 'di las kyang yongs su nyams pa yod dam zhes bya ba ni snyoms par 'jug pa 'di ni mya ngan las 'das pa dang 'dra ba yin na ji ltar yongs su nyams par 'gyur snyam nas yid mi ches te 'dri ba yin no //
translated: One does not believe that one can retrogress from this meditative attainment, since it is similar to nirvana.

original: 'char byed kyi mdo zhes bya ba ni mdo 'di 'phags pa sh'a ri'i bus bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: 'char byed kyi mdo zhes bya ba ni mdo 'di 'phags pa sh'a ri'i bus bshad pa yin te /
translated: The s≈´tra called ‚ÄúThe One Who Arises‚Äù was explained by the noble ≈öƒÅriputra.

original: de la 'char byed rgol bar byed pa yin pas 'char byed kyi mdo zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la 'char byed rgol bar byed pa yin pas 'char byed kyi mdo zhes bya'o //
translated: Since the one who arises is the challenger, it is called ‚ÄúThe S≈´tra of the One Who Arises.‚Äù

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: gleng gzhi ni mnyan yod na'o //
analyzed: gleng gzhi ni mnyan yod na'o //
translated: The setting is in ≈örƒÅvastƒ´.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus dge slong rnams la smras pa /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus dge slong rnams la smras pa /
translated: Then the venerable ≈öƒÅriputra said to the monks:

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag 'di na dge slong tshul khrims phun sum tshogs pa yang yin /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag 'di na dge slong tshul khrims phun sum tshogs pa yang yin /
translated: ‚ÄúVenerable ones, here a monk who is perfect in morality,

original: ting nge 'dzin phun sum tshogs pa yang yin /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin phun sum tshogs pa yang yin /
translated: perfect in concentration,

original: shes rab phun sum tshogs pa yang yin pa de ni yang dang yang du 'du shes dang tshor ba dang 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug pa dang ldan pa'i gnas de yod do zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: shes rab phun sum tshogs pa yang yin pa de ni yang dang yang du 'du shes dang tshor ba dang 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug pa dang ldan pa'i gnas de yod do zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: and perfect in wisdom knows as it truly is: ‚ÄòThere is a state of repeatedly entering and emerging from the meditative absorption of the cessation of discriminations and feelings.‚Äô

original: de ni mthong ba'i chos kho na la dang po nyid du kun shes pa'i chos thob par yang mi byed cing 'chi ba'i dus kyi tshe yang ma yin la /
analyzed: de ni mthong ba'i chos kho na la dang po nyid du kun shes pa'i chos thob par yang mi byed cing 'chi ba'i dus kyi tshe yang ma yin la /
translated: He does not attain the Dharma of complete understanding in this very life, nor at the time of death.

original: lus zhig nas kyang kham gyi zas za ba'i lha las 'das te yid las byung ba'i lha'i lus gang yang rung ba zhig tu skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lus zhig nas kyang kham gyi zas za ba'i lha las 'das te yid las byung ba'i lha'i lus gang yang rung ba zhig tu skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: But when his body breaks up, he passes beyond the gods who consume solid food and is reborn in the body of a god who is born spontaneously.

original: de der skyes nas yang dang yang du 'du @151b shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug pa dang ldang ba'i gnas de yod do zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: de der skyes nas yang dang yang du 'du @151b shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug pa dang ldang ba'i gnas de yod do zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: Having been reborn there, he repeatedly enters and emerges from the meditative absorption that stops discernment and feeling. He knows that there is such a state.

original: de nas yang de'i tshe tshe dang ldan pa 'char byed 'khor de nyid du 'dus par gyur te 'dug go //
analyzed: de nas yang de'i tshe tshe dang ldan pa 'char byed 'khor de nyid du 'dus par gyur te 'dug go //
translated: At that time, the venerable Udayi was also present in that assembly.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa 'char byed kyis tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa 'char byed kyis tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then the venerable Udayi said to the venerable ≈öƒÅriputra:

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu gang dge slong yid las byung ba'i lha'i lus gang yang rung ba zhig tu skyes nas yang dang yang du 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug pa dang ldan pa'i gnas de yod do zhes bya bar yang
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu gang dge slong yid las byung ba'i lha'i lus gang yang rung ba zhig tu skyes nas yang dang yang du 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug pa dang ldan pa'i gnas de yod do zhes bya bar yang
translated: Venerable ≈öƒÅriputra, it is possible that a monk, having been born in any of the divine bodies that arise from the mind, repeatedly enters and emerges from the meditative absorption that is the cessation of discriminations and feelings.

original: dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so zhes bya ba 'di ni gnas ma yin zhing go skabs med do //
analyzed: dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so zhes bya ba 'di ni gnas ma yin zhing go skabs med do //
translated: This is the way things are, just as it is.

original: tshe dang ldan pa 'char byed kyis tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu la lan gnyis lan gsum du 'di skad du /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa 'char byed kyis tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu la lan gnyis lan gsum du 'di skad du /
translated: Venerable Upagu spoke to Venerable ≈öƒÅriputra a second and a third time, saying,üîΩ‚ÄúVenerable, this is not possible.‚Äù

original: tshe dang ldan pa 'di ni gnas ma yin te zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin du smras pa dang / de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu 'di snyam du sems par gyur te /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa 'di ni gnas ma yin te zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin du smras pa dang / de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu 'di snyam du sems par gyur te /
translated: Then Venerable ≈öƒÅriputra thought,

original: bdag gis bshad pa la dge slong 'di lan gsum gyi bar du phyir spong bar byed phyir khro bar byed la tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa 'ga' yang bdag gis bshad pa la rjes su yi rang bar mi byed pas /
analyzed: bdag gis bshad pa la dge slong 'di lan gsum gyi bar du phyir spong bar byed phyir khro bar byed la tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa 'ga' yang bdag gis bshad pa la rjes su yi rang bar mi byed pas /
translated: This monk has rejected my teaching three times, and he has become angry. No one who practices pure conduct has rejoiced in my teaching.

original: ma la bdag bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der 'gro gor ma chag snyam mo //
analyzed: ma la bdag bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der 'gro gor ma chag snyam mo //
translated: I will certainly go to the Blessed One.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der song ste /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der song ste /
translated: Then the venerable ≈öƒÅriputra went to the Blessed One.

original: song nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te phyogs gcig tu 'dug go //
analyzed: song nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te phyogs gcig tu 'dug go //
translated: Having gone, he bowed his head at the Blessed One‚Äôs feet and sat to one side.

original: phyogs gcig tu 'dug nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus dge slong rnams la smras pa /
analyzed: phyogs gcig tu 'dug nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus dge slong rnams la smras pa /
translated: Sitting to one side, the venerable ≈öƒÅriputra said to the monks,

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag 'di la dge slong tshul khrims dang ldan pa yang yin zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag 'di la dge slong tshul khrims dang ldan pa yang yin zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin no //
translated: ‚ÄúVenerable ones, here a monk is virtuous, as before.

original: de nas yang de'i tshe tshe dang ldan pa 'char byed ces bya ba snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: de nas yang de'i tshe tshe dang ldan pa 'char byed ces bya ba snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Then at that time the venerable Udayin, as before.

original: tshe dang ldan pa 'char byed kyis tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu la lan gnyis lan gsum gyi bar du 'di skad ces smras so zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa 'char byed kyis tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu la lan gnyis lan gsum gyi bar du 'di skad ces smras so zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Venerable Udayin spoke to Venerable ≈öƒÅriputra a second and a third time, just as before.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu 'di snyam du sems par gyur te /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu 'di snyam du sems par gyur te /
translated: Then Venerable ≈öƒÅriputra thought,

original: ston pa'i spyan snga na yang dge slong 'di bdag gis bshad pa la lan gsum gyi bar du spong bar byed phyir khro bar byed la /üîΩtshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa 'ga' yang bdag @152a * //
analyzed: ston pa'i spyan snga na yang dge slong 'di bdag gis bshad pa la lan gsum gyi bar du spong bar byed phyir khro bar byed la / tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa 'ga' yang bdag @152a * //
translated: ‚ÄúThis monk has three times rejected what I have said in the presence of the Teacher, and he has been hostile.

original: gis bshad pa la rjes su yi rang bar mi byed pas /
analyzed: gis bshad pa la rjes su yi rang bar mi byed pas /
translated: Not a single fellow practitioner has agreed with what I have said.

original: ma la bdag cang mi smra bar 'jug par bya gor ma chag snyam mo //
analyzed: ma la bdag cang mi smra bar 'jug par bya gor ma chag snyam mo //
translated: I will certainly remain silent from now on.‚Äù

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu cang mi smra bar gyur to //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu cang mi smra bar gyur to //
translated: So Venerable ≈öƒÅriputra remained silent.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa 'char byed la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa 'char byed la bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the Blessed One said to Venerable Udayin,üîΩ‚ÄúUdayin, Udayin,

original: 'char byed khyod kyis yid las byung ba'i lha'i lus gang yang rung ba gang zhig yin par shes /
analyzed: 'char byed khyod kyis yid las byung ba'i lha'i lus gang yang rung ba gang zhig yin par shes /
translated: ‚ÄúO you who are the cause of arising, do you know any divine body that arises from the mind?‚Äù

original: gsol pa / btsun pa gzugs can ma lags pa 'du shes las byung ba ji snyed pa ma lags sam /
analyzed: gsol pa / btsun pa gzugs can ma lags pa 'du shes las byung ba ji snyed pa ma lags sam /
translated: He replied, ‚ÄúVenerable One, is it not all that arises from perception that is not physical?‚Äù

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Buddha said,

original: skyes bu rmongs pa re zhig de lta na go //
analyzed: skyes bu rmongs pa re zhig de lta na go //
translated: ‚ÄúO foolish man, that is so for the time being.

original: long ba mig med pa khyod kho na mig dang ldan pa dge slong sh'a ri'i bu dang lhan cig chos mngon pa 'am 'dul ba'i gtam bya bar sems sam /
analyzed: long ba mig med pa khyod kho na mig dang ldan pa dge slong sh'a ri'i bu dang lhan cig chos mngon pa 'am 'dul ba'i gtam bya bar sems sam /
translated: Do you think that you, who are blind and eyeless, can discuss the Abhidharma or the Vinaya with the monk ≈öƒÅriputra, who has eyes?‚Äù

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa 'char byed mngon sum du spyos nas tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa 'char byed mngon sum du spyos nas tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the Blessed One directly reprimanded the venerable UdƒÅyƒ´ and said to the venerable ƒÄnanda,

original: kun dga' bo khyod kyang dge slong gnas brtan la rnam par 'tshe ba yal bar 'jog gam /
analyzed: kun dga' bo khyod kyang dge slong gnas brtan la rnam par 'tshe ba yal bar 'jog gam /
translated: ‚ÄúƒÄnanda, do you also ignore the monk elders‚Äô harassment?

original: khyod skyes bu rmongs pas dge slong gnas brtan gtses na snying rje yang ma skyes sam /
analyzed: khyod skyes bu rmongs pas dge slong gnas brtan gtses na snying rje yang ma skyes sam /
translated: Foolish man, when the monk elders harass you, do you not feel compassion?‚Äù

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa 'char byed dang tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo mngon sum du spyos nas /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa 'char byed dang tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo mngon sum du spyos nas /
translated: Then the Bhagavan directly reprimanded the venerable Udayi and the venerable Ananda,

original: dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
translated: and he said to the monks:

original: dge slong dag 'di la dge slong tshul khrims phun sum tshogs pa yang yin /
analyzed: dge slong dag 'di la dge slong tshul khrims phun sum tshogs pa yang yin /
translated: ‚ÄúMonks, in this regard, a monk is perfect in morality,

original: ting nge 'dzin phun sum tshogs pa yang yin zhes bya ba rgyas par gnas 'di yod do zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so zhes bya ba'i bar bka' stsal nas /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin phun sum tshogs pa yang yin zhes bya ba rgyas par gnas 'di yod do zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so zhes bya ba'i bar bka' stsal nas /
translated: perfect in concentration, and he knows as it really is: ‚ÄòThis is the noble reality of suffering.‚Äô

original: bcom ldan 'das bzhengs te nang du yang dag 'jog par gtsug lag khang du gshegs so zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bzhengs te nang du yang dag 'jog par gtsug lag khang du gshegs so zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúThe Bhagavan arose and went to the temple to enter into meditative absorption.‚Äù

original: 'dir ni tshe dang ldan pa 'char byed ni yid las byung ba'i lus gang yang rung ba 'di ni gzugs med pa na spyod pa yin par bshad do snyam du yid la byas nas brgal ba byas pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dir ni tshe dang ldan pa 'char byed ni yid las byung ba'i lus gang yang rung ba 'di ni gzugs med pa na spyod pa yin par bshad do snyam du yid la byas nas brgal ba byas pa yin te /
translated: Here, the venerable Udayi thought: ‚ÄúAny body that is mentally created is formless,‚Äù and he made his objection.

original: de na ni gzugs ni med kyi yid kho na mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa yod do //
analyzed: de na ni gzugs ni med kyi yid kho na mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa yod do //
translated: But there is no form there, only mind and mental factors.

original: de lta bas na de'i bsam pa ni de na yod pa'i lus ni yid las byung ba yin la /
analyzed: de lta bas na de'i bsam pa ni de na yod pa'i lus ni yid las byung ba yin la /
translated: Thus, the intention of the sutra is that the body that exists there is a mental body,

original: de yang snyoms par 'jug pa 'di la snyoms par mi 'jug go snyam pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang snyoms par 'jug pa 'di la snyoms par mi 'jug go snyam pa yin no //
translated: and that mental body does not enter this meditative attainment.

original: 'phags pa sh'a ri'i @152b bus ni yid las byung ba'i lha'i lus gzugs na spyod pa yin par bsams pa yin te /
analyzed: 'phags pa sh'a ri'i @152b bus ni yid las byung ba'i lha'i lus gzugs na spyod pa yin par bsams pa yin te /
translated: Arya ≈öƒÅriputra thought that the mental body of a god is a form realm body,

original: khu chu dang khrag las ma brtan par 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khu chu dang khrag las ma brtan par 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not generated from semen and blood.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa 'char byed 'di la 'char byed khyod kyis yid las byung ba'i lha'i lus gang yang rung ba gang zhig yin par shes zhes smras so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa 'char byed 'di la 'char byed khyod kyis yid las byung ba'i lha'i lus gang yang rung ba gang zhig yin par shes zhes smras so //
translated: For that very reason, the BhagavƒÅn said to the venerable UdƒÅyin, ‚ÄúUdƒÅyin, which mental body of a god do you know to be?‚Äù

original: des kyang btsun pa gzugs can ma lags pa 'du shes las byung ba ji snyed pa ma lags sam zhes de lta bur khas blangs pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis yid las byung ba'i lha'i lus gzugs na spyod pa kho na yin par dgongs nas /
analyzed: des kyang btsun pa gzugs can ma lags pa 'du shes las byung ba ji snyed pa ma lags sam zhes de lta bur khas blangs pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis yid las byung ba'i lha'i lus gzugs na spyod pa kho na yin par dgongs nas /
translated: The BhagavƒÅn, thinking that the divine body that arises from mind is only in the form realm,

original: 'phags pa sh'a ri'i bu'i gzhung lugs gzhung gzugs pa'i phyir tshe dang ldan pa 'char byed la /
analyzed: 'phags pa sh'a ri'i bu'i gzhung lugs gzhung gzugs pa'i phyir tshe dang ldan pa 'char byed la /
translated: in order to establish the scriptural system of the noble ≈öƒÅriputra,

original: skyes bu rmongs pa re zhig de lta na go //
analyzed: skyes bu rmongs pa re zhig de lta na go //
translated: said to the venerable UdƒÅyin:

original: long ba mig med pa khyod kho na mig dang ldan pa dge slong sh'a ri'i bu dang lhan cig chos mngon pa'am 'dul ba'i gtam bya bar sems sam zhes spyos so //
analyzed: long ba mig med pa khyod kho na mig dang ldan pa dge slong sh'a ri'i bu dang lhan cig chos mngon pa'am 'dul ba'i gtam bya bar sems sam zhes spyos so //
translated: ‚ÄúYou fool, you blind man, you think that you should discuss the Abhidharma or the Vinaya with the monk ≈öƒÅriputra, who has eyes.‚Äù

original: gnas de yod do zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par 'jug pa dang ldan pa gang yin pa'i gnas te /
analyzed: gnas de yod do zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par 'jug pa dang ldan pa gang yin pa'i gnas te /
translated: The existence of that state is the state of one who possesses entry into the meditative attainment of cessation.

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhi na rab tu shes so //
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhi na rab tu shes so //
translated: He fully knows it just as it is.

original: dang po nyid du zhes bya ba ni dang po kho nar zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dang po nyid du zhes bya ba ni dang po kho nar zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: First of all means at the very beginning.

original: kun shes pa 'thob par zhes bya ba ni dgra bcom pa 'thob par zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: kun shes pa 'thob par zhes bya ba ni dgra bcom pa 'thob par zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Attaining complete knowledge means attaining the state of an arhat.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa 'di ni srid pa'i rtse mo pa yin zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni srid pa'i rtse mo pa yin te /
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa 'di ni srid pa'i rtse mo pa yin zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni srid pa'i rtse mo pa yin te /
translated: This meditative attainment is of the summit of existence means that the meditative attainment of cessation is of the summit of existence.

original: gang gis de 'thob pa de ni srid pa'i rtse mo kho nar skye bar 'gyur gyis gzugs kyi khams su ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gis de 'thob pa de ni srid pa'i rtse mo kho nar skye bar 'gyur gyis gzugs kyi khams su ni ma yin no //
translated: One who attains it is born only in the summit of existence and not in the form realm.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang mdo las de gzugs kyi khams su skyes te yang dang yang du 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug pa dang ldang bar gsungs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang mdo las de gzugs kyi khams su skyes te yang dang yang du 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug pa dang ldang bar gsungs te /
translated: The Bhagavat also declares in a sutra that one born in the form realm repeatedly enters and arises from the meditative attainment that is the cessation of ideation and sensation.

original: de lta bas na 'di las yongs su nyams pa yod do zhes bya bar shes so //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'di las yongs su nyams pa yod do zhes bya bar shes so //
translated: Therefore it should be understood that one can retrogress from it.

original: bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyi ltar na ni 'di rung na /
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyi ltar na ni 'di rung na /
translated: According to the VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas, this is correct.

original: mdo sde pa rnams ltar na go ji ltar rung /
analyzed: mdo sde pa rnams ltar na go ji ltar rung /
translated: But how can this be correct according to the SautrƒÅntikas?

original: 'gog pa 'thob pa ni 'phags pa kho na yin la /üîΩmdo sde pa rnams kyi grub pa'i mtha' ni 'phags pa'i lam las yongs su nyams pa @153a * //
analyzed: 'gog pa 'thob pa ni 'phags pa kho na yin la / mdo sde pa rnams kyi grub pa'i mtha' ni 'phags pa'i lam las yongs su nyams pa @153a * //
translated: Obtaining cessation is only for ƒÅryas.

original: med do zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: med do zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The SautrƒÅntika tenets state that there is no complete degeneration from the ƒÅrya path.

original: 'phags pa de ji ltar 'phags pa'i lam gong ma las yongs su nyams par 'dod ce na /
analyzed: 'phags pa de ji ltar 'phags pa'i lam gong ma las yongs su nyams par 'dod ce na /
translated: How can it be asserted that an ƒÅrya degenerates from the higher ƒÅrya path?

original: de dag gi ltar na yang mdo 'di mi 'gal lo //
analyzed: de dag gi ltar na yang mdo 'di mi 'gal lo //
translated: According to the SautrƒÅntikas, this s≈´tra is not contradictory.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How?

original: 'ga' zhig srid pa'i rtse mo thob nas nges pa la 'jug pa gang yin pa de ni phyir mi 'ong ba yin pa las 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa skyed par yang byad cing /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig srid pa'i rtse mo thob nas nges pa la 'jug pa gang yin pa de ni phyir mi 'ong ba yin pa las 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa skyed par yang byad cing /
translated: Some who obtain the summit of existence and enter the state of an ƒÅrya enter the state of a nonreturner and generate the meditative attainment of cessation.

original: de srid pa'i rtse mo'i 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa las yongs su nyams par yang 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de srid pa'i rtse mo'i 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa las yongs su nyams par yang 'gyur gyi /
translated: They degenerate from the meditative attainment of cessation of the summit of existence,

original: lam las ni ma yin te /
analyzed: lam las ni ma yin te /
translated: but they do not degenerate from the path.

original: sa gong ma pa'i 'phags pa'i lam nam yang ma bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa gong ma pa'i 'phags pa'i lam nam yang ma bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the ƒÅrya path of the higher stage has never been generated.

original: de yongs su nyams par gyur nas bsam gtan bskyed de gzugs kyi khams su skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yongs su nyams par gyur nas bsam gtan bskyed de gzugs kyi khams su skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When one falls away from that, one generates the meditative development of the absorptions and is reborn in the form realm.

original: de lta bas na 'di las yongs su nyams pa yod kyi 'phags pa'i lam las yongs su nyams pa ni ma yin pas rang gis grub pa'i mtha' dang 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'di las yongs su nyams pa yod kyi 'phags pa'i lam las yongs su nyams pa ni ma yin pas rang gis grub pa'i mtha' dang 'gal ba med do //
translated: Consequently, there is a falling away from this, but not from the ƒÅrya path.

original: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan bzhi dang gzugs med pa bzhi dang 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan bzhi dang gzugs med pa bzhi dang 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'o //
translated: The nine meditative attainments of the serial meditative development are called the four meditative absorptions, the four formless states and the meditative attainment of cessation.

original: 'di ni rtsom pa dang po la nges pa yin te zhes bya ba ni dang por snyoms par 'jug pa skyed par byed pa la zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'di ni rtsom pa dang po la nges pa yin te zhes bya ba ni dang por snyoms par 'jug pa skyed par byed pa la zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the rule for the first one who is beginning, i.e. for the one who is generating the meditative attainment for the first time.

original: myong bar 'gyur bar nges pa dang gnyi ga yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: myong bar 'gyur bar nges pa dang gnyi ga yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because it is certain to be experienced and because it is both.

original: myong bar 'gyur bar nges pa ni 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: myong bar 'gyur bar nges pa ni 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ste /
translated: The meditative attainment of nondiscernment is certain to be experienced.üîΩ

original: skyes nas myong bar 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes nas myong bar 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The meditative attainment of nonperception is certain to be experienced because it is experienced after rebirth.

original: gnyi gang myong bar 'gyur ba ni 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: gnyi gang myong bar 'gyur ba ni 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'o //
translated: The meditative attainment of cessation is experienced in both ways.

original: myong bar 'gyur bar nges pa dang / ma nges pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /üîΩmyong bar 'gyur bar nges pa ni phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'o //
analyzed: myong bar 'gyur bar nges pa dang / ma nges pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste / myong bar 'gyur bar nges pa ni phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'o //
translated: It is called certain to be experienced and uncertain to be experienced.üîΩThe meditative attainment of nonperception is certain to be experienced by nonreturners.

original: myong bar 'gyur bar ma nges pa ni dgra bcom pa'i ste /
analyzed: myong bar 'gyur bar ma nges pa ni dgra bcom pa'i ste /
translated: The meditative attainment of cessation is uncertain to be experienced by arhats,

original: 'di nyid du yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i phyir ro //üîΩdang por bskyed pa las kyang zhes bya ba ni 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni la la dang por mi dag gi nang du skyed par byed la /
analyzed: 'di nyid du yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i phyir ro // dang por bskyed pa las kyang zhes bya ba ni 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni la la dang por mi dag gi nang du skyed par byed la /
translated: because they attain nirvana in this life.üîΩAlso, it is generated first in humans, but not in the form realm.

original: la la ni gzugs kyi khams su'o //
analyzed: la la ni gzugs kyi khams su'o //
translated: The meditative attainment of nonperception is generated first among humans, but not in the form realm.

original: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni mi dag gi nang kho nar skyed par byed la yongs su nyams na ni gzugs kyi khams su'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni mi dag gi nang kho nar skyed par byed la yongs su nyams na ni gzugs kyi khams su'o //
translated: The meditative attainment of cessation is generated only among humans, but if one regresses from it, it is generated in the form realm.

original: @153b yang ci'i phyir 'di mi dag gi nang kho nar skyed par byed la /
analyzed: @153b yang ci'i phyir 'di mi dag gi nang kho nar skyed par byed la /
translated: Why is it generated only among humans?

original: phyir mi 'ong ba 'du shes dang tshor ba'i sgo nas rtog pa dang dpyod pa la sogs pa sems las byung ba rab tu rgyu bas yongs su skyob pa dang zhi bar gnas pas bde bar gnas par bya'o snyam nas 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa skyed par
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba 'du shes dang tshor ba'i sgo nas rtog pa dang dpyod pa la sogs pa sems las byung ba rab tu rgyu bas yongs su skyob pa dang zhi bar gnas pas bde bar gnas par bya'o snyam nas 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa skyed par
translated: Nonreturners generate the meditative attainment of cessation in order to dwell in bliss through complete pacification by way of the complete pacification of the movement of the mind and mental factors such as investigation and analysis.

original: byed do // phyir mi 'ong ba gzugs kyi khams su skyes pa ni gzugs kyi khams zhi ba yin pa'i phyir de na yod pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba 'byung bas de ltar gnod par mi byed pas dang por der skyed par mi byed do //
analyzed: byed do // phyir mi 'ong ba gzugs kyi khams su skyes pa ni gzugs kyi khams zhi ba yin pa'i phyir de na yod pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba 'byung bas de ltar gnod par mi byed pas dang por der skyed par mi byed do //
translated: Nonreturners born in the form realm do not generate it there for the first time because the form realm is peaceful and the occurrence of minds and mental factors there does not harm them.

original: yongs su nyams na ni sngon goms pas de skyed par byed do //
analyzed: yongs su nyams na ni sngon goms pas de skyed par byed do //
translated: But if they regress from it, they generate it there through prior familiarity.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams su skyes pa 'du shes med 'du shes med min du nye bar 'gro bar skyes pa yang zhi ba de nyid kyi phyir skyed par mi byed do //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams su skyes pa 'du shes med 'du shes med min du nye bar 'gro bar skyes pa yang zhi ba de nyid kyi phyir skyed par mi byed do //
translated: And one born in the formless realm, in the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception, does not generate it, for the same reason that it is peaceful.

original: rnam pa gcig tu phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te de na gzugs ni med do //
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te de na gzugs ni med do //
translated: Or else, it follows that nirvana without remainder of aggregates would be the only nirvana, for form does not exist there.
