original: gal te sems dang sems las byung ba yang 'gags par gyur na sems dang ldan pa ma yin pa rnams 'ba' zhig gnas pa'i mthu med pa'i phyir 'di yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te sems dang sems las byung ba yang 'gags par gyur na sems dang ldan pa ma yin pa rnams 'ba' zhig gnas pa'i mthu med pa'i phyir 'di yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: If mind and mental factors cease, then, because those not associated with mind have no power to remain, this person would definitely attain nirvana.

original: myong bar 'gyur bar nges pa'i las 'bras bu yongs su rdzogs pa bgegs kyi ngo bor gnas pa'i phyir yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ni mi srid do //
analyzed: myong bar 'gyur bar nges pa'i las 'bras bu yongs su rdzogs pa bgegs kyi ngo bor gnas pa'i phyir yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ni mi srid do //
translated: It is impossible that one would attain nirvana, because karma to be experienced with certainty remains as an obstruction to the completion of its result.

original: 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni thar pa'i 'du shes nges par 'byung ba'i 'du shes sngon du 'gro ba'i yid la byed pas snyoms par 'jug pas gzugs kyi khams su yang dang por snyoms par 'jug go //
analyzed: 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni thar pa'i 'du shes nges par 'byung ba'i 'du shes sngon du 'gro ba'i yid la byed pas snyoms par 'jug pas gzugs kyi khams su yang dang por snyoms par 'jug go //
translated: The meditative attainment of nonperception is entered by those who have previously cultivated the perception of liberation and the perception of release.üîΩWhy are they called meditative attainments?

original: yang ci'i phyir 'di dag ces bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni snyoms par 'jug pa 'di gnyi ga yang sems dang sems las byung ba ni thams cad 'gag pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir sems dang sems las byung ba 'gog pa zhes brjod dgos so snyamüîΩdu bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir 'di dag ces bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni snyoms par 'jug pa 'di gnyi ga yang sems dang sems las byung ba ni thams cad 'gag pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir sems dang sems las byung ba 'gog pa zhes brjod dgos so snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: The two meditative attainments are called meditative attainments because they are the nature of the cessation of all minds and mental factors.üîΩBecause they are incompatible with those, they are called meditative attainments.

original: de dag dang mi mthun pas de dag la snyoms par 'jug par sbyor ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'du shes dang tshor ba dang mi mthun pas snyoms par 'jug pa de dag la sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag dang mi mthun pas de dag la snyoms par 'jug par sbyor ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'du shes dang tshor ba dang mi mthun pas snyoms par 'jug pa de dag la sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are incompatible with those minds and mental factors, they are called meditative attainments.

original: 'du shes dang mi mthun pas ni 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la @154a * //
analyzed: 'du shes dang mi mthun pas ni 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la @154a * //
translated: One applies oneself to the meditative attainment of nonperception through not being in accord with perception.

original: sbyor pa yin te /
analyzed: sbyor pa yin te /
translated: One applies oneself to the meditative attainment of nonperception through not being in accord with perception.

original: 'du shes ni zug rngu'o //
analyzed: 'du shes ni zug rngu'o //
translated: Perception is a thorn.

original: 'du shes ni nad do //
analyzed: 'du shes ni nad do //
translated: Perception is a disease.

original: 'du shes ni 'bras so //
analyzed: 'du shes ni 'bras so //
translated: Perception is a dart.üîΩThis is peace.

original: 'di ni zhi ba'o //üîΩ'di ni gya nom pa'o snyam nas zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni zhi ba'o // 'di ni gya nom pa'o snyam nas zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba yin no //
translated: This is sublime.

original: 'du shes dang tshor ba dang mi mthun pas ni 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la sbyor ro //
analyzed: 'du shes dang tshor ba dang mi mthun pas ni 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la sbyor ro //
translated: One applies oneself to the meditative attainment of cessation through not being in accord with both feeling and discrimination.üîΩIt is like the expression knowledge of others' minds.

original: gzhan gyi sems shes pa zhes bya ba bzhin no zhes bya ba ni dper na gzhan gyi sems shes pa zhes bya ba nam yang gzhan gyi sems shes pas sems las byung ba mi shes pa ma yin mod kyi 'on kyang dang por gzhan gyi sems shes par
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems shes pa zhes bya ba bzhin no zhes bya ba ni dper na gzhan gyi sems shes pa zhes bya ba nam yang gzhan gyi sems shes pas sems las byung ba mi shes pa ma yin mod kyi 'on kyang dang por gzhan gyi sems shes par
translated: For example, although the knowledge of others' minds never fails to know mental factors when it knows the mind of another, still it is called knowledge of others' minds because it is the first to know the mind of another.

original: bya'o snyam du sbyor ba'i phyir gzhan gyi sems shes pa zhes bya ba'i sems dang sems las byung ba shes pa zhes ni mi bya ba de bzhin du 'dir yang snyoms par 'jug pa 'di gnyis la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: bya'o snyam du sbyor ba'i phyir gzhan gyi sems shes pa zhes bya ba'i sems dang sems las byung ba shes pa zhes ni mi bya ba de bzhin du 'dir yang snyoms par 'jug pa 'di gnyis la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Similarly, these two meditative attainments are called meditative attainment of cessation and meditative attainment of nondiscernment because they are applied with the thought I will enter meditative attainment of cessation and I will enter meditative attainment of nondiscernment.

original: de la bye brag tu smra ba la sogs pa ni 'gog pa dang 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang 'du shes med pa pa sems med pa pa kho na dag yin no zhes zer la /
analyzed: de la bye brag tu smra ba la sogs pa ni 'gog pa dang 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang 'du shes med pa pa sems med pa pa kho na dag yin no zhes zer la /
translated: Vaibhasikas and so on say: The meditative attainment of cessation and the meditative attainment of nondiscernment are mindless states alone.

original: gnas brtan dbyig bshes la sogs pa ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa yongs su mi gsal ba kho nas sems dang bcas pa dag yin no zhes zer /
analyzed: gnas brtan dbyig bshes la sogs pa ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa yongs su mi gsal ba kho nas sems dang bcas pa dag yin no zhes zer /
translated: Elder Vasumitra and so on say: They are states with mind alone, since mental consciousness is not clear.üîΩYogacaras say: They are states with mind alone, since they are states of foundation consciousness.

original: rnal 'byor spyod pa pa dag ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pas sems dang bcas pa dag yin no zhes zer te grub pa'i mtha' tha dad pas de lta bas na /
analyzed: rnal 'byor spyod pa pa dag ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pas sems dang bcas pa dag yin no zhes zer te grub pa'i mtha' tha dad pas de lta bas na /
translated: Since there are different philosophical tenet systems,

original: da ni ji ltar 'gags nas yun ring du lon pa'i sems las zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba 'di nye bar 'god par byed de /
analyzed: da ni ji ltar 'gags nas yun ring du lon pa'i sems las zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba 'di nye bar 'god par byed de /
translated: Now he raises the question, ‚ÄúHow can the mind that has long ceased to exist be the causal condition of the mind that has arisen?‚Äù

original: 'gags nas yun ring du lon pa smos pa ni 'gags ma thag pa bsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gags nas yun ring du lon pa smos pa ni 'gags ma thag pa bsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthat has long ceased to exist‚Äù is used to exclude the mind that has ceased to exist immediately before the present mind.

original: bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re de ni 'gags ma thag pa la sogs pa yang ji lta bu zhig yin /üîΩgal te 'gags ma thag pa yod do //
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re de ni 'gags ma thag pa la sogs pa yang ji lta bu zhig yin / gal te 'gags ma thag pa yod do //
translated: The VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas ask, ‚ÄúWhat is the mind that has ceased to exist immediately before the present mind?

original: zhes bya bar khas blangs na ni 'gags nas yun ring du lon pa yang ci ste yod do zhes bya bar khas mi blang zhes zer ro //
analyzed: zhes bya bar khas blangs na ni 'gags nas yun ring du lon pa yang ci ste yod do zhes bya bar khas mi blang zhes zer ro //
translated: If you accept that the mind that has ceased to exist immediately before the present mind exists, then why do you not accept that the mind that has long ceased to exist also exists?‚Äù

original: 'gags ma thag pa yod pa nyid du ni mi smra'o //
analyzed: 'gags ma thag pa yod pa nyid du ni mi smra'o //
translated: We do not say that the mind that has ceased to exist immediately before the present mind exists.

original: 'on kyang srang mda'i mthon dman bzhin du da ltar gyi sems ni bdag nyid kyi sems gzhan gyi rgyu'i dngos po rnam par bzhag nas 'gags la gzhan ni skye'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang srang mda'i mthon dman bzhin du da ltar gyi sems ni bdag nyid kyi sems gzhan gyi rgyu'i dngos po rnam par bzhag nas 'gags la gzhan ni skye'o //
translated: However, just as the two sides of a scale rise and fall, the present mind ceases to exist when it has established the causal entity of another mind of its own continuum, and another mind arises.

original: de ni 'gags la sems gzhan ni @154b skye bar 'gyur bas 'gags ma thag pa'i sems las sems gzhan skye'o zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de ni 'gags la sems gzhan ni @154b skye bar 'gyur bas 'gags ma thag pa'i sems las sems gzhan skye'o zhes bya ste /
translated: Since that mind ceases and another mind arises, another mind arises from the mind that has just ceased.

original: da lta dang nye bar yang da ltar dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: da lta dang nye bar yang da ltar dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the present is similar to the present.üîΩOthers say:

original: gzhan dag na re ni zhes bya ba ni mdo sde pa rnams te re zhig gzugs med par skyes pa rnams kyis zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re ni zhes bya ba ni mdo sde pa rnams te re zhig gzugs med par skyes pa rnams kyis zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: The present is similar to the present.

original: re zhig ces bya ba'i sgra ni rim gyis don te /
analyzed: re zhig ces bya ba'i sgra ni rim gyis don te /
translated: The word ‚Äúfirst‚Äù means in order.üîΩThe meaning of the example should be stated first.

original: re zhig dpe'i don 'di kho na brjod par bya ste zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: re zhig dpe'i don 'di kho na brjod par bya ste zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning of the word ‚Äúfirst.‚Äù

original: gzugs la ni mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen yod par mi 'dod na /
analyzed: gzugs la ni mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen yod par mi 'dod na /
translated: If you do not assert that form has a similar immediately preceding condition,

original: de ji ltar skye zhe na /
analyzed: de ji ltar skye zhe na /
translated: how does it arise?

original: de ni sems de kho na las skye'i gzugs las ni ma yin no zhes smra'o //
analyzed: de ni sems de kho na las skye'i gzugs las ni ma yin no zhes smra'o //
translated: We say that it arises from that mind alone, not from form.

original: 'di gnyis ni phan tshun sa bon can yin no zhes bya ba ni sems la yang dbang po dang bcas pa'i lus kyi sa bon yod la dbang po dang bcas pa'i lus la yang sems kyi sa bon yod do zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di gnyis ni phan tshun sa bon can yin no zhes bya ba ni sems la yang dbang po dang bcas pa'i lus kyi sa bon yod la dbang po dang bcas pa'i lus la yang sems kyi sa bon yod do zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: These two are seeds of each other. This means that the mind has the seed of the body together with the faculties, and the body together with the faculties has the seed of the mind.

original: yongs su dri ba las zhes bya ba ni yongs su dri ba zhes bya ba'i bstan bcos gnas brtan dbyig bshes kyis byas ba yin no //
analyzed: yongs su dri ba las zhes bya ba ni yongs su dri ba zhes bya ba'i bstan bcos gnas brtan dbyig bshes kyis byas ba yin no //
translated: From the Questions of Milinda. The treatise called the Questions of Milinda was composed by the elder Nagasena.

original: des de las bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: des de las bshad pa yin te /
translated: It explains this.

original: de'i bstan bcos bzhi lnga pa la sogs pa yang yod pas de'i phyir khyad par du byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i bstan bcos bzhi lnga pa la sogs pa yang yod pas de'i phyir khyad par du byed pa yin no //
translated: Since there are also four or five treatises by him, this is a specification.

original: de la skyon du 'gyur zhes bya ba skyon gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: de la skyon du 'gyur zhes bya ba skyon gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the fault there?

original: da ni ji ltar 'gags nas yun ring du lon pa'i sems las zhes bshad pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: da ni ji ltar 'gags nas yun ring du lon pa'i sems las zhes bshad pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Now, how is it that the mind that has long ceased is explained as the cause of the mind?

original: gsum 'dus pa zhes bya ba ni dbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa rnams so //
analyzed: gsum 'dus pa zhes bya ba ni dbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa rnams so //
translated: The three coming together refers to the faculties, objects, and consciousnesses.

original: 'di la 'du shes dang tshor ba dag kyang 'gag par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni btsun pa dbyig bshes kyi gzhung lugs 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa de sems dang bcas pa nyid yin yang 'di la 'du shes dang tshor ba dag 'gog go zhes byaüîΩba yin te /
analyzed: 'di la 'du shes dang tshor ba dag kyang 'gag par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni btsun pa dbyig bshes kyi gzhung lugs 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa de sems dang bcas pa nyid yin yang 'di la 'du shes dang tshor ba dag 'gog go zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: This is the system of the Venerable Vasumitra, who maintains that the meditative attainment of cessation is accompanied by mind, but that perception and feeling cease in this state.

original: de'i phyir de ltar thal bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar thal bar byed pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, this is the way that Vasubandhu presents the argument.

original: ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las skyes pa zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa dang lhan cig pa'i 'dus te reg pa ni ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las skyes pa zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa dang lhan cig pa'i 'dus te reg pa ni ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa'o //
translated: Arisen from contact associated with ignorance means contact associated with ignorance is contact that is simultaneous with ignorance.

original: de las skyes pa ni ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las skyes pa'o //
analyzed: de las skyes pa ni ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las skyes pa'o //
translated: Arisen from that is arisen from contact associated with ignorance.

original: tshor ba skye ba la ni ma byas zhes bya ba ni reg pa 'di lta bu ni tshor ba'i rkyen yin no zhes bya bar ro //
analyzed: tshor ba skye ba la ni ma byas zhes bya ba ni reg pa 'di lta bu ni tshor ba'i rkyen yin no zhes bya bar ro //
translated: Feeling does not arise means feeling does not arise due to this type of contact.

original: btsun pa dbyangs sgrogs de nyid kyis mjug brtul ba'i phyir de lta bas na sems med pa pa @155a * //
analyzed: btsun pa dbyangs sgrogs de nyid kyis mjug brtul ba'i phyir de lta bas na sems med pa pa @155a * //
translated: The Venerable Gho·π£aka concludes, Therefore, it is mindless.

original: yin no zhes zer zhes bya ba smos so //üîΩji ltar na sems med pa snyoms par 'jug pa nyid yin zhes bya ba ni 'di snyam du bsam gtan la sogs pa ni snyams  par 'jug pas sems dang sems las byung ba rnams mnyam par byed rtse gcig par byed pas snyoms par 'jug pa nyid yin
analyzed: yin no zhes zer zhes bya ba smos so // ji ltar na sems med pa snyoms par 'jug pa nyid yin zhes bya ba ni 'di snyam du bsam gtan la sogs pa ni snyams  par 'jug pas sems dang sems las byung ba rnams mnyam par byed rtse gcig par byed pas snyoms par 'jug pa nyid yin
translated: The answer is yes.üîΩHow can that which is without mind be meditative attainment?

original: par 'os kyi snyam du bsams nas 'dri bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: par 'os kyi snyam du bsams nas 'dri bar byed pa yin no //
translated: Thinking that meditative attainment is only proper for the absorptions, etc., since they are meditative attainments that equalize and unify mind and mental factors, he asks this question.üîΩBecause it is the establishment of the sameness of the great elements.

original: 'byung ba chen po mnyam pa nyid du bsgrub pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'dis 'byung ba chen po rnams mnyam par byed pas na snyoms par 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po mnyam pa nyid du bsgrub pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'dis 'byung ba chen po rnams mnyam par byed pas na snyoms par 'jug pa yin no //
translated: Since this establishes the sameness of the great elements, it is a meditative attainment.

original: de ltar na 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa 'di dang bsam gtan la sogs pa la snyoms par 'jug pa nyid yod do //
analyzed: de ltar na 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa 'di dang bsam gtan la sogs pa la snyoms par 'jug pa nyid yod do //
translated: Thus, this meditative attainment of cessation and the meditative attainments of the absorptions, etc., exist.

original: 'di la 'byung ba chen po rnams kyi mnyam pa nyid gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'di la 'byung ba chen po rnams kyi mnyam pa nyid gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the sameness of the great elements in this case?

original: sems skye ba dang 'gal bar yang dag par gnas pa'o /
analyzed: sems skye ba dang 'gal bar yang dag par gnas pa'o /
translated: It is the correct abiding that is incompatible with the arising of mind.

original: // / bam po bco lnga pa /
analyzed: // / bam po bco lnga pa /
translated: Chapter 15üîΩ

original: 'thob par 'gyur bas na zhes bya ba ni de la snyoms par 'jug cing 'thob par 'gyur bas na snyoms par 'jug pa ste las su sgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: 'thob par 'gyur bas na zhes bya ba ni de la snyoms par 'jug cing 'thob par 'gyur bas na snyoms par 'jug pa ste las su sgrub pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause it causes attainment‚Äù means that it causes attainment and enters into meditative attainment.

original: rnal 'byor pa dag bsam gtan la sogs pa yang 'thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa dag bsam gtan la sogs pa yang 'thob par 'gyur te /
translated: yogis also attain the meditative development of the absorptions, etc.

original: de lta bas na bsam gtan la sogs pa yang snyoms par 'jug pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na bsam gtan la sogs pa yang snyoms par 'jug pa nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, the absorptions, etc. are meditative attainment.

original: rdzas su zhes bya ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid du'o //
analyzed: rdzas su zhes bya ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid du'o //
translated: ‚ÄúSubstantially‚Äù means ‚Äúin terms of their own intrinsic nature.‚Äù

original: sems skye ba la bgegs byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar sems skye ba'i bgegs byed pa yin no //
analyzed: sems skye ba la bgegs byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar sems skye ba'i bgegs byed pa yin no //
translated: Because it obstructs the arising of mind means that it obstructs the arising of mind in this way.

original: ma yin te snyoms par 'jug pa'i sems kho na zhes bya ba de ni de lta ma yin no //
analyzed: ma yin te snyoms par 'jug pa'i sems kho na zhes bya ba de ni de lta ma yin no //
translated: No, it is only the mind of meditative attainment. That is not so.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it not so?

original: snyoms par 'jug pa'i sems kho na de la bgegs byed pa'i phyir te sems skye ba la bgegs byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa'i sems kho na de la bgegs byed pa'i phyir te sems skye ba la bgegs byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Because it obstructs only the mind of meditative attainment, i.e., because it obstructs the arising of mind.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is it so?

original: de bstan pa'i phyir snyoms par 'jug pa'i sems kho na zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
analyzed: de bstan pa'i phyir snyoms par 'jug pa'i sems kho na zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
translated: It is only the mind of meditative equipoise.

original: de nyid snyoms par 'jug pa'i sems kho na yin gyi rdzas gzhan ni med do //
analyzed: de nyid snyoms par 'jug pa'i sems kho na yin gyi rdzas gzhan ni med do //
translated: It is only the mind of meditative equipoise, not a different substance.

original: de dang 'gal ba'i rten bskyed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni sems dang 'gal ba'i rten te rgyud bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang 'gal ba'i rten bskyed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni sems dang 'gal ba'i rten te rgyud bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it generates a basis that is incompatible with mind means because it generates a continuum that is incompatible with mind.

original: sems gang gis na gtan du ma yin pa dus gzhan gyi bar du mi 'jug par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: sems gang gis na gtan du ma yin pa dus gzhan gyi bar du mi 'jug par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: By what mind is it not entered for a long time, but only for a period of time?

original: tsam zhes @155b bya ba'i sgra ni rdzas gzhan bzlog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tsam zhes @155b bya ba'i sgra ni rdzas gzhan bzlog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word ‚Äúonly‚Äù excludes other substances.

original: sems gzhan dang 'gal ba ste /
analyzed: sems gzhan dang 'gal ba ste /
translated: It is incompatible with other minds.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i sems dang 'gal ba skye'o //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i sems dang 'gal ba skye'o //
translated: It is generated as incompatible with future minds.

original: mi 'jug pa tsam gang yin pa de la snyoms par 'jug pa zhes gdags te 'di ni btags pa'i chos yin gyi rdzas kyi chos ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mi 'jug pa tsam gang yin pa de la snyoms par 'jug pa zhes gdags te 'di ni btags pa'i chos yin gyi rdzas kyi chos ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: That mere non-engagement is designated as meditative equipoise. This is an imputed phenomenon, not a substantial phenomenon.

original: gal te rdzas kyi chos ma yin na 'di ji ltar 'dus byas zhes gdags she na /üîΩsmras pa / mi 'jug pa tsam de yang sngon ma byung ba dang dus phyis langs pa'i rnal 'byor pa la med pa yin pas 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa 'am /
analyzed: gal te rdzas kyi chos ma yin na 'di ji ltar 'dus byas zhes gdags she na / smras pa / mi 'jug pa tsam de yang sngon ma byung ba dang dus phyis langs pa'i rnal 'byor pa la med pa yin pas 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa 'am /
translated: If it is not a substantial entity, how can it be designated as a conditioned entity?

original: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug par yang rung snyoms par 'jug pa 'di ni tha snyad du 'dus byas su gdags kyi rdzas su ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug par yang rung snyoms par 'jug pa 'di ni tha snyad du 'dus byas su gdags kyi rdzas su ni ma yin no //
translated: We respond: That mere non-engagement also does not exist for yogis who have not previously generated it or who have arisen from it. Therefore, this meditative attainment, whether it is the meditative attainment of the non-perceptual state or the meditative attainment of cessation, is designated as a conditioned entity conventionally, but not substantially.

original: rten nyid de ltar mnyam par sgrub pa zhes bya ba ni de lta bur rnam par 'jog pa ste /
analyzed: rten nyid de ltar mnyam par sgrub pa zhes bya ba ni de lta bur rnam par 'jog pa ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúit is established as such by the mere fact that it is the basis‚Äù means that it is posited in that way.

original: gnas skabs kyi khyad par yin te /
analyzed: gnas skabs kyi khyad par yin te /
translated: It is a specific state.

original: kho bo cag ni snyoms par 'jug pas bskyed pa 'di la snyoms par 'jug pa zhes 'dogs so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: kho bo cag ni snyoms par 'jug pas bskyed pa 'di la snyoms par 'jug pa zhes 'dogs so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: We designate this meditative attainment that is generated by meditative attainment as a meditative attainment.

original: gnas skabs de yang snga ma bzhin du byung bar ma gyur pa dang phyis langs pa la med pas 'dus byas nyid du 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: gnas skabs de yang snga ma bzhin du byung bar ma gyur pa dang phyis langs pa la med pas 'dus byas nyid du 'gal ba med do //
translated: and it is not that it did not exist in a previous state and then arises later.

original: yang na snyoms par 'jug pa zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: yang na snyoms par 'jug pa zhes 'byung ste /
translated: Or else, it is called meditative attainment.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa de 'dus byas kyi gnas skabs kyi khyad par yin pa'i phyir 'dus byas nyid du 'grub bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa de 'dus byas kyi gnas skabs kyi khyad par yin pa'i phyir 'dus byas nyid du 'grub bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Because that meditative attainment is a specific state of conditioned states, it is established as a conditioned state.

original: 'du shes med pa pa yang de bzhin du zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni /
analyzed: 'du shes med pa pa yang de bzhin du zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni /
translated: The state of composure without conception is also like that.

original: rnal 'byor pa 'dis 'du shes med pa pa der sems kho na sems 'jug pa pa dang 'gal ba pa 'thob po //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa 'dis 'du shes med pa pa der sems kho na sems 'jug pa pa dang 'gal ba pa 'thob po //
translated: This yogi obtains the state of composure without conception, which is the mere non-functioning of the mind.

original: mi 'jug pa tsam de yang sems dang sems las byung ba rnams zhes bya ba tshig lhag ma yin te /
analyzed: mi 'jug pa tsam de yang sems dang sems las byung ba rnams zhes bya ba tshig lhag ma yin te /
translated: The mere non-functioning of the mind is a state of mind and mental factors, as the remainder of the sentence indicates.

original: 'du shes med pa pa zhes bya bar gdags kyi rdzas su ni med do zhes bya bar bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: 'du shes med pa pa zhes bya bar gdags kyi rdzas su ni med do zhes bya bar bsams pa yin no //
translated: The state of composure without conception is designated as such, but it does not exist as a substance.üîΩThe state of composure of cessation is also like that.üîΩThis yogi obtains the state of composure of cessation, which is the mere non-functioning of the mind and mental factors.üîΩThe mere non-functioning of the mind and mental factors is a state of mind and mental factors, as the remainder of the sentence indicates.üîΩThe state of composure of cessation is designated as such, but it does not exist as a substance.

original: de lta bas na drod dang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni drod dang rnam par shes pa 'jug pa ne srog la rag las pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na drod dang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni drod dang rnam par shes pa 'jug pa ne srog la rag las pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, heat and consciousness are dependent on life force.

original: de lta bas na srog ni drod dang rnam par shes pa'i rten yin no zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de lta bas na srog ni drod dang rnam par shes pa'i rten yin no zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Thus, life force is the support of heat and consciousness.

original: gnas pa'i rgyu yang de dag kho na yin no //üîΩrtag tu ldog pa med @156a * //
analyzed: gnas pa'i rgyu yang de dag kho na yin no // rtag tu ldog pa med @156a * //
translated: And those are the causes of their duration.üîΩIt would follow that they would never cease.

original: par thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni 'di dag rtag tu rgyun chags par thal bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: par thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni 'di dag rtag tu rgyun chags par thal bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: It would follow that they would always be continuous.

original: ris mthun pa gnas pa'i dus kyi 'phen pa yin zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ris mthun pa gnas pa'i dus kyi 'phen pa yin zhes bya ba la /
translated: The projection of the duration of the life-stream.

original: ris mthun pa ni gzugs la sogs pa phung po lnga'i ngo bo nyid kyi 'du byed de lta bu de dag kho na yin no zhes bshad zin to //
analyzed: ris mthun pa ni gzugs la sogs pa phung po lnga'i ngo bo nyid kyi 'du byed de lta bu de dag kho na yin no zhes bshad zin to //
translated: The life-stream is the continuum of the five aggregates, such as form, and so on.

original: de dag gnas pa ni rgyun to //
analyzed: de dag gnas pa ni rgyun to //
translated: Its duration is its continuity.

original: de'i dus ni des ji srid du gnas par 'gyur ba'i 'du byed kyi mtshan nyid de snyed pa de dag kho na yin no //
analyzed: de'i dus ni des ji srid du gnas par 'gyur ba'i 'du byed kyi mtshan nyid de snyed pa de dag kho na yin no //
translated: The time of its duration is the characteristic of the formation that endures for a certain period of time.

original: de 'phangs pa ni tshe rabs snga ma'i las kyis nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i skad cig ma la rgyur rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: de 'phangs pa ni tshe rabs snga ma'i las kyis nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i skad cig ma la rgyur rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
translated: The projection of that life is posited as the cause of the moment of linking at conception due to karma in a former life.

original: rgyu de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu de yang gang zhe na /
translated: What is that cause?

original: nus pa'i khyad par yin te /
analyzed: nus pa'i khyad par yin te /
translated: It is a special potency.

original: de ni brgyud pa'i phung po'i rgyun gyi mtshan nyid kyi gnas pa'i rgyur 'gyur ro //üîΩde nyid kyi phyir gnas pa'i dus 'phangs pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de ni brgyud pa'i phung po'i rgyun gyi mtshan nyid kyi gnas pa'i rgyur 'gyur ro // de nyid kyi phyir gnas pa'i dus 'phangs pa zhes bya ste /
translated: It becomes the cause of the duration of the continuum of the aggregates, which is characterized by abiding.

original: dus re zhig rgyun chags pa la ltos pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus re zhig rgyun chags pa la ltos pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore it is called projected duration because it is characterized by the continuum that lasts for a certain time.

original: de gnas pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de gnas pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: That is called abiding.

original: de zhes bya ba ni ris mthun pa'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni ris mthun pa'o //
translated: That refers to a class affiliate.

original: 'bru rnams kyi smin pa'i dus 'phen pa lta bu ni ji ltar 'bru rnams kyi smin pa'i dus kyi 'phen pa nus pa'i khyad par gyi ngo bo nyid skad cig ma brgyud pas ji srid ma smin gyi bar du 'bru'i rgyun gyi rgyur 'gyur ba gang yin pa
analyzed: 'bru rnams kyi smin pa'i dus 'phen pa lta bu ni ji ltar 'bru rnams kyi smin pa'i dus kyi 'phen pa nus pa'i khyad par gyi ngo bo nyid skad cig ma brgyud pas ji srid ma smin gyi bar du 'bru'i rgyun gyi rgyur 'gyur ba gang yin pa
translated: The projection of the time of ripening of grains is like this. Just as the projection of the time of ripening of grains is the cause of the continuum of grains until they ripen, which is the essence of a special potency that is a continuum of moments,

original: sa bon gyi myu gu la 'jog pa ltar 'di yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: sa bon gyi myu gu la 'jog pa ltar 'di yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: Just as the sprout is posited as the seed, so it is here.

original: mda' 'phangs pa dag gi gnas pa'i dus kyi 'phen pa bzhin zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mda' 'phangs pa dag gi gnas pa'i dus kyi 'phen pa bzhin zhes bya ba la /
translated: Like the impetus of the duration of an arrow that is shot.

original: mda' 'phangs pa'i gnas pa ni nam mkha'i yul gzhan du 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: mda' 'phangs pa'i gnas pa ni nam mkha'i yul gzhan du 'byung ba ste /
translated: The duration of an arrow that is shot is the occurrence of the object of space in another place.

original: rgyun gyis 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: rgyun gyis 'jug pa'o //
translated: It is the engagement of a continuum.

original: de'i dus ni mtshams te gang phan chad du mi 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: de'i dus ni mtshams te gang phan chad du mi 'byung ba'o //
translated: Its time is a period, because it does not occur beyond that.

original: de'i 'phen pa ni rgyu rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: de'i 'phen pa ni rgyu rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: Its impetus is the establishment of a cause.

original: rgyu de yang gang zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu de yang gang zhig yin zhe na /
translated: What is that cause?

original: 'bad pa khyad par can du gyur pa las grub pa'i rlung gi khams kyis bskyed pa'i nus pa'i khyad par yin te /
analyzed: 'bad pa khyad par can du gyur pa las grub pa'i rlung gi khams kyis bskyed pa'i nus pa'i khyad par yin te /
translated: It is the special potency generated by the wind element that is the result of special exertion.

original: ji ltar mda' 'phangs pa dag gi gnas pa'i dus kyi 'phen pa rdzas gzhan med pa ltar tshe'i mtshan nyid kyi 'phen pa 'di yang de dang 'dra bar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar mda' 'phangs pa dag gi gnas pa'i dus kyi 'phen pa rdzas gzhan med pa ltar tshe'i mtshan nyid kyi 'phen pa 'di yang de dang 'dra bar blta bar bya'o //
translated: Just as the impetus of the duration of an arrow that is shot is not a different substance, so this impetus of the characteristics of life should be regarded as similar.

original: gang zhig sems pa zhes bya ba ni bye brag pa yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig sems pa zhes bya ba ni bye brag pa yin no //
translated: The one called mind is a Vai≈õe·π£ika.

original: 'du byed ces bya ba yon tan gyi khyad par zhes bya ba ni sa la sogs pa yon tan khyad par can 'du byed ces bya ba las /
analyzed: 'du byed ces bya ba yon tan gyi khyad par zhes bya ba ni sa la sogs pa yon tan khyad par can 'du byed ces bya ba las /
translated: The term ‚Äúdistinctive quality‚Äù refers to the distinctive qualities of earth and so on, which are called ‚Äúcompositional factors.‚Äù

original: las skyes @156b pa dang las kyi rgyu can yin pa ming gnyis pa shugs zhes bya ba mda' la skye ste de'i dbang gis yon tan 'di'i dbang gis ma ltung gi bar du 'gro bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: las skyes @156b pa dang las kyi rgyu can yin pa ming gnyis pa shugs zhes bya ba mda' la skye ste de'i dbang gis yon tan 'di'i dbang gis ma ltung gi bar du 'gro bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The term ‚Äúforce‚Äù is a synonym for ‚Äúaction‚Äù and ‚Äúthat which arises from action.‚Äù It is generated in the arrow and, by its power, the arrow moves until it falls to the ground.

original: de'i phyir de la 'di dper mi rung ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir de la 'di dper mi rung ste /
translated: Therefore, this example is not appropriate.

original: ji ltar 'du byed ces bya ba rdzas gzhan yod pa de bzhin du tshe yang yod par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'du byed ces bya ba rdzas gzhan yod pa de bzhin du tshe yang yod par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Just as the so-called compositional factors are substantially real, so too is life substantially real.

original: de'i phyir slob dpon gyis de'i gzhung lugs sun dbyung ba de'i ni zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir slob dpon gyis de'i gzhung lugs sun dbyung ba de'i ni zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
translated: Therefore, the master presents the following critique of the Vai≈õe·π£ika position:

original: de'i zhes bya ba ni bye brag pa'i'o //
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba ni bye brag pa'i'o //
translated: The term ‚Äúhis‚Äù refers to the Vai≈õe·π£ika.

original: de ni gcig pu yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'du byed de gcig pu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni gcig pu yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'du byed de gcig pu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is singular means because the compositional factor is singular.

original: gags  byed pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni shing la rtugs pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gags  byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gags  byed pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni shing la rtugs pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gags  byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no obstruction. There is no obstruction in the form of a tree trunk, etc.

original: ci zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhe na /
translated: What is not tenable?

original: yul gzhan dag tu mgyogs pa dang ches dang shin tu ches dang mgyogs par phyin pa'i dus kyi bye brag kyang mi 'thad de /
analyzed: yul gzhan dag tu mgyogs pa dang ches dang shin tu ches dang mgyogs par phyin pa'i dus kyi bye brag kyang mi 'thad de /
translated: The distinctions of speed, greater speed, and extreme speed in going to other places are not tenable.

original: mgyogs pa dang ches mgyogs pa dang shin tu ches mgyogs pa'o //
analyzed: mgyogs pa dang ches mgyogs pa dang shin tu ches mgyogs pa'o //
translated: Speed, greater speed, and extreme speed.

original: gang dag tu zhe na /
analyzed: gang dag tu zhe na /
translated: Where?

original: yul gzhan dag dang bcas par te nam mkha'i yul la sogs par ro //
analyzed: yul gzhan dag dang bcas par te nam mkha'i yul la sogs par ro //
translated: In other places, in the place of space, etc.

original: de'i dus de'i bye brag de mi 'thad de gong du bshad pa'i gtan tshigs de gnyis kyis ni yul gzhan dag dang bcas par mgyogs pa dang ches mgyogs pa dang shin tu ches mgyogs par mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de'i dus de'i bye brag de mi 'thad de gong du bshad pa'i gtan tshigs de gnyis kyis ni yul gzhan dag dang bcas par mgyogs pa dang ches mgyogs pa dang shin tu ches mgyogs par mi 'thad do //
translated: The distinctions of speed, greater speed, and extreme speed are not tenable there, because of the two reasons explained above.

original: 'du byed pa la khyad par med pa'i phyir ltung bar yang mi 'thad do //
analyzed: 'du byed pa la khyad par med pa'i phyir ltung bar yang mi 'thad do //
translated: And because there is no difference in the activity, falling is not tenable.

original: 'du byed yod na mda' ltung bar yang mi 'thad de /
analyzed: 'du byed yod na mda' ltung bar yang mi 'thad de /
translated: If there is formative force, it is untenable that the arrow falls.

original: rgyu yod bzhin du 'bras bu mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ba 'di ni mi 'dod do //
analyzed: rgyu yod bzhin du 'bras bu mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ba 'di ni mi 'dod do //
translated: For, it is not accepted that an effect does not occur when its cause exists.üîΩIf you say that the wind obstructs it,

original: gal te rlung gis de la gags  byas so zhe na zhes bya ba ni gal te de la rlung gis gags  byas pa'i phyir rlung gags  byed pa'i khyad par las mgyogs pa dang ches dang shin tu ches mgyogs par phyin par yang 'thad la ltungüîΩbar yang 'thad de /
analyzed: gal te rlung gis de la gags  byas so zhe na zhes bya ba ni gal te de la rlung gis gags  byas pa'i phyir rlung gags  byed pa'i khyad par las mgyogs pa dang ches dang shin tu ches mgyogs par phyin par yang 'thad la ltung bar yang 'thad de /
translated: if you say that the wind obstructs it, then it is tenable that the arrow moves quickly, very quickly, and extremely quickly due to the special obstruction of the wind and that it falls due to the obstruction of the wind.

original: reg pa dang ldan pa'i rdzas phrad pa las las med do zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bar 'dod na /
analyzed: reg pa dang ldan pa'i rdzas phrad pa las las med do zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bar 'dod na /
translated: For, it is said that action does not exist from the contact of a tangible object possessing contact.

original: 'dir tshu rol du ltung bar thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'dir tshu rol du ltung bar thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Here, it is said that the consequence is that it falls to one side.

original: mda' 'phangs na rlung dang ldan pas gzhu rgyud dang bral ma thag kho nar drung nyid du ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mda' 'phangs na rlung dang ldan pas gzhu rgyud dang bral ma thag kho nar drung nyid du ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If an arrow is shot, it falls to the ground immediately after it is released from the bowstring because it is endowed with wind.

original: 'on te rlung gis gags  byas kyang dung du mi ltung na ni gzhar yang mi @157a * //
analyzed: 'on te rlung gis gags  byas kyang dung du mi ltung na ni gzhar yang mi @157a * //
translated: But if it does not fall into the conch because it is obstructed by the wind, then it would never fall.üîΩ

original: ltung bar 'gyur te phyis kyang ltung bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ltung bar 'gyur te phyis kyang ltung bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: But if it does not fall into the conch because it is obstructed by the wind, then it will never fall, because it will not fall later either.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rlung la khyad par med pa'i phyir te nye ba la ji lta bar ring ba la yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: rlung la khyad par med pa'i phyir te nye ba la ji lta bar ring ba la yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: Because there is no difference in the wind. Just as it is near, so it is far.

original: ya nga ba yongs su ma spangs pas so zhes bya ba ni bag med par za ba la sogs pa'i ya nga ba ma spangs pas so //
analyzed: ya nga ba yongs su ma spangs pas so zhes bya ba ni bag med par za ba la sogs pa'i ya nga ba ma spangs pas so //
translated: Because the danger has not been completely eliminated.

original: tshe zad na bsod nams zad pa 'chi ba la nus pa med de de'i phyir mu gsum par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshe zad na bsod nams zad pa 'chi ba la nus pa med de de'i phyir mu gsum par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: When life is exhausted, the exhaustion of merit has no power over death, so the third alternative does not occur.

original: de lta bas na gnyi ga zad na gnyi ga zad pa las 'chi ba zhes bya ba ni gnyi ga zad na zhes bya ba'i don gang yin pa de ni gnyi ga zad pas zhes bya ba'i don 'di yin par bshad par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na gnyi ga zad na gnyi ga zad pa las 'chi ba zhes bya ba ni gnyi ga zad na zhes bya ba'i don gang yin pa de ni gnyi ga zad pas zhes bya ba'i don 'di yin par bshad par rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, when both are exhausted, death occurs from the exhaustion of both. The meaning of ‚Äúwhen both are exhausted‚Äù is explained as the meaning of ‚Äúfrom the exhaustion of both.‚Äù

original: tshe ma zad par yang 'chi bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ji ltar shes she na /
analyzed: tshe ma zad par yang 'chi bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ji ltar shes she na /
translated: How do we know that one dies before one‚Äôs life span is exhausted?

original: 'bru la sogs pa dang chos mthun pa'i phyir te /üîΩ'bru la sogs pa ni sa bon gyi 'phen pa yongs su zad phan chad zhing dang chu la sogs pa rkyen gzhan yod kyang 'bras bu smin pa'am /
analyzed: 'bru la sogs pa dang chos mthun pa'i phyir te / 'bru la sogs pa ni sa bon gyi 'phen pa yongs su zad phan chad zhing dang chu la sogs pa rkyen gzhan yod kyang 'bras bu smin pa'am /
translated: Because of the similarity of the situation to that of grain, etc.üîΩWe see that grain, etc., ceases to grow when the momentum of the seed is exhausted, even though other conditions such as the field, water, etc., are present.

original: 'bras bu smin pa'i dus su ma phyin pa kho nar rgyun ldog pa yang mthong ste /üîΩsa bon shin tu grung ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩsa bon grung po'i 'phen pa yod kyang chu la sogs pa gnas pa dang 'phel ba la sogs pa'i rkyen med pa'i phyir rgyun ldog pa yang mthong ngo //üîΩsa bon gyi 'phen pa dang gnas pa dang 'phel ba'i rkyen med na yang mthong ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu smin pa'i dus su ma phyin pa kho nar rgyun ldog pa yang mthong ste / sa bon shin tu grung ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro // sa bon grung po'i 'phen pa yod kyang chu la sogs pa gnas pa dang 'phel ba la sogs pa'i rkyen med pa'i phyir rgyun ldog pa yang mthong ngo // sa bon gyi 'phen pa dang gnas pa dang 'phel ba'i rkyen med na yang mthong ste /
translated: We see that even when the momentum of the seed is strong, the continuum ceases if conditions such as water, etc., are absent.üîΩWe see that even when the momentum of the seed and the conditions such as water, etc., are present, the continuum ceases if the conditions for remaining and growing, such as a field, etc., are absent.

original: gang gi tshe sa bon gyi 'phen pa yang yongs su rdzogs pa yin la chu yang med pa na'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe sa bon gyi 'phen pa yang yongs su rdzogs pa yin la chu yang med pa na'o //
translated: We see that even when the conditions for the momentum of the seed and for remaining and growing are present, the continuum ceases if the conditions for ripening, such as time, etc., are absent.üîΩWe see that even when the conditions for the momentum of the seed and for remaining and growing and for ripening are present, the continuum ceases if the conditions for the production of the fruit, such as a bird, etc., are absent.

original: sa bon grung po'i 'phen pa yang yod la chu la sogs pa gnas pa dang 'phel ba'i rkyen yang yod kyang 'gro ba la sogs pa'i gnod pas 'bru la sogs pa'i rgyun ldog pa yang mthong ba lta bu'o //üîΩgang la lus la gnod pas gnod par 'gyur ba de ni rgyud la rag lus pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di ni nyi 'og pa'i gzhung lugs yin te /
analyzed: sa bon grung po'i 'phen pa yang yod la chu la sogs pa gnas pa dang 'phel ba'i rkyen yang yod kyang 'gro ba la sogs pa'i gnod pas 'bru la sogs pa'i rgyun ldog pa yang mthong ba lta bu'o // gang la lus la gnod pas gnod par 'gyur ba de ni rgyud la rag lus pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di ni nyi 'og pa'i gzhung lugs yin te /
translated: The seed is projected by the seed‚Äôs own potency, and water, etc., are the conditions for its endurance and growth, but the continuum of the seed, etc., is seen to be interrupted by the harm of being burned by fire, etc.

original: tshe de ni lus kyi rgyud la rag lus pa yin pas rgyud la rag lus pa zhes bya'o //üîΩkha che ba'i gzhung lugs ltar na yang don ni de kho nar zad de glo bur dang bcas pa dang glo bur med pa zhes bya ba sgra tsam zhig tha dad par zad do //
analyzed: tshe de ni lus kyi rgyud la rag lus pa yin pas rgyud la rag lus pa zhes bya'o //üîΩkha che ba'i gzhung lugs ltar na yang don ni de kho nar zad de glo bur dang bcas pa dang glo bur med pa zhes bya ba sgra tsam zhig tha dad par zad do //
translated: The VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas of Western India say: That which is harmed by harm to the body is called dependent on the continuum because the life force is dependent on the body‚Äôs continuum.üîΩThe meaning is the same in the system of the Kashmiris, but they say that the life force is dependent on the body‚Äôs continuum because it is associated with adventitious conditions.üîΩThe meaning is the same in the system of the Kashmiris, but they say that the life force is dependent on the body‚Äôs continuum because it is associated with adventitious conditions.

original: yang na rgyud la rag lus pa de ni rgyud kho na la yod pa 'ba' zhig yin gyi lan cig skyes nas gnas pa ma yin @157b pas glo bur dang bcas pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: yang na rgyud la rag lus pa de ni rgyud kho na la yod pa 'ba' zhig yin gyi lan cig skyes nas gnas pa ma yin @157b pas glo bur dang bcas pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Or else, it is adventitious because it is dependent on the stream, and it exists only in the stream, not in a single moment.

original: lung 'dis ni dus ma yin par 'chi ba yod do zhes ston par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: lung 'dis ni dus ma yin par 'chi ba yod do zhes ston par byed pa yin no //
translated: This scriptural passage shows that untimely death exists.üîΩA sutra declares that untimely death exists.üîΩThe sutra states:

original: mdo las kyang dus ma yin par 'chi ba yod par 'byung ngo zhes bstan pa'i phyir mdo las lus thob pa ni bzhi ste zhes bya ba rgyas par smos ta /
analyzed: mdo las kyang dus ma yin par 'chi ba yod par 'byung ngo zhes bstan pa'i phyir mdo las lus thob pa ni bzhi ste zhes bya ba rgyas par smos ta /
translated: There are four types of obtaining a body.

original: bdag nyid 'chi ba ni bdag nyid kyis 'chi ba'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid 'chi ba ni bdag nyid kyis 'chi ba'o //
translated: Death by oneself is death by one‚Äôs own hand.

original: gzhan gyis gsod pa ni pha rol pos gsod pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis gsod pa ni pha rol pos gsod pa'o //
translated: Death by another is death at the hands of another.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi yang yin par brjod par bya ba ci zhe na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi yang yin par brjod par bya ba ci zhe na /
translated: Should we say that this is also the case for buddhas?

original: bdag nyid 'grongs ba de bdag nyid 'grongs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid 'grongs ba de bdag nyid 'grongs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Death by oneself is death by one‚Äôs own hand.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni mi brdzi ba'i chos can dang sku tshe gtong ba la mnga' brnyes pa yang yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni mi brdzi ba'i chos can dang sku tshe gtong ba la mnga' brnyes pa yang yin no //
translated: The Bhagavan buddhas possess the quality of being invincible and they have mastery over relinquishing their lifespans.

original: phal cher zhes bya ba smos pa ni mu bzhi par bstan pa dmyal ba dang srid pa bar ma pa la sogs pa yongs su spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phal cher zhes bya ba smos pa ni mu bzhi par bstan pa dmyal ba dang srid pa bar ma pa la sogs pa yongs su spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The term ‚Äúmostly‚Äù is used because the four possibilities are taught, excluding hell beings, intermediate beings, and so on.

original: rgyal po'i drang srong ni sngon 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po byed byed pa las rab tu byung ba'o //
analyzed: rgyal po'i drang srong ni sngon 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po byed byed pa las rab tu byung ba'o //
translated: A royal sage is one who previously was a cakravartin king and then goes forth.

original: rgyal ba'i pho nya ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis 'ga' zhig pho nyar btang ba gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: rgyal ba'i pho nya ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis 'ga' zhig pho nyar btang ba gang yin pa ste /
translated: A messenger of the Victor is one who is sent by the Bhagavat Buddha to some place.

original: dper na bcom ldan 'das kyis ne tso gcig cig aa mra skyong ma'i thog tu btang ba litstsha b'i rnams kyis phrin zer ba yin par mthong nas mda' rub kyis brubs kyang gsad par ma nus pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: dper na bcom ldan 'das kyis ne tso gcig cig aa mra skyong ma'i thog tu btang ba litstsha b'i rnams kyis phrin zer ba yin par mthong nas mda' rub kyis brubs kyang gsad par ma nus pa lta bu ste /
translated: For example, the Bhagavat sent a parrot to ƒÄmrapƒÅlƒ´, and the Licchavis saw him and surrounded him with arrows, but they were unable to kill him.

original: ji srid du pho nya'i bya ba de ma byas pa de srid du bdag nyid 'chi bar yang mi 'gyur la gzhan gyis gsod par yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji srid du pho nya'i bya ba de ma byas pa de srid du bdag nyid 'chi bar yang mi 'gyur la gzhan gyis gsod par yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: As long as he did not complete his mission as a messenger, he could not be killed by others.

original: rgyal bas bstan pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyis 'dis 'di srid cig thub par 'gyur ro zhes bka' stsal pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rgyal bas bstan pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyis 'dis 'di srid cig thub par 'gyur ro zhes bka' stsal pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The Victor has taught that the Blessed One has declared that this one will live for so long.

original: chos len zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sngon gyi gtam rgyud dag las khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: chos len zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sngon gyi gtam rgyud dag las khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù should be understood from the previous stories.

original: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni gzhan dag kyang rtogs par bya ste /
analyzed: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni gzhan dag kyang rtogs par bya ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù indicates that one should understand other cases as well.

original: de dag ni bdag nyid kyang 'chi bar mi 'gyur la gzhan gyis kyang gsod par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag ni bdag nyid kyang 'chi bar mi 'gyur la gzhan gyis kyang gsod par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They do not die by their own hand, nor are they killed by others.

original: srid pa tha ma pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni gang dag tshe de kho na la dgra bcom pa nyid 'thob pa yin no //
analyzed: srid pa tha ma pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni gang dag tshe de kho na la dgra bcom pa nyid 'thob pa yin no //
translated: Bodhisattvas in their last existence are those who attain the state of an arhat in that very life.

original: byang chub sems dpa' yum de'i lhums na gnas pa ni byang chub sems dpa' lhums na bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' yum de'i lhums na gnas pa ni byang chub sems dpa' lhums na bzhugs pa'o //
translated: A bodhisattva in the womb is a bodhisattva who is in the womb.

original: 'khor los sgyur ba'i ma 'khor los sgyur ba mngal na gnas pa ste /
analyzed: 'khor los sgyur ba'i ma 'khor los sgyur ba mngal na gnas pa ste /
translated: A universal monarch in the womb is a universal monarch who is in the womb.

original: de dag ni bdag nyid @158a * //
analyzed: de dag ni bdag nyid @158a * //
translated: They do not die by their own hand,

original: kyang mi 'chi la gzhan gyis kyang gsod par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kyang mi 'chi la gzhan gyis kyang gsod par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But they do not die and they are not killed by others.

original: gal te gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa thams cad bdag nyid kyang mi 'chi la gzhan gyis kyang gsod par mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa thams cad bdag nyid kyang mi 'chi la gzhan gyis kyang gsod par mi 'gyur na /
translated: If those who experience the form and formless realms do not die and are not killed by others,

original: 'o na yang ci'i phyir mdo las gsungs zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
analyzed: 'o na yang ci'i phyir mdo las gsungs zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
translated: why does the sutra state in detail:üîΩ‚ÄúThere is neither in that realm‚Äù?

original: de na ni gnyi ga med do zhes bya ba ni 'du shes med 'du shes med min gyi skye mched de na'o //
analyzed: de na ni gnyi ga med do zhes bya ba ni 'du shes med 'du shes med min gyi skye mched de na'o //
translated: In the base of neither discernment nor nondiscernment, both are absent.

original: rang gi sa pa'i 'phags pa'i lam ni med de /
analyzed: rang gi sa pa'i 'phags pa'i lam ni med de /
translated: The ƒÅrya path of that level does not exist there.

original: ji srid du 'du shes la snyoms par 'jug pa de srid du de kun shes pa 'thob bo zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji srid du 'du shes la snyoms par 'jug pa de srid du de kun shes pa 'thob bo zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is said, ‚ÄúAs long as one enters meditative attainment of discernment, one obtains complete knowledge.‚Äù

original: sa gong ma pa'i nyer bsdogs kyang med de gong nas med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa gong ma pa'i nyer bsdogs kyang med de gong nas med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The access concentration of higher levels also does not exist there because it is not higher.

original: gzhan gyi sa pa'i 'phags pa'i lam zhes bya ba ni ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi sa pa'i 'phags pa'i lam ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyi sa pa'i 'phags pa'i lam zhes bya ba ni ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi sa pa'i 'phags pa'i lam ste /
translated: The ƒÅrya path of other levels refers to the ƒÅrya path of the base of nothingness.

original: srid rtser 'phags pa ci yang med //
analyzed: srid rtser 'phags pa ci yang med //
translated: The noble ones in the summit of existence are nonperishing.

original: mngon sum byas pas zag pa zad //üîΩces bya ba'i phyir ro //üîΩ'o na ni mtha' smos pas zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mngon sum byas pas zag pa zad // ces bya ba'i phyir ro // 'o na ni mtha' smos pas zhes bya ba la /
translated: They exhaust contaminants by manifesting that.üîΩIf you say that the phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù is stated in order to include the end,

original: 'o na zhes bya ba ni don gzhan brjod par 'dod pa'i tshig gi phrad yin no //
analyzed: 'o na zhes bya ba ni don gzhan brjod par 'dod pa'i tshig gi phrad yin no //
translated: then the word ‚Äúif‚Äù indicates that another meaning is intended.

original: de la sogs pa go'o zhes bya ba ni mtha' ma 'du shes med 'du shes med min de la sogs pa ste bsam gtan bzhi pa dang gzugs med pa lhag ma gsum mo //
analyzed: de la sogs pa go'o zhes bya ba ni mtha' ma 'du shes med 'du shes med min de la sogs pa ste bsam gtan bzhi pa dang gzugs med pa lhag ma gsum mo //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù refers to the end, the base of neither discernment nor nondiscernment, and so on, which includes the fourth absorption and the remaining three formless states.

original: 'dod pa'i khams ni de la sogs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams ni de la sogs pa ma yin te /
translated: The desire realm is not included in that and so on because

original: mnyam par gzhag pa ma yin pa nyid kyis mi 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa ma yin pa nyid kyis mi 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: it is not similar since it is not equipoise.

original: yang na snyoms par 'jug pa'i sgo nas de la sogs pa gzugs dang gzugs med pa dag kho na yin te mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na snyoms par 'jug pa'i sgo nas de la sogs pa gzugs dang gzugs med pa dag kho na yin te mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Alternatively, that and so on refers to the form and formless realms from the perspective of meditative attainment because it is said, ‚ÄúThere are nine meditative attainments of successive abiding.‚Äù

original: de rtogs pa ni de la sogs pa go ba'o //
analyzed: de rtogs pa ni de la sogs pa go ba'o //
translated: To understand that is to understand and so on.

original: gzhan la lar yang 'di lta bu mthong ba yod dam zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan la lar yang 'di lta bu mthong ba yod dam zhe na /
translated: Is this also seen in other realms?

original: smras pa / yod de /
analyzed: smras pa / yod de /
translated: He says: Yes, it is.

original: la lar ni mtha' yang dang pos go zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
analyzed: la lar ni mtha' yang dang pos go zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
translated: In some realms, the end is understood by the beginning.üîΩFor example, like the gods of Brahmapurohita.

original: 'di lta ste tshangs ris kyi lha dag lta bu zhes bya ba ni tshangs ris kyi lha dag dang de'i mtha' bsdus pas tshangs pa'i mdun na 'don dang tshangs chen dag kyang bde ba skye ba dang po yin no //üîΩ'di lta ste 'od gsal ba'i lha rnams lta bu zhes bya ba ni 'od gsal ba dag dang de la sogs pa bsdus pas 'od chung dang tshad med 'od rnams kyang bde ba skye ba gnyis pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di lta ste tshangs ris kyi lha dag lta bu zhes bya ba ni tshangs ris kyi lha dag dang de'i mtha' bsdus pas tshangs pa'i mdun na 'don dang tshangs chen dag kyang bde ba skye ba dang po yin no // 'di lta ste 'od gsal ba'i lha rnams lta bu zhes bya ba ni 'od gsal ba dag dang de la sogs pa bsdus pas 'od chung dang tshad med 'od rnams kyang bde ba skye ba gnyis pa yin no //
translated: For example, like the gods of Abhasvara.

original: bde ba skye ba @158b ni gsum kho nar 'dod de /
analyzed: bde ba skye ba @158b ni gsum kho nar 'dod de /
translated: The three births of bliss are asserted to beüîΩthe three concentrations.

original: bde ba skye ba gsum po ni //
analyzed: bde ba skye ba gsum po ni //
translated: The three births of bliss are

original: bsam gtan gsum la sa dgu yin //
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum la sa dgu yin //
translated: the nine levels of the three concentrations.

original: zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because this is stated.

original: dpe'i chos ni 'di yin zhes bya ba ni gang de'i rnam pa gcig ston par byed kyi thams cad ma yin yang lhag ma rnams rtogs par 'gyur ba ni dpe'i tshul yin te /
analyzed: dpe'i chos ni 'di yin zhes bya ba ni gang de'i rnam pa gcig ston par byed kyi thams cad ma yin yang lhag ma rnams rtogs par 'gyur ba ni dpe'i tshul yin te /
translated: The method of example is as follows: ‚ÄúThis is the example.‚Äù Although only one aspect is shown, the rest are understood.

original: dper na sgra ni mi rtag pa ste /
analyzed: dper na sgra ni mi rtag pa ste /
translated: For example, ‚ÄúSound is impermanent

original: byas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: byas pa'i phyir /
translated: because it is produced.üîΩIt is like a pot.‚Äù

original: 'di lta ste bum pa lta bu'o zhes byas nas 'di lta ste zhes bya ba'i sgra ni dper brjod pa yin pa'i phyir ras yug la sogs pa yang bsdus pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste bum pa lta bu'o zhes byas nas 'di lta ste zhes bya ba'i sgra ni dper brjod pa yin pa'i phyir ras yug la sogs pa yang bsdus pa lta bu'o //
translated: Since the phrase ‚Äúfor example‚Äù is an example, cloth and so on are also included.

original: 'di ni nye bar sbyar du mi rung ngo zhes bya ba ni dper mi rung ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'di ni nye bar sbyar du mi rung ngo zhes bya ba ni dper mi rung ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚ÄúThis is not suitable to be applied‚Äù means ‚Äúthis is not suitable as an example.‚Äù

original: mi rnams dang lha kha cig go zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mi rnams dang lha kha cig go zhes bya ba la /
translated: ‚ÄúSome humans and gods‚Äù means

original: lha kha cig ni 'dod pa na spyod pa drug dang bsam gtan dang por skyes pa'i lha dang por byung ba ma gtogs pa rnams te lus tha dad pa dang 'du shes tha dad pa'i sems can ni 'di dag kho na tsam du zad kyi 'di dag la
analyzed: lha kha cig ni 'dod pa na spyod pa drug dang bsam gtan dang por skyes pa'i lha dang por byung ba ma gtogs pa rnams te lus tha dad pa dang 'du shes tha dad pa'i sems can ni 'di dag kho na tsam du zad kyi 'di dag la
translated: These are the only sentient beings who have different bodies and different perceptions.

original: ma gtogs pa med pas 'di lta ste zhes bya ba'i sgra 'di ni dper brjod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ma gtogs pa med pas 'di lta ste zhes bya ba'i sgra 'di ni dper brjod pa ma yin no //
translated: Since there are none other than these, the term ‚Äúsuch as‚Äù does not indicate an example.

original: de lta bas na 'di ni nye bar bstan pa'i don kho nar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'di ni nye bar bstan pa'i don kho nar blta bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, this term should be viewed as merely an illustration.

original: nye bar bstan pa nyid yin dang de kho na dang 'dra bar mtha' smos pas de la sogs pa go'o zhes bya ba 'di gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: nye bar bstan pa nyid yin dang de kho na dang 'dra bar mtha' smos pas de la sogs pa go'o zhes bya ba 'di gnas pa yin no //
translated: The term ‚Äúsuch as‚Äù is used to indicate that the term ‚Äúonly‚Äù is applied to the preceding terms.üîΩThe opposite of that is unconditioned.

original: bzlog pa ni 'dus ma byas so zhes bya ba ni gang la 'di dag med pa de ni 'dus ma byas yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: bzlog pa ni 'dus ma byas so zhes bya ba ni gang la 'di dag med pa de ni 'dus ma byas yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The term ‚Äúunconditioned‚Äù refers to that which lacks these three characteristics.

original: 'dus ma byas kyi mtshan nyid gnas pa yang yod pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyi mtshan nyid gnas pa yang yod pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: Isn‚Äôt the characteristic of endurance also a characteristic of the unconditioned?

original: 'dus ma byas kyi gnas pa rdzas gzhan gyi ngo bo ni med do //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyi gnas pa rdzas gzhan gyi ngo bo ni med do //
translated: But the state of nondiscipline is not a substance that is a different nature from the three roots.

original: 'dir ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid rdzas gzhan gyi ngo bo dag yin par 'dod pas 'di ni klan kar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: 'dir ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid rdzas gzhan gyi ngo bo dag yin par 'dod pas 'di ni klan kar mi rung ngo //
translated: Here, since the characteristics of conditioned states are asserted to be different substances, this is not a proper objection.

original: mdo las gsum po 'di dag ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: mdo las gsum po 'di dag ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How do you interpret the sutra statement, ‚ÄúMonks, these three are characteristics of conditioned states‚Äù?

original: mdo las dge slong dag gsum po 'di dag ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: mdo las dge slong dag gsum po 'di dag ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: The sutra states, ‚ÄúMonks, these three are characteristics of conditioned states.

original: gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: gsum gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three?

original: dge slong dag 'dus byas la skye ba yang mngon no //üîΩ'jig pa yang mngon no //
analyzed: dge slong dag 'dus byas la skye ba yang mngon no // 'jig pa yang mngon no //
translated: Monks, the arising of conditioned states is evident.üîΩTheir destruction is evident.

original: gnas pa gzhan du 'gyur ba yang mngon no zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gnas pa gzhan du 'gyur ba yang mngon no zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Their enduring and changing is evident.‚Äù

original: der bzhi pa yang brjod par bya dgos zhes zer ba ni bye brag tu sma ba rnams yin no //
analyzed: der bzhi pa yang brjod par bya dgos zhes zer ba ni bye brag tu sma ba rnams yin no //
translated: The Vaibhasikas say that the fourth should have been mentioned there.

original: 'o na ni gnas pa gzhan du 'gyur ba zhes bya ba gang yin pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'o na ni gnas pa gzhan du 'gyur ba zhes bya ba gang yin pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: But what is this that is called enduring and changing?

original: rgol ba po'i @159a * //
analyzed: rgol ba po'i @159a * //
translated: The opponent says:

original: bsam pa ni 'di la gnas pa zhes bya ba'i sgra grag na ni ji ltar gnas pa ma gsungs so zhes bya ba 'di brjod snyam pa yin no //
analyzed: bsam pa ni 'di la gnas pa zhes bya ba'i sgra grag na ni ji ltar gnas pa ma gsungs so zhes bya ba 'di brjod snyam pa yin no //
translated: The thought is that if the term ‚Äúendures‚Äù is heard in this context, then one should say, ‚ÄúHow does it endure?‚Äù

original: 'di ni rga ba'i rnam grangs yin zhes bya ba ni gnas pa las gzhan du 'gyur ba ni gnas pa gzhan du 'gyur ba'o zhes rga ba 'di bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni rga ba'i rnam grangs yin zhes bya ba ni gnas pa las gzhan du 'gyur ba ni gnas pa gzhan du 'gyur ba'o zhes rga ba 'di bstan pa yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúThis is an alternate term for aging‚Äù means that this aging is indicated by the term ‚Äúchange from what was into something else,‚Äù since it is a change from what was into something else.

original: dper skye ba'i rnam grangs 'byung ba zhes bya ba dang / mi rtag pa nyid kyis 'jig pa zhes bya ba de bzhin du gnas pa gzhan du 'gyur ba ni rga ba'i rnam grangs yin no //
analyzed: dper skye ba'i rnam grangs 'byung ba zhes bya ba dang / mi rtag pa nyid kyis 'jig pa zhes bya ba de bzhin du gnas pa gzhan du 'gyur ba ni rga ba'i rnam grangs yin no //
translated: Just as ‚Äúarising‚Äù is an alternate term for birth and ‚Äúdestruction‚Äù is an alternate term for impermanence, so ‚Äúchange from what was into something else‚Äù is an alternate term for aging.

original: yang ci'i phyir mtshan nyid bzhi yod bzhin du bcom ldan 'das kyis gsum kho na zhig gsungs she na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir mtshan nyid bzhi yod bzhin du bcom ldan 'das kyis gsum kho na zhig gsungs she na /
translated: Why did the BhagavƒÅn state only three characteristics when four exist?

original: de'i phyir chos gang dag ces bya ba rgyas par smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir chos gang dag ces bya ba rgyas par smos so //
translated: Therefore he says, ‚ÄúAny dharma that arises also ceases.‚Äù

original: 'dul ba rnams skyo bar bya ba'i phyir skye ba dang rga ba dang mi rtag pa nyid de dag kho na chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid du gsungs te mdo las bstan pa ni dgongs pa can yin la chos mngon pa las bstan pa ni mtshan nyid pa yin
analyzed: 'dul ba rnams skyo bar bya ba'i phyir skye ba dang rga ba dang mi rtag pa nyid de dag kho na chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid du gsungs te mdo las bstan pa ni dgongs pa can yin la chos mngon pa las bstan pa ni mtshan nyid pa yin
translated: The Abhidharma teaches the characteristics of conditioned states in terms of their characteristics.

original: no // rga ba dang mi rtag pa nyid kyis ni da ltar byung ba nas 'das par te zhes bya ba ni sbed do zhes bya bar skabs dang sbyar te /
analyzed: no // rga ba dang mi rtag pa nyid kyis ni da ltar byung ba nas 'das par te zhes bya ba ni sbed do zhes bya bar skabs dang sbyar te /
translated: Aging and impermanence conceal present states as pastüîΩstates.

original: rga ba dang mi rtag pa nyid dag gis na da ltar byung ba'i dus nas 'das par sbed do //
analyzed: rga ba dang mi rtag pa nyid dag gis na da ltar byung ba'i dus nas 'das par sbed do //
translated: Aging and impermanence conceal present states as past states.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na nyam chung ngur byas te 'joms par byed pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na nyam chung ngur byas te 'joms par byed pa'i phyir te /
translated: Why? Because they weaken and destroy them.

original: dga' bas ni nyam chung ngu byed la mi rtag pa nyid kyis ni 'joms pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dga' bas ni nyam chung ngu byed la mi rtag pa nyid kyis ni 'joms pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Desire weakens them and impermanence destroys them.

original: mi rtag pa nyid kho nas chos da ltar byung ba'i dus nas 'das pa'i dus su sbed par byed kyi rga bas ni ma yin te /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid kho nas chos da ltar byung ba'i dus nas 'das pa'i dus su sbed par byed kyi rga bas ni ma yin te /
translated: Only impermanence conceals a present dharma from the past, not aging.

original: rga bas ni chos nyam chung ngur byed pa 'ba' zhig tu zad pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: rga bas ni chos nyam chung ngur byed pa 'ba' zhig tu zad pa ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt it that aging alone weakens a dharma?

original: ci'i phyir 'di skad du rga ba dang mi rtag pa nyid dag gis ni da ltar byung ba nas 'das par sbed par byed do zhes bshad ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'di skad du rga ba dang mi rtag pa nyid dag gis ni da ltar byung ba nas 'das par sbed par byed do zhes bshad ce na /
translated: Why is it said that aging and impermanence conceal a present dharma in the past?

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: nyam chung ngur byed pa yang de dus su sbed par byed pa kho nar 'gyur te /
analyzed: nyam chung ngur byed pa yang de dus su sbed par byed pa kho nar 'gyur te /
translated: That which weakens a dharma is also concealed at that time.

original: nyam chung ngur ma byas pa la dus su 'pho ba med pas dga' ba yang de dus su sbed par rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: nyam chung ngur ma byas pa la dus su 'pho ba med pas dga' ba yang de dus su sbed par rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Since that which is not weakened is not transferred to another time, that which is pleasant is also posited as concealed at that time.

original: 'dus ma byas kyang rang gi mtshan nyid la gnas pa yod pa'i phyir zhas bya ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid la gnas pa'i gnas pa yod do //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyang rang gi mtshan nyid la gnas pa yod pa'i phyir zhas bya ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid la gnas pa'i gnas pa yod do //
translated: Since unconditioned states also exist as the endurance of their own characteristics, it is said that they exist as the endurance of their own characteristics.

original: gnas pa yod pa de'i phyir gnas pa ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid du rnam par ma gzhag ste /
analyzed: gnas pa yod pa de'i phyir gnas pa ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid du rnam par ma gzhag ste /
translated: Because endurance exists, endurance is not posited as a characteristic of conditioned states.

original: gnas pa ni 'dus ma byas kyi gnas skabs kyi khyad par gyi mtshan nyid kyi gnas pa dang @159b 'dra bas chos kyi rjes bcom ldan 'das kyi dgongs pa ni 'dus ma byas de 'dus byas nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba spang bar bzhed nas mtshan nyid du
analyzed: gnas pa ni 'dus ma byas kyi gnas skabs kyi khyad par gyi mtshan nyid kyi gnas pa dang @159b 'dra bas chos kyi rjes bcom ldan 'das kyi dgongs pa ni 'dus ma byas de 'dus byas nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba spang bar bzhed nas mtshan nyid du
translated: Since endurance is similar to the characteristic of endurance that is a specific state of unconditioned states, the BhagavƒÅn, the master of the Dharma, did not explain it as a characteristic in order to avoid the consequence that unconditioned states would become conditioned states.

original: ma bshad do snyam pa yin no //
analyzed: ma bshad do snyam pa yin no //
translated: This is the thought of the BhagavƒÅn.

original: gzhan dag rtog par byed pa ni zhes bya ba ni mdo las kyang gnas pa bshad do zhes bya bar brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan dag rtog par byed pa ni zhes bya ba ni mdo las kyang gnas pa bshad do zhes bya bar brjod pa yin te /
translated: Others imagine that the BhagavƒÅn also explained endurance in the s≈´tras, because it is said, ‚ÄúEndurance is also explained in the s≈´tras.‚Äù

original: mdo las / rga ba dang gnas pa bsdus te gnas pa dang gzhan du 'gyur ba ni gnas pa gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid do zhes bsdus te bshad kyi bye brag tu ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mdo las / rga ba dang gnas pa bsdus te gnas pa dang gzhan du 'gyur ba ni gnas pa gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid do zhes bsdus te bshad kyi bye brag tu ni ma yin no //
translated: The s≈´tras subsume aging and endurance and explain them as the subsumption of endurance and change, but they do not explain them separately.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gsum po 'di dag ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid yin no zhes 'byung ba 'gal bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsum po 'di dag ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid yin no zhes 'byung ba 'gal bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would contradict the statement, ‚ÄúThese three are the characteristics of conditioned states.‚Äù

original: 'di dag ni nang na 'di ni chags pa'i gzhi yin zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: 'di dag ni nang na 'di ni chags pa'i gzhi yin zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: The root text states, ‚ÄúAmong these, this is the basis for attachment.‚Äù

original: 'di dag ni nang na zhes bya ba ni skye ba la sogs pa'i nang na'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ni nang na zhes bya ba ni skye ba la sogs pa'i nang na'o //
translated: Among these means among birth and the rest.

original: 'di zhes bya ba ni gnas pa'o //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba ni gnas pa'o //
translated: This means duration.

original: chags pa'i gzhi ni chags pa'i gnas te 'dis chos gnas par 'gyur ro snyam pa yin no //
analyzed: chags pa'i gzhi ni chags pa'i gnas te 'dis chos gnas par 'gyur ro snyam pa yin no //
translated: The basis for attachment is the basis for attachment. The idea is that this causes conditioned entities to endure.

original: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis gnas pa de la ma chags par bya ba'i don du gnas pa dpal dang 'dra ba 'di bkra mi shis pa rnam nag ma dang lhan cig tu bstan te /
analyzed: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis gnas pa de la ma chags par bya ba'i don du gnas pa dpal dang 'dra ba 'di bkra mi shis pa rnam nag ma dang lhan cig tu bstan te /
translated: Therefore, the Lord taught this duration, which is like good fortune, together with misfortune, which is like a black cloud, in order to help beings overcome their attachment to duration.

original: kha cig ni 'di skad du 'di la chags par mi bya ste /
analyzed: kha cig ni 'di skad du 'di la chags par mi bya ste /
translated: Some believe that one should not become attached to duration.

original: 'di ltar 'di ni bkra shis ma dang bkra mi shis ma bzhin du mi rtag pa nyid dang rjes su 'brel pa yin no zhes bya bar 'chad do //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di ni bkra shis ma dang bkra mi shis ma bzhin du mi rtag pa nyid dang rjes su 'brel pa yin no zhes bya bar 'chad do //
translated: Thus, it is said that this is like a lucky charm and an unlucky charm, respectively, because it is related to impermanence.

original: gzhan dag ni 'di la chags par mi bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni 'di la chags par mi bya ste /
translated: Others do not agree with this explanation.

original: 'di ltar 'di bkra shis ma dang bkra mi shis ma bzhin du rga ba dang rjes su 'brel ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di bkra shis ma dang bkra mi shis ma bzhin du rga ba dang rjes su 'brel ba yin te /
translated: They say that this is like a lucky charm and an unlucky charm, respectively, because it is related to aging,

original: gzhan du 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid kyi rga ba dang gcig tu bya ba yin gyi mi rtag pa nyid dang ni ma yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan du 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid kyi rga ba dang gcig tu bya ba yin gyi mi rtag pa nyid dang ni ma yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: because aging, which has the characteristic of transformation, is related to conditioned states, but impermanence is not.

original: de'i phyir 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid ni bzhi kho na'o zhes bya ba ni phyogs gnyi ga'i mjug sdud pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid ni bzhi kho na'o zhes bya ba ni phyogs gnyi ga'i mjug sdud pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the conclusion of both sides is that the characteristics of conditioned states are only four.

original: skye ba la sogs pa gzhan yang yod par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni skye ba'i mthus 'dus byas kyi chos 'ga' zhig skye bar 'gyur na skye ba yang 'dus byas yin pas /
analyzed: skye ba la sogs pa gzhan yang yod par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni skye ba'i mthus 'dus byas kyi chos 'ga' zhig skye bar 'gyur na skye ba yang 'dus byas yin pas /
translated: If arising and so on are characteristics, then other characteristics of conditioned states would also exist, because if any conditioned state arises through the power of arising, then arising is a conditioned state.

original: de lta bas na de la yang skye ba gzhan yod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta bas na de la yang skye ba gzhan yod par 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, arising would have another arising,

original: bdag nyid la byed pa 'gal ba'i phyir dang grub pa'i mtha' las /
analyzed: bdag nyid la byed pa 'gal ba'i phyir dang grub pa'i mtha' las /
translated: because it is contradictory for something to act on itself, and because

original: thams cad 'dus byas mtshan nyid dang zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad 'dus byas mtshan nyid dang zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: the philosophical treatise declares, ‚ÄúAll are characterized by the three characteristics of conditioned phenomena.‚Äù

original: de bzhin du rga ba la sogs pa la @160a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du rga ba la sogs pa la @160a * //
translated: Aging and so on should be

original: yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: yang sbyar bar bya'o //
