translated: applied in a similar way.üîΩThe arising of arising and so onüîΩThe phrase ‚Äúthe arising of arising and so on‚Äù should be viewed asüîΩindicating the phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù in the phrase ‚Äúthe arising of arising and

original: de dag ni skye ba'i skye la sogs zhes bya ba ni de dag skye ba'i skye la sogs pa yang zhes bya bar 'dir yang zhes bya ba'i sgra mi mngon par bstan par blta bar bya'o //üîΩre re la yang mtshan nyid bzhi pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni mtshan nyid re re la mtshan nyid bzhi pa ste /
analyzed: de dag ni skye ba'i skye la sogs zhes bya ba ni de dag skye ba'i skye la sogs pa yang zhes bya bar 'dir yang zhes bya ba'i sgra mi mngon par bstan par blta bar bya'o // re re la yang mtshan nyid bzhi pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni mtshan nyid re re la mtshan nyid bzhi pa ste /
translated: so on.‚ÄùüîΩEach characteristic has four characteristicsüîΩThe phrase ‚Äúeach characteristic has four characteristics‚Äù means that each

original: mtshan nyid bzhi po tshan gcig tu byas pa'i mtshan nyid bzhi par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mtshan nyid bzhi po tshan gcig tu byas pa'i mtshan nyid bzhi par 'gyur ro //
translated: of the four characteristics is itself a set of four characteristics.

original: mtha' thug pa med pa'i skyon du yang zhes bya ba ni mu thug pa med pa'i skyon du yang ste skye ba la yang mi rtag pa nyid kyi bar yod pa dang mi rtag pa nyid kyi bar la yang yod par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir dang mthun
analyzed: mtha' thug pa med pa'i skyon du yang zhes bya ba ni mu thug pa med pa'i skyon du yang ste skye ba la yang mi rtag pa nyid kyi bar yod pa dang mi rtag pa nyid kyi bar la yang yod par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir dang mthun
translated: The error of infinite regress would also occur means that the error of an infinite regress would also occur because it would follow that arising would also exist up to impermanence and impermanence would also exist up to arising.

original: pa'i mtshan nyid de dag la yang skye ba gzhan la sogs pa yod par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pa'i mtshan nyid de dag la yang skye ba gzhan la sogs pa yod par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: And the error of infinite regress would also occur because it would follow that arising and so on would also exist for those characteristics that are similar to them.üîΩThe phrase they engage eight or one means that those phenomena that are the nature of arising and so on and arising of arising and so forth engage eight or one, respectively.

original: de chos brgyad dang gcig la 'jug ces bya ba ni skye ba la sogs pa dang skye ba'i skye ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi chos de dag ni rim bzhin du chos brgyad dang gcig la 'jug ste skye ba la sogs pa ni chos brgyad la
analyzed: de chos brgyad dang gcig la 'jug ces bya ba ni skye ba la sogs pa dang skye ba'i skye ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi chos de dag ni rim bzhin du chos brgyad dang gcig la 'jug ste skye ba la sogs pa ni chos brgyad la
translated: Arising and so on engage eight phenomena.

original: 'jug go // skye ba'i skye ba la sogs pa ni chos gcig la'o //
analyzed: 'jug go // skye ba'i skye ba la sogs pa ni chos gcig la'o //
translated: The arising of arising and so on engage one phenomenon.

original: bdag nyid rtogs par dgu zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid dang mthun pa'i mtshan nyid dag la ltos nas de skad bshad kyi /
analyzed: bdag nyid rtogs par dgu zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid dang mthun pa'i mtshan nyid dag la ltos nas de skad bshad kyi /
translated: The statement ‚Äúnine, including itself‚Äù is made in terms of the characteristics and the characteristics of the characteristics.

original: de la ci rigs par thob pa la sogs pa dang 'byung ba dag dang 'byung ba las gyur ba dag mi 'byung ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de la ci rigs par thob pa la sogs pa dang 'byung ba dag dang 'byung ba las gyur ba dag mi 'byung ba ni ma yin te /
translated: Obtainment and so on and the primary elements and the derivative form that arise from them do not arise in the way that they are described.

original: 'dod na dbang po med pa dang // sgra med phra rab rdul rdzas brgyad //
analyzed: 'dod na dbang po med pa dang // sgra med phra rab rdul rdzas brgyad //
translated: If one wishes, one can say that the subtle particle of the sense faculty of touch that is devoid of sound has eight substances.

original: ces bya ba dang // thams cad 'dus byas mtshan nyid dang mtshan nyid thob pa'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ces bya ba dang // thams cad 'dus byas mtshan nyid dang mtshan nyid thob pa'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: And one can say that all conditioned states possess the characteristics of conditioned states and obtain the characteristics of conditioned states.üîΩThe arising of arising generates eight dharmas, excluding itself.

original: skye bas ni bdag nyid ma gtogs par zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni rang gi bdag nyid la byed pa 'gal bas de'i phyir bdag nyid ma gtogs par chos brgyad skyed par byed do //
analyzed: skye bas ni bdag nyid ma gtogs par zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni rang gi bdag nyid la byed pa 'gal bas de'i phyir bdag nyid ma gtogs par chos brgyad skyed par byed do //
translated: The statement ‚Äúarising generates eight dharmas, excluding itself‚Äù is made in terms of the characteristics and the characteristics of the characteristics.

original: brgyad gang zhe na gzugs sam sems kyi chos de dang gnas pa dang / rga ba dang / mi rtag pa nyid dang skye ba'i skye ba dang / gnas pa'i gnas pa dang / rga ba'i rga ba dang / mi rtag pa nyid kyis mi rtag pa nyid skyed par byed do //
analyzed: brgyad gang zhe na gzugs sam sems kyi chos de dang gnas pa dang / rga ba dang / mi rtag pa nyid dang skye ba'i skye ba dang / gnas pa'i gnas pa dang / rga ba'i rga ba dang / mi rtag pa nyid kyis mi rtag pa nyid skyed par byed do //
translated: What are the eight? The arising of the arising of form or mind, the enduring of the enduring of form or mind, the aging of the aging of form or mind, and the impermanence of the impermanence of form or mind.

original: skye ba'i skye bas ni de kho na skyed par byed do //üîΩde bzhin du rga ba dang mi rtag pa nyid dag la yang sbyar bar bya'o zhes @160b bya ba ni rga bas ni bdag nyid ma gtogs pa chos brgyad skyed par byed do //
analyzed: skye ba'i skye bas ni de kho na skyed par byed do // de bzhin du rga ba dang mi rtag pa nyid dag la yang sbyar bar bya'o zhes @160b bya ba ni rga bas ni bdag nyid ma gtogs pa chos brgyad skyed par byed do //
translated: The arising of arising generates just that arising.üîΩThe enduring of enduring generates just that enduring.

original: rga ba'i rga bas ni rga ba de kho na skyed par byed do //üîΩmi rtag pa nyid kyis ni bdag nyid ma gtogs pa chos brgyad skyed par byed do //
analyzed: rga ba'i rga bas ni rga ba de kho na skyed par byed do // mi rtag pa nyid kyis ni bdag nyid ma gtogs pa chos brgyad skyed par byed do //
translated: The aging of aging generates just that aging.

original: mi rtag pa nyid kyis ni mi rtag pa nyid de kho na skyed par byed do ;
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid kyis ni mi rtag pa nyid de kho na skyed par byed do ;
translated: The impermanence of impermanence generates just that impermanence.üîΩThe arising of arising generates the eight dharmas, excluding itself.üîΩThe enduring of enduring generates the eight dharmas, excluding itself.üîΩThe aging of aging generates the eight dharmas, excluding itself.üîΩThe impermanence of impermanence generates the eight dharmas, excluding itself.

original: ;'di ni nam mkha' 'dral bar skyed pa yin te zhes bya ba ni rnam par 'dral bar byed pa'o snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: ;'di ni nam mkha' 'dral bar skyed pa yin te zhes bya ba ni rnam par 'dral bar byed pa'o snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: The idea is that he splits open the sky.

original: nam mkha' ni thogs pa dang bcas pa'i rdzas med pa tsam du zad kyi /
analyzed: nam mkha' ni thogs pa dang bcas pa'i rdzas med pa tsam du zad kyi /
translated: The sky is merely the absence of an obstructing substance.

original: nam mkha' zhes bya ba ni cung zad kyang med de /
analyzed: nam mkha' zhes bya ba ni cung zad kyang med de /
translated: There is nothing at all called ‚Äúsky.‚Äù

original: de ji ltar dral bar mi nus pa'am /
analyzed: de ji ltar dral bar mi nus pa'am /
translated: How can it be split open?üîΩOr how can it be improper?

original: ji ltar mi rung ba de bzhin du skye ba la sogs pa yod pa ma yin pa'i chos 'di dag kyang rnam pa dbye bar mi nus pa'am mi rung ba yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar mi rung ba de bzhin du skye ba la sogs pa yod pa ma yin pa'i chos 'di dag kyang rnam pa dbye bar mi nus pa'am mi rung ba yin no //
translated: In the same way, these phenomena that do not exist, such as arising, cannot be split open or be improper.

original: de'i phyir skye ba la sogs pa 'di dag ni yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir skye ba la sogs pa 'di dag ni yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
translated: Therefore, these arising, etc., do not exist.

original: 'di dag ni ji ltar rnam par 'byed pa ltar te skye bas ni bdag nyid ma gtogs pa chos brgyad skyed par byed do zhes bya ba de lta bu rgyas par rnam par 'byed par byed pa ltar rdzas su yod cing rang gi mtshan nyid du yod paüîΩma yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag ni ji ltar rnam par 'byed pa ltar te skye bas ni bdag nyid ma gtogs pa chos brgyad skyed par byed do zhes bya ba de lta bu rgyas par rnam par 'byed par byed pa ltar rdzas su yod cing rang gi mtshan nyid du yod pa ma yin no //
translated: How are they not substantially existent and not essentially existent as they are distinguished?

original: ji ltar gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams zhes bya ba 'dir /
analyzed: ji ltar gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams zhes bya ba 'dir /
translated: Here, in the statement, ‚Äúdharmas such as form,‚Äù

original: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni sgra la sogs pa dang tshor ba la sogs pa dang mig la sogs pa bsdu'o //
analyzed: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni sgra la sogs pa dang tshor ba la sogs pa dang mig la sogs pa bsdu'o //
translated: the word ‚Äúsuch‚Äù includes sound, etc., feeling, etc., and eye, etc.

original: de la re zhig gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi mngon sum gyi tshad mas dmigs so //
analyzed: de la re zhig gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi mngon sum gyi tshad mas dmigs so //
translated: Among them, form, sound, etc., are perceived by the valid knowledge of direct perception that has the characteristic of eye consciousness, etc.

original: tshor ba la sogs pa yang rang rig par bya ba yin pa'i phyir mngon sum gyis dmigs so //
analyzed: tshor ba la sogs pa yang rang rig par bya ba yin pa'i phyir mngon sum gyis dmigs so //
translated: Feeling, etc., are also perceived by direct perception because they are to be known by reflexive awareness.

original: mig la sogs pa ni de dag yod dam med na de dag yod dam med pa'i phyir mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i rten gzugs dang ba ni mig la sogs pa yin no zhes bya bar mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i rjes
analyzed: mig la sogs pa ni de dag yod dam med na de dag yod dam med pa'i phyir mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i rten gzugs dang ba ni mig la sogs pa yin no zhes bya bar mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i rjes
translated: Because the eyes and so on exist when form and so on exist and do not exist when they do not exist, the eyes and so on are the pure form that is the basis of eye consciousness and so on.

original: su dpag pas rjes su dpog par byed do //
analyzed: su dpag pas rjes su dpog par byed do //
translated: This is inferred through inference that follows eye consciousness and so on.

original: lung yang mig gis gzugs rnams mthong nas zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba dang / de bzhin du rna bas sgra rnams thos nas zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: lung yang mig gis gzugs rnams mthong nas zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba dang / de bzhin du rna bas sgra rnams thos nas zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: Also, scripture states, Having seen forms with the eyes and so on and Having heard sounds with the ears and so on.

original: dri la sogs pa la yang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: dri la sogs pa la yang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Smells and so on should be applied in the same way.

original: @161a * // de bzhin du gzugs gang yin pa ci yang rung ste 'das pa'am /
analyzed: @161a * // de bzhin du gzugs gang yin pa ci yang rung ste 'das pa'am /
translated: Similarly, any form whatsoever that is past,

original: ma 'ongs pa'am da ltar byung ba'am zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'am da ltar byung ba'am zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: present or future.

original: tshor ba la sogs pa la yang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: tshor ba la sogs pa la yang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: This should be applied in the same way to feeling and so on.

original: gzhan gyi rgyud la yod pa'i tshor ba la sogs pa gzugs can ma yin pa rnams yod pa nyid du rjes su dpag pa ni bdag nyid kyi bzhin du lus kyi g-yo ba mthong nas de dag rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi rgyud la yod pa'i tshor ba la sogs pa gzugs can ma yin pa rnams yod pa nyid du rjes su dpag pa ni bdag nyid kyi bzhin du lus kyi g-yo ba mthong nas de dag rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The existence of the non-material, such as feeling, etc., in the mental continuum of another is inferred from the observation of bodily movement, just as in one‚Äôs own continuum.

original: lung yang mig dang gzugs rnams la brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa dang de dang lhan cig skye ba 'du shes dang tshor ba dang sems pa dag skye'o zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: lung yang mig dang gzugs rnams la brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa dang de dang lhan cig skye ba 'du shes dang tshor ba dang sems pa dag skye'o zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: The scriptural passage is: ‚ÄúThe eye consciousness arises in dependence upon the eye and forms. Feeling, discrimination, and volitional factors arise together with it.‚Äù

original: skye ba la sogs pa ni gzugs la sogs pa bzhin du mngon sum du yang mi 'gyur la 'di dag yod pa nyid du nus pa'i rjes su dpag pa yang med do //
analyzed: skye ba la sogs pa ni gzugs la sogs pa bzhin du mngon sum du yang mi 'gyur la 'di dag yod pa nyid du nus pa'i rjes su dpag pa yang med do //
translated: Birth, etc., are not directly perceived like form, etc., and there is no inference of their existence.

original: rdzas su yod pa nyid kyi lung yang med do //
analyzed: rdzas su yod pa nyid kyi lung yang med do //
translated: There is no scriptural passage that indicates their substantial existence.

original: 'o na gang mdo las gsungs so zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni 'dus byas skye bar yang snang ngo zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba'i lung 'di yod pa ma yin nam zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'o na gang mdo las gsungs so zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni 'dus byas skye bar yang snang ngo zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba'i lung 'di yod pa ma yin nam zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúWell then, the statement in the sutra is extensive, but the scriptures do not exist, for it is extensive, ‚ÄúThe arising of conditioned states is also seen.‚Äù

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis ni don la rton par gsungs so zhes bya ba ni dge slong dag rton pa ni bzhi po 'di dag yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis ni don la rton par gsungs so zhes bya ba ni dge slong dag rton pa ni bzhi po 'di dag yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúThe Lord said that one should rely on the meaning,‚Äù means that the Lord said, ‚ÄúMonks, there are four reliances.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: chos la rton gyi gang zag la mi rton pa dang / don la rton gyi tshig 'bru la ma yin pa dang / nges pa'i don gyi mdo la rton gyi drang ba'i don la ma yin pa dang / ye shes la rton gyi rnam par shes pa la ma yin pa'o zhes bya ba dang /
analyzed: chos la rton gyi gang zag la mi rton pa dang / don la rton gyi tshig 'bru la ma yin pa dang / nges pa'i don gyi mdo la rton gyi drang ba'i don la ma yin pa dang / ye shes la rton gyi rnam par shes pa la ma yin pa'o zhes bya ba dang /
translated: Rely on the teaching, not on the person; rely on the meaning, not on the words; rely on the definitive meaning sutras, not on the interpretable meaning sutras; rely on direct intuition, not on consciousness.

original: de bzhin du don la rton pa yin gyi tshig 'bru la ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du don la rton pa yin gyi tshig 'bru la ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'byung ba yin no //
translated: And similarly, ‚ÄúOne should rely on the meaning, not on the words.‚Äù

original: 'di'i don gang zhe na zhes bya ba ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid kyi mdo nye bar bkod pa 'di'o //
analyzed: 'di'i don gang zhe na zhes bya ba ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid kyi mdo nye bar bkod pa 'di'o //
translated: What is the meaning of this? This is the sutra on the characteristics of the conditioned.

original: don de bstan pa'i phyir ma rig pas ldongs pa'i byis pa rnams zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
analyzed: don de bstan pa'i phyir ma rig pas ldongs pa'i byis pa rnams zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
translated: In order to teach that meaning, he says, ‚ÄúThe childish, blinded by ignorance, etc.‚Äù

original: 'du byed kyi rgyun la bdag dang bdag gir mos pa ni dga' bar gyur pa'o //üîΩmngon par zhen pa ni chags par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'du byed kyi rgyun la bdag dang bdag gir mos pa ni dga' bar gyur pa'o // mngon par zhen pa ni chags par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: They are devoted to the self and what belongs to the self in the stream of conditioning factors, and thus they are attached.üîΩThey are attached to the stream of conditioning factors, and thus they are attached.

original: 'dus byas nyid dang rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba nyid ces bya ba ni rnam grangs yin te rkyen rnams 'dus shing phrad nas byas pa ni 'dus byas @161b so //
analyzed: 'dus byas nyid dang rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba nyid ces bya ba ni rnam grangs yin te rkyen rnams 'dus shing phrad nas byas pa ni 'dus byas @161b so //
translated: The conditioned and dependent origination are synonyms. That which is produced by the assembly and convergence of conditions is the conditioned.

original: rkyen de dang phrad nas 'byung ba ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: rkyen de dang phrad nas 'byung ba ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'o //
translated: That which originates in dependence on those conditions is dependent origination.

original: skad cig ma la ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni 'di ni rgyun kho na la 'dus byas nyid brjod par bzhed nas gsungs pa yin gyi skad cig ma la ni ma yin te skad cig ma ni rtogs par dka' ba'i phyir skad cig ma la skye
analyzed: skad cig ma la ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni 'di ni rgyun kho na la 'dus byas nyid brjod par bzhed nas gsungs pa yin gyi skad cig ma la ni ma yin te skad cig ma ni rtogs par dka' ba'i phyir skad cig ma la skye
translated: This is stated by the proponent of conditioned characteristics in the continuum alone, but not in a moment, because a moment is difficult to comprehend.

original: ba dang 'jig pa dang gnas pa gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid kyi chos dag mi mngon no //
analyzed: ba dang 'jig pa dang gnas pa gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid kyi chos dag mi mngon no //
translated: The characteristics of arising, enduring, aging, and ceasing are not manifest in a moment.

original: ji ste khyod de dag mi mngon yang mtshan nyid yin par 'os so snyam du sems na /
analyzed: ji ste khyod de dag mi mngon yang mtshan nyid yin par 'os so snyam du sems na /
translated: But if you think that even though they are not manifest, they are suitable as characteristics,

original: de'i phyir / mi mngon pa de dag ni mtshan nyid yin par 'os pa ma yin te zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir / mi mngon pa de dag ni mtshan nyid yin par 'os pa ma yin te zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: then it is said: Those that are not manifest are not suitable as characteristics.

original: mngon pa kho na mtshan nyid yin te /
analyzed: mngon pa kho na mtshan nyid yin te /
translated: Only that which is manifest is a characteristic.

original: dper na chu'i chu skyar lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na chu'i chu skyar lta bu'o //
translated: For example, like a water bird.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mdo de las zhes bya ba ni de nyid kyi phyir mdo las mngon no zhes bya ba smos pa mdzad kyi de lta ma yin na 'dus byas skye ba yang 'jig pa yang gnas pa gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid kyang zhes bya ba khoüîΩna zhig bka' stsal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mdo de las zhes bya ba ni de nyid kyi phyir mdo las mngon no zhes bya ba smos pa mdzad kyi de lta ma yin na 'dus byas skye ba yang 'jig pa yang gnas pa gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid kyang zhes bya ba kho na zhig bka' stsal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were not so, the Lord would have said, ‚Äúconditioned arising, conditioned passing away, and conditioned remaining.‚ÄùüîΩThe phrase ‚Äúconditioned characteristics‚Äù means ‚Äúthe characteristics of conditioned states.‚Äù

original: 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid dag ces bya ba ni 'dus byas zhes bya ba'i mtshan nyid dag yin no zhes bya ba'i don du yongs su gzung ba'i phyir yang 'dus byas zhes bya ba smos so //üîΩchu dang chu skyar ltar zhes bya ba 'di ni chos mi mthun pa'i dpe yin te ji ltar chu skyar chu yod pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid dag ces bya ba ni 'dus byas zhes bya ba'i mtshan nyid dag yin no zhes bya ba'i don du yongs su gzung ba'i phyir yang 'dus byas zhes bya ba smos so // chu dang chu skyar ltar zhes bya ba 'di ni chos mi mthun pa'i dpe yin te ji ltar chu skyar chu yod pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid yin gyi /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúconditioned states‚Äù is also mentioned in order to avoid the interpretation that the characteristics are of the nature of conditioned states.üîΩThe example of the water and the osprey is an example of dissimilarity.üîΩIt is not proper to understand that the existence of water is the characteristic of the osprey,

original: chu'i chu nyid kyi mtshan nyid ni ma yin pa de ltar shes na mi rung ngo //
analyzed: chu'i chu nyid kyi mtshan nyid ni ma yin pa de ltar shes na mi rung ngo //
translated: but that the nature of water is not.

original: ci zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of this?

original: 'dus byas kyi dngos po yod pa nyid dag yin no zhes bya bar ro //
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi dngos po yod pa nyid dag yin no zhes bya bar ro //
translated: and the existence of conditioned things.üîΩLike the marks of a maiden, virtue and nonvirtue.

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba nyid kyi bu mo'i mtshan bzhin zhes bya ba ni ji ltar bu mo'i mtshan bzang ba dang mi bzang ba dag go rims bzhin du dge ba dang mi dge ba nyid kyi mtshan nyid dag yin pa lta bur te /üîΩgal te 'di dag kyang de dang 'dra bar 'dus byas kyi dngos po yod pa nyid dam //üîΩdge ba nyid dang mi dge ba nyid kyi mtshan nyid yin par bzhed par gyur na ni gsum po 'di dag ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid yin no zhes bka' stsal bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba nyid kyi bu mo'i mtshan bzhin zhes bya ba ni ji ltar bu mo'i mtshan bzang ba dang mi bzang ba dag go rims bzhin du dge ba dang mi dge ba nyid kyi mtshan nyid dag yin pa lta bur te / gal te 'di dag kyang de dang 'dra bar 'dus byas kyi dngos po yod pa nyid dam // dge ba nyid dang mi dge ba nyid kyi mtshan nyid yin par bzhed par gyur na ni gsum po 'di dag ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid yin no zhes bka' stsal bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: Just as the marks of a maiden are the characteristics of virtue and nonvirtue, respectively, in the same way, these three are the characteristics of conditioned things.üîΩIf the Lord Buddha had intended to state that these three are the characteristics of the existence of conditioned things or the characteristics of virtue and nonvirtue, he would have said, ‚ÄúThese three are the characteristics of conditioned things.‚Äù

original: 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid yin no zhes bya bar ni bka' stsal par mi 'gyur ba zhig na yang bka' stsal yang stsal to //üîΩdes na 'dus byas nyid mtshan nyid dag @162a * //
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid yin no zhes bya bar ni bka' stsal par mi 'gyur ba zhig na yang bka' stsal yang stsal to // des na 'dus byas nyid mtshan nyid dag @162a * //
translated: But he did not say that; he said, ‚ÄúThese three are the characteristics of conditioned things.‚Äù

original: yin no zhes bya bar shes so //
analyzed: yin no zhes bya bar shes so //
translated: Therefore, we understand that conditioned things themselves are the characteristics.

original: yang ji ltar na skye ba la sogs pa yod pa ma yin pa rgyun dag la rnam par bzhag pa'am mngon pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang ji ltar na skye ba la sogs pa yod pa ma yin pa rgyun dag la rnam par bzhag pa'am mngon pa yin zhe na /
translated: How can origination, etc. be posited or manifested in continua if they do not exist?

original: skye ba la sogs pa med ces ni mi smra'i /
analyzed: skye ba la sogs pa med ces ni mi smra'i /
translated: We do not say that origination, etc. do not exist.

original: ji ltar rdzas kyi ngo bor rnam par phye ba de ltar ni yod pa ma yin no zhes smra'o //
analyzed: ji ltar rdzas kyi ngo bor rnam par phye ba de ltar ni yod pa ma yin no zhes smra'o //
translated: We say that they do not exist as they are distinguished in the nature of substances.

original: 'o na khyed kyi ltar ni ji ltar yod pa de bzhin du smros shig ce na /
analyzed: 'o na khyed kyi ltar ni ji ltar yod pa de bzhin du smros shig ce na /
translated: Well then, tell us how they exist according to you!

original: de'i phyir rgyun gyi dang po ni skye ba yin no zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyun gyi dang po ni skye ba yin no zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
translated: Therefore, he says, the first moment of a continuum is origination, etc.

original: ldog pa ni 'jig pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rgyun zhig pa ni 'jig pa yin pa'o //
analyzed: ldog pa ni 'jig pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rgyun zhig pa ni 'jig pa yin pa'o //
translated: Cessation is the termination of a continuum.

original: rgyun de nyid rjes su 'jug pa zhes bya ba skad cig ma 'dra ba rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir rgyun rjes su 'jug pa ni gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rgyun de nyid rjes su 'jug pa zhes bya ba skad cig ma 'dra ba rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir rgyun rjes su 'jug pa ni gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The continuation of a continuum is endurance, because a similar moment continues.

original: de'i snga phyi'i bye brag ces bya ba ni snga ma las skad cig ma phyi ma bye brag yod pa'am skad cig snga ma dang phyi ma dang gi bye brag ni snga phyi'i bye brag go //
analyzed: de'i snga phyi'i bye brag ces bya ba ni snga ma las skad cig ma phyi ma bye brag yod pa'am skad cig snga ma dang phyi ma dang gi bye brag ni snga phyi'i bye brag go //
translated: The ‚Äúdistinction of its prior and subsequent‚Äù is the distinction of the subsequent moment from the prior moment. The distinction of the prior and subsequent moments is the distinction of prior and subsequent.

original: de lta yin pas na zhes bya ba ni skye ba la sogs pa rgyun gyi ngo bo kho na yin pas na tshe dang ldan pa mdzes dga'i dran pa nye bar gnas pa las brtsams te gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: de lta yin pas na zhes bya ba ni skye ba la sogs pa rgyun gyi ngo bo kho na yin pas na tshe dang ldan pa mdzes dga'i dran pa nye bar gnas pa las brtsams te gsungs pa yin te /
translated: ‚Äú Because of this‚Äù means that since birth, etc., are the nature of a continuum, the Buddha spoke of the abiding of the mindfulness of the venerable Subh≈´ti, beginning with the statement:

original: de'i tshor ba rgyun dang ldan pa rig bzhin du skye zhing rig bzhin du gnas pa dang rig bzhin du yongs su zad pa dang yongs su gtugs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshor ba rgyun dang ldan pa rig bzhin du skye zhing rig bzhin du gnas pa dang rig bzhin du yongs su zad pa dang yongs su gtugs par 'gyur ro //
translated: ‚ÄúHis feeling arises in a continuum, and he knows it as it arises, he knows it as it remains, he knows it as it is destroyed and perishes.

original: rtogs par dka' ba'i phyir skad cig ma dang ldan pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rtogs par dka' ba'i phyir skad cig ma dang ldan pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not said to be momentary, because it is difficult to understand.

original: skad cig ma ni rig kyang gnas pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig ma ni rig kyang gnas pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since it is impossible to know a moment as it remains,

original: don 'di nyid tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis bsdu ba'i phyir //
analyzed: don 'di nyid tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis bsdu ba'i phyir //
translated: In order to summarize this very meaning in two verses, he says:

original: rgyun gyi dang po skye ba yin //
analyzed: rgyun gyi dang po skye ba yin //
translated: The first of the continuum is origination.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa thams cad smos so //üîΩgnas pa de zhes bya ba ni rgyun de nyid gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa thams cad smos so // gnas pa de zhes bya ba ni rgyun de nyid gnas pa yin no //
translated: All of this is stated.üîΩThat very endurance is of that very continuum.

original: de nyid ces bya ba ni rgyun de nyid kyi'o //
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba ni rgyun de nyid kyi'o //
translated: That very is of that very continuum.

original: de chad ces bya ba ni rgyun chad pa'o //
analyzed: de chad ces bya ba ni rgyun chad pa'o //
translated: That is severed is the severance of the continuum.

original: skad cig ma'i chos la ni zhes bya ba ni tshigs su bcad pa yin te /
analyzed: skad cig ma'i chos la ni zhes bya ba ni tshigs su bcad pa yin te /
translated: With regard to momentary phenomena,

original: gal te skad cig ma'i chos ni gnas pa zhig med na 'jig par 'gyur bas gnas pa yod do zhes bya bar sems na chos de yang gnas pa yod bzhin du yang 'jig par 'gyur ba kho na ste /
analyzed: gal te skad cig ma'i chos ni gnas pa zhig med na 'jig par 'gyur bas gnas pa yod do zhes bya bar sems na chos de yang gnas pa yod bzhin du yang 'jig par 'gyur ba kho na ste /
translated: if you think that if a momentary phenomenon does not endure, it would be destroyed, and therefore endurance exists, then that phenomenon would be destroyed even while enduring,

original: skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir dang / 'jig pa la rgyu med pa'i phyir 'jig par 'gyur ba kho na'o //
analyzed: skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir dang / 'jig pa la rgyu med pa'i phyir 'jig par 'gyur ba kho na'o //
translated: because it is momentary and because destruction does not require a cause.

original: de lta bas na der rtog pa don med de /
analyzed: de lta bas na der rtog pa don med de /
translated: Therefore, conceiving it to be that way is pointless.

original: gnas par rtog pa dgos pa med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gnas par rtog pa dgos pa med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of the statement, ‚ÄúConceiving endurance is pointless‚Äù is that it is purposeless.

original: skad cig @162b gnyis pa la sogs pa'i gnas pa la gnas par rtog pa ni don med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: skad cig @162b gnyis pa la sogs pa'i gnas pa la gnas par rtog pa ni don med pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not meaningless to conceive of the endurance of a dharma in the second moment and so on.

original: de'i phyir gnas pa ni rgyun kho na yin no zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir chos skad cig ma la gnas par rtog pa'i don med pas so //
analyzed: de'i phyir gnas pa ni rgyun kho na yin no zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir chos skad cig ma la gnas par rtog pa'i don med pas so //
translated: Therefore, endurance is just the continuum, because the conception of the endurance of a momentary dharma is meaningless.

original: de ltar bshad na 'di yang zhes bya ba ni gnas pa ni rgyun kho na yin par bshad na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de ltar bshad na 'di yang zhes bya ba ni gnas pa ni rgyun kho na yin par bshad na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: If endurance is explained in this way, then this is also so. If endurance is explained as just the continuum, then this is also so.üîΩBecause there is no destruction of that which has arisen in a moment.

original: skyes pa skad cig ma la ni mi 'jig pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di la kha cig 'di snyam du gnas pa yod pa'i phyir chos skyes pa skad cig ma gcig cig mi 'jig pa yin no //
analyzed: skyes pa skad cig ma la ni mi 'jig pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di la kha cig 'di snyam du gnas pa yod pa'i phyir chos skyes pa skad cig ma gcig cig mi 'jig pa yin no //
translated: In this regard, some think that because endurance exists, a dharma that has arisen does not disintegrate for one moment.üîΩIf endurance did not exist, that one moment would not exist.

original: gal te gnas pa med na ni skad cig ma gcig po de yang yod par mi 'gyur ro snyam du sems na ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te gnas pa med na ni skad cig ma gcig po de yang yod par mi 'gyur ro snyam du sems na ma yin te /
translated: This is not so.

original: de yod pa nyid ni 'di yod na 'di 'byung zhes 'byung ba'i phyir rgyu dang rkyen dang sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yod pa nyid ni 'di yod na 'di 'byung zhes 'byung ba'i phyir rgyu dang rkyen dang sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and its existence is preceded by causes and conditions, because it is said, ‚ÄúWhen this exists, that comes to be.‚Äù

original: gal te gnas pas nye bar 'dzin to snyam ste /
analyzed: gal te gnas pas nye bar 'dzin to snyam ste /
translated: If you think that endurance causes appropriation,

original: ji ste rgyu dang rkyen dag las skye ba'i chos gnas pas nye bar 'dzin to zhes bya bar 'dod na /
analyzed: ji ste rgyu dang rkyen dag las skye ba'i chos gnas pas nye bar 'dzin to zhes bya bar 'dod na /
translated: then if you assert that a phenomenon that arises from causes and conditions is appropriated by endurance,

original: gal te gnas pas nye bar ma bzung na ci zhig tu 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te gnas pas nye bar ma bzung na ci zhig tu 'gyur /
translated: what would happen if it were not appropriated by endurance?

original: bdag nyid yod par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid yod par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: It would not exist by itself.

original: 'o na ni gnas pas skyed par byed pa yin par 'gyur gyi gnas par byed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'o na ni gnas pas skyed par byed pa yin par 'gyur gyi gnas par byed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But then endurance would be the producer, not the endurer.

original: gal te gnas pas rgyun yod pa gnas par byed do //
analyzed: gal te gnas pas rgyun yod pa gnas par byed do //
translated: If you think that endurance causes the continuum to endure,

original: zhe na / rgyu dang rkyen dag la gnas pa zhes bya bar thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: zhe na / rgyu dang rkyen dag la gnas pa zhes bya bar thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: then it follows that endurance would be the cause of the continuum,

original: rgyu dang rkyen rnams ni rgyun gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen rnams ni rgyun gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because causes and conditions are the cause of the continuum.

original: ris mthun pa'i sems la rung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni ris mthun pa gcig la sems du ma yang ris mthun pa gcig las byung ba'i phyir gcig ces bya'o snyam du bsams pa yin te /
analyzed: ris mthun pa'i sems la rung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni ris mthun pa gcig la sems du ma yang ris mthun pa gcig las byung ba'i phyir gcig ces bya'o snyam du bsams pa yin te /
translated: It is suitable to say that it is a single mind in the same class because many minds in the same class arise from a single mind in the same class.

original: sems de la sems gcig la zhes bya bar brjod du rung gi //
analyzed: sems de la sems gcig la zhes bya bar brjod du rung gi //
translated: It is suitable to say that it is a single mind in the same class.

original: de lta ma yin na sems kyi skad cig ma gcig la ji ltar skye ba dang 'chi ba dang gnas pa gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid du 'gyur /üîΩphyi ma phyi ma'i skad cig ma rjes su 'brel pa ni gnas pa'o zhes bya ba ni mtshungs pa'i phyir skad cig ma phyi ma ni skad cig ma snga ma dang 'dra ba yin te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na sems kyi skad cig ma gcig la ji ltar skye ba dang 'chi ba dang gnas pa gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid du 'gyur / phyi ma phyi ma'i skad cig ma rjes su 'brel pa ni gnas pa'o zhes bya ba ni mtshungs pa'i phyir skad cig ma phyi ma ni skad cig ma snga ma dang 'dra ba yin te /
translated: Otherwise, how could birth, death and other changes occur in a single moment of mind?üîΩThe later moments that are connected are called enduring because the later moment is similar to the former moment.

original: de'i phyir skad cig ma snga ma de da dung gnas pa dang 'dra bas na skad cig ma phyi ma la gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir skad cig ma snga ma de da dung gnas pa dang 'dra bas na skad cig ma phyi ma la gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since the former moment is similar to the later moment, it is called enduring.

original: 'o na gang gi tshe 'dra bar yang skye'o zhes bya ba ni 'o na gang gi tshe 'dra bar skye ba de'i tshe ni mi @163a * //
analyzed: 'o na gang gi tshe 'dra bar yang skye'o zhes bya ba ni 'o na gang gi tshe 'dra bar skye ba de'i tshe ni mi @163a * //
translated: But when it arises in a similar way, then it does not arise in a dissimilar way.

original: 'dra ba nyid med do //
analyzed: 'dra ba nyid med do //
translated: When it arises in a similar way, then it does not arise in a dissimilar way.

original: gnas pa gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid ni mi 'dra ba nyid yin par bshad de /
analyzed: gnas pa gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid ni mi 'dra ba nyid yin par bshad de /
translated: The transformation of the prior state is called ‚Äúdissimilarity.‚Äù

original: de bas na 'dra bar skye ba la gnas pa gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid med pas mtshan nyid ma khyab pa can du 'gyur ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na 'dra bar skye ba la gnas pa gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid med pas mtshan nyid ma khyab pa can du 'gyur ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, since there is no transformation of the prior state when it arises in a similar way, the characteristic would not be universal.

original: 'phangs pa dang ma 'phangs pa dang stobs chen po dang stobs chung ngus 'phangs pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni de ni 'phangs pa dang ma 'phangs pa yin pas 'phangs pa dang ma 'phangs pa'o //
analyzed: 'phangs pa dang ma 'phangs pa dang stobs chen po dang stobs chung ngus 'phangs pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni de ni 'phangs pa dang ma 'phangs pa yin pas 'phangs pa dang ma 'phangs pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúprojected and not projected, projected by a powerful action and projected by a weak action‚Äù means that it is projected and not projected, thus it is projected and not projected.

original: stobs chen po dang stobs chung ngu dag gis 'phangs pa ni stobs chen po dang stobs chung ngus 'phangs pa'o //
analyzed: stobs chen po dang stobs chung ngu dag gis 'phangs pa ni stobs chen po dang stobs chung ngus 'phangs pa'o //
translated: Projected by a powerful action and projected by a weak action is projected by a powerful action and a weak action.

original: de ni 'phangs pa dang ma 'phangs pa yang yin la stobs chen po dang stobs chung ngus 'phangs pa yang yin pas 'phangs pa dang ma 'phangs pa dang stobs chen po dang stobs chung ngus 'phangs pa'o //
analyzed: de ni 'phangs pa dang ma 'phangs pa yang yin la stobs chen po dang stobs chung ngus 'phangs pa yang yin pas 'phangs pa dang ma 'phangs pa dang stobs chen po dang stobs chung ngus 'phangs pa'o //
translated: It is thrown and not thrown, and it is thrown by a strong or weak force.

original: de ci zhe na /
analyzed: de ci zhe na /
translated: What is it?

original: rdo rje la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rdo rje la sogs pa ste /
translated: It is a diamond, etc.

original: sogs pa smos pas ni lcags dang rdo la sogs pa bsdu'o //
analyzed: sogs pa smos pas ni lcags dang rdo la sogs pa bsdu'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes iron, stone, etc.

original: gzhan dag ni 'di ltar tshig rnam par sbyor bar byed de /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni 'di ltar tshig rnam par sbyor bar byed de /
translated: Others explain the sentence in the following way:

original: 'phangs pa dang ma 'phangs pa ni 'phangs pa dang ma 'phangs pa dag yin no //
analyzed: 'phangs pa dang ma 'phangs pa ni 'phangs pa dang ma 'phangs pa dag yin no //
translated: That which is thrown and not thrown is thrown and not thrown.

original: stobs chen po dang stobs chung ngu dag gis 'phangs pa dag ni stobs chen po dang stobs chung ngus 'phangs pa dag ste /
analyzed: stobs chen po dang stobs chung ngu dag gis 'phangs pa dag ni stobs chen po dang stobs chung ngus 'phangs pa dag ste /
translated: That which is thrown by a strong or weak force is thrown by a strong or weak force.

original: rnam pa 'di gnyis ni 'phangs pa'i bye brag yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa 'di gnyis ni 'phangs pa'i bye brag yin no //
translated: These two modes are the distinctions of being thrown.

original: 'di la rdo rje la 'phangs pa dang ma 'phangs pa dang stobs chen po dang stobs chung ngus 'phangs pa dang yod pas na rdo rje la sogs pa 'phangs pa dang ma 'phangs pa dang stobs chen po dang stobs chung ngus 'phangs pa'o //üîΩtshig rnam par sbyar ba 'di la rdo rje la sogs pa khyad par yin la 'phangs pa dang ma 'phangs pa dang stobs chen po chen po dang stobs chung ngus 'phangs pa ni khyad par gyi gzhi yin no //
analyzed: 'di la rdo rje la 'phangs pa dang ma 'phangs pa dang stobs chen po dang stobs chung ngus 'phangs pa dang yod pas na rdo rje la sogs pa 'phangs pa dang ma 'phangs pa dang stobs chen po dang stobs chung ngus 'phangs pa'o // tshig rnam par sbyar ba 'di la rdo rje la sogs pa khyad par yin la 'phangs pa dang ma 'phangs pa dang stobs chen po chen po dang stobs chung ngus 'phangs pa ni khyad par gyi gzhi yin no //
translated: Here, the diamond, etc., is the qualified, and the thrown, not thrown, thrown with great force, and thrown with little force are the qualifiers.üîΩIn this analysis of the sentence, the diamond, etc., is the qualifier, and the thrown, not thrown, thrown with great force, and thrown with little force are the qualified.

original: de lta bu'i rdo rje la sogs pa de ci rigs par bul ba dang myur ba dang ches bul pa dang ches myur bar ltung ba ste 'phangs pa ni bul bar ltung ngo //
analyzed: de lta bu'i rdo rje la sogs pa de ci rigs par bul ba dang myur ba dang ches bul pa dang ches myur bar ltung ba ste 'phangs pa ni bul bar ltung ngo //
translated: The diamond, etc., thus qualified, falls slowly, quickly, very slowly, and very quickly, respectively. The thrown falls slowly.

original: ma 'phangs pa ni ches bu la bar ltung ngo //
analyzed: ma 'phangs pa ni ches bu la bar ltung ngo //
translated: The not thrown falls very slowly.

original: stobs chung ngus 'phangs pa ni myur bar ltung ngo //
analyzed: stobs chung ngus 'phangs pa ni myur bar ltung ngo //
translated: The thrown with little force falls quickly.üîΩThe thrown with great force falls very quickly.

original: stobs chen pos 'phangs pa ni ches myur bar ltung ngo //
analyzed: stobs chen pos 'phangs pa ni ches myur bar ltung ngo //
translated: That which is projected with great force falls very quickly.

original: de'i dus te de'i bye brag go //
analyzed: de'i dus te de'i bye brag go //
translated: The time of that is the distinction of that.

original: bul ba dang myur ba dang / @163b ches bul ba dang myur bar ltung ba'i dus kyi bye brag las de'i 'byung ba rnams kyi ste rdo rje la sogs pa'i 'byung ba rnams kyi yongs su gyur pa'i bye brag ste 'phangs pa'i yongs su gyur pa yang gang gis na bul bar ltung ba ste
analyzed: bul ba dang myur ba dang / @163b ches bul ba dang myur bar ltung ba'i dus kyi bye brag las de'i 'byung ba rnams kyi ste rdo rje la sogs pa'i 'byung ba rnams kyi yongs su gyur pa'i bye brag ste 'phangs pa'i yongs su gyur pa yang gang gis na bul bar ltung ba ste
translated: Due to the distinction of the time of falling slowly, quickly, very slowly, and very quickly, there is a distinction of the transformation of the primary elements of that, the primary elements of the vajra and so on, the transformation of the projection, by which it falls slowly.

original: / gzhan du yin la de bzhin du stobs chen pos 'phangs pa'i yongs su gyur pa yang gang gis na ches myur bar ltung ba'i bar du gzhan du yin no //
analyzed: / gzhan du yin la de bzhin du stobs chen pos 'phangs pa'i yongs su gyur pa yang gang gis na ches myur bar ltung ba'i bar du gzhan du yin no //
translated: And similarly, the transformation of that projected with great force is different, by which it falls very quickly.

original: yongs su gyur pa'i bye brag de 'grub ste yongs su gyur pa'i bye brag 'grub pa de'i phyir de dag khyad par med pa ma yin no zhes bya bar skabs dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: yongs su gyur pa'i bye brag de 'grub ste yongs su gyur pa'i bye brag 'grub pa de'i phyir de dag khyad par med pa ma yin no zhes bya bar skabs dang sbyar ro //
translated: That distinction of transformation is established, and because that distinction of transformation is established, they are not undifferentiated.

original: 'o na ni sgra dang me lce'i skad cig ma tha ma zhes bya bar rgyas par 'byung ba ni sgra dang mar me la sogs pa'i rgyun 'jig pa'i dus kyi skad cig ma tha ma gang yin pa dang dgra bcom pa phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya
analyzed: 'o na ni sgra dang me lce'i skad cig ma tha ma zhes bya bar rgyas par 'byung ba ni sgra dang mar me la sogs pa'i rgyun 'jig pa'i dus kyi skad cig ma tha ma gang yin pa dang dgra bcom pa phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya
translated: But the last moment of sound and the last moment of a flame, etc.,

original: ngan las 'da' ba'i tshe skye mched la skad cig ma phyi ma med pa'i phyir gnas pa med do //
analyzed: ngan las 'da' ba'i tshe skye mched la skad cig ma phyi ma med pa'i phyir gnas pa med do //
translated: are not established as abiding because they do not abide for a second moment.

original: gnas pa med pa'i phyir gnas pa gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid med pas de'i mi 'dra ba nyid ni gnas pa gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid do zhes bshad pa gang yin pa'i mtshan nyid rnam par bzhag pa ma khyab pa can du 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gnas pa med pa'i phyir gnas pa gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid med pas de'i mi 'dra ba nyid ni gnas pa gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid do zhes bshad pa gang yin pa'i mtshan nyid rnam par bzhag pa ma khyab pa can du 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Since they do not abide, they do not transform.üîΩTherefore the definition of impermanence is not established as a universal because it is not included in the last moment of sound, a flame, etc., and in the last moment of the sense bases of an arhat who attains nirvana without remainder.

original: gang la gnas pa yod pa de la ni gdon mi za bar gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid kyang yod la gang la gnas pa med pa de la ni gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid kyang med do zhes bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: gang la gnas pa yod pa de la ni gdon mi za bar gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid kyang yod la gang la gnas pa med pa de la ni gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid kyang med do zhes bshad pa yin te /
translated: But it is explained that that which abides definitely transforms and that which does not abide does not transform.

original: mdo las ni srid pa'i phyir 'di skad du gsum po 'di dag ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid do zhes bshad par zad do //
analyzed: mdo las ni srid pa'i phyir 'di skad du gsum po 'di dag ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid do zhes bshad par zad do //
translated: But the sutra merely says that these three are the characteristics of conditioned phenomena because it is possible that they exist in some conditioned phenomena.

original: de lta bas na sgra dang me lce'i skad cig ma tha ma la sogs pa la ni mtshan nyid skye ba dang 'jig pa gnyis kho nar yod par 'dod la /
analyzed: de lta bas na sgra dang me lce'i skad cig ma tha ma la sogs pa la ni mtshan nyid skye ba dang 'jig pa gnyis kho nar yod par 'dod la /
translated: Therefore, it is accepted that the final moment of sound and the flame of a lamp and so on have only two characteristics: arising and disintegrating.

original: de las gzhan pa dag la ni gnas pa gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid kyang yod do //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa dag la ni gnas pa gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid kyang yod do //
translated: But other conditioned phenomena have the characteristic of change.

original: gzhan dag na re ni sgra dang me lce'i skad cig ma tha ma la sogs pa la yang rang gnas pa gang yin pa'i gnas pa yod la /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re ni sgra dang me lce'i skad cig ma tha ma la sogs pa la yang rang gnas pa gang yin pa'i gnas pa yod la /
translated: Others say: The final moment of sound and the flame of a lamp and so on have the characteristic of endurance that is their own state.

original: de'i gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid ni skad cig ma snga ma la ltos pa yin pas de dag la yang mtshan nyid gsum rnam par gzhag go zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de'i gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid ni skad cig ma snga ma la ltos pa yin pas de dag la yang mtshan nyid gsum rnam par gzhag go zhes zer ro //
translated: Since their change is dependent on the prior moment, they also have three characteristics.

original: de ni ji ltar mtshan nyid kyi gzhi'i chos de nyid kyi mtshan nyid du zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid kyi gzhi dang mtshan nyid dag ni chu @164a * //
analyzed: de ni ji ltar mtshan nyid kyi gzhi'i chos de nyid kyi mtshan nyid du zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid kyi gzhi dang mtshan nyid dag ni chu @164a * //
translated: ‚ÄúHow could it be the defining characteristic of that very phenomenon that is the basis of the defining characteristic?‚Äù

original: dang chu skyar bzhin du gzhan nyid yin par mthong nas rgol bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: dang chu skyar bzhin du gzhan nyid yin par mthong nas rgol bar byed pa yin no //
translated: Seeing that the basis of the defining characteristic and the defining characteristic are different, like water and a water-bird, he objects.

original: mdo sde pa rnams kyis de 'khrul bar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mdo sde pa rnams kyis de 'khrul bar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show that he is mistaken, the SautrƒÅntikas say:

original: re zhig ji ltar na skyes bu chen po'i mtshan rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: re zhig ji ltar na skyes bu chen po'i mtshan rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúHow could the marks of a great being be the great being?‚Äù

original: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan rnams ni skyes bu chen pos bsdus pa'i phyir te de las gzhan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan rnams ni skyes bu chen pos bsdus pa'i phyir te de las gzhan pa ma yin no //
translated: The marks of a great being are included in a great being, they are not different from him.

original: skyes bu chen po ni skyes bu chen po'i mtshan tsam ma yin gyi /
analyzed: skyes bu chen po ni skyes bu chen po'i mtshan tsam ma yin gyi /
translated: A great being is not just the marks of a great being.

original: chos tsam ni ma byung ba las 'byung ba byung nas kyang med par 'gyur bar 'di ni dper mi rung ngo zhes smra na 'di la bdag smra bar bya'o //
analyzed: chos tsam ni ma byung ba las 'byung ba byung nas kyang med par 'gyur bar 'di ni dper mi rung ngo zhes smra na 'di la bdag smra bar bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe arising of mere phenomena from non-arising and the ceasing of what has arisen to non-existence is not a suitable example.‚Äù If he says this, I will reply to him.

original: 'di ni mtshungs pa nyid de /
analyzed: 'di ni mtshungs pa nyid de /
translated: This is the same.

original: ji ltar skyes bu chen po'i mtshan rnams la skyes bu chen po zhes kyang bya skyes bu chen po'i mtshan zhes kyang bya ba de bzhin du 'dus byas kyi chos la yang 'dus byas zhes kyang bya la 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid ces kyang bya ste /
analyzed: ji ltar skyes bu chen po'i mtshan rnams la skyes bu chen po zhes kyang bya skyes bu chen po'i mtshan zhes kyang bya ba de bzhin du 'dus byas kyi chos la yang 'dus byas zhes kyang bya la 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid ces kyang bya ste /
translated: Just as the marks of a great person are called both ‚Äúgreat person‚Äù and ‚Äúmarks of a great person,‚Äù so too conditioned phenomena are called both ‚Äúconditioned‚Äù and ‚Äúcharacteristics of conditioned phenomena.‚Äù

original: chos de ni skye ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid gnas skabs kyi khyad par gyis mtshon par byed do //
analyzed: chos de ni skye ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid gnas skabs kyi khyad par gyis mtshon par byed do //
translated: That phenomenon is characterized by the specific states of arising and so on.

original: gang gi tshe rgyun la mtshan nyid rnam par 'jog par byed pa de'i tshe ni spyis spyi mtshon par byed de /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rgyun la mtshan nyid rnam par 'jog par byed pa de'i tshe ni spyis spyi mtshon par byed de /
translated: When the characteristics are posited in relation to a continuum, then a general characteristic characterizes a general characteristic.

original: dper na skyes bu chen po zhes bya ba spyi skyes bu chen po'i mtshan spyis mtshon par byed pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na skyes bu chen po zhes bya ba spyi skyes bu chen po'i mtshan spyis mtshon par byed pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, the general term ‚Äúgreat person‚Äù characterizes the general term ‚Äúmarks of a great person.‚Äù

original: 'dis ni lkog shal la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid dag kyang rnam par bshang pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni lkog shal la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid dag kyang rnam par bshang pa yin no //
translated: This also explains the characteristics of the dewlap and so on.

original: sra ba nyid la sogs pa dag kyang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni dpe 'di ni 'di'i gsung rab las grags pa yin pa'i phyir gnyi ga la grub pa yin te /
analyzed: sra ba nyid la sogs pa dag kyang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni dpe 'di ni 'di'i gsung rab las grags pa yin pa'i phyir gnyi ga la grub pa yin te /
translated: This example is established for both parties because it is renowned in the scriptures.

original: sa'i khams ni sra ba'i mtshan nyid can yin no zhes bya ba mod kyi sra ba nyid sa'i khams las gzhan pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sa'i khams ni sra ba'i mtshan nyid can yin no zhes bya ba mod kyi sra ba nyid sa'i khams las gzhan pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The earth element has the characteristic of solidity, but solidity is not different from the earth element.

original: de bzhin du thams cad la'ang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du thams cad la'ang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: This should be applied in the same way to all.üîΩWhen the earth element is characterized as solid, it is called the characteristic of solidity.

original: sa'i khams de sra ba'i mtshon par byed pa na sra ba'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba de bzhin du 'dus byas de nyid ma byung ba las 'byung ba'i byung nas kyang med pas mtshon par byed pa na mtshon par byed pas mtshan nyid ces bya ba yin pa'i
analyzed: sa'i khams de sra ba'i mtshon par byed pa na sra ba'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba de bzhin du 'dus byas de nyid ma byung ba las 'byung ba'i byung nas kyang med pas mtshon par byed pa na mtshon par byed pas mtshan nyid ces bya ba yin pa'i
translated: In the same way, when the unarisen arising of that conditioned phenomenon is characterized as arising, it is called the characteristic of arising.

original: phyir 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid ces bya mod kyi de las gzhan pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: phyir 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid ces bya mod kyi de las gzhan pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is called the characteristic of conditioned phenomena, but it is not different from that.

original: ji ltar gyen du 'gro ba las zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni bye brag tu smra ba skad cig mar smra ba'i ltar na du ba'i gyen du 'gro ba @164b gzhan yod pa ma yin te /üîΩde nyid gyen du yul gzhan dag tu 'byung ba na gyen du 'gro ba zhes bya ba'i ming 'thob bo //
analyzed: ji ltar gyen du 'gro ba las zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni bye brag tu smra ba skad cig mar smra ba'i ltar na du ba'i gyen du 'gro ba @164b gzhan yod pa ma yin te / de nyid gyen du yul gzhan dag tu 'byung ba na gyen du 'gro ba zhes bya ba'i ming 'thob bo //
translated: Just as it is said, ‚ÄúIt is not different from smoke,‚Äù the ascending is not different from smoke.üîΩHere, the same method applies.üîΩJust as it is said, ‚ÄúIt is not different from smoke,‚Äù the ascending is not different from smoke.üîΩHere, the same method applies.

original: gyen du 'gro ba de ni de dang tha dad pa ltar snang yang du ba'i gyen du 'gro ba nyid ni gzhan yin par yang mi 'dod do //
analyzed: gyen du 'gro ba de ni de dang tha dad pa ltar snang yang du ba'i gyen du 'gro ba nyid ni gzhan yin par yang mi 'dod do //
translated: Just as it is said, ‚ÄúIt is not different from smoke,‚Äù the ascending is not different from smoke.üîΩHere, the same method applies.üîΩJust as it is said, ‚ÄúIt is not different from smoke,‚Äù the ascending is not different from smoke.üîΩHere, the same method applies.üîΩJust as it is said, ‚ÄúIt is not different from smoke,‚Äù the ascending is not different from smoke.üîΩHere, the same method applies.

original: de ni du ba'i de las kyang mi gzhan pa ltar zhes bya ba ni gyen du 'gro ba de ni du ba las gzhan pa yang ma yin pa ltar ro //
analyzed: de ni du ba'i de las kyang mi gzhan pa ltar zhes bya ba ni gyen du 'gro ba de ni du ba las gzhan pa yang ma yin pa ltar ro //
translated: Just as it is said, ‚ÄúIt is not different from smoke,‚Äù the ascending is not different from smoke.üîΩHere, the same method applies.üîΩJust as it is said, ‚ÄúIt is not different from smoke,‚Äù the ascending is not different from smoke.üîΩHere, the same method applies.üîΩJust as it is said, ‚ÄúIt is not different from smoke,‚Äù the ascending is not different from smoke.üîΩHere, the same method applies.üîΩJust as it is said, ‚ÄúIt is not different from smoke,‚Äù the ascending is not different from smoke.üîΩHere, the same method applies.üîΩJust as it is said, ‚ÄúIt is not different from smoke,‚Äù the ascending is not different from smoke.üîΩHere, the same method applies.üîΩJust as it is said, ‚ÄúIt is not different from smoke,‚Äù the ascending is not different from smoke.üîΩHere, the same method applies.üîΩJust as it is said, ‚ÄúIt is not different from smoke,‚Äù the ascending is not different from smoke.üîΩHere, the same method applies.üîΩJust as it is said, ‚ÄúIt is not different from smoke,‚Äù the ascending is not different from smoke.üîΩHere, the same method applies.üîΩJust as it is said, ‚ÄúIt is not different from smoke,‚Äù the ascending is not different from smoke.

original: 'dir yang tshul de nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni de bzhin de skye ba dang 'jig pa dang gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid de tha dad par snang mod kyi 'dus byas gzhan yang ma yin no /
analyzed: 'dir yang tshul de nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni de bzhin de skye ba dang 'jig pa dang gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid de tha dad par snang mod kyi 'dus byas gzhan yang ma yin no /
translated: Here, the same method applies.üîΩJust

original: 'dus byas gzugs la sogs pa ji srid du rang gi ngo bo gzung yang ji srid du med pa dang phyis med pa mi shes pa ste gzugs la sogs pa de dag gi skye ba snga ma med pa mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'dus byas gzugs la sogs pa ji srid du rang gi ngo bo gzung yang ji srid du med pa dang phyis med pa mi shes pa ste gzugs la sogs pa de dag gi skye ba snga ma med pa mi shes pa'o //
translated: As long as one apprehends the intrinsic reality of conditioned things such as form, one does not know that they are nonexistent, and one does not know that they will be nonexistent later. One does not know that their prior arising is nonexistent.

original: phyis ci zhe na /
analyzed: phyis ci zhe na /
translated: What about later?

original: med par te ji srid du med pa dang zhig nas med pa mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: med par te ji srid du med pa dang zhig nas med pa mi shes pa'o //
translated: One does not know that they are nonexistent, and one does not know that they will be nonexistent after they have perished.

original: rgyun gyi bye brag ji srid du mi shes pa zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: rgyun gyi bye brag ji srid du mi shes pa zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The distinction of the continuum should be supplied in each case.

original: de lta bas na de nyid kyis de mtshon pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba ni 'dus byas de nyid kyis 'dus byas de nyid mtshon par byed pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na de nyid kyis de mtshon pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba ni 'dus byas de nyid kyis 'dus byas de nyid mtshon par byed pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not that very thing which is indicated by that. The conditioned itself does not indicate the conditioned itself.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: snga na med pa la sogs pas 'dus byas nyid mtshon par byed do //
analyzed: snga na med pa la sogs pas 'dus byas nyid mtshon par byed do //
translated: Conditionedness is indicated by prior nonexistence and so on.

original: gal te gzugs la sogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo bzung ba na 'dus byas so zhes bya bar 'dzin par gyur na ni snga na med pa dang phyis med pa dang rgyun gyi bye brag ma shes pa kho nar de shes par 'gyur ba zhig na de ltar
analyzed: gal te gzugs la sogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo bzung ba na 'dus byas so zhes bya bar 'dzin par gyur na ni snga na med pa dang phyis med pa dang rgyun gyi bye brag ma shes pa kho nar de shes par 'gyur ba zhig na de ltar
translated: If one apprehends the intrinsic reality of form, etc., and then apprehends it as conditioned, then one would know it only after not knowing the difference between its prior nonexistence, subsequent nonexistence, and continuity.

original: yang mi shes te /
analyzed: yang mi shes te /
translated: But that is not so.

original: de lta bas na de nyid kyis de mtshon pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na de nyid kyis de mtshon pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not that very thing which is indicated by that.

original: gzugs la sogs pa de dag las skye ba la sogs pa rdzas gzhan nyid du yod pa yang ma yin te /üîΩrgyun gyi dang po skye ba yin //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa de dag las skye ba la sogs pa rdzas gzhan nyid du yod pa yang ma yin te / rgyun gyi dang po skye ba yin //
translated: Origination, etc., do not exist as real entities separate from form, etc.,üîΩbecause it is said:

original: zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The first of the continuities is origination.

original: de dag ni lhan cig 'byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni skye ba la sogs pa dus mnyam du skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni lhan cig 'byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni skye ba la sogs pa dus mnyam du skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: They are simultaneous, because origination, etc., are produced at the same time.

original: bya ba'i dus tha dad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni de lta ma yin no //
analyzed: bya ba'i dus tha dad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni de lta ma yin no //
translated: They are not different in terms of the time of action.

original: ci'i phyi'i zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyi'i zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bya ba'i dus tha dad pa'i phyir te rtsal gyi dus tha dad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bya ba'i dus tha dad pa'i phyir te rtsal gyi dus tha dad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: because the times of their activity are different, that is, because the times of their functioning are different.

original: de bstan pa'i phyir skye ba ma 'ongs pa ni bya ba byed de zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //üîΩci ma 'ongs pa @165a * //
analyzed: de bstan pa'i phyir skye ba ma 'ongs pa ni bya ba byed de zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so // ci ma 'ongs pa @165a * //
translated: In order to demonstrate that, he says, ‚Äúfuture arising performs its activity.‚ÄùüîΩDoes future arising exist or not exist as a substantial entity?

original: rdzas su yod dam med ces bya ba re zhig ma 'ongs pa nyid med do zhes bya bar sgrub par 'gyur na skye ba ma 'ongs pa bya ba byed do zhes bya ba lta ga la yod snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: rdzas su yod dam med ces bya ba re zhig ma 'ongs pa nyid med do zhes bya bar sgrub par 'gyur na skye ba ma 'ongs pa bya ba byed do zhes bya ba lta ga la yod snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: If it is established that it does not exist, then how could it be said that future arising performs its activity?

original: de yod du chug na yang zhes bya ba ni rdzas su yod du chug na yang skye ba ma 'ongs pa de pa 'ongs pa'i gnas skabs na bya ba byed na go //
analyzed: de yod du chug na yang zhes bya ba ni rdzas su yod du chug na yang skye ba ma 'ongs pa de pa 'ongs pa'i gnas skabs na bya ba byed na go //
translated: Even if it does exist, if that future arising performs its activity in the future state,

original: ji ltar ma 'ongs par 'grub par 'gyur te ma 'ongs pa ni bya ba mi byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'i 'grub pa'i mtha' de dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar ma 'ongs par 'grub par 'gyur te ma 'ongs pa ni bya ba mi byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'i 'grub pa'i mtha' de dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: how could it be established as future? For it is a tenet of the VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas that the future is that which has not yet performed its activity.

original: de lta bas na de ni brjod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na de ni brjod par mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should not be said that it exists.üîΩHow could it be established in the present?üîΩThe activity of arising is the state of the future. The activity of cessation is the state of the past.

original: ji ltar na da ltar 'grub par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni bya ba zhig pa ni 'das pa yin par 'dod la skye ba yang ma 'ongs pa nyid na bya ba zhig pas da lta'i gnas skabs na 'das pa kho nar 'gyur gyi da ltar yin par niüîΩmi 'gyur ro //üîΩde lta bas na da lta'i mtshan nyid kyang brjod par bya dgos te gal te bya ba yongs su rdzogs pa ni da lta yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na da ltar 'grub par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni bya ba zhig pa ni 'das pa yin par 'dod la skye ba yang ma 'ongs pa nyid na bya ba zhig pas da lta'i gnas skabs na 'das pa kho nar 'gyur gyi da ltar yin par ni mi 'gyur ro // de lta bas na da lta'i mtshan nyid kyang brjod par bya dgos te gal te bya ba yongs su rdzogs pa ni da lta yin no zhe na /
translated: If the activity of arising is the state of the future, then the activity of cessation would be the state of the past.üîΩTherefore, the characteristic of the present must be stated.

original: 'das pa yang da lta yin par 'gyur te 'das pa la 'bras bu 'byin pa'i bya ba yod par 'dod de /
analyzed: 'das pa yang da lta yin par 'gyur te 'das pa la 'bras bu 'byin pa'i bya ba yod par 'dod de /
translated: If the activity that is completed is the present, then the past would be the present, because the activity of producing a result is asserted to exist in the past.üîΩIf it is asked, ‚ÄúWhen does it exist?‚Äù

original: 'di gang gi tsheg na gnas par byed pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gnas pa dang rga ba dang 'jig pa'i bya ba dag ni phan tshun 'gal ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di gang gi tsheg na gnas par byed pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gnas pa dang rga ba dang 'jig pa'i bya ba dag ni phan tshun 'gal ba yin te /
translated: The activity of enduring, aging, and disintegrating are mutually exclusive.

original: chos de gnas pa yang yin la 'jig pa yang yin no zhes bya bar rnam par gzhag par rigs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: chos de gnas pa yang yin la 'jig pa yang yin no zhes bya bar rnam par gzhag par rigs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not reasonable to posit that a phenomenon both endures and disintegrates.

original: skad cig ma nyid la gnod par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni dang po ni gnas pas gnas par byed la /
analyzed: skad cig ma nyid la gnod par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni dang po ni gnas pas gnas par byed la /
translated: It would contradict momentariness means that it would contradict the position that all conditioned states are momentary because the first moment would endure through its own power,

original: de'i 'og tu ni rga bas rgas par byed /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu ni rga bas rgas par byed /
translated: then it would age through its own power,

original: de'i 'og tu ni mi rtag pa nyid kyis 'jig par byed pas skad cig ma gsum du gnas pa'i phyir skad cig ma nyid la gnod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu ni mi rtag pa nyid kyis 'jig par byed pas skad cig ma gsum du gnas pa'i phyir skad cig ma nyid la gnod par 'gyur ro //
translated: and then it would disintegrate through its own power.

original: kho bo cag gi skad cig ma ni 'di kho na yin no zhes bya ba ni nus pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i mtshan nyid yin gyi skyes ma thag tu 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: kho bo cag gi skad cig ma ni 'di kho na yin no zhes bya ba ni nus pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i mtshan nyid yin gyi skyes ma thag tu 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Our position is that a moment has just these characteristics means that a moment has the characteristic of the complete development of its capacity, but it does not have the characteristic of disintegration immediately after it arises.

original: de lta na yang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni lhan cig 'byung ba rnams rim gyis byed par mi rung na re zhig gnas pas gnas par byed kyi de'i tshe rga bas kyang rgas par mi byed la mi rtag pa nyid kyis kyang 'jig par miüîΩbyed do zhes bya ba 'di ga las /
analyzed: de lta na yang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni lhan cig 'byung ba rnams rim gyis byed par mi rung na re zhig gnas pas gnas par byed kyi de'i tshe rga bas kyang rgas par mi byed la mi rtag pa nyid kyis kyang 'jig par mi byed do zhes bya ba 'di ga las /
translated: If it is not possible for coemergent states to perform their functions sequentially, then at the time that endurance causes endurance, aging does not cause aging and impermanence does not cause destruction.üîΩWhy would they later become powerless?üîΩWhy would they later become powerless?üîΩWhy would endurance, which is present when the phenomenon endures, destroy that phenomenon together with impermanence?üîΩIt is not possible for it to do so because it is powerless.

original: phyis ci'i phyir stobs dang mi ldan pa nyid du @165b 'gyur zhes bya ba ni phyis gang gis na stobs dang mi ldan pa nyid du gyur na gang gi phyir na gnas pa 'di chos dang lhan cig gang la gnas pa yod pa'i chos de dang lhan cigüîΩmi rtag pa nyid kyis 'joms par byed /

original: bya ba byas pas yang mi nus te skye ba bzhin no zhes bya ba ni ji ltar skye bas bya ba byas zin to //
analyzed: bya ba byas pas yang mi nus te skye ba bzhin no zhes bya ba ni ji ltar skye bas bya ba byas zin to //
translated: It is not possible for it to do so because it is powerless.üîΩIt

original: bskyed par bya ba bskyed nas nus pa thad na yang skyed par mi byed pa de bzhin du gnas pas kyang gnas par mi byed do //
analyzed: bskyed par bya ba bskyed nas nus pa thad na yang skyed par mi byed pa de bzhin du gnas pas kyang gnas par mi byed do //
translated: Just as that which is to be generated is not generated again when the potency is present, so too that which is to be made to endure is not made to endure again by endurance.

original: skye bas bskyed par bya ba da lta nyid du zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir skyed par bya ba da lta nyid du khyer te 'ongs pa ni yang bskyed par mi nus kyi /
analyzed: skye bas bskyed par bya ba da lta nyid du zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir skyed par bya ba da lta nyid du khyer te 'ongs pa ni yang bskyed par mi nus kyi /
translated: Since there would be an infinite regress, that which is to be generated is not able to be brought into the present and generated again.

original: gnas pa ni gnas par bya ba ye gnas par bya bar nus te gnas pa ni 'jig pa'i bgegs byed pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas pa ni gnas par bya ba ye gnas par bya bar nus te gnas pa ni 'jig pa'i bgegs byed pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But endurance is able to make that which is to be made endure endure for a long time, because endurance has the characteristic of obstructing disintegration.üîΩThose two alone are aging and impermanence

original: rga ba dang mi rtag pa nyid de dag kho na yin no zhes bya ba ni rga ba dang mi rtag pa nyid de dag kho na bgegs byed pa yin no //
analyzed: rga ba dang mi rtag pa nyid de dag kho na yin no zhes bya ba ni rga ba dang mi rtag pa nyid de dag kho na bgegs byed pa yin no //
translated: Those two alone are aging and impermanence that obstruct.

original: de na gnas par bya ba ye gnas par bya bar mi nus te rga bas ni gnas pa nyam chung ngur byed la mi rtag pa nyid kyis ni nyam dmas pa 'joms par byed do //
analyzed: de na gnas par bya ba ye gnas par bya bar mi nus te rga bas ni gnas pa nyam chung ngur byed la mi rtag pa nyid kyis ni nyam dmas pa 'joms par byed do //
translated: But it is impossible for it to endure, because aging weakens endurance and impermanence destroys that which is weak.

original: slob dpon gyis smras pa /
analyzed: slob dpon gyis smras pa /
translated: The Master says:

original: gal te rga ba dang mi rtag pa nyid de dag stobs dang ldan pa zhig yin na ni sngon po kho na ste /
analyzed: gal te rga ba dang mi rtag pa nyid de dag stobs dang ldan pa zhig yin na ni sngon po kho na ste /
translated: If aging and impermanence are powerful,

original: gnas par bya ba byed pa'i tshe de dag gis gnas pa de bya ba byed du mi ster ba yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnas par bya ba byed pa'i tshe de dag gis gnas pa de bya ba byed du mi ster ba yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: then when endurance is performing its function, they would not allow endurance to perform its function.üîΩWhen the activity of endurance ceases,üîΩthen aging and impermanence would not endure, nor would the phenomenon itself.

original: gnas pa'i bya ba log na yang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gang gi tshe gnas pa'i bya ba log pa de'i tshe rga ba dang mi rtag pa nyid de dag kyang mi gnas la chos de yang mi gnas te gnas pa'i bya bas de rnamsüîΩgnas par brtags pa yin no //
analyzed: gnas pa'i bya ba log na yang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gang gi tshe gnas pa'i bya ba log pa de'i tshe rga ba dang mi rtag pa nyid de dag kyang mi gnas la chos de yang mi gnas te gnas pa'i bya bas de rnamsüîΩgnas par brtags pa yin no //
translated: When the activity of endurance ceases, then aging and impermanence would not endure, nor would the phenomenon itself endure, because they are imputed to endure due to the activity of endurance.

original: de lta bas na de rnams kyang med na rga ba dang mi rtag pa nyid mi gnas pa dag gis ji ltar ram chos mi gnas pa gang la bya ba byed par nus par 'gyur //
analyzed: de lta bas na de rnams kyang med na rga ba dang mi rtag pa nyid mi gnas pa dag gis ji ltar ram chos mi gnas pa gang la bya ba byed par nus par 'gyur //
translated: Thus, if they do not exist, how could aging and impermanence, which are nonenduring, perform functions in relation to a nonenduring phenomenon?

original: yang na rga ba dang mi rtag pa nyid de dag gis ci zhig bya ste gnas pa'i mthus chos skyes pa tsam des zhig par 'gyur ba yin la de gnas par bya ba zhig pa des yal bar btang ste /
analyzed: yang na rga ba dang mi rtag pa nyid de dag gis ci zhig bya ste gnas pa'i mthus chos skyes pa tsam des zhig par 'gyur ba yin la de gnas par bya ba zhig pa des yal bar btang ste /
translated: Or else, what would aging and impermanence do? The mere birth of a phenomenon is destroyed by the power of endurance. If endurance is destroyed, it is abandoned and does not endure.

original: gnas par mi byed na ni gdon mi za bar mi gnas pas mi gnas pa yin pa 'di nyid 'di'i 'jig pa yin na rga ba dang mi rtag pa nyid dag gis ci @166a * //
analyzed: gnas par mi byed na ni gdon mi za bar mi gnas pas mi gnas pa yin pa 'di nyid 'di'i 'jig pa yin na rga ba dang mi rtag pa nyid dag gis ci @166a * //
translated: If it does not endure, it definitely does not endure. This itself is its destruction. What would aging and impermanence do?

original: zhig bya snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: zhig bya snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: This is the thought.

original: de nyid las de'i rnam pa gzhan nyid du ni rung ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni gal te de nyid yin na ni 'di gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid las de'i rnam pa gzhan nyid du ni rung ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni gal te de nyid yin na ni 'di gzhan ma yin no //
translated: It is not tenable that it is different from itself. If it is itself, it is not different.

original: gzhan yin na ni 'o na de nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yin na ni 'o na de nyid ma yin no //
translated: If it is different, it is not itself.

original: gang dag gzhan nyid yin pa de dag ni gzhan yin par mthong ste /
analyzed: gang dag gzhan nyid yin pa de dag ni gzhan yin par mthong ste /
translated: Those that are different are seen to be different,

original: dper na lha sbyin dang mchod sbyin dag lta bu'o //üîΩgang yang sde pa gzhan na re zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa mang pos bkur ba'i sde pa ste /
analyzed: dper na lha sbyin dang mchod sbyin dag lta bu'o // gang yang sde pa gzhan na re zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa mang pos bkur ba'i sde pa ste /
translated: like Devadatta and Yaj√±adatta.

original: de ni bum pa la sogs pa ni 'jig pa ni thob pa la sogs pas byas pa yin par sems so //
analyzed: de ni bum pa la sogs pa ni 'jig pa ni thob pa la sogs pas byas pa yin par sems so //
translated: Some other schools say that the destruction of a pot, etc. is caused by such things as a hammer.

original: de ltar na gzugs ni dus gzhan gyi bar du gnas pa yin la /
analyzed: de ltar na gzugs ni dus gzhan gyi bar du gnas pa yin la /
translated: Thus form endures for a period of time,

original: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams ni skad cig ma nyid yin no /üîΩ// / bam po bcu drug pa //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams ni skad cig ma nyid yin no / // / bam po bcu drug pa //
translated: but mind and mental factors are momentary.

original: de'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: Therefore we say:

original: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams skad cig ma nyid du khas blangs pas de dag ni mi rtag pa nyid sems dang sems las byung ba'i mi rtag pa nyid 'jig pa'i rgyu la mi ltos pa'i phyir rang gi ngang gis 'jig pa'i phyir gnas pa dang mi
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams skad cig ma nyid du khas blangs pas de dag ni mi rtag pa nyid sems dang sems las byung ba'i mi rtag pa nyid 'jig pa'i rgyu la mi ltos pa'i phyir rang gi ngang gis 'jig pa'i phyir gnas pa dang mi
translated: Since mind and mental factors are accepted as momentary, they are impermanent. Since the impermanence of mind and mental factors does not depend on a cause of destruction, they are destroyed by their intrinsic nature. Therefore they do not remain for a second moment.

original: rtag pa nyid dag cig car bya ba byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtag pa nyid dag cig car bya ba byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: Permanence would be simultaneous activity.

original: de'i phyir sems sam sems las byung ba gcig la cig car du gnas pa dang 'jig pa nyid phan tshun 'gal ba nyid du yang thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir sems sam sems las byung ba gcig la cig car du gnas pa dang 'jig pa nyid phan tshun 'gal ba nyid du yang thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it follows that the abiding and destruction of a single mind or mental factor would be simultaneous, and that is mutually contradictory.
