original: de lta na mdo de legs par drangs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni dge slong dag gsum po 'di dag ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid do zhes 'byung ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de lta na mdo de legs par drangs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni dge slong dag gsum po 'di dag ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid do zhes 'byung ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: Thus, the sutra is properly cited.

original: tshogs pa yod na ni 'byung la med na ni mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang rkyen rnams tshogs pa yod na ni bskyed par bya ba 'byung la med na ni mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshogs pa yod na ni 'byung la med na ni mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang rkyen rnams tshogs pa yod na ni bskyed par bya ba 'byung la med na ni mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because when the assembly exists, it arises, and when it does not exist, it does not arise.

original: skye ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: skye ba ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not arising.

original: ci zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhe na /
translated: What is it?

original: mthu ma yin par blta bar bya zhes bya bar skabs dang sbyar te /
analyzed: mthu ma yin par blta bar bya zhes bya bar skabs dang sbyar te /
translated: It is seen to be nonpotent.

original: rgyu dang rkyen tshogs kyang bskyed par bya ba de res 'ga' yod la res 'ga' med pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen tshogs kyang bskyed par bya ba de res 'ga' yod la res 'ga' med pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But the effect is not sometimes existent and sometimes nonexistent, even though the assemblage of causes and conditions exists.

original: 'di la btsun ba go cha mtha' yas na re dper na mig snang ba la sogs pa med par mig gi rnam par shes pa skyed par mi byed mod kyi /
analyzed: 'di la btsun ba go cha mtha' yas na re dper na mig snang ba la sogs pa med par mig gi rnam par shes pa skyed par mi byed mod kyi /
translated: The Venerable Anantavarma says that, for example, the eye does not produce visual consciousness without the presence of light, etc.

original: de'i phyir de skye ba'i rgyu ma yin pa yang ma yin pa de bzhin du skye ba yang rgyu dang rkyen dag med par chos skyed par mi byed mod kyi de'i phyir de skye ba'i rgyu ma yin pa yang ma yin no zhes zer te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de skye ba'i rgyu ma yin pa yang ma yin pa de bzhin du skye ba yang rgyu dang rkyen dag med par chos skyed par mi byed mod kyi de'i phyir de skye ba'i rgyu ma yin pa yang ma yin no zhes zer te /
translated: But that does not mean that light, etc., are not the causes of its arising. In the same way, arising does not produce a dharma without causes and conditions, but that does not mean that causes and conditions are not the causes of its arising.

original: 'di @166b la smras pa 'di ni mi smra'o //
analyzed: 'di @166b la smras pa 'di ni mi smra'o //
translated: We reply that this is not a good analogy.

original: snang ba la sogs pa yod du zin kyang long ba dang long ba ma yin pa dag gi mig gi rnam par shes pa skye ba dang mi skye ba snang ba'i phyir mig gi nus pa ni mthong gi skye ba ni de lta ma yin no //
analyzed: snang ba la sogs pa yod du zin kyang long ba dang long ba ma yin pa dag gi mig gi rnam par shes pa skye ba dang mi skye ba snang ba'i phyir mig gi nus pa ni mthong gi skye ba ni de lta ma yin no //
translated: Even when light, etc., exist, visual consciousness arises for the sighted but not for the blind. Therefore, we see that the eye has the power to produce visual consciousness, but arising does not.

original: chos kyi rang bzhin phra mo dag ces bya ba ni dper na sems las byung ba reg pa la sogs pa yongs su bcad par dka' ba'i phyir rang bzhin ngo bo nyid phra ba dag yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: chos kyi rang bzhin phra mo dag ces bya ba ni dper na sems las byung ba reg pa la sogs pa yongs su bcad par dka' ba'i phyir rang bzhin ngo bo nyid phra ba dag yin pa bzhin no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe subtle nature of phenomena‚Äù means that, for example, the nature or essence of such things as contact that are mental factors is subtle because they are difficult to discern.üîΩIf arising existed as it truly appears, then one could ascertain it by its activity, even though it is not seen, just as one can ascertain some phenomena by their activity.

original: de lta bu ni yod bden na chos kha cig ni mi snang yang byed pa'i sgo nas nges par 'dzin par 'gyur gyi skye ba ni de ltar byed pa'i sgo nas nges par zin par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bu ni yod bden na chos kha cig ni mi snang yang byed pa'i sgo nas nges par 'dzin par 'gyur gyi skye ba ni de ltar byed pa'i sgo nas nges par zin par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But one cannot ascertain arising in this way.

original: reg pa ni bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis nges par bzung ste /
analyzed: reg pa ni bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis nges par bzung ste /
translated: The Blessed One himself has ascertained contact,

original: gang cung zad tshor ba'i phung po dang / 'du shes kyi phung po dang / 'du byed kyi phung po gang yin pa de thams cad ni reg pa la brten nas zhes bya ba rgyas par gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gang cung zad tshor ba'i phung po dang / 'du shes kyi phung po dang / 'du byed kyi phung po gang yin pa de thams cad ni reg pa la brten nas zhes bya ba rgyas par gsungs pa yin no //
translated: for he has said, ‚ÄúWhatever is the aggregate of feeling, the aggregate of conception, and the aggregate of formation, all that is based on contact.‚Äù

original: skye ba zhig med na skyes zhes bya ba dang zhes bya ba ni gzugs la gzugs kyi blo ni rang gi mtshan nyid la ltos pa yin gyi skye ba'o snyam pa'i skye ba'i blo ni rang gi mtshan nyid la ltos pa ma yin te /
analyzed: skye ba zhig med na skyes zhes bya ba dang zhes bya ba ni gzugs la gzugs kyi blo ni rang gi mtshan nyid la ltos pa yin gyi skye ba'o snyam pa'i skye ba'i blo ni rang gi mtshan nyid la ltos pa ma yin te /
translated: If there were no arising, there would be no statement ‚Äúarising has arisen,‚Äù because the cognition of form in ‚Äúform‚Äù depends on the intrinsic identity of form, but the cognition of arising in ‚Äúarising has arisen‚Äù does not depend on the intrinsic identity of arising.

original: tshor ba la sogs pa la yang yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshor ba la sogs pa la yang yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the cognition of arising also occurs in regard to feeling, etc.

original: de lta bas na skye ba'i blo ni skye ba'i rdzas don gzhan du gyur pa zhig la ltos pa yin par nges par bzung ngo //
analyzed: de lta bas na skye ba'i blo ni skye ba'i rdzas don gzhan du gyur pa zhig la ltos pa yin par nges par bzung ngo //
translated: Therefore, the cognition of arising is definitely ascertained to depend on a substance of arising that is a different object.

original: gzugs kyi skye ba zhes bya ba drug pa'i tshig tu yang mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni drug par ston pa ni gzhi mi mthun par sbyar ba yin gyi /
analyzed: gzugs kyi skye ba zhes bya ba drug pa'i tshig tu yang mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni drug par ston pa ni gzhi mi mthun par sbyar ba yin gyi /
translated: ‚ÄúThe statement ‚Äòthe arising of form‚Äô would not be a genitive tatpuru·π£a compound‚Äù means that the sixth case is used to indicate a different basis,

original: gzhi mthun par sbyar ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhi mthun par sbyar ba ni ma yin no //
translated: not a common basis.

original: de'i phyir dper na gzugs kyi gzugs zhes mi bya ba bzhin no zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir dper na gzugs kyi gzugs zhes mi bya ba bzhin no zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is like the statement ‚Äúthe form of form‚Äù is not used.

original: 'di ni chos mi mthun pa'i dpe yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni chos mi mthun pa'i dpe yin te /
translated: This is an example of a dissimilar case.

original: ji ltar gzugs ni gzugs las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir gzugs kyi gzugs zhes drug pa ston par mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du gzugs kyi skye ba zhes bya bar yang mi 'gyur ba zhig na'o //
analyzed: ji ltar gzugs ni gzugs las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir gzugs kyi gzugs zhes drug pa ston par mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du gzugs kyi skye ba zhes bya bar yang mi 'gyur ba zhig na'o //
translated: Just as the expression ‚Äúthe form of form‚Äù is not used because form is not different from form, so too, the expression ‚Äúthe arising of form‚Äù would not exist.

original: de lta bas na drug pa bstan pa 'di ni skye ba'i rgyu mtshan can yin par shes so //
analyzed: de lta bas na drug pa bstan pa 'di ni skye ba'i rgyu mtshan can yin par shes so //
translated: Therefore, it should be understood that the expression of the sixth case is based on arising.

original: de bzhin du mi rtag pa nyid kyi bar du ci rigs par brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gnas pa zhig med na gnas pa nyid dang gzugs kyi gnas pa zhes bya ba drug pa'i tshig tu yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin du mi rtag pa nyid kyi bar du ci rigs par brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gnas pa zhig med na gnas pa nyid dang gzugs kyi gnas pa zhes bya ba drug pa'i tshig tu yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: The same should be said, respectively, up to non-endurance, because if endurance does not exist, the expression ‚Äúthe endurance of form‚Äù would not be a sixth case expression,

original: dper na gzugs kyi gzugs zhes bya ba bzhin no //üîΩrga ba zhig med na rgas pa nyid dang gzugs kyi @167a * //
analyzed: dper na gzugs kyi gzugs zhes bya ba bzhin no // rga ba zhig med na rgas pa nyid dang gzugs kyi @167a * //
translated: just like the expression ‚Äúthe form of form.‚Äù

original: rga ba zhes bya ba drug pa'i tshig tu yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: rga ba zhes bya ba drug pa'i tshig tu yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: If aging does not exist, the expression ‚Äúthe aging of form‚Äù would not be a sixth case expression,

original: dper na gzugs kyi gzugs zhes bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na gzugs kyi gzugs zhes bya ba bzhin no //
translated: just like the expression ‚Äúthe form of form.‚Äù

original: de bzhin du mi rtag pa nyid cig med na 'jig pa nyid dang gzugs kyi 'jig pa zhes bya ba drug pa'i tshig tu yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin du mi rtag pa nyid cig med na 'jig pa nyid dang gzugs kyi 'jig pa zhes bya ba drug pa'i tshig tu yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: So too, if impermanence did not exist, then destruction would not exist and the phrase ‚Äúthe destruction of form‚Äù would not exist.

original: dper na gzugs kyi gzugs zhes bya ba bzhin no zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: dper na gzugs kyi gzugs zhes bya ba bzhin no zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: For example, it would be like saying ‚Äúthe form of form.‚Äù

original: 'o na ni des na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gal te skyes pa zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'i blo grub par bya ba'i phyir skye ba la sogs par brtag na /
analyzed: 'o na ni des na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gal te skyes pa zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'i blo grub par bya ba'i phyir skye ba la sogs par brtag na /
translated: But if you imagine that arising and so on are imputed to that which has arisen and so on in order to establish the cognition of that which has arisen and so on,

original: bdag med pa nyid cig kyang 'dod par bya dgos te /
analyzed: bdag med pa nyid cig kyang 'dod par bya dgos te /
translated: then you must also assert the existence of selflessness.

original: bdag med pa'i blo rgyu med pa yin par 'os pa ni ma yin no //üîΩ'on te bdag med pa nyid ni btags par yod la /
analyzed: bdag med pa'i blo rgyu med pa yin par 'os pa ni ma yin no // 'on te bdag med pa nyid ni btags par yod la /
translated: It is not tenable that the cognition of selflessness is causeless.üîΩBut if you assert that selflessness exists as an imputationüîΩand that the cognition of selflessness is based on that,

original: bdag med pa'i blo yang de'i rgyu mtshan can yin par 'dod na ni /
analyzed: bdag med pa'i blo yang de'i rgyu mtshan can yin par 'dod na ni /
translated: then it follows that the self would also exist as an imputationüîΩand the cognition of the self would be based on that.

original: skye ba la sogs pa yang btags pa'i yod pa yin la skye ba la sogs pa'i blo yang de'i rgyu mtshan can yin par 'dod par bya dgos so //
analyzed: skye ba la sogs pa yang btags pa'i yod pa yin la skye ba la sogs pa'i blo yang de'i rgyu mtshan can yin par 'dod par bya dgos so //
translated: and arising, etc. are also imputedly existent, and the cognition of arising, etc. must be admitted to have them as its objective cause.

original: 'di la sgrub pa ni skye ba la sogs pa ni btags pa'i yod pa ma yin na ste /
analyzed: 'di la sgrub pa ni skye ba la sogs pa ni btags pa'i yod pa ma yin na ste /
translated: The proof here is: If arising, etc. were not imputedly existent,

original: rjes su yod pa la ltos te gzung bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir bdag med pa nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: rjes su yod pa la ltos te gzung bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir bdag med pa nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: they would be like selflessness, which is not apprehended in dependence on what exists subsequently.

original: gzugs gcig dang / gzugs gnyis dang / chen po dang / chung ngu dang / tha dad pa dang / ldan pa dang / rnam par phye ba dang / gzhan dang / gzhan ma yin pa dang / gzugs yod pa zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du 'di ni rdzas so //
analyzed: gzugs gcig dang / gzugs gnyis dang / chen po dang / chung ngu dang / tha dad pa dang / ldan pa dang / rnam par phye ba dang / gzhan dang / gzhan ma yin pa dang / gzugs yod pa zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du 'di ni rdzas so //
translated: One form, two forms, large, small, separate, conjoined, divided, different, not different, the existence of form, and similarly, this is a substance,

original: 'di ni gzugs so //
analyzed: 'di ni gzugs so //
translated: this is form,

original: 'di ni bum pa'o zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'i blo 'grub par bya ba'i phyir dang / drug par bya ba'i phyir bye brag pas kun brtags pa grangs la sogs pa dang / gzugs kyi ldan pa yang khas blangs dgos so //
analyzed: 'di ni bum pa'o zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'i blo 'grub par bya ba'i phyir dang / drug par bya ba'i phyir bye brag pas kun brtags pa grangs la sogs pa dang / gzugs kyi ldan pa yang khas blangs dgos so //
translated: In order to establish such cognitions as ‚Äúthis is a pot,‚Äù and in order to make sixfold enumeration, the Vai≈õe·π£ikas must accept the universals of number and so on and the inherence of form.

original: yod pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras rdzas nyid dang gzugs nyid dang bum pa nyid la sogs pa bsdu'o //
analyzed: yod pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras rdzas nyid dang gzugs nyid dang bum pa nyid la sogs pa bsdu'o //
translated: The term ‚Äúand so on‚Äù in ‚Äúexistence and so on‚Äù includes the universals of substance, form, pot, and so on.

original: ldan pa smos pa ni dper brjod pa tsam du zad de gzugs kyi tha dad pa dang gzhan nyid dang gzhan ma yin pa nyid ces bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: ldan pa smos pa ni dper brjod pa tsam du zad de gzugs kyi tha dad pa dang gzhan nyid dang gzhan ma yin pa nyid ces bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The term ‚Äúand so on‚Äù in ‚Äúinherence‚Äù is merely an example; it should be applied to such cases as ‚Äúthe difference of form,‚Äù ‚Äúthe otherness of form,‚Äù and ‚Äúthe nondifference of form.‚Äù

original: gzugs kyi rang bzhin zhes bya ba'i drug pa 'di yang ji ltar brtag ces bya ba ni bye brag tu smra ba @167b khyed gzugs las gzugs kyi rang bzhin gzhan yin par mi 'dod pas so //
analyzed: gzugs kyi rang bzhin zhes bya ba'i drug pa 'di yang ji ltar brtag ces bya ba ni bye brag tu smra ba @167b khyed gzugs las gzugs kyi rang bzhin gzhan yin par mi 'dod pas so //
translated: How can you imagine that the sixth case, ‚Äúthe nature of form,‚Äù is like this? You VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas do not assert that the nature of form is different from form.

original: skye ba zhes bya ba ni ma byung ba las byung ba kho na shes par bya ba'i don du skye ba kho na gdags pa mdzad pa yin gyi zhig pa zhes bya ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: skye ba zhes bya ba ni ma byung ba las byung ba kho na shes par bya ba'i don du skye ba kho na gdags pa mdzad pa yin gyi zhig pa zhes bya ba ni ma yin no //
translated: Birth is the mere arising of what did not exist before. It is only birth that is designated for the purpose of understanding. It is not destruction.

original: rnam pa mang du yod pa zhes bya ba ni bye brag mang du yod pa ste /
analyzed: rnam pa mang du yod pa zhes bya ba ni bye brag mang du yod pa ste /
translated: Many kinds means many different kinds.

original: gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because form, feeling, etc. are different.

original: de bye brag tu bya ba'i phyir te gzugs kyi skye ba yin gyi tshor ba la sogs pa'i skye ba ni ma yin no zhes bye brag tu bya ba'i phyir drug par mdzad do //
analyzed: de bye brag tu bya ba'i phyir te gzugs kyi skye ba yin gyi tshor ba la sogs pa'i skye ba ni ma yin no zhes bye brag tu bya ba'i phyir drug par mdzad do //
translated: The sixth case is used in order to specify that. The birth of form is specified, but not the birth of feeling, etc.

original: gzhan du ni shes par mi 'gyur bar bya ba ni gzugs zhes bya ba kho na skye ba'i tshor ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan du ni shes par mi 'gyur bar bya ba ni gzugs zhes bya ba kho na skye ba'i tshor ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni ma yin pa'o //
translated: Otherwise, it would not be understood that it is only form that is born, not feeling, etc.

original: des tsan dan gyi dri la sogs pa dang mchi gu'i lus zhes bya ba bzhin no zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: des tsan dan gyi dri la sogs pa dang mchi gu'i lus zhes bya ba bzhin no zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: For example, the body of a lump of clay, the smell of sandalwood, etc.

original: don gzhan ma yin yang drug par ston par byed do //
analyzed: don gzhan ma yin yang drug par ston par byed do //
translated: although it is not a different object, it is taught as the sixth.

original: sangs rgyas pa'i grub pa'i mtha' ni tsan dan gyi dri la sogs pa 'dus pa tsam yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas pa'i grub pa'i mtha' ni tsan dan gyi dri la sogs pa 'dus pa tsam yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The Buddhist philosophical tenet is that sandalwood scent, etc. are merely a collection.

original: bye brag pa'i grub pa'i mtha' la ltos na dpe tsan dan ma grub pas dpe gzhan mchi gu'i lus zhes bya ba nye bar 'god de /
analyzed: bye brag pa'i grub pa'i mtha' la ltos na dpe tsan dan ma grub pas dpe gzhan mchi gu'i lus zhes bya ba nye bar 'god de /
translated: In relation to the Vai≈õe·π£ika philosophical tenet, since the example sandalwood is not established, another example, the body of a worm, is presented.

original: mchi gu dang lus gnyis ni bye brag pa rnams kyi grub pa'i mthas kyang don gzhan ma yin mod kyi /
analyzed: mchi gu dang lus gnyis ni bye brag pa rnams kyi grub pa'i mthas kyang don gzhan ma yin mod kyi /
translated: Although the worm and the body are not different objects according to the Vai≈õe·π£ika philosophical tenet,

original: drug par ston par yang 'gyur te de ltar ston pa de ni don gzhan du kun brtags pas byas pa yin no //
analyzed: drug par ston par yang 'gyur te de ltar ston pa de ni don gzhan du kun brtags pas byas pa yin no //
translated: it is also taught as the sixth. Teaching it in that way is done by superimposing a different object.

original: de bzhin du gnas pa la sogs pa la yang ci rigs par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni de lta bas na gnas pa zhes bya ba 'di ni rgyun gyis gnas pa shes par bya ba'i don du btags pa tsam kho na mdzad pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du gnas pa la sogs pa la yang ci rigs par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni de lta bas na gnas pa zhes bya ba 'di ni rgyun gyis gnas pa shes par bya ba'i don du btags pa tsam kho na mdzad pa yin no //
translated: In the same way, abiding, etc. should be understood as appropriate. This means that therefore this so-called abiding is merely a designation made for the purpose of knowing the abiding of the continuum.

original: rgyun gyis gnas pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gnas pa de yang rnam pa mang du yod pas de bye brag tu bya ba'i phyir gzugs kyi gnas pa zhes drug par mdzad de /üîΩci nas kyang gzugs zhes bya ba kho na gnas par shes par bya'i gzhan du ni shes par mi 'gyur bar bya ba yin te zhes bya pa dang / rgas pa zhes bya ba 'di ni snga phyi'i khyad par shes par bya ba'i don gdags pa tsam mdzad pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyun gyis gnas pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gnas pa de yang rnam pa mang du yod pas de bye brag tu bya ba'i phyir gzugs kyi gnas pa zhes drug par mdzad de / ci nas kyang gzugs zhes bya ba kho na gnas par shes par bya'i gzhan du ni shes par mi 'gyur bar bya ba yin te zhes bya pa dang / rgas pa zhes bya ba 'di ni snga phyi'i khyad par shes par bya ba'i don gdags pa tsam mdzad pa yin no //
translated: Since the duration that is the characteristic of enduring has many varieties, the sixth case is used in order to specify it, as in the phrase ‚Äúthe duration of form.‚ÄùüîΩThe sixth case is used in order to specify it, as in the phrase ‚Äúthe duration of form,‚Äù so that it is understood that only form endures and not anything else.

original: snga phyi'i khyad par kyi  mtshan nyid kyi rga ba de yang rnam pa mang du yod pas de bye brag tu bya ba'i phyir gzugs kyi rang bzhin zhes drug par mdzad de ci nas kyang gzugs @168a * //üîΩzhes bya ba kho na rga bar shes par bya'i /
analyzed: snga phyi'i khyad par kyi  mtshan nyid kyi rga ba de yang rnam pa mang du yod pas de bye brag tu bya ba'i phyir gzugs kyi rang bzhin zhes drug par mdzad de ci nas kyang gzugs @168a * //üîΩzhes bya ba kho na rga bar shes par bya'i /
translated: The sixth case is used in order to specify it, as in the phrase ‚Äúthe aging of form,‚Äù so that it is understood that only form ages and not anything else.

original: gzhan du ni shes par mi 'gyur bar bya ba yin te zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du zhig pa zhes bya ba 'di ni rgyun ldog pa shes par bya ba'i don du btags pa tsam mdzad pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du ni shes par mi 'gyur bar bya ba yin te zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du zhig pa zhes bya ba 'di ni rgyun ldog pa shes par bya ba'i don du btags pa tsam mdzad pa yin no //
translated: And in the same way, the word ‚Äúdestruction‚Äù is used merely as a designation to indicate the cessation of a continuum.

original: rgyun log pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'jig pa de yang rnam pa mang du yod pas de bye brag tu bya ba'i phyir gzugs kyi 'jig pa zhes drug par mdzad de ci nas kyang gzugs zhes bya ba kho na 'jig par shes par bya'i /
analyzed: rgyun log pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'jig pa de yang rnam pa mang du yod pas de bye brag tu bya ba'i phyir gzugs kyi 'jig pa zhes drug par mdzad de ci nas kyang gzugs zhes bya ba kho na 'jig par shes par bya'i /
translated: And since that destruction which is the cessation of a continuum is of many types, the word ‚Äúof‚Äù is used in order to specify it, so that it be known that it is the destruction of only that which is called ‚Äúform,‚Äù

original: gzhan du ni shes par mi 'gyur bar bya ba yin te zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: gzhan du ni shes par mi 'gyur bar bya ba yin te zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: and it is done in order that it be known that it is the destruction of only that which is called ‚Äúform,‚Äù and not something else.

original: thams cad du yang dper ni tsan dan gyi dri la sogs pa dang / mchi gu'i lus zhes bya ba bzhin no zhes bya ba dpe gnyis kyang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad du yang dper ni tsan dan gyi dri la sogs pa dang / mchi gu'i lus zhes bya ba bzhin no zhes bya ba dpe gnyis kyang brjod par bya'o //
translated: And in every case, the two examples should be stated: ‚ÄúFor example, the fragrance of sandalwood, etc., and the body of a tortoise.‚Äù

original: yang ji ltar chos nyid kyis zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yang ji ltar chos nyid kyis zhes bya ba la /
translated: Moreover, it is said, ‚ÄúHow is it by intrinsic nature?‚Äù

original: chos nyid ni chos kyi rang bzhin te chos kyi ngo bo nyid dang chos kyi ngang tshul can zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: chos nyid ni chos kyi rang bzhin te chos kyi ngo bo nyid dang chos kyi ngang tshul can zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Reality is the nature of things; it is a synonym for the intrinsic reality of things and the intrinsic mode of being of things.

original: chos nyid chos kyi rang bzhin yin no zhes bya ba 'di ga las she na /
analyzed: chos nyid chos kyi rang bzhin yin no zhes bya ba 'di ga las she na /
translated: How do you know that reality is the nature of things?

original: mig ni chos nyid kyis rtag pa dang brtan pa dang ther zug dang mi 'gyur ba'i chos can dang bdag dang bdag gis stong ngo //
analyzed: mig ni chos nyid kyis rtag pa dang brtan pa dang ther zug dang mi 'gyur ba'i chos can dang bdag dang bdag gis stong ngo //
translated: The eye is permanent, stable, and eternal by reality, and it is empty of self and being mine.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ni 'di'i rang bzhin yin no zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'di ni 'di'i rang bzhin yin no zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: This is its nature.

original: ji ltar chos nyid kyi nam mkha' la sogs pa thams cad skye ba dang ldan par mi 'dod pa de ltar thams cad mi skye'o zhes bya ba kho nar 'dod par bya ste /
analyzed: ji ltar chos nyid kyi nam mkha' la sogs pa thams cad skye ba dang ldan par mi 'dod pa de ltar thams cad mi skye'o zhes bya ba kho nar 'dod par bya ste /
translated: Just as you do not accept that all things such as space arise by reality, you should accept that all things do not arise.

original: 'dus byas kho na skye ba dang ldan pa yin gyi 'dus ma byas ni ma yin no zhes bya ba gang yin pa 'di la ni chos nyid ma gtogs pa gtan tshig cung zad kyang med do //üîΩde ltar na skye ba med kyang 'dus byas kho na skye bar 'gyur gyi 'dus ma byas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dus byas kho na skye ba dang ldan pa yin gyi 'dus ma byas ni ma yin no zhes bya ba gang yin pa 'di la ni chos nyid ma gtogs pa gtan tshig cung zad kyang med do // de ltar na skye ba med kyang 'dus byas kho na skye bar 'gyur gyi 'dus ma byas ni ma yin no //
translated: But there is not the slightest reason to prove that only the conditioned is produced and not the unconditioned.üîΩThus, although unconditioned factors are not produced, only the conditioned is produced.

original: yang ji ltar skye ba dang ldan par mtshungs pa las zhes bya ba gang dag ce na /
analyzed: yang ji ltar skye ba dang ldan par mtshungs pa las zhes bya ba gang dag ce na /
translated: But how can one say that the conditioned factors are produced, since they are similar to the unconditioned factors in not being produced?

original: gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The VaibhƒÅ·π£ika: Form, sensation, etc.üîΩThe conditions of the other, i.e., of sensation, etc., are not the same as the conditions of form. The conditions of the production of sensation, etc., are not the same as the conditions of the production of form.

original: de dag las gzhan pa'i rkyen rnams zhes bya ba ni tshor ba la sogs pa skyed pa'i rkyen rnams ni gzugs skye ba'i rkyen de dag las gzhan pa yin te de dag las gzhan pa'i rkyen de rnams kyis ni de dag las gzhan pa bskyed par nus paüîΩma yin no //
analyzed: de dag las gzhan pa'i rkyen rnams zhes bya ba ni tshor ba la sogs pa skyed pa'i rkyen rnams ni gzugs skye ba'i rkyen de dag las gzhan pa yin te de dag las gzhan pa'i rkyen de rnams kyis ni de dag las gzhan pa bskyed par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: The conditions of the production of form cannot produce sensation, etc.

original: tshor ba la sogs pa de dag las gzhan pa ni /
analyzed: tshor ba la sogs pa de dag las gzhan pa ni /
translated: The conditions of the production of sensation, etc., cannot produce form.

original: de @168b dag las gzhan pa'o //
analyzed: de @168b dag las gzhan pa'o //
translated: The conditions of the production of the other are not the same as the conditions of the production of the first.

original: de ci zhe na /
analyzed: de ci zhe na /
translated: What is the other?

original: gzugs te ji ltar de dag las gzhan pa de tshor ba la sogs pa'i rkyen rnams kyis bskyed par nus pa ma yin pa de bzhin du gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa'i rkyen thams cad kyis kyang nam mkha' la sogs pa 'dus ma byas bskyed par miüîΩnus par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzugs te ji ltar de dag las gzhan pa de tshor ba la sogs pa'i rkyen rnams kyis bskyed par nus pa ma yin pa de bzhin du gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa'i rkyen thams cad kyis kyang nam mkha' la sogs pa 'dus ma byas bskyed par mi nus par 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as form is not produced by the conditions of feeling and so on, which are different from it, in the same way, unconditioned states such as space are not produced by all the conditions of form, feeling, and so on.

original: snga ma ni rang gi ngo bo nges pa'i sgo nas bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: snga ma ni rang gi ngo bo nges pa'i sgo nas bshad pa yin no //
translated: The former explanation is from the perspective of the definitiveness of their nature.

original: 'di ni nus pa nges pa'i sgo nas bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni nus pa nges pa'i sgo nas bshad pa yin no //
translated: This explanation is from the perspective of the definitiveness of their potency.üîΩThe refutation continues,

original: sun 'byin par byed pa dag yod ces te zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni dper na ri dags dag yod ces te nas mi rmo ba ma yin gyi rmo ba kho na'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /üîΩdgag pa gnyis kyi don rnams ma go bar 'gyur ba lta bu dang / dper na sbrang bu dag yod ces te /
analyzed: sun 'byin par byed pa dag yod ces te zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni dper na ri dags dag yod ces te nas mi rmo ba ma yin gyi rmo ba kho na'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste / dgag pa gnyis kyi don rnams ma go bar 'gyur ba lta bu dang / dper na sbrang bu dag yod ces te /
translated: For example, it is not that one does not plow the field because there are no deer, but rather because there are deer.üîΩThis is similar to not understanding the meaning of two negations.

original: la du mi bza' ba ma yin no //
analyzed: la du mi bza' ba ma yin no //
translated: For example, it is not that one does not eat honey because there are bees.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: bza' ba kho na yin pa de bzhin du sun 'byin pa dag yod ces te /
analyzed: bza' ba kho na yin pa de bzhin du sun 'byin pa dag yod ces te /
translated: Just as it is with food, so it is with refutations.

original: lung chos mngon pa'i bstan bcos dag dor du ni mi rung ngo //
analyzed: lung chos mngon pa'i bstan bcos dag dor du ni mi rung ngo //
translated: It is not right to abandon the scriptures and the Abhidharma treatises.

original: de lta bas na skyon rnams la yang lan gdab par bya ste /
analyzed: de lta bas na skyon rnams la yang lan gdab par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, we must respond to the objections.

original: pha rol pos rnam par gzhag pa'i skyon rnams la yang lan gdab par bya la grub pa'i mtha'i rjes su 'brang bar yang bya ste /
analyzed: pha rol pos rnam par gzhag pa'i skyon rnams la yang lan gdab par bya la grub pa'i mtha'i rjes su 'brang bar yang bya ste /
translated: We must respond to the objections that the opponent posits, and we must follow the tenets.

original: yongs su mi dor bar bya'o snyam du bsams pa yin no //üîΩming gi tshogs la sogs pa ni //
analyzed: yongs su mi dor bar bya'o snyam du bsams pa yin no // ming gi tshogs la sogs pa ni //
translated: We must not abandon them.üîΩThe collection of names,

original: ming dang ngag dang yi ge'i tshogs //
analyzed: ming dang ngag dang yi ge'i tshogs //
translated: the collection of phrases, and the collection of syllables.

original: zhes bya ba ni ming gi tshogs ni ming gi tshogs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ming gi tshogs ni ming gi tshogs so //
translated: The collection of names is the collection of names.

original: ngag gi tshogs ni tshig gi tshogs so //
analyzed: ngag gi tshogs ni tshig gi tshogs so //
translated: The collection of phrases is the collection of words.

original: yi ge'i tshogs ni yi ge'i tshogs so //
analyzed: yi ge'i tshogs ni yi ge'i tshogs so //
translated: The collection of syllables is the collection of syllables.

original: ming byed pa zhes bya ba 'di ni 'jig rten gyi skad yin no //
analyzed: ming byed pa zhes bya ba 'di ni 'jig rten gyi skad yin no //
translated: The term ‚Äúname-making‚Äù is a worldly expression.

original: ming byed pa dang ming 'dogs pha zhes bya ba ni rnam grangs yin te 'di ltar 'jig rten na smra ba po 'di'i ming lha sbyin zhes bya bar 'dogs so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: ming byed pa dang ming 'dogs pha zhes bya ba ni rnam grangs yin te 'di ltar 'jig rten na smra ba po 'di'i ming lha sbyin zhes bya bar 'dogs so zhes zer ro //
translated: The terms ‚Äúname‚Äù and ‚Äúthat which is named‚Äù are synonyms, because it is said in the world, ‚ÄúThe name of this speaker is Devadatta.‚Äù

original: ming gi byed pa ni ming byed pa ste gang gis na sems las byung ba'i chos 'du shes byed cing skyed pa'o //
analyzed: ming gi byed pa ni ming byed pa ste gang gis na sems las byung ba'i chos 'du shes byed cing skyed pa'o //
translated: The function of name is the activity of name, because it causes the discrimination of mental factors.

original: yang na ming nyid byed pas na ming byed pa ste ming smos pa ni gzhan byed pa bzlog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na ming nyid byed pas na ming byed pa ste ming smos pa ni gzhan byed pa bzlog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Or, name itself is the activity, because the mention of name excludes other activities.

original: byed pa smos pa ni sems las byung ba las khyad par du bya ba'i phyir te gal te ming ni ming ste zhes brjod na ni sems las byung ba yin par yang sems las byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byed pa smos pa ni sems las byung ba las khyad par du bya ba'i phyir te gal te ming ni ming ste zhes brjod na ni sems las byung ba yin par yang sems las byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The mention of activity is for the purpose of distinguishing it from mental factors, because if it is said that name is name, then name would be a mental factor.

original: ming byed pa @169a * //
analyzed: ming byed pa @169a * //
translated: Name is that which is named.

original: ni ming ste gzugs dang sgra dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ni ming ste gzugs dang sgra dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, ‚Äúform, sound,‚Äù etc.

original: ngag ni tshig ste zhes bya ba ni 'dis go bar 'gyur zhing rtogs par gyur pas na tshig go //
analyzed: ngag ni tshig ste zhes bya ba ni 'dis go bar 'gyur zhing rtogs par gyur pas na tshig go //
translated: Speech is the words, because one understands and realizes through this, it is words.

original: de'i phyir ji tsam gyis 'don pa yongs su rdzogs pa ste zhes bya bar smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir ji tsam gyis 'don pa yongs su rdzogs pa ste zhes bya bar smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚Äúup to the point where the recitation is completed.‚Äù

original: kye ma 'du byed rnams mi rtag //
analyzed: kye ma 'du byed rnams mi rtag //
translated: Alas, compounded phenomena are impermanent!

original: ces bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni /
analyzed: ces bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni /
translated: Such as this, and so on. The phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù includes:

original: skye zhing 'jig pa'i chos can yin //
analyzed: skye zhing 'jig pa'i chos can yin //
translated: They have the nature of arising and ceasing.

original: skyes nas 'gag par 'gyur ba ste //
analyzed: skyes nas 'gag par 'gyur ba ste //
translated: Having arisen, they cease.

original: de dag nye bar zhi ba bde //üîΩzhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa bsdu'o //
analyzed: de dag nye bar zhi ba bde // zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa bsdu'o //
translated: Their complete pacification is bliss.

original: tshigs su bcad pa 'di'i don ni 'di skad du /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa 'di'i don ni 'di skad du /
translated: This is the meaning of this verse.

original: kye ma 'du byed rnams mi rtag / ces bya ba ni dam bca' ba yin no //
analyzed: kye ma 'du byed rnams mi rtag / ces bya ba ni dam bca' ba yin no //
translated: The statement ‚ÄúAlas, compounded phenomena are impermanent!‚Äù is the thesis.

original: skye zhing 'jig pa'i chos can yin //
analyzed: skye zhing 'jig pa'i chos can yin //
translated: They have the nature of arising and ceasing.

original: zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs yin te gang gi phyir skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos dang ldan pa de'i phyir rtag pa dag go zhes bya bar yongs su chod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs yin te gang gi phyir skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos dang ldan pa de'i phyir rtag pa dag go zhes bya bar yongs su chod par 'gyur ro //
translated: This is the reason. Because they possess the attributes of origination and cessation, therefore they are impermanent.

original: skyes nas 'gag par 'gyur ba ste //
analyzed: skyes nas 'gag par 'gyur ba ste //
translated: They originate and then cease.

original: zhes bya ba ni dpe ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dpe ste /
translated: This is the example.

original: gang dag skye ba de dag ni 'gag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang dag skye ba de dag ni 'gag par 'gyur te /
translated: Whatever originates ceases.

original: dper na bum pa la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na bum pa la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, a pot, etc.

original: 'dus byas rnams kyang de dang 'dra'o zhes 'chad do //üîΩgzhan dag na re 'di ni de dag //üîΩskye zhing 'jig pa'i chos can yin //
analyzed: 'dus byas rnams kyang de dang 'dra'o zhes 'chad do // gzhan dag na re 'di ni de dag // skye zhing 'jig pa'i chos can yin //
translated: Compounded phenomena are like that.

original: zhes bya ba 'di ji ltar shes she na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di ji ltar shes she na /
translated: Others say: How do you know that this is so?üîΩBecause it is seen that after originating, they cease.

original: 'di ltar skyes nas 'gag par 'gyur ba mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes gtan tshigs ma grub pa sgrub par byed pa yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar skyes nas 'gag par 'gyur ba mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes gtan tshigs ma grub pa sgrub par byed pa yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Thus they prove what is not established as a reason.

original: gzhan dag na re /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re /
translated: Others say:

original: kye ma 'du byed rnams mi rtag //
analyzed: kye ma 'du byed rnams mi rtag //
translated: Alas! Compounded phenomena are impermanent.

original: skye zhing 'jig pa'i chos can yin //
analyzed: skye zhing 'jig pa'i chos can yin //
translated: They have the attribute of origination and cessation.

original: zhes bya ba 'di gnyis ni rnam grangs su brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di gnyis ni rnam grangs su brjod pa yin no //
translated: These two verses are synonyms.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: smras pa / 'di ltar /
analyzed: smras pa / 'di ltar /
translated: It is said:

original: skyes nas 'gag par 'gyur ba ste //
analyzed: skyes nas 'gag par 'gyur ba ste //
translated: Because they arise and cease.

original: zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs smos pa yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs smos pa yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: This is the reason.

original: de dag nye bar zhi ba bde //
analyzed: de dag nye bar zhi ba bde //
translated: The pacification of these is happiness.

original: zhes bya ba ni gang dag mi rtag pa de dag ni sdug bsngal ba yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gang dag mi rtag pa de dag ni sdug bsngal ba yin te /
translated: Whatever is impermanent is suffering.üîΩTherefore,

original: de'i phyir / de dag nye bar zhi ba bde //
analyzed: de'i phyir / de dag nye bar zhi ba bde //
translated: the pacification of these is happiness.

original: zhes gdul ba'i skye bo sbyor bar mdzad pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes gdul ba'i skye bo sbyor bar mdzad pa yin no //
translated: This is how the Buddha engages disciples.üîΩThe difference in the connection of action, quality, and time is understood.

original: gang gis na bya ba dang yon tan dang dus kyi 'brel pa'i khyad par rtogs par 'gyur ba'o zhes bya ba ni dper na 'chad do 'don to 'gro'o zhes bya ba lta bu dang / nag po'i dkar sham @169b po'o dmar po'o zhes bya ba lta bu dang /
analyzed: gang gis na bya ba dang yon tan dang dus kyi 'brel pa'i khyad par rtogs par 'gyur ba'o zhes bya ba ni dper na 'chad do 'don to 'gro'o zhes bya ba lta bu dang / nag po'i dkar sham @169b po'o dmar po'o zhes bya ba lta bu dang /
translated: For example, it is like saying ‚Äúhe explains,‚Äù ‚Äúhe recites,‚Äù ‚Äúhe goes,‚Äù and ‚Äúhe is dark,‚Äù ‚Äúhe is fair,‚Äù ‚Äúhe is red.‚Äù

original: 'tshed ngo 'tshed par 'gyur ro btsos so zhes bya ba lta bur bya ba dang / yon tan dang / dus rnams kyi 'brel ba'i khyad par rtogs par 'gyur ba de ni tshig yin te /üîΩ'di ltar tshig spyi la 'dug pa rnams /
analyzed: 'tshed ngo 'tshed par 'gyur ro btsos so zhes bya ba lta bur bya ba dang / yon tan dang / dus rnams kyi 'brel ba'i khyad par rtogs par 'gyur ba de ni tshig yin te / 'di ltar tshig spyi la 'dug pa rnams /
translated: The meaning of the word is that which is indicated by the word, as in the expressions: The cook, the one who is being cooked, the one who will cook, the one who is being cooked, the one who has cooked.üîΩ The letter is that which is the basis of the word, as in the expressions: The letter a, the letter ƒÅ.üîΩ The syllable is that which is the basis of the letter, as in the expressions: The syllable ka, the syllable kha.

original: khyad par la 'jog pa gang yin pa de ni ngag gi don yin no zhes zer ro //üîΩde ltar na ming ni rang gi mtshan nyid rjod par byed pa yin la /üîΩtshig ni bya ba la sogs pa'i 'brel pa'i khyad par rjod par byed pa yin no zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: khyad par la 'jog pa gang yin pa de ni ngag gi don yin no zhes zer ro // de ltar na ming ni rang gi mtshan nyid rjod par byed pa yin la / tshig ni bya ba la sogs pa'i 'brel pa'i khyad par rjod par byed pa yin no zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: The word is that which is the basis of the syllable, as in the expressions: The word go, the word kutapa.üîΩ The sentence is that which is the basis of the word, as in the expressions: The sentence 'Go, Kutapa! Cook rice for the community and the Teacher,' the sentence 'Go, Kutapa! Cook rice for the community and the Teacher.'

original: yi ge ni yi ge ste zhes bya ba ni yi ge yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yi ge ni yi ge ste zhes bya ba ni yi ge yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The letter is that which is the basis of the syllable, as in the expressions: The letter a, the letter ƒÅ.üîΩ The syllable is that which is the basis of the letter, as in the expressions: The syllable ka, the syllable kha.üîΩ The word is that which is the basis of the syllable, as in the expressions: The word go, the word kutapa.

original: yi ge rnams kyang yig 'bru'i yan lag dag gi ming ma yin nam zhes bya ba ni yig 'bru ni mi la sogs pas glegs bu la sogs pa la bris pa yin no //üîΩde dag gi ming ni yi ge rnams yin te /
analyzed: yi ge rnams kyang yig 'bru'i yan lag dag gi ming ma yin nam zhes bya ba ni yig 'bru ni mi la sogs pas glegs bu la sogs pa la bris pa yin no //üîΩde dag gi ming ni yi ge rnams yin te /
translated: The sentence is that which is the basis of the word, as in the expressions: The sentence 'Go, Kutapa! Cook rice for the community and the Teacher,' the sentence 'Go, Kutapa! Cook rice for the community and the Teacher.'

original: gzugs kyi ming smos na /
analyzed: gzugs kyi ming smos na /
translated: If the name of form is mentioned,

original: gzugs rtogs pa bzhin du yi ge smos na yi ge 'bru rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzugs rtogs pa bzhin du yi ge smos na yi ge 'bru rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: form is understood, just as if the name of a letter is mentioned, the letter is understood.

original: de'i phyir yi ge rnams kyang yig 'bru'i yan lag dag gi ming yin par 'gyur bas mtshan nyid 'chol pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir yi ge rnams kyang yig 'bru'i yan lag dag gi ming yin par 'gyur bas mtshan nyid 'chol pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, since the letters are also the names of the parts of the letters, the definition is confused.

original: des na yi ge ni yi ge ste zhes ming la ma gtogs pa gzhan nyid du 'dod pa gang yin pa ste mi 'thad do //
analyzed: des na yi ge ni yi ge ste zhes ming la ma gtogs pa gzhan nyid du 'dod pa gang yin pa ste mi 'thad do //
translated: Thus, it is not tenable to assert that the letters are something other than the names.

original: yig 'bru'i yan lag rnams go bar bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni 'di ni log par smras pa yin no zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: yig 'bru'i yan lag rnams go bar bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni 'di ni log par smras pa yin no zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: The response, ‚ÄúIn order to understand the parts of the letters,‚Äù is incorrect.

original: yi ge smos na yig 'bru rtogs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba gang yin pa de ni rtogs par bya ba dang rtogs par byed pa'i dngos por sgro btags pa yin pa'i phyir yin gyi de dag gi ming yin pa'i phyir ma yin no //
analyzed: yi ge smos na yig 'bru rtogs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba gang yin pa de ni rtogs par bya ba dang rtogs par byed pa'i dngos por sgro btags pa yin pa'i phyir yin gyi de dag gi ming yin pa'i phyir ma yin no //
translated: The response, ‚ÄúIf the name of a letter is mentioned, the letter is understood,‚Äù is incorrect because it is a superimposition of the relationship of the object to be understood and the means of understanding, but it is not because they are the names of those.

original: mang po'i don gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba de ni tshogs zhes bya ba'i don yin te spyi yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mang po'i don gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba de ni tshogs zhes bya ba'i don yin te spyi yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: That which is the meaning of many is the meaning of collection.

original: de dag kyang ngag gi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mdo sde pa'i tshig yin no //üîΩde ngag ni ngag gi rang bzhin ma yin te zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni bye brag tu smra ba'i tshig go //
analyzed: de dag kyang ngag gi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mdo sde pa'i tshig yin no // de ngag ni ngag gi rang bzhin ma yin te zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni bye brag tu smra ba'i tshig go //
translated: They are also by nature speech.üîΩSpeech is not by nature speech.üîΩThe meaning of words is not understood by mere sound.

original: sgra tsam gyis ni don dag go bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni yi ge'i bdag nyid ma yin pa'i sgras ni don ngag go bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sgra tsam gyis ni don dag go bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni yi ge'i bdag nyid ma yin pa'i sgras ni don ngag go bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The meaning of words is not understood by sound that is not by nature letters.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /üîΩngag gi ming la 'jug pa la ming des ni dag bdag gi ngo bo bzhin du byed pa na don rjod par @170a * //
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na / ngag gi ming la 'jug pa la ming des ni dag bdag gi ngo bo bzhin du byed pa na don rjod par @170a * //
translated: What is it then?üîΩThe meaning of words is understood by means of the name that is engaged by speech.

original: byed do rtogs par byed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: byed do rtogs par byed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: That name expresses the meaning, as if it were the nature of the name itself.

original: mdo sde pas sgra tsam kho na ngag ma yin gyi zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
analyzed: mdo sde pas sgra tsam kho na ngag ma yin gyi zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
translated: The Sautrantikas say: Mere sound is not speech.

original: kho bo cag kyang ngag sgra tsam yin no zhes ni mi brjod kyi yi ge'i bdag nyid kyi sgra la la don dag la mtshams bcad cing tshig gis gzung ba gang yin pa de kho na ngag yin no //
analyzed: kho bo cag kyang ngag sgra tsam yin no zhes ni mi brjod kyi yi ge'i bdag nyid kyi sgra la la don dag la mtshams bcad cing tshig gis gzung ba gang yin pa de kho na ngag yin no //
translated: We do not say that speech is mere sound, but that speech is that sound which is the nature of syllables, and which is delimited with regard to certain objects and is grasped as a word.

original: 'dis ni brda la ltos pa'i sgras ni don go bar byed kyi sgra'o cog gis ni ma yin no zhes bya bar ston par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni brda la ltos pa'i sgras ni don go bar byed kyi sgra'o cog gis ni ma yin no zhes bya bar ston par byed pa yin no //
translated: This shows that the understanding of the meaning depends on the convention, and not on any sound whatsoever.

original: brdar btags pa'i sgras don go bar 'gyur pa'i phyir de ni don go bar byed pa'i sgra tsam kho nas 'grub par 'gyur bas de ni don de rjod par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: brdar btags pa'i sgras don go bar 'gyur pa'i phyir de ni don go bar byed pa'i sgra tsam kho nas 'grub par 'gyur bas de ni don de rjod par byed pa yin no //
translated: Since the meaning is understood through the sound that is designated by convention, it is established by the mere sound that expresses the meaning. Therefore, that is what expresses the meaning.

original: 'di'i don ni ming med pa'i sgra brjod par bya ba'i don can gyis kyang 'grub bo zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
analyzed: 'di'i don ni ming med pa'i sgra brjod par bya ba'i don can gyis kyang 'grub bo zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
translated: The meaning of this is that it is established by the sound that has the object to be expressed, even without a name.

original: gal te skyed par byed na ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni ngag yod na sems dang ldan pa ma yin pa de skyed par byed do zhes bya bar 'dod na /
analyzed: gal te skyed par byed na ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni ngag yod na sems dang ldan pa ma yin pa de skyed par byed do zhes bya bar 'dod na /
translated: If you assert that it generates mind and mental factors when speech exists,

original: des na gal te skyed par byed na ni zhes bya ba'i rtogs pa 'di slong bar byed de /
analyzed: des na gal te skyed par byed na ni zhes bya ba'i rtogs pa 'di slong bar byed de /
translated: then this understanding is raised: if you assert that it generates mind and mental factors when speech exists, then if it generates them,

original: gal te de lta yin na ni khyu mchog la sogs pa la yod pa yang rung sgra tsam thams cad kyis ming bskyed par 'gyur te ngag ni sgra'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gal te de lta yin na ni khyu mchog la sogs pa la yod pa yang rung sgra tsam thams cad kyis ming bskyed par 'gyur te ngag ni sgra'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: then all mere sounds, even those of a bull, would generate names, because speech is the nature of sound.

original: 'on te khyod sgra khyad par can yi ge'i bdag nyid du 'dod pa gang yin pa de kho nas ming skyed par byed do zhes smra na /
analyzed: 'on te khyod sgra khyad par can yi ge'i bdag nyid du 'dod pa gang yin pa de kho nas ming skyed par byed do zhes smra na /
translated: But if you say that only the special sound that you assert to be the nature of syllables generates names,üîΩthen what is the nature of the other sounds?

original: 'on te sgra'i khyad par de lta bu zhig ming skyed par byed pa yin par 'dod na ni de nyid don rjod par byed pa yin par 'gyur gyi sems dang mi ldan pa de ni ma yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on te sgra'i khyad par de lta bu zhig ming skyed par byed pa yin par 'dod na ni de nyid don rjod par byed pa yin par 'gyur gyi sems dang mi ldan pa de ni ma yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: But if you maintain that such a distinctive sound generates the name, then that sound itself would express the meaning, not the mindless one.üîΩBut if you maintain that it makes the meaning manifest, then, in that case, all mere sounds would make the meaning manifest.

original: 'on te gsal bar byed pa yin no zhe na ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gal te sgra skye bas don brjod par bya ba'i phyir sems dang ldan pa ma yin pa de skyed par byed cing des de gsal bar byed do zhes bya bar
analyzed: 'on te gsal bar byed pa yin no zhe na ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gal te sgra skye bas don brjod par bya ba'i phyir sems dang ldan pa ma yin pa de skyed par byed cing des de gsal bar byed do zhes bya bar
translated: If you maintain that the sound that generates the name makes the meaning manifest in order to express the meaning, then, in that case, all mere sounds would make the meaning manifest.

original: 'dod na 'dir sgra tsam thams cad kyis gsal bar byed par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod na 'dir sgra tsam thams cad kyis gsal bar byed par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
translated: The rest is as before.üîΩMoreover, sounds do not have a collection.

original: yang sgra rnams la tshogs pa med la zhes bya ba ni yi ge du ma'i ming gang yin pa de skye bar rtog pa ni sgra du ma la ltos pa yin pas de'i phyir 'di ltar dpyod par byed de //
analyzed: yang sgra rnams la tshogs pa med la zhes bya ba ni yi ge du ma'i ming gang yin pa de skye bar rtog pa ni sgra du ma la ltos pa yin pas de'i phyir 'di ltar dpyod par byed de //
translated: Since the name that consists of many syllables is conceived to be generated, it depends on many sounds. Therefore, it is analyzed in this way.

original: 'di sgra rnams ni brjod nas 'jig pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di sgra rnams ni brjod nas 'jig pa yin no //
translated: The sounds are destroyed after they are uttered.

original: de lta bas na 'di dag la cig car gnas pa med do //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'di dag la cig car gnas pa med do //
translated: Thus, they do not exist simultaneously.üîΩIt is not reasonable that a single real entity can be produced in parts, as is the case with the existence of a pot, etc., which is imputed.

original: rdzas su @170b yod pa'i chos gcig la ji ltar bum pa la sogs pa btags pa'i yod pa la btags pa lta bur cha shas kyis dum bur skye ba yang rigs pa ma yin na skyed par byed pa na ji ltar gang gis ming skyed par byed de
analyzed: rdzas su @170b yod pa'i chos gcig la ji ltar bum pa la sogs pa btags pa'i yod pa la btags pa lta bur cha shas kyis dum bur skye ba yang rigs pa ma yin na skyed par byed pa na ji ltar gang gis ming skyed par byed de
translated: When it is produced, how can it be produced by a name?

original: / tshig gi don ni gang gi tshe skyed par byed pa de'i tshe ji ltar skyed par byed ces bya ba yin no //
analyzed: / tshig gi don ni gang gi tshe skyed par byed pa de'i tshe ji ltar skyed par byed ces bya ba yin no //
translated: The meaning of the sentence is: ‚ÄúWhen it is produced, how is it produced?‚Äù

original: da lta'i ngag gis ming skyed par byed na sgra'i mtshan nyid kyi ngag thams cad cig car du da ltar yin par ni med de /
analyzed: da lta'i ngag gis ming skyed par byed na sgra'i mtshan nyid kyi ngag thams cad cig car du da ltar yin par ni med de /
translated: If the present speech produces the name, then all speech, which is characterized by sound, is not present simultaneously.

original: gzugs zhes bya ba la gang gi tsher zhes bya ba'i sgra da lta yin pa de'i tshe a'u zhes bya ba dang pa zhes bya ba dang aa zhes bya ba dag ma 'ongs pa yin no //
analyzed: gzugs zhes bya ba la gang gi tsher zhes bya ba'i sgra da lta yin pa de'i tshe a'u zhes bya ba dang pa zhes bya ba dang aa zhes bya ba dag ma 'ongs pa yin no //
translated: When the sound ‚Äúr≈´pa‚Äù is present, the sounds ‚Äúau‚Äù and ‚Äúpa‚Äù and ‚Äúa‚Äù are future.

original: gang gi tshe a'u zhes bya ba da ltar yin pa de'i tshe ra zhes bya ba'i sgra ni 'das pa yin la /
analyzed: gang gi tshe a'u zhes bya ba da ltar yin pa de'i tshe ra zhes bya ba'i sgra ni 'das pa yin la /
translated: When the syllable au is present, the syllable ra is past.

original: pa zhes bya ba dang aa zhes bya ba dag ni ma 'ongs pa yin no //
analyzed: pa zhes bya ba dang aa zhes bya ba dag ni ma 'ongs pa yin no //
translated: The syllables pa and a are future.

original: de bzhin du pa zhes bya ba dang ra zhes bya ba dag kyang gang gi tshe rim gyis da ltar yin pa de'i tshe de las gzhan pa dag 'das pa'am /
analyzed: de bzhin du pa zhes bya ba dang ra zhes bya ba dag kyang gang gi tshe rim gyis da ltar yin pa de'i tshe de las gzhan pa dag 'das pa'am /
translated: Similarly, when the syllables pa and ra are present in sequence, the others are past or future.

original: ma 'ongs pa yin na ji ltar ngag des ming skyed par byed /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa yin na ji ltar ngag des ming skyed par byed /
translated: How can that statement generate a name?

original: khyod da ltar gyi ra zhes bya bas ni gzugs kyi ming de'i tshe snga ma skyed par byed do //
analyzed: khyod da ltar gyi ra zhes bya bas ni gzugs kyi ming de'i tshe snga ma skyed par byed do //
translated: You say that the present syllable ra generates the name of form at that time.

original: da ltar gyi a'u zhes bya ba'i sgras kyang cha gnyis pa skyed par byed do //
analyzed: da ltar gyi a'u zhes bya ba'i sgras kyang cha gnyis pa skyed par byed do //
translated: The present syllable au generates the second part.

original: de bzhin du aa zhes bya ba'i sgras kyang de'i cha bzhi pa'i bar skyed par byed do zhes smra na /
analyzed: de bzhin du aa zhes bya ba'i sgras kyang de'i cha bzhi pa'i bar skyed par byed do zhes smra na /
translated: Similarly, the syllable a generates up to the fourth part.

original: chos gcig la cha shas kyi skye ba mi srid pa'i phyir de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: chos gcig la cha shas kyi skye ba mi srid pa'i phyir de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: That is illogical, because the arising of a single phenomenon in parts is impossible.

original: de ni bshad zin to //üîΩre zhig ji ltar na 'das pa la ltos pa'i rnam par rig byed kyi skad cig ma tha mas rnam par rig byed ma yin pa skyed par byed ces bya ba ni so sor thar pa'i sdom pa yang dag par len pa na lus kyi rnam par rig
analyzed: de ni bshad zin to // re zhig ji ltar na 'das pa la ltos pa'i rnam par rig byed kyi skad cig ma tha mas rnam par rig byed ma yin pa skyed par byed ces bya ba ni so sor thar pa'i sdom pa yang dag par len pa na lus kyi rnam par rig
translated: That has already been explained.üîΩFirst, how does the final moment of indicative form that depends on the past generate nonindicative form? When one correctly takes up pratimok·π£a vows, the body and speech indicative forms that are the collection of those do not exist.

original: byed dang ngag gi rnam par rig byed de dag tshogs pa med mod kyi 'on kyang lus dang ngag gi rnam par rig byed kyi skad cig ma 'das pa la ltos pa'i rnam par rig byed kyi skad cig ma thams so sor thar pas bsdus pa'i rnam parüîΩrig byed ma yin pa skyed par byed do //üîΩde bzhin du sgra'i skad cig ma 'das pa la ltos pa'i sgra'i skad cig ma thams cad kyang lus dang ming skyed par byed do zhe'o //
analyzed: byed dang ngag gi rnam par rig byed de dag tshogs pa med mod kyi 'on kyang lus dang ngag gi rnam par rig byed kyi skad cig ma 'das pa la ltos pa'i rnam par rig byed kyi skad cig ma thams so sor thar pas bsdus pa'i rnam par rig byed ma yin pa skyed par byed do // de bzhin du sgra'i skad cig ma 'das pa la ltos pa'i sgra'i skad cig ma thams cad kyang lus dang ming skyed par byed do zhe'o //
translated: However, the final moment of indicative form that depends on the past moments of body and speech indicative form generates nonindicative form subsumed by pratimok·π£a vows.üîΩSimilarly, all moments of sound that depend on past moments of sound generate body and name.

original: de lta na 'o na ni sgra tha ma kho nas zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
analyzed: de lta na 'o na ni sgra tha ma kho nas zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
translated: If that is so, then the final moment of sound alone generates body and name, because the collection of past moments of sound does not exist.

original: sgra tha mas mi skyed pa'i phyir @171a * //
analyzed: sgra tha mas mi skyed pa'i phyir @171a * //
translated: because the last sound does not generate it.

original: gang gis de gcig kho na thos pa ste /
analyzed: gang gis de gcig kho na thos pa ste /
translated: One who hears only one sound

original: gang gis sgra tha ma gcig kho na thos pa des kyang don go bar 'gyur te de'i ming skyes pa'i phyir des kyang gzugs kyi ming gis don 'dzin par 'gyur ba zhig na de ltar go ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gis sgra tha ma gcig kho na thos pa des kyang don go bar 'gyur te de'i ming skyes pa'i phyir des kyang gzugs kyi ming gis don 'dzin par 'gyur ba zhig na de ltar go ba ni ma yin no //
translated: One who hears only the last sound would also understand the meaning, because the name would have been produced. He would also apprehend the meaning by the name of form, but that is not how understanding occurs.

original: de lta bas na 'di ni rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'di ni rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore this is not logical.üîΩIf one imagines that, etc.,

original: 'on te 'di snyam du rtog par byed na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni ngag kyang yi ge'i skad cig mar snang ba yin la yi ge yang der snang ba yin pas /
analyzed: 'on te 'di snyam du rtog par byed na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni ngag kyang yi ge'i skad cig mar snang ba yin la yi ge yang der snang ba yin pas /
translated: Speech appears as the moment of a syllable, and the syllable appears as that.üîΩThus, speech generates the syllable, and the syllable generates the name.

original: ngag gis ni yi ge skyed par byed la yi ges ni ming skyed par byed do zhes bya ba phyogs gzhan nye bar 'god par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: ngag gis ni yi ge skyed par byed la yi ges ni ming skyed par byed do zhes bya ba phyogs gzhan nye bar 'god par byed pa yin no //
translated: This is the other position that is being set forth.

original: 'di la yang skyon de nyid yod de yi ge rnams la tshogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di la yang skyon de nyid yod de yi ge rnams la tshogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But the same error exists in this case, because syllables do not exist as a collection.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: yang yi ge rnams ni tshogs pa med la chos gcig la cha shas kyis skye ba yang rigs pa ma yin na skyed par byed pa na ji ltar yi ges ming skyed par byed /
analyzed: yang yi ge rnams ni tshogs pa med la chos gcig la cha shas kyis skye ba yang rigs pa ma yin na skyed par byed pa na ji ltar yi ges ming skyed par byed /
translated: Also, since letters do not exist as a collection and it is illogical that a single phenomenon arises in parts, how do letters generate a name when they generate it?

original: re zhig ji ltar na 'das pa la ltos pa'i rnam par rig byed kyi skad cig ma tha mas rnam par rig byed ma yin pa skyed par byed /
analyzed: re zhig ji ltar na 'das pa la ltos pa'i rnam par rig byed kyi skad cig ma tha mas rnam par rig byed ma yin pa skyed par byed /
translated: First, how does the final moment of indicative form that relies on the past generate nonindicative form?

original: de lta na 'o na ni yi ge tha ma kho nas ming skyed par byed pa'i phyir gang gis yi ge skyed par byed pa'i sgra tha ma de gcig kho na thos pa'am gang gis yi ge de gcig kho na thos pa des kyang go bar 'gyur ro
analyzed: de lta na 'o na ni yi ge tha ma kho nas ming skyed par byed pa'i phyir gang gis yi ge skyed par byed pa'i sgra tha ma de gcig kho na thos pa'am gang gis yi ge de gcig kho na thos pa des kyang go bar 'gyur ro
translated: If that were so, then since the final letter alone generates the name, one who hears the final sound that generates the letter alone would understand the name.

original: // ngag ming gsal bar byed pa yin na skyon de nyid yod do zhes bya ba ni sgra rnams ni tshogs pa med la chos gcig la cha shas kyis gsal bar yang rigs pa ma yin na gsal bar byed pa na ji ltar ngag gis ming gsal bar byed
analyzed: // ngag ming gsal bar byed pa yin na skyon de nyid yod do zhes bya ba ni sgra rnams ni tshogs pa med la chos gcig la cha shas kyis gsal bar yang rigs pa ma yin na gsal bar byed pa na ji ltar ngag gis ming gsal bar byed
translated: The error is this: sounds do not exist in an aggregate, and it is not reasonable that one entity manifests in part. How then does speech manifest the name?

original: / re zhig ji ltar na 'das pa la ltos pa'i rnam par rig byed kyi skad cig ma tha mas rnam par rig byed ma yin pa skyed par byed /üîΩde ltar na 'o na ni sgra tha ma kho nas ming gsal bar byed pa'i phyir gang gis de gcig kho na thos pa des kyang don go bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: / re zhig ji ltar na 'das pa la ltos pa'i rnam par rig byed kyi skad cig ma tha mas rnam par rig byed ma yin pa skyed par byed / de ltar na 'o na ni sgra tha ma kho nas ming gsal bar byed pa'i phyir gang gis de gcig kho na thos pa des kyang don go bar 'gyur ro //
translated: First, how does the last moment of informative form that relies on the past give rise to noninformative form?üîΩIf that is so, then only the last sound manifests the name, and therefore even one who hears only that sound would understand the meaning.

original: 'on te 'di snyam du ngag gis na yi ge gsal bar byed la yi ges ni ming gsal bar byed do snyam du rtog par byed na de la yang skyon de nyid yod de yi ge rnams tshogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'on te 'di snyam du ngag gis na yi ge gsal bar byed la yi ges ni ming gsal bar byed do snyam du rtog par byed na de la yang skyon de nyid yod de yi ge rnams tshogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If you imagine that speech manifests syllables and syllables manifest the name, then the same error arises, because syllables do not exist in an aggregate.

original: 'o na gang gi ltar na ming ni sgra tsam yin zhing ming yi ge du ma yang yin la /
analyzed: 'o na gang gi ltar na ming ni sgra tsam yin zhing ming yi ge du ma yang yin la /
translated: What do you ask?üîΩName is mere sound and name is also many syllables.üîΩ

original: yi ge rnams tshogs pa yang med pa de'i ltar ji ltar ming gi don rjod par byed ce na /
analyzed: yi ge rnams tshogs pa yang med pa de'i ltar ji ltar ming gi don rjod par byed ce na /
translated: But if, according to some, a name is merely sound and a name is not a collection of many letters, and the collection of letters does not exist, how can a name signify an object?

original: don ni @171b yi ge thams cad dran pa'i rjes la go ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don ni @171b yi ge thams cad dran pa'i rjes la go ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the object is understood after the memory of all the letters.

original: de nyid kyi phyir med na med pa'i phyir kha cig gis ni yi ge dang po thos pa'i tshe nyid na yi ge lhag ma rnams dran pa'i stobs kyis don go bar 'gyur ba kho na'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir med na med pa'i phyir kha cig gis ni yi ge dang po thos pa'i tshe nyid na yi ge lhag ma rnams dran pa'i stobs kyis don go bar 'gyur ba kho na'o //
translated: For this very reason, because it does not exist when the letters do not exist, some understand the object by the power of memory of the remaining letters at the very time of hearing the first letter.

original: ngag ni yi ge skyed par byed pa yin par yang mi rung la gsal bar byed pa yin par yang mi rung ngo zhes bya ba ni gong du ni yi ge sgras bskyed par bya ba dang / sgras gsal bar bya ba yin pa ltar khas blangs nas nyes par brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: ngag ni yi ge skyed par byed pa yin par yang mi rung la gsal bar byed pa yin par yang mi rung ngo zhes bya ba ni gong du ni yi ge sgras bskyed par bya ba dang / sgras gsal bar bya ba yin pa ltar khas blangs nas nyes par brjod pa yin no //
translated: Speech is not suitable as the producer of letters, nor is it suitable as the revealer of letters. This is because above, it was said that the fault is incurred if one accepts that letters are produced by sound and revealed by sound.

original: da ni sgra la ma gtogs pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir de la bskyed par bya ba dang gsal bar bya ba nyid kyang med do zhes de nyid du drungs nas 'byin par byed pa yin gyi sgra rnams ni tshogs pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i skyon brjodüîΩpar bya ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: da ni sgra la ma gtogs pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir de la bskyed par bya ba dang gsal bar bya ba nyid kyang med do zhes de nyid du drungs nas 'byin par byed pa yin gyi sgra rnams ni tshogs pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i skyon brjod par bya ba ni ma yin te /
translated: The fault that is to be stated is not that ‚Äúsounds do not exist as a collection,‚Äù

original: sgra du ma la ltos nas yi ge go ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sgra du ma la ltos nas yi ge go ba ni ma yin no //
translated: because the understanding of a syllable does not depend on many sounds.

original: 'on kyang ngag ni yi ge'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir sgra tsam thams cad kyis kyang yi ge skyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang ngag ni yi ge'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir sgra tsam thams cad kyis kyang yi ge skyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: However, since speech is the intrinsic nature of syllables, all mere sounds would produce syllables.

original: 'on te sgra'i khyad par de lta bu zhig yi ge skyed par byed pa 'am gsal bar byed pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te sgra'i khyad par de lta bu zhig yi ge skyed par byed pa 'am gsal bar byed pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But if a particular sound produces or manifests a syllable,

original: de nyid kyis yi ge'i don byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyis yi ge'i don byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: then that sound alone would perform the function of a syllable.

original: 'on te ming don dang lhan cig skyes pa yin te skye ba la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya bar 'dod na ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni ming don dang lhan cig skye bar brtags na ming ni ngag gis bskyed par bya ba'am /
analyzed: 'on te ming don dang lhan cig skyes pa yin te skye ba la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya bar 'dod na ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni ming don dang lhan cig skye bar brtags na ming ni ngag gis bskyed par bya ba'am /
translated: then the fault that the name is generated or manifested by speech would not be entailed.

original: gsal bar bya ba zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'i nyes par thal bar mi 'gyur ro snyam du bsams nas phyogs gzhan 'di rnam par rtog par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: gsal bar bya ba zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'i nyes par thal bar mi 'gyur ro snyam du bsams nas phyogs gzhan 'di rnam par rtog par byed pa yin no //
translated: Thinking that, one imagines this other position.üîΩJust as arising and so on are asserted to arise simultaneously with the object, the name would not be past or future when the object is present.

original: ji ltar skye ba la sogs pa mtshan nyid rnams don dang lhan cig skye ba kho nar 'dod pas don 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i da ltar ngag yin par mi 'gyur ba ltar gal te ming yang de dang 'dra bar 'dod na ni don 'das pa dang
analyzed: ji ltar skye ba la sogs pa mtshan nyid rnams don dang lhan cig skye ba kho nar 'dod pas don 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i da ltar ngag yin par mi 'gyur ba ltar gal te ming yang de dang 'dra bar 'dod na ni don 'das pa dang
translated: If you assert that the name is like that, then the name would not be past or future when the object is present.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i ming da ltar yin par mi 'gyur te des na don 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa tha snyad gdags par mi nus so //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i ming da ltar yin par mi 'gyur te des na don 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa tha snyad gdags par mi nus so //
translated: The name of the future would not be the name of the present. Thus, one cannot designate the object of the past and the object of the future.

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i ming gis don brjod par ni 'os pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i ming gis don brjod par ni 'os pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not proper to express the object of the past and the future by means of the name of the present.

original: dper na 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i ngag gis ming skyed pa 'am gsal bar byed par 'os pa ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i ngag gis ming skyed pa 'am gsal bar byed par 'os pa ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is not proper for the speech of the past and the future to generate or manifest the name.

original: ming mang po zhig yod pa nyid yin na lhan cig skyes pa'i ming yongs su chod par yang mi 'gyur ro //üîΩ'dus @172a * //
analyzed: ming mang po zhig yod pa nyid yin na lhan cig skyes pa'i ming yongs su chod par yang mi 'gyur ro // 'dus @172a * //
translated: If there were many names, the name that arises simultaneously would not be ascertained.

original: ma byas rnams mi skye ba dang ldan pa'i phyir ming lhan cig skye bar mi 'gyur bas 'di ni ming 'dod pa nyid do //
analyzed: ma byas rnams mi skye ba dang ldan pa'i phyir ming lhan cig skye bar mi 'gyur bas 'di ni ming 'dod pa nyid do //
translated: The unconditioned do not arise, and therefore the name does not arise simultaneously with them. This is the assertion of the name.

original: 'di ni 'dod par mi bya ba kho na'o snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni 'dod par mi bya ba kho na'o snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: This is thought to be unacceptable.

original: tshigs bcad mid la brten pa ste //
analyzed: tshigs bcad mid la brten pa ste //
translated: It is based on the verse.

original: zhes bya ba ni tshigs su bcad pa ni ngag yin la de ni ming la brten pa yin te ming dag byung na de yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni tshigs su bcad pa ni ngag yin la de ni ming la brten pa yin te ming dag byung na de yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: A verse is speech, and that is based on names, because when names occur, it exists.

original: de lta bas na ming rnams dang tshig yod do zhes smra ba'i skabs yod pas /
analyzed: de lta bas na ming rnams dang tshig yod do zhes smra ba'i skabs yod pas /
translated: Therefore, there is an occasion to say that names and phrases exist.

original: der yang don rnams la mtshams bcad pa'i sgra ni ming yin la zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
analyzed: der yang don rnams la mtshams bcad pa'i sgra ni ming yin la zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
translated: In that case, the sound that delineates meaning is a name, etc.

original: don la mtshams bcad pa'i sgra'i ngo bo nyid kyi ming rnams bkod pa'i khyad par yang tshigs su bcad pa yin te /
analyzed: don la mtshams bcad pa'i sgra'i ngo bo nyid kyi ming rnams bkod pa'i khyad par yang tshigs su bcad pa yin te /
translated: A verse is a particular arrangement of names that have the nature of sounds that delineate meaning.

original: bsdebs pa'i khyad par can zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bsdebs pa'i khyad par can zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúhaving a particular arrangement‚Äù is like a garland.

original: phreng ba lta bu zhes bya ba ni dper na grog ma la sogs pa sbrengs pa'i khyad par gyi phreng ba de las rdzas gzhan 'byung ba ma yin pa de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: phreng ba lta bu zhes bya ba ni dper na grog ma la sogs pa sbrengs pa'i khyad par gyi phreng ba de las rdzas gzhan 'byung ba ma yin pa de dang 'dra'o //
translated: Like a garland means that, for example, a garland is not a different substance from the particular arrangement of ants, etc.

original: phreng ba ni grog ma la sogs pa dus gcig na yod pa rnams sbrengs pa'i khyad par la bya la bkod pa'i khyad par ni sgra rim gyis 'byung ba rnams yin te /
analyzed: phreng ba ni grog ma la sogs pa dus gcig na yod pa rnams sbrengs pa'i khyad par la bya la bkod pa'i khyad par ni sgra rim gyis 'byung ba rnams yin te /
translated: A rosary is a special arrangement of ants, etc., that exist at the same time, and the special arrangement of sounds is their sequential occurrence.

original: des na mi mtshungs so zhes smra ba'i skabs la brtags nas /
analyzed: des na mi mtshungs so zhes smra ba'i skabs la brtags nas /
translated: Thus, they are not similar.

original: dpe gnyis pa sems kyi rim pa bzhin no zhes bya ba nye bar bkod de ji ltar sems rim gyis 'byung ba dag las rim pa gzhan yod pa ma yin pa de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: dpe gnyis pa sems kyi rim pa bzhin no zhes bya ba nye bar bkod de ji ltar sems rim gyis 'byung ba dag las rim pa gzhan yod pa ma yin pa de dang 'dra'o //
translated: Having examined the context of this statement, the second example, ‚Äúlike the sequence of mind,‚Äù is presented. Just as there is no other sequence in the sequential occurrence of minds, so it is with the sequential occurrence of sounds.

original: rtog pa don med pa yin no zhes bya ba ni ming dang tshig don gzhan du rtog pa dgos pa med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rtog pa don med pa yin no zhes bya ba ni ming dang tshig don gzhan du rtog pa dgos pa med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The statement ‚Äúconceptualization is pointless‚Äù means that conceptualizing names and phrases as having a different meaning is pointless.

original: chos thams cad rtog ge'i spyod yul ma yin pas zhes bya ba ni kha cig kho na rtog ge'i spyod yul yin gyi thams cad ni ma yin te /
analyzed: chos thams cad rtog ge'i spyod yul ma yin pas zhes bya ba ni kha cig kho na rtog ge'i spyod yul yin gyi thams cad ni ma yin te /
translated: The statement ‚Äúbecause all phenomena are not the domain of conceptualization‚Äù means that only some are the domain of conceptualization, not all.

original: gang dag de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul du gtogs pa kho na yin pa de dag rtog ge'i spyod yul ma yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: gang dag de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul du gtogs pa kho na yin pa de dag rtog ge'i spyod yul ma yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: The meaning is that they are the domain of the wisdom of the TathƒÅgatas alone, and not the domain of reasoning.

original: sems dang mi ldan pa'i khyad par brjod par 'dod nas /
analyzed: sems dang mi ldan pa'i khyad par brjod par 'dod nas /
translated: With the intention of expressing the distinction of being associated with mind, he says:

original: yang ci ming gi tshogs pa la sogs pa 'di dag ldan pa 'am zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
analyzed: yang ci ming gi tshogs pa la sogs pa 'di dag ldan pa 'am zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
translated: Are these collections of names, etc. associated or not?

original: ci gang dang ldan pa ni khams gang dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: ci gang dang ldan pa ni khams gang dang ldan pa'o //
translated: What is associated is associated with what realm?

original: sems can du ston pa dang // sems can du ston pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni ci zhes bya ba yin no //üîΩ'dod dang gzugs gtogs sems can ston //
analyzed: sems can du ston pa dang // sems can du ston pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni ci zhes bya ba yin no // 'dod dang gzugs gtogs sems can ston //
translated: Are they only sentient beings or non-sentient beings?üîΩThey are sentient beings belonging to the desire and form realms.

original: rgyu mthun lung bstan min zhes bya ba ni 'dod @172b pa dang gzugs su gtogs pa kho na'o //
analyzed: rgyu mthun lung bstan min zhes bya ba ni 'dod @172b pa dang gzugs su gtogs pa kho na'o //
translated: They are only sentient beings belonging to the desire and form realms.

original: sems can du ston pa kho na'o //
analyzed: sems can du ston pa kho na'o //
translated: They are only sentient beings.

original: rgyu mthun pa kho na'o zhes bya bar gzung ba yin no //
