analyzed: rgyu mthun pa kho na'o zhes bya bar gzung ba yin no //
translated: They are only natural outflow.

original: de dag ni brjod par bya ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni gzugs med par gtogs pa'i ming gi tshogs la sogs pa de dag ni brjod par bya ba ma yin pa yin te /

original: de na tshig med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de na tshig med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Those collections of names, etc., that belong to the formless realm are not expressible because speech does not exist there.

original: bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re gang gi tshe de dag mi brjod na de dag yod do zhes bya bar yang ji ltar shes /
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re gang gi tshe de dag mi brjod na de dag yod do zhes bya bar yang ji ltar shes /
translated: The VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas ask, if they are not expressed, how do you know they exist?

original: de lta bas na 'dod pa dang gzugs su gtogs pa kho na yin gyi gzugs med par gtogs pa ni ma yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'dod pa dang gzugs su gtogs pa kho na yin gyi gzugs med par gtogs pa ni ma yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Therefore they belong to the desire and form realms, but not to the formless realm.

original: sems can du ston pa kho na yin te sems can gyi rtsol ba las byung ba'i yi ge la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can du ston pa kho na yin te sems can gyi rtsol ba las byung ba'i yi ge la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are only revealed to sentient beings because they are the nature of letters, etc., that arise from the effort of sentient beings.

original: gang zhig rjod par byed pa de de dag dang ldan zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig tu the tshom za bar gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhig rjod par byed pa de de dag dang ldan zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig tu the tshom za bar gyur zhe na /
translated: What is the doubt that arises when it is said that one who expresses them possesses them?

original: 'di'i ming ni 'di'o zhes tha snyad 'dogs pa'i phyir brjod par bya ba dang ldan par 'gyur ro snyam mo //
analyzed: 'di'i ming ni 'di'o zhes tha snyad 'dogs pa'i phyir brjod par bya ba dang ldan par 'gyur ro snyam mo //
translated: It is the object of expression because it is designated by the name of this or that.üîΩFor example, the eye sense faculty is only the agent of seeing, not the object of seeing, a sentient being.

original: dper na mig gi dbang po dang ni lta bar byed pa kho na dang ldan gyi blta bar bya ba'i sems can dang ni ma yin pa de bzhin du brjod par byed pa kho na dang ldan gyi brjod par bya ba dang ni ma yin no //üîΩskal ba mnyam pa'i rgyus bskyed pa'i phyir rgyu mthun pa las byung ba kho na yin gyi 'dod dgu na 'byung ba'i phyir rnam par smin pa las skyes pa yang ma yin la gzugs can ma yin pa rnams la bsags pa med pa'i phyir rgyas pa las byung
analyzed: dper na mig gi dbang po dang ni lta bar byed pa kho na dang ldan gyi blta bar bya ba'i sems can dang ni ma yin pa de bzhin du brjod par byed pa kho na dang ldan gyi brjod par bya ba dang ni ma yin no // skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyus bskyed pa'i phyir rgyu mthun pa las byung ba kho na yin gyi 'dod dgu na 'byung ba'i phyir rnam par smin pa las skyes pa yang ma yin la gzugs can ma yin pa rnams la bsags pa med pa'i phyir rgyas pa las byung

original: ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: ba yang ma yin no //

It is not derived from the cause of maturation, because it is not generated by the cause of maturation. original: srog ni tshe yin zhes 'byung ba'i phyir bshad zin te /
analyzed: srog ni tshe yin zhes 'byung ba'i phyir bshad zin te /
translated: Because it says, ‚ÄúLife force is lifespan,‚Äù it has already been explained.

original: tshe ni khams gsum pa yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩsems can du ston pa nyid kyang mdo las /
analyzed: tshe ni khams gsum pa yin pa'i phyir ro // sems can du ston pa nyid kyang mdo las /
translated: Because lifespan belongs to the three realms.üîΩThe faculty of life force is indicative of sentient beings.

original: srog ni rnam smin zhes 'byung ba'i phyir bshad zin te /
analyzed: srog ni rnam smin zhes 'byung ba'i phyir bshad zin te /
translated: Because it says in a sutra, ‚ÄúLife force is karmic maturation,‚Äù it has already been explained.

original: rnam smin lung du ma bstan chos //
analyzed: rnam smin lung du ma bstan chos //
translated: Karmic maturation is an unobscured neutral phenomenon.

original: sems can zhes bya lung bstan byung //
analyzed: sems can zhes bya lung bstan byung //
translated: The Buddha has declared that the sentient beings are the sentient beings.

original: zhes 'byung ba'i phyir rnam par smin pa ni sems can du ston pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ba'i phyir rnam par smin pa ni sems can du ston pa kho na yin no //
translated: Thus, the sentient beings are only the sentient beings.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'di'i ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa nyid kyang bshad zin pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'di'i ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa nyid kyang bshad zin pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it has been explained that the sentient beings are only the non-obscuring indeterminate.

original: slob dpon gyis ni brjod par bya ba bshad zin pa go dka' ba gang yin pa de ji ltar thob pa rnams kyi sems can du ston pa nyid bshad zin ce na /
analyzed: slob dpon gyis ni brjod par bya ba bshad zin pa go dka' ba gang yin pa de ji ltar thob pa rnams kyi sems can du ston pa nyid bshad zin ce na /
translated: The master has already explained the difficult to understand subject matter. How is it that the sentient beings are only the sentient beings?

original: ldan pa zhes bshad zin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pas rnams par phye ba yin no //
analyzed: ldan pa zhes bshad zin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pas rnams par phye ba yin no //
translated: The sentient beings are only the sentient beings because they are associated with the aggregates, etc.

original: rgyu rnams ni gang rkyen rnams ni gang zhes bya ba rgyu rnams dang rkyen rnams la khyad par ci zhig yod ce na /
analyzed: rgyu rnams ni gang rkyen rnams ni gang zhes bya ba rgyu rnams dang rkyen rnams la khyad par ci zhig yod ce na /
translated: What is the difference between the causes and the conditions?

original: smras pa / cung zad kyang med de /
analyzed: smras pa / cung zad kyang med de /
translated: There is no difference at all.

original: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis rgyu gnyis dang rkyen gnyis ni yang dag pa'i lta ba skyed par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis rgyu gnyis dang rkyen gnyis ni yang dag pa'i lta ba skyed par byed pa yin no //
translated: The Blessed One has said that the two causes and the two conditions generate the correct view.

original: gnyis gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnyis gang zhe na /
translated: What are the two?

original: gzhan gyi sgra dang nang gi tshul bzhin yid la byed pa'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gzhan gyi sgra dang nang gi tshul bzhin yid la byed pa'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: They are the words of another and proper mental attention.

original: rgyu dang rkyen dang gzhi dang byed rgyu dang rgyu mtshan dang rtags rgyu dang 'bras gnas zhes bya ba ni rnam grangs dag yin no //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen dang gzhi dang byed rgyu dang rgyu mtshan dang rtags rgyu dang 'bras gnas zhes bya ba ni rnam grangs dag yin no //
translated: Cause, condition, basis, active cause, reason, sign, cause, and effect-state are synonyms.

original: 'bras gnas zhes bya ba'i sgra ni /üîΩres 'ga' ni shu bu la yod la /
analyzed: 'bras gnas zhes bya ba'i sgra ni / res 'ga' ni shu bu la yod la /
translated: The term effect-state isüîΩsometimes used for a result,

original: res 'ga' ni sogs pa nyid la yang yod de /
analyzed: res 'ga' ni sogs pa nyid la yang yod de /
translated: and sometimes for a collection.

original: dper na nyi ma la sogs pa'i lha zhes bya ba dang / shu bu'i sbyor ba ni 'bras gnas kyi sbyor ba yin no @174b zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na nyi ma la sogs pa'i lha zhes bya ba dang / shu bu'i sbyor ba ni 'bras gnas kyi sbyor ba yin no @174b zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like the expression ‚Äúgod of the sun,‚Äù and the expression ‚Äúthe application of the effect-state‚Äù is the application of a collection.

original: gal te so sor khyad par med na ci'i phyir rgyu rnams dang rkyen rnams so sor bstan zhe na /
analyzed: gal te so sor khyad par med na ci'i phyir rgyu rnams dang rkyen rnams so sor bstan zhe na /
translated: If there is no difference between them, why are causes and conditions taught separately?

original: rgyu yang don gyi khyad par gzhan du bstan la rkyen yang gzhan du bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: rgyu yang don gyi khyad par gzhan du bstan la rkyen yang gzhan du bstan pa yin te /
translated: Causes are taught in one way and conditions are taught in another way.

original: rgyu bstan pa la ni bgegs mi byed pa'i ngo bo dang / lhan cig 'byung ba nyid dang 'dra ba nyid la sogs pa'i don gyi khyad par du bshad pa yin la /
analyzed: rgyu bstan pa la ni bgegs mi byed pa'i ngo bo dang / lhan cig 'byung ba nyid dang 'dra ba nyid la sogs pa'i don gyi khyad par du bshad pa yin la /
translated: The meaning of the term cause is explained as the nature of not obstructing and coemergence, similarity and so on.

original: rkyen bstan pa la ni mtshungs pa de ma thag pa nyid la sogs pa don gyi khyad par gzhan du bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: rkyen bstan pa la ni mtshungs pa de ma thag pa nyid la sogs pa don gyi khyad par gzhan du bshad pa yin no //
translated: The meaning of the term condition is explained as the other specific meanings of immediately preceding and so on.

original: yang chos mngon pa thams cad ni mdo'i don dang / mdo gtan la 'bebs pa dang / mdo rnam par 'chad pa yin na rgyu drug po mdog las bshad ce na /
analyzed: yang chos mngon pa thams cad ni mdo'i don dang / mdo gtan la 'bebs pa dang / mdo rnam par 'chad pa yin na rgyu drug po mdog las bshad ce na /
translated: Again, if all Abhidharma is the meaning of the sutras, the ascertainment of the sutras and the explanation of the sutras, why are the six causes taught in the sutras?

original: bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re mdo de ni nub ste /
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re mdo de ni nub ste /
translated: Vaibhasikas say: That sutra has disappeared.

original: 'di ltar gcig las 'phros pa'i lung chos rgya'i bar du bstan par gyur pa las da lta bcu'i bar ston par snang ngo zhes brjod do //
analyzed: 'di ltar gcig las 'phros pa'i lung chos rgya'i bar du bstan par gyur pa las da lta bcu'i bar ston par snang ngo zhes brjod do //
translated: Thus, the sutra was taught up to the Dharma of the one hundred thousand. It appears that the teaching of the Dharma has lasted for ten thousand years.

original: 'on kyang so sor nges pa'i rgyu ston par byed pa'i mdo dag dmigs pas de dag dper brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang so sor nges pa'i rgyu ston par byed pa'i mdo dag dmigs pas de dag dper brjod par bya ste /
translated: However, since sutras that teach the causes of the specific results are observed, they should be cited as examples.

original: mig dang gzugs rnams la brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa skye'o zhes bya ba ni byed rgyu'i rgyu yin te 'di'i ni skye ba la bgegs mi byed pa'i ngo bor gzhag go //
analyzed: mig dang gzugs rnams la brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa skye'o zhes bya ba ni byed rgyu'i rgyu yin te 'di'i ni skye ba la bgegs mi byed pa'i ngo bor gzhag go //
translated: The statement, ‚Äúeye consciousness arises in dependence on the eye and forms,‚Äù is a causal condition because it is posited as the state of non-obstruction to the arising of that consciousness.

original: lam gyi yan lag gsum po 'di dag ni yang dag pa'i lta ba'i rjes su 'brang ba yin te /
analyzed: lam gyi yan lag gsum po 'di dag ni yang dag pa'i lta ba'i rjes su 'brang ba yin te /
translated: These three branches of the path are the following of right view.

original: lhan cig skye ba'i tshor ba dang 'du shes dang sems pa'o zhes bya ba ni lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin te 'di ni phan tshun rjes su 'brang ba dang bya ba gcig pa'i don gyi rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: lhan cig skye ba'i tshor ba dang 'du shes dang sems pa'o zhes bya ba ni lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin te 'di ni phan tshun rjes su 'brang ba dang bya ba gcig pa'i don gyi rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The statement, ‚Äúfeeling, conception, and intention arise simultaneously with it‚Äù is a co-existent cause because it is posited as the meaning of mutual following and the same activity.üîΩThe statement, ‚ÄúThis person possesses virtuous and non-virtuous entities‚Äù is a homogeneous cause because it is posited as the meaning of the arising of similar entities.

original: skyes bu gang zag 'di ni chos dge ba rnams dang yang ldan la mi dge ba rnams dang yang ldan zhes bya ba nas 'di la dge ba'i rtsa ba kun du ma chad pa gang las 'di'i dge ba'i rtsa ba las dge ba'i rtsa ba gzhan skye bar
analyzed: skyes bu gang zag 'di ni chos dge ba rnams dang yang ldan la mi dge ba rnams dang yang ldan zhes bya ba nas 'di la dge ba'i rtsa ba kun du ma chad pa gang las 'di'i dge ba'i rtsa ba las dge ba'i rtsa ba gzhan skye bar
translated: The statement, ‚ÄúThe roots of virtue that have not been eradicated in this person from which other roots of virtue arise‚Äù is a cause of similar outcome because it is posited as the meaning of the arising of similar entities.

original: 'gyur ba chung ngu dang lhan cig gyur pa yod na /
analyzed: 'gyur ba chung ngu dang lhan cig gyur pa yod na /
translated: If there is a transformation together with a small change,üîΩthen later this person will be one who has pure qualities.

original: de lta na skyes bu gang zag 'di phyis rnam par dag pa'i chos can du 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ba ni skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: de lta na skyes bu gang zag 'di phyis rnam par dag pa'i chos can du 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ba ni skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin te /
translated: This is the homogeneous cause.

original: 'dir ni 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba'i chos rnams kyi 'bras bu 'dra ba 'grub pa'i don gyis rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: 'dir ni 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba'i chos rnams kyi 'bras bu 'dra ba 'grub pa'i don gyis rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Here it is established by the meaning of producing a similar result of past and present phenomena.

original: rtogs nas shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa 'di ni mthong ba'i gzhi can gyi dang po'o //
analyzed: rtogs nas shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa 'di ni mthong ba'i gzhi can gyi dang po'o //
translated: This is the first of those based on seeing, which is concomitant with knowledge that has realized.

original: gang rnam par shes pa de @175a * //
analyzed: gang rnam par shes pa de @175a * //
translated: That which is consciousness

original: ni rab tu shes so zhes bya ba ni mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: ni rab tu shes so zhes bya ba ni mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu yin te /
translated: is well known. This is the concomitant cause.

original: 'di ni dmigs pa gcig dang bya ba gcig pa'i don gyis rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: 'di ni dmigs pa gcig dang bya ba gcig pa'i don gyis rnam par gzhag go //
translated: This is established by the meaning of one object and one action.

original: skyes bu gang zag log par lta ba can gyi lus kyi las gang yin pa dang / de'i lta ba can gyi ngag gi las gang yin pa dang / sems pa gang yin pa dang / smon pa gang yin pa de dag dang rjes su mthun pa'i 'du byed gang yin pa'i chos de dag thams cad kyang mi 'dod par 'gyur ba dang mi sdug par 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: skyes bu gang zag log par lta ba can gyi lus kyi las gang yin pa dang / de'i lta ba can gyi ngag gi las gang yin pa dang / sems pa gang yin pa dang / smon pa gang yin pa de dag dang rjes su mthun pa'i 'du byed gang yin pa'i chos de dag thams cad kyang mi 'dod par 'gyur ba dang mi sdug par 'gyur ba dang /
translated: Whatever physical action there is of a person who has a wrong view, whatever verbal action there is of one who has that view, whatever intention there is, whatever aspiration there is, and whatever volition there is that is in accordance with that, all those dharmas are made undesirable, unattractive,

original: mi dga' ba nyid du 'gyur ba dang / yid du mi 'ong ba nyid du 'gyur bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: mi dga' ba nyid du 'gyur ba dang / yid du mi 'ong ba nyid du 'gyur bar byed pa yin no //
translated: unappealing, and disagreeable.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di'i lta ba 'di lta ste log par lta ba ni sdig pa can yin no zhes 'byung ba ni kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: 'di'i lta ba 'di lta ste log par lta ba ni sdig pa can yin no zhes 'byung ba ni kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu yin te /
translated: Because it is said, ‚ÄúThis view, namely wrong view, is sinful.‚Äù This is the all-pervading cause,

original: 'di ni skal ba mnyam pa dang skal ba mi mnyam pa'i nyon mongs pa can gyi chos kyi rgyun skyed par byed pa'i don gyis rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: 'di ni skal ba mnyam pa dang skal ba mi mnyam pa'i nyon mongs pa can gyi chos kyi rgyun skyed par byed pa'i don gyis rnam par gzhag go //
translated: because it is established as the meaning of generating the continuum of defiled dharmas of the same and different kinds.

original: 'di ni las mi dge ba dang dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa dang bsgoms pa las byung ba'i rnam par smin pa der skyes pa rnams kyis so sor yang dag par myong bar 'gyur ro //üîΩched du bsams pa'i las byas shing bsags pa'i rnam par smin pa zhes 'byung ba ni rnam par smin pa'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni las mi dge ba dang dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa dang bsgoms pa las byung ba'i rnam par smin pa der skyes pa rnams kyis so sor yang dag par myong bar 'gyur ro // ched du bsams pa'i las byas shing bsags pa'i rnam par smin pa zhes 'byung ba ni rnam par smin pa'i rgyu yin te /
translated: This is the karmic maturation of nonvirtuous karma and of virtuous karma contaminated by the three realms, and it is experienced by those born there.üîΩKarma that is intended and accumulated is the cause of karmic maturation.

original: 'di ni 'bras bu mi 'dra ba 'phen par byed pa nyid kyis rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: 'di ni 'bras bu mi 'dra ba 'phen par byed pa nyid kyis rnam par gzhag go //
translated: It is posited as the cause of karmic maturation because it projects a dissimilar result.

original: de'i phyir rgyu drug po 'di dag ni mdo kho na las grags pa yin pas bye brag tu smra ba rnams /üîΩrgyu ni rnam pa drug tu 'dod //
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu drug po 'di dag ni mdo kho na las grags pa yin pas bye brag tu smra ba rnams / rgyu ni rnam pa drug tu 'dod //
translated: Therefore these six causes are renowned in the sutras.üîΩThe Vaibhasikas think that the Abhidharmako≈õa passage,üîΩThe cause is asserted to be sixfold,

original: ces bya bar bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: ces bya bar bsams pa yin no //
translated: refers to the six causes.

original: rang las gzhan pa byed pa'i rgyu //
analyzed: rang las gzhan pa byed pa'i rgyu //
translated: The active cause is different from the object.

original: zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid las gzhan pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid las gzhan pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: The term different from the object means different from itself.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid la byed pa 'gal ba'i phyir rang gi bdag nyid ni rgyu ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid la byed pa 'gal ba'i phyir rang gi bdag nyid ni rgyu ma yin no //
translated: The cause is not its own nature because it is contradictory for an action to act on itself.

original: 'dus byas kyi chos thams cad ni byed pa'i rgyu yin zhes bya ba ni byed pa nyid rgyu yin pas na byed pa'i rgyu ste rgyu gang zhig khyad par gyi ming gis ma brjod la rgyu'i ngo bo spyi bzung nas brjod pa de ni byed pa'i rgyu yin
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi chos thams cad ni byed pa'i rgyu yin zhes bya ba ni byed pa nyid rgyu yin pas na byed pa'i rgyu ste rgyu gang zhig khyad par gyi ming gis ma brjod la rgyu'i ngo bo spyi bzung nas brjod pa de ni byed pa'i rgyu yin
translated: All conditioned phenomena are active causes.üîΩAn active cause is a cause that is not specified by a particular name, but is referred to in general terms as a cause.

original: no // gang zhig khyad par gyi ming dag gis bshad pa'i rgyu gzhan dag tu ni khyad par du ma byas la rgyu ni yin pa de nyid de'i khyad par yin te /
analyzed: no // gang zhig khyad par gyi ming dag gis bshad pa'i rgyu gzhan dag tu ni khyad par du ma byas la rgyu ni yin pa de nyid de'i khyad par yin te /
translated: That which is not specified as a particular cause, but is a cause, is a specific cause.

original: dper na gzugs kyi skye mched du bshad pa lta bu yin no //üîΩ@175b skye ba la bgegs mi byed pa'i ngo bor gnas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir skye ba dang ldan pa rnams skye ba la rang las gzhan pa'i chos rnams bgegs mi byed pa'i ngo bor gnas pa de'i phyir byed pa'i rgyu zhes bya
analyzed: dper na gzugs kyi skye mched du bshad pa lta bu yin no // @175b skye ba la bgegs mi byed pa'i ngo bor gnas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir skye ba dang ldan pa rnams skye ba la rang las gzhan pa'i chos rnams bgegs mi byed pa'i ngo bor gnas pa de'i phyir byed pa'i rgyu zhes bya
translated: For example, it is like the explanation of the sense sphere of visible form.üîΩBecause it exists in the nature of not obstructing the arising of that which is to arise.

original: ba yin no //
analyzed: ba yin no //
translated: Because those that possess arising exist in the nature of not obstructing the arising of that which is to arise, other than themselves, they are active causes.

original: zag pa gang dag mi shes pa de la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gal te shes na zag pa skyes pa de dag skye bar mi 'gyur ba zhig na zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: zag pa gang dag mi shes pa de la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gal te shes na zag pa skyes pa de dag skye bar mi 'gyur ba zhig na zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: If one knew those contaminants that arise, they would not arise.

original: mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam ma skyes pa'i gang zag mi shes pa la ni mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam gyis gzhom par bya ba'i zag pa 'dod chags la sogs pa gang dag yin pa de dag skyes la /
analyzed: mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam ma skyes pa'i gang zag mi shes pa la ni mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam gyis gzhom par bya ba'i zag pa 'dod chags la sogs pa gang dag yin pa de dag skyes la /
translated: For a person who has not generated the paths of seeing and meditation, those contaminants such as attachment that are to be abandoned by the paths of seeing and meditation arise in relation to ignorance.

original: mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam skyes pa'i gang zag shes pa la ni de dag gis gzhom par bya ba 'dod chags la sogs pa mi skye'o //
analyzed: mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam skyes pa'i gang zag shes pa la ni de dag gis gzhom par bya ba 'dod chags la sogs pa mi skye'o //
translated: For a person who has generated the paths of seeing and meditation, those such as attachment that are to be abandoned by those paths do not arise in relation to knowledge.

original: des na cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: des na cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is the point of this?

original: smras pa / de dag skye ba la yang mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam gyis bsdus pa'i shes pa bgegs byed do //
analyzed: smras pa / de dag skye ba la yang mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam gyis bsdus pa'i shes pa bgegs byed do //
translated: It is said: Even though they arise, the knowledge subsumed by the paths of seeing and meditation obstructs them.

original: skar ma rnams mthong ba la yang nyi ma'i 'od mthong ba skye ba la bgegs byed do zhes bya bar skabs dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: skar ma rnams mthong ba la yang nyi ma'i 'od mthong ba skye ba la bgegs byed do zhes bya bar skabs dang sbyar ro //
translated: The context is this: the light of the sun is an obstruction to the arising of the seeing of stars.

original: de lta yin na ji ltar rang gi ngo bo la gtogs pa chos thams cad 'dus byas kyi byed pa'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: de lta yin na ji ltar rang gi ngo bo la gtogs pa chos thams cad 'dus byas kyi byed pa'i rgyu yin te /
translated: If that is so, then how is it that all dharmas included in one‚Äôs own nature are the active causes of the conditioned?

original: 'di ltar zag pa skye ba la yang shes pa byed pa'i rgyu la yin la skar ma mthong ba skye ba la yang nyi ma'i 'od byed pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar zag pa skye ba la yang shes pa byed pa'i rgyu la yin la skar ma mthong ba skye ba la yang nyi ma'i 'od byed pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: Thus, the knowledge of the arising of defilement is the active cause, and the light of the sun is the active cause of the arising of the seeing of stars.

original: 'di skad du zag pa skye ba la yang rang gi ngo bo dang shes pa ma gtogs pa chos thams cad 'dus byas kyi byed pa'i rgyu yin la /
analyzed: 'di skad du zag pa skye ba la yang rang gi ngo bo dang shes pa ma gtogs pa chos thams cad 'dus byas kyi byed pa'i rgyu yin la /
translated: In this way, it must be said that all dharmas, except for one‚Äôs own nature and knowledge, are the active causes of the conditioned.

original: skar ma mthong ba skye ba la yang rang gi ngo bo dang nyi ma'i 'od ma gtogs pa chos thams cad byed pa'i rgyu yin no zhes brjod dgos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skar ma mthong ba skye ba la yang rang gi ngo bo dang nyi ma'i 'od ma gtogs pa chos thams cad byed pa'i rgyu yin no zhes brjod dgos par 'gyur ro //
translated: And all dharmas, except for one‚Äôs own nature and the light of the sun, are the active causes of the arising of the seeing of stars.

original: skye ba la bgegs mi byed pa'i ngo bor gnas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rkyen rnams tshogs na mjug thogs su 'byung ba'i chos la skye ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: skye ba la bgegs mi byed pa'i ngo bor gnas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rkyen rnams tshogs na mjug thogs su 'byung ba'i chos la skye ba zhes bya ste /
translated: When conditions assemble, the phenomenon that occurs in the next moment is called arising.

original: skye ba de skye ba la chos thams cad bgegs mi byed pa'i ngo bor gnas pa kho na yin gyi thams cad kyi ni ma yin no zhes bya bar khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: skye ba de skye ba la chos thams cad bgegs mi byed pa'i ngo bor gnas pa kho na yin gyi thams cad kyi ni ma yin no zhes bya bar khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: Arising exists in the nature of not obstructing arising for all phenomena, but not for all.

original: shes pa yod na ni zag pa de dag skye bar yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: shes pa yod na ni zag pa de dag skye bar yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: When consciousness exists, those contaminants do not arise,

original: thob pa la sogs pa med pas rkyen tshogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thob pa la sogs pa med pas rkyen tshogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the assembly of conditions does not exist, since obtainment and so on do not exist.

original: skar ma mthong ba yang rkyen tshogs pa med pa kho @176a * //
analyzed: skar ma mthong ba yang rkyen tshogs pa med pa kho @176a * //
translated: The seeing of stars also does not arise due to the nonexistence of the assembly of conditions.

original: nas mi skye ba yin no zhes bya bar sbyor ro //
analyzed: nas mi skye ba yin no zhes bya bar sbyor ro //
translated: This is how the passage should be applied.

original: de'i phyir rang gi ngo bo ma gtogs pa chos thams cad ni 'dus byas kyi byed pa'i rgyu yin no zhes bya ba ni so na 'dug pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rang gi ngo bo ma gtogs pa chos thams cad ni 'dus byas kyi byed pa'i rgyu yin no zhes bya ba ni so na 'dug pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the statement all phenomena are active causes of conditioned states, with the exception of their own nature, remains as it is.

original: dper na spyod par byed pa mi 'tshe ba'i dbang du byas nas zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni mi rnams grong gi bdag po mi 'tshe ba la bsams nas bdag cag ni rje bos bde bar byas so zhes smra ba lta bu yin no //
analyzed: dper na spyod par byed pa mi 'tshe ba'i dbang du byas nas zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni mi rnams grong gi bdag po mi 'tshe ba la bsams nas bdag cag ni rje bos bde bar byas so zhes smra ba lta bu yin no //
translated: For example, it is like the statement, ‚ÄúFrom the perspective of non-violence, the one who acts is the lord,‚Äù which means that people think, ‚ÄúWe are happy because of the lord.‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir de dag de skad ces zer bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de dag de skad ces zer bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Why do they say that?

original: 'di ltar de ni 'tshe bar byed nus pa las 'tshe bar mi byed pas /
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni 'tshe bar byed nus pa las 'tshe bar mi byed pas /
translated: Because the one who is able to harm does not harm.

original: dper na chos thams cad skye ba la mya ngan las 'das pa dang mi skye ba'i chos can rnams zhes bya ba ci zhe na /
analyzed: dper na chos thams cad skye ba la mya ngan las 'das pa dang mi skye ba'i chos can rnams zhes bya ba ci zhe na /
translated: For example, it is like the statement, ‚ÄúAll phenomena arise from nirvana and phenomena that do not arise,‚Äù which means that all phenomena arise from the cause of nirvana.

original: ji ltar na rgyu'i dngos po yin zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: ji ltar na rgyu'i dngos po yin zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: What is the meaning of ‚Äúdo not arise‚Äù?

original: dmyal ba la sogs pa dag lta bu zhes bya ba ni dmyal ba dang dud 'gro'i skye gnas la sogs pa gzugs med pa'i phung po skye ba la ji ltar rgyu'i dngos po yin /
analyzed: dmyal ba la sogs pa dag lta bu zhes bya ba ni dmyal ba dang dud 'gro'i skye gnas la sogs pa gzugs med pa'i phung po skye ba la ji ltar rgyu'i dngos po yin /
translated: It is like the statement, ‚ÄúThe formless aggregates arise from hell and so on,‚Äù which means that the formless aggregates arise from the cause of hell and the animal realm and so on.

original: dmyal ba la sogs pa smos pa ni res 'ga' lung 'bogs pa la sogs pas rgyur 'gyur ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: dmyal ba la sogs pa smos pa ni res 'ga' lung 'bogs pa la sogs pas rgyur 'gyur ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: The mention of hell beings and so on is meant to include those who sometimes serve as the cause of scriptural transmission and so on.üîΩEven if they do not exist

original: de dag med du zin kyang zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa la sogs pa de dag med du zin kyang /
analyzed: de dag med du zin kyang zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa la sogs pa de dag med du zin kyang /
translated: means that even if nirvana and so on do not exist,

original: ji ltar yod cing med pa ma yin pa de kho na bzhin du bgegs byed mi nus par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar yod cing med pa ma yin pa de kho na bzhin du bgegs byed mi nus par 'gyur ro //
translated: they cannot prevent the existence of the self, just as they cannot prevent the nonexistence of the self.

original: de'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa la sogs pa 'di dag yod dam med kyang rung /
analyzed: de'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa la sogs pa 'di dag yod dam med kyang rung /
translated: Therefore, whether nirvana and so on exist or do not exist,üîΩthere is no difference in their inability to prevent the existence of the self.

original: bgegs mi byed pa nyid la khyad par med pa nyid de dag med par mtshungs so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bgegs mi byed pa nyid la khyad par med pa nyid de dag med par mtshungs so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: They are the same in not existing.üîΩJust as one says, ‚ÄúThe villagers are happy because of the bandit,‚ÄùüîΩeven though the bandit is unable to make them happy,

original: spyod par byed par mi nus pa bzhin du zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni spyod par byed pa 'tshe bar byed mi nus bzhin du yang grong mi rnams bdag cag ni rdze bos bde ba byas so zhes de skad nga smra bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: spyod par byed par mi nus pa bzhin du zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni spyod par byed pa 'tshe bar byed mi nus bzhin du yang grong mi rnams bdag cag ni rdze bos bde ba byas so zhes de skad nga smra bar 'gyur te /
translated: one says this because the villagers are happy due to the absence of the bandit.

original: 'dir dpe ni gong du bshad pa gang yin pa de nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'dir dpe ni gong du bshad pa gang yin pa de nyid yin no //
translated: The example here is the same as the one explained above.

original: de'i phyir dpe 'di kho nas mya ngan las 'das pa la sogs pa bgegs byed par mi nus pa rnams kyang bgegs mi byed pa'i ngo bor gnas pa'i phyir byed pa'i rgyu'i dngos por grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir dpe 'di kho nas mya ngan las 'das pa la sogs pa bgegs byed par mi nus pa rnams kyang bgegs mi byed pa'i ngo bor gnas pa'i phyir byed pa'i rgyu'i dngos por grub pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, by this very example, it is established that even those who are unable to obstruct nirvana, etc. are established as the cause of action because they remain in the nature of not obstructing.

original: yang med par mtshungs pa las ci'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa la sogs pa ni byed pa'i rgyu nyid yin par @176b 'dod la med pa ri bong gi rva la sogs pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang med par mtshungs pa las ci'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa la sogs pa ni byed pa'i rgyu nyid yin par @176b 'dod la med pa ri bong gi rva la sogs pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: Again, why is it that among things that are equally nonexistent, only nirvana, etc. are accepted as the cause of action and not nonexistent rabbit horns, etc.?

original: med pa'i dpe med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: med pa'i dpe med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because there is no example of nonexistence.

original: spyod par byed pa med pa'i dbang du byas nas grong mi rnams bdag cag ni rje bos bde bar byas so zhes smras pa'am /
analyzed: spyod par byed pa med pa'i dbang du byas nas grong mi rnams bdag cag ni rje bos bde bar byas so zhes smras pa'am /
translated: In the absence of an agent, people say, ‚ÄúWe are made happy by the lord,‚Äù or ‚ÄúWe are made happy by rabbit horns.‚Äù

original: bdag cag ni ri bong gi rvas bde bar byas so zhes smra bar 'gyur ba ni med pas 'di ni klan kar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: bdag cag ni ri bong gi rvas bde bar byas so zhes smra bar 'gyur ba ni med pas 'di ni klan kar mi rung ngo //
translated: But this is not the case, so this is not a proper objection.

original: 'di ni spyir bstan pa yin zhes bya ba ni byed rgyu'i gtso bo gang yin pa dang gtso bo ma yin pa thams cad kyi dbang du byas nas /üîΩrang las gzhan pa byed rgyu'i rgyu //
analyzed: 'di ni spyir bstan pa yin zhes bya ba ni byed rgyu'i gtso bo gang yin pa dang gtso bo ma yin pa thams cad kyi dbang du byas nas / rang las gzhan pa byed rgyu'i rgyu //
translated: It is explained from the perspective of all primary and nonprimary active causes.

original: zhes bshad pa yin gyi gtso bo skyed par byed pa'i byed rgyu'i rgyu gang yin pa de ni shin tu yang bgegs mi byed pa'i ngo bor gnas pa yin gyi cig shos 'ba' zhig yin pa ma yin no //üîΩlus las zas zhes bya ba ni bskyed par bya ba la nus zhes bya bar skabs dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: zhes bshad pa yin gyi gtso bo skyed par byed pa'i byed rgyu'i rgyu gang yin pa de ni shin tu yang bgegs mi byed pa'i ngo bor gnas pa yin gyi cig shos 'ba' zhig yin pa ma yin no // lus las zas zhes bya ba ni bskyed par bya ba la nus zhes bya bar skabs dang sbyar ro //
translated: The active cause that generates the primary cause is also a cause that does not obstruct, but it is not only that.üîΩFood for the body is the context for the statement, ‚Äúthat which has the power to generate.‚Äù

original: zas kun 'byung pas lus kun du 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ba'i phyir te ro la sogs pa 'gyur ba dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zas kun 'byung pas lus kun du 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ba'i phyir te ro la sogs pa 'gyur ba dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the body arises from the arising of food, because food is the source of the body.

original: myu gu la sogs pa la sa bon la sogs pa bzhin zhes bya ba ni sa bon dang myu gu dang 'dab ma dang sdong bu la sogs pa ni myu gu dang 'dab ma dang sdong bu dang yal ga la sogs pa bskyed par bya ba la nusüîΩpa kho na'o //
analyzed: myu gu la sogs pa la sa bon la sogs pa bzhin zhes bya ba ni sa bon dang myu gu dang 'dab ma dang sdong bu la sogs pa ni myu gu dang 'dab ma dang sdong bu dang yal ga la sogs pa bskyed par bya ba la nus pa kho na'o //
translated: A seed, sprout, leaf, stem, etc. are only capable of producing a sprout, leaf, stem, branch, etc.üîΩOne might argue as follows:

original: gang zhig 'di skad du rgol bar byed pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni byed rgyu'i yod na 'bras bu 'byung bar 'gyur ro snyam du bsams nas /
analyzed: gang zhig 'di skad du rgol bar byed pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni byed rgyu'i yod na 'bras bu 'byung bar 'gyur ro snyam du bsams nas /
translated: Thinking that an effect arises when a cause exists,üîΩwhy don‚Äôt all things arise simultaneously?

original: ci'i phyir thams cad cig car skye bar mi 'gyur ji ltar srog gcod par byed pa srog gcod pa la brten pa de bzhin du thams cad kyang de la brten par ci'i phyir mi 'gyur zhes rgol bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: ci'i phyir thams cad cig car skye bar mi 'gyur ji ltar srog gcod par byed pa srog gcod pa la brten pa de bzhin du thams cad kyang de la brten par ci'i phyir mi 'gyur zhes rgol bar byed pa yin no //
translated: And why is it that just as one who kills is dependent on killing, all things are not dependent on that?üîΩIt is not by the nature of an agent.

original: byed pa po'i ngo bos ma yin no zhes bya ba ni 'di'i dngos su byed pas byed rgyu nyid yin pa ni ma yin no zhes ston par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: byed pa po'i ngo bos ma yin no zhes bya ba ni 'di'i dngos su byed pas byed rgyu nyid yin pa ni ma yin no zhes ston par byed pa yin no //
translated: This shows that it is not the case that it is the cause of action because it is the actual agent.

original: re zhig thams cad cig car skye bar yang mi 'gyur te rkyen tshogs pa med pas mi skye ba'i phyir ro /üîΩ// / bam po bcu bdun pa /
analyzed: re zhig thams cad cig car skye bar yang mi 'gyur te rkyen tshogs pa med pas mi skye ba'i phyir ro / // / bam po bcu bdun pa /
translated: It is not that all arise simultaneously, because they do not arise due to the absence of a collection of conditions.

original: byed pa po ma yin pa'i phyir srog gcod pa dang ldan pa yang ma yin te byed pa po gang yin pa de ni srog gcod pa dang ldan pa kho na yin no //üîΩyid kyi rnam par shes pa dge ba dang mi dge ba skye la zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa la dmigs pa'i yid kyi rnam par @177a * //
analyzed: byed pa po ma yin pa'i phyir srog gcod pa dang ldan pa yang ma yin te byed pa po gang yin pa de ni srog gcod pa dang ldan pa kho na yin no // yid kyi rnam par shes pa dge ba dang mi dge ba skye la zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa la dmigs pa'i yid kyi rnam par @177a * //
translated: Because it is not an agent, it does not possess killing, because that which is an agent definitely possesses killing.üîΩA virtuous or nonvirtuous mental consciousness arises and a mental consciousness arises from that,

original: shes pa dge ba dang mi dge ba'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa skye la de las kyang mig gi rnam par shes pa skye ste /
analyzed: shes pa dge ba dang mi dge ba'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa skye la de las kyang mig gi rnam par shes pa skye ste /
translated: and from that, eye consciousness arises.

original: brgyud pa'i sgo nas mya ngan las 'das pa de yang mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rkyen du gyur pa'i phyir nus pa yod do zhes bya bar skabs dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: brgyud pa'i sgo nas mya ngan las 'das pa de yang mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rkyen du gyur pa'i phyir nus pa yod do zhes bya bar skabs dang sbyar ro //
translated: Since nirvana is a condition of eye consciousness through the door of the continuum, it has the ability to act as a condition.

original: de bzhin du gzhan la yang rtogs par bya ste zhes bya ba ni dmyal ba la sogs pa yang gzugs med pa'i phung po skye ba la nus pa yod do //üîΩji lta zhe na /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan la yang rtogs par bya ste zhes bya ba ni dmyal ba la sogs pa yang gzugs med pa'i phung po skye ba la nus pa yod do // ji lta zhe na /
translated: So too, it should be understood for other states.

original: kye ma dmyal ba pa dang yi dags la sogs pa 'di dag ni shin tu sdug bsngal lo zhes dmyal ba la sogs pa la dmigs pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa dge ba skye'o //
analyzed: kye ma dmyal ba pa dang yi dags la sogs pa 'di dag ni shin tu sdug bsngal lo zhes dmyal ba la sogs pa la dmigs pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa dge ba skye'o //
translated: The mental consciousness that focuses on hell beings and so on and thinks, Alas, these hell beings and hungry ghosts are experiencing such great suffering generates virtuous states.

original: de nas rim gyis tshul khrims la rnam par gnas pa bsgom pa la sbyor ba'i sgo nas gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang skye ba 'thad par 'gyur ro //üîΩlhan cig 'byung gang phan tshun 'bras //
analyzed: de nas rim gyis tshul khrims la rnam par gnas pa bsgom pa la sbyor ba'i sgo nas gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang skye ba 'thad par 'gyur ro // lhan cig 'byung gang phan tshun 'bras //
translated: Then, through the process of gradually stabilizing ethical conduct and applying oneself to meditation, it is tenable that one enters and is born in the formless realm.üîΩThose that arise simultaneously are results of each other.

original: zhes bya ba ni rgyu zhes bya bar sbyar te lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu ni chos gang dag phan tshun 'bras bu yin pa'i chos de dag yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rgyu zhes bya bar sbyar te lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu ni chos gang dag phan tshun 'bras bu yin pa'i chos de dag yin te /
translated: Those that arise simultaneously are results of each other and are coemergent causes.

original: gang dag gcig la gcig 'bras bu yin par bya zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gang dag gcig la gcig 'bras bu yin par bya zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is: they are the effect of each other.

original: lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu ni lhan cig 'byung ba dag yin no zhes ni ma bshad do //
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu ni lhan cig 'byung ba dag yin no zhes ni ma bshad do //
translated: But it is not said that co-existent causes are only co-existent.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: chos kha cig lhan cig 'byung ba yod kyang lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu ma yin te /
analyzed: chos kha cig lhan cig 'byung ba yod kyang lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu ma yin te /
translated: Because some factors, even though co-existent, are not co-existent causes.

original: dper na sngon po la sogs pa rgyur byas pa'i gzugs 'byung ba dag dang lhan cig 'byung mod kyi /
analyzed: dper na sngon po la sogs pa rgyur byas pa'i gzugs 'byung ba dag dang lhan cig 'byung mod kyi /
translated: For example, the primary elements that are the material cause of blue, etc., are co-existent with blue, etc.,

original: phan tshun lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu ni ma yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: phan tshun lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu ni ma yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: but they are not co-existent causes of blue, etc.

original: de'i phyir phan tshun 'bras zhes bya ba'i don smos pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir phan tshun 'bras zhes bya ba'i don smos pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the meaning of ‚Äúmutually‚Äù is added.

original: mtshan nyid 'di yang lhag ma dang bcas pa yin te /
analyzed: mtshan nyid 'di yang lhag ma dang bcas pa yin te /
translated: This definition is incomplete.

original: de'i phyir 'og nas phan tshun 'bras bu nyid med bzhin du chos ni mthun pa'i mtshan nyid rnams kyi lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin la de dag ni de'i ma yin pas kha bskang bar bya'o zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'og nas phan tshun 'bras bu nyid med bzhin du chos ni mthun pa'i mtshan nyid rnams kyi lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin la de dag ni de'i ma yin pas kha bskang bar bya'o zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, later it will be explained that although phenomena and their characteristics do not mutually act as effects, characteristics are coemergent causes of phenomena and phenomena are not coemergent causes of characteristics.

original: kha bskang bar bya ba yang bstan bcos chen po nyid yin par rab tu bstan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: kha bskang bar bya ba yang bstan bcos chen po nyid yin par rab tu bstan pa'i phyir te /
translated: This is because the great treatise is also to be supplemented.

original: brda phrad pa la sogs pa'i bstan bcos chen po dag kha skong ba dang bcas par snang ngo //
analyzed: brda phrad pa la sogs pa'i bstan bcos chen po dag kha skong ba dang bcas par snang ngo //
translated: The great treatises such as the Compendium of Abhidharma appear to be supplemented.

original: 'byung ba bzhin zhes bya ba'i rkyen ni dper na zhes bya ba'i don yin no //
analyzed: 'byung ba bzhin zhes bya ba'i rkyen ni dper na zhes bya ba'i don yin no //
translated: The term ‚Äúlike the elements‚Äù means ‚Äúfor example.‚Äù

original: de ltar na 'dus byas thams cad ni ci @177b rigs par lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid rnams kyang mtshan gzhi'i lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin la de yang de dag gi yin pa de'i
analyzed: de ltar na 'dus byas thams cad ni ci @177b rigs par lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid rnams kyang mtshan gzhi'i lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin la de yang de dag gi yin pa de'i
translated: Thus all conditioned states are coemergent causes in whatever way is possible because the characteristics of conditioned states are coemergent causes of the basis of those characteristics and the basis of those characteristics is a coemergent cause of those characteristics.

original: phyir ci rigs par 'dus byas thams cad ni lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: phyir ci rigs par 'dus byas thams cad ni lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin te /
translated: All conditioned states are co-existent causes in some way.

original: 'dus byas kyang mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i phyir la mtshan gzhi dang mtshan nyid dag kyang lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dus byas kyang mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i phyir la mtshan gzhi dang mtshan nyid dag kyang lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because conditioned states possess characteristics and because the basis of those characteristics and the characteristics themselves are co-existent causes.

original: mtshan nyid gzhan dag dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir thams cad ni thams cad kyi ma yin pas ci rigs par zhes bya bar smos so //üîΩde dag dang sems kyi skye ba la sogs pa gang dag yin pa zhes bya ba ni sems dang mtshungs par ldan pa sems pa la sogs pa dang / bsam gtan gyi sdom pa dang gang zag pa med pa'i sdom pa de dag gi chos skye ba la sogs pa gang yin pa dang /
analyzed: mtshan nyid gzhan dag dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir thams cad ni thams cad kyi ma yin pas ci rigs par zhes bya bar smos so // de dag dang sems kyi skye ba la sogs pa gang dag yin pa zhes bya ba ni sems dang mtshungs par ldan pa sems pa la sogs pa dang / bsam gtan gyi sdom pa dang gang zag pa med pa'i sdom pa de dag gi chos skye ba la sogs pa gang yin pa dang /
translated: But since all conditioned states are not co-existent causes of all conditioned states, he says in some way in order to show that they are co-existent causes of some.üîΩThose that are concomitant with the mind, such as volition, and those that are the arising, etc., of those states, such as the absorptive meditation vows and the uncontaminated vows, are called concomitant causes.

original: sems kyi skye ba la sogs pa gang dag yin pa'i chos de dag ni sems kyi rjes su 'jug pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems kyi skye ba la sogs pa gang dag yin pa'i chos de dag ni sems kyi rjes su 'jug pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Those that are the arising, etc., of the mind are called following states.

original: dus dang ni /
analyzed: dus dang ni /
translated: and time,

original: 'bras sogs dge la sogs pas so //
analyzed: 'bras sogs dge la sogs pas so //
translated: and result, etc., and virtue, etc.

original: zhes bya ba ni dus dang 'bras bu la sogs pa dang dge ba la sogs pas yin pas dus dang ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dus dang 'bras bu la sogs pa dang dge ba la sogs pas yin pas dus dang ni /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúand time, and result, etc., and virtue, etc.‚Äù means that they are concomitant with the mind through time, through result, etc., and through virtue, etc.

original: 'bras sogs dge la sogs pas so //
analyzed: 'bras sogs dge la sogs pas so //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúand result, etc., and virtue, etc.‚Äù

original: re zhig dus las ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni 'di dag ni sems dang lhan cig skye ba gcig pa dang / gnas pa gcig pa dang / 'gag pa gcig pa yin no //
analyzed: re zhig dus las ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni 'di dag ni sems dang lhan cig skye ba gcig pa dang / gnas pa gcig pa dang / 'gag pa gcig pa yin no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúfirst, through time‚Äù is an elaboration. They are concomitant with the mind through having the same arising, the same abiding, and the same cessation.

original: de'i ngo bor te skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'gag pa gcig pa nyid de dang ngo //
analyzed: de'i ngo bor te skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'gag pa gcig pa nyid de dang ngo //
translated: They have the same nature of arising, abiding, and cessation.

original: dus gcig tu gtogs pas na /
analyzed: dus gcig tu gtogs pas na /
translated: They are included in the same time period.

original: dus gcig tu gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: dus gcig tu gtogs pa'o //
translated: They are included in the same time period.

original: de'i ngo bo ste bzhi pa dus gcig tu gtogs pa nyid des na dus kyi sgo nas sems kyi rjes su 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo ste bzhi pa dus gcig tu gtogs pa nyid des na dus kyi sgo nas sems kyi rjes su 'jug pa yin no //
translated: They are concomitant with the mind through time because they have the same nature of being included in the same time period.

original: 'bras bu gcig pa nyid dang / rnam par smin pa gcig pa nyid dang / rgyu mthun pa gcig pa nyid kyis sems kyi rjes su 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu gcig pa nyid dang / rnam par smin pa gcig pa nyid dang / rgyu mthun pa gcig pa nyid kyis sems kyi rjes su 'jug pa yin no //
translated: They are concomitant with the mind through having the same result, the same ripening, and the same natural outcome.

original: 'dir 'bras bu ni skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu dang 'bral ba'i 'bras bu yin te /
analyzed: 'dir 'bras bu ni skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu dang 'bral ba'i 'bras bu yin te /
translated: Here, the result is the result of conscious effort and the result of separation.

original: rnam par smin pa dang rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu ni logs shig tu smos zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa dang rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu ni logs shig tu smos zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The result of karmic maturation and the result of natural outflow are mentioned separately.

original: bdag po'i 'bras bu ni thams cad dang thun mong yin pas ma smos so //
analyzed: bdag po'i 'bras bu ni thams cad dang thun mong yin pas ma smos so //
translated: The dominant result is not mentioned because it is common to all.

original: 'bras bu gcig pa nyid dang @178a * //
analyzed: 'bras bu gcig pa nyid dang @178a * //
translated: The same result

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gcig ces bya ba'i sgra 'di ni grangs sam thun mong ba yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gcig ces bya ba'i sgra 'di ni grangs sam thun mong ba yin no //
translated: The word ‚Äúsame‚Äù in the phrase ‚Äúthe same result‚Äù refers to a number or a commonality.

original: gcig ces bya ba'i sgra snga ma ni lhan cig pa'i don yin te /
analyzed: gcig ces bya ba'i sgra snga ma ni lhan cig pa'i don yin te /
translated: The former word ‚Äúsame‚Äù has the meaning of ‚Äútogether.‚Äù

original: sems dang lhan cig skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'gag pa nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sems dang lhan cig skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'gag pa nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means ‚Äúarising, enduring, and ceasing together with the mind.‚Äù

original: 'di la grangs kyi don ni mi srid de /
analyzed: 'di la grangs kyi don ni mi srid de /
translated: The meaning of a number is not possible here.

original: sems kyi skye ba gang yin pa de nyid rjes su 'jug pa rnams kyi yin pa'am de dag gi gang yin pa de nyid sems kyi yin pa ni med do //
analyzed: sems kyi skye ba gang yin pa de nyid rjes su 'jug pa rnams kyi yin pa'am de dag gi gang yin pa de nyid sems kyi yin pa ni med do //
translated: The arising of the mind is not the arising of those that accompany it, nor is the arising of those that accompany it the arising of the mind.

original: de ltar na rgyu bcus zhes bya ba ni dus kyi sgo nas bzhi ste /
analyzed: de ltar na rgyu bcus zhes bya ba ni dus kyi sgo nas bzhi ste /
translated: Thus, the ten causes are four in terms of time.

original: skye ba gcig pa nyid dang gnas pa gcig pa nyid dang / 'gag pa gcig pa dang / dus gcig tu gtogs pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: skye ba gcig pa nyid dang gnas pa gcig pa nyid dang / 'gag pa gcig pa dang / dus gcig tu gtogs pa nyid kyis so //
translated: They are the same in arising, the same in enduring, the same in ceasing, and they are included in the same time period.

original: skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'gag pa gcig pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba 'di kho nas dus gcig tu gtogs pa 'di bshad pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'gag pa gcig pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba 'di kho nas dus gcig tu gtogs pa 'di bshad pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: Isn‚Äôt the phrase ‚Äúthe same in arising, enduring, and ceasing‚Äù itself the explanation of ‚Äúincluded in the same time period‚Äù?

original: thams cad ni bshad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: thams cad ni bshad pa ma yin te /
translated: No, it is not.

original: mi skye ba'i chos can gyi sems la sems kyi rjes su 'jug pa rnams dus gcig tu gtogs pa yin mod kyi de dag skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'gag pa gcig pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mi skye ba'i chos can gyi sems la sems kyi rjes su 'jug pa rnams dus gcig tu gtogs pa yin mod kyi de dag skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'gag pa gcig pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Although all minds and mental factors that are not to be abandoned are included in the same time period, they are not the same in arising, enduring, and ceasing.

original: de lta bas na rgyu bzhi pa dus gcig tu gtogs pa nyid brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na rgyu bzhi pa dus gcig tu gtogs pa nyid brjod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the fourth cause, ‚Äúincluded in the same time period,‚Äù is stated.

original: 'bras bu dang rnam par smin pa dang rgyu mthun pa gcig pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba gsum dang / dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba yang gsum ste bcus so //
analyzed: 'bras bu dang rnam par smin pa dang rgyu mthun pa gcig pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba gsum dang / dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba yang gsum ste bcus so //
translated: The three that are the same in terms of result, karmic maturation, and natural outflow, and the three that are virtuous, nonvirtuous, and neutral.

original: rnam grangs kyi tshul lam rigs kyi dbang du byas nas 'di skad du bcus zhes bshad kyi sems gcig la rgyu bcu yod pa ni ma yin no //üîΩdge ba'i sems la rgyu mi dge ba'am lung du ma bstan pa dag yod pa'ang ma yin la /
analyzed: rnam grangs kyi tshul lam rigs kyi dbang du byas nas 'di skad du bcus zhes bshad kyi sems gcig la rgyu bcu yod pa ni ma yin no // dge ba'i sems la rgyu mi dge ba'am lung du ma bstan pa dag yod pa'ang ma yin la /
translated: The ten are explained in terms of the method of enumeration or type, but not in terms of ten causes existing in one mind.üîΩNonvirtuous and neutral causes do not exist in a virtuous mind.

original: mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i sems dang mi skye ba'i chos can la yang ma yin no //
analyzed: mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i sems dang mi skye ba'i chos can la yang ma yin no //
translated: Nor do they exist in a nonvirtuous or neutral mind that is an unarisen state.

original: lung du ma bstan pa'i sems mi skye ba'i chos can la ni dus gcig tu gtogs pa nyid dang 'bras bu dang rgyu mthun pa gcig nyid dag dang lung du ma bstan pa nyid dang bzhis so //
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa'i sems mi skye ba'i chos can la ni dus gcig tu gtogs pa nyid dang 'bras bu dang rgyu mthun pa gcig nyid dag dang lung du ma bstan pa nyid dang bzhis so //
translated: Four causes exist in a neutral mind that is an unarisen state: the same time period, the same result, the same natural outflow, and neutral.

original: skye ba'i chos can la ni bzhi po de dag nyid dang skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'gag pa gcig pa nyid dag dang bdun gyis so //
analyzed: skye ba'i chos can la ni bzhi po de dag nyid dang skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'gag pa gcig pa nyid dag dang bdun gyis so //
translated: For those that are subject to arising, there are seven: those four, plus the one that is the same as arising, enduring, and disintegrating.

original: zag pa med pa la yang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: zag pa med pa la yang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: The same is true for those that are uncontaminated.

original: lung du ma bstan pa nyid 'ba' zhig phyung la dge ba nyid @178b kyis bstan par zad do //üîΩmi dge ba dang dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa mi skye ba'i chos can la ni gzhi ji lta ba bzhin du mi dge ba nyid la sogs pa dang dus gcig tu gtogs pa nyid dang 'bras bu dang rnam par smin pa dang rgyu mthun pa gcig
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa nyid 'ba' zhig phyung la dge ba nyid @178b kyis bstan par zad do // mi dge ba dang dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa mi skye ba'i chos can la ni gzhi ji lta ba bzhin du mi dge ba nyid la sogs pa dang dus gcig tu gtogs pa nyid dang 'bras bu dang rnam par smin pa dang rgyu mthun pa gcig
translated: The only difference is that the uncontaminated is taught by the term ‚Äúundefiled.‚Äù

original: pa nyid dag dang lngas so //
analyzed: pa nyid dag dang lngas so //
translated: For those that are nonvirtuous and those that are virtuous but subject to arising, there are five: the one that is nonvirtuous, etc., as appropriate; the one that is included in the same time period; the one that is the same as the result, the ripening, and the natural outflow.

original: de dag skye ba'i chos can la ni lnga po de dag nyid dang skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'gag pa gcig pa nyid dang brgyad kyis so //
analyzed: de dag skye ba'i chos can la ni lnga po de dag nyid dang skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'gag pa gcig pa nyid dang brgyad kyis so //
translated: For those that are subject to arising, there are eight: those five, plus the one that is the same as arising, enduring, and disintegrating.

original: sems nang na nyung ba ni zhes bya ba ni thams cad pas 'khor nyung ba'i sems gang yin pa de ni nang na nyung ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems nang na nyung ba ni zhes bya ba ni thams cad pas 'khor nyung ba'i sems gang yin pa de ni nang na nyung ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The mind that has the least is the mind that has the least of all.

original: de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de yang gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa yan chad kyi sems ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa yan chad kyi sems ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa yin te /
translated: It is the unobscured indeterminate mind of the second absorption and above.

original: de la ni rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag kyang med la dge ba'i sa mang po la sogs pa yang med kyi /
analyzed: de la ni rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag kyang med la dge ba'i sa mang po la sogs pa yang med kyi /
translated: It does not have investigation and analysis, nor does it have the many virtuous factors, etc.

original: sa mang po pa bcu kho na yod par zad do //
analyzed: sa mang po pa bcu kho na yod par zad do //
translated: It only has the ten universal mental factors.

original: de dag gi mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni sa mang po pa'i mtshan nyid rnams te /üîΩde dag gi mthun pa'i mtshan nyid rnams ni thag ring ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gi mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni sa mang po pa'i mtshan nyid rnams te / de dag gi mthun pa'i mtshan nyid rnams ni thag ring ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The term their characteristics refers to the characteristics of the universal mental factors.üîΩThe secondary characteristics of those are not their characteristics because they are distant.

original: rang gi mthun pa'i mtshan nyid rnams kyi ni yin te nye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi mthun pa'i mtshan nyid rnams kyi ni yin te nye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The secondary characteristics of those are the characteristics of those because they are close.

original: de'i phyir rang gi mtshan nyid dang mthun pa'i mtshan nyid brgyad kyi yin no zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir rang gi mtshan nyid dang mthun pa'i mtshan nyid brgyad kyi yin no zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore it is said, They are the eight: their own characteristics and secondary characteristics.

original: rang gi mthun pa'i mtshan nyid ma gtogs pa rnams so zhes bya ba ni mthun pa'i mtshan nyid rnams ni mtshan nyid dag la byed pa yin te /üîΩsems ni khyad par du 'phags pa yin la de dag ni dman pa yin pas so //
analyzed: rang gi mthun pa'i mtshan nyid ma gtogs pa rnams so zhes bya ba ni mthun pa'i mtshan nyid rnams ni mtshan nyid dag la byed pa yin te / sems ni khyad par du 'phags pa yin la de dag ni dman pa yin pas so //
translated: Except for their own characteristics, they are the homogeneous cause of all other factors.üîΩThe characteristics of the factors are not a homogeneous cause of the characteristics, because the characteristics are not of the same stage or path as the characteristics.

original: sems ni mtshan nyid dang mthun pa'i mtshan nyid rnams kyi rgyal po lta bu yin te de'i phyir mthun pa'i mtshan nyid rnams kyi sems kyi lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin gyi de dag ni sems kyi ma yin no //
analyzed: sems ni mtshan nyid dang mthun pa'i mtshan nyid rnams kyi rgyal po lta bu yin te de'i phyir mthun pa'i mtshan nyid rnams kyi sems kyi lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin gyi de dag ni sems kyi ma yin no //
translated: The characteristics are not a homogeneous cause of the principal factor, because the principal factor is superior to the characteristics.üîΩThe principal factor is like a king, the characteristics are like subjects.üîΩThe characteristics are a homogeneous cause of the principal factor, because the principal factor is not superior to the characteristics.

original: mtshan nyid rnams ni sems la byed pa yod pas de dag ni sems kyi lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: mtshan nyid rnams ni sems la byed pa yod pas de dag ni sems kyi lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin no //
translated: The characteristics are a homogeneous cause of the characteristics, because they are of the same stage and path.üîΩAccording to other masters, the principal factor and the characteristics are a homogeneous cause of fourteen factors.

original: gzhan dag na re bcu bzhi pa yin te zhes bya ba la gzhan dag gi bsam pa ni dper na mthun pa'i mtshan nyid rnams chos la byed pa med do //üîΩ'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re bcu bzhi pa yin te zhes bya ba la gzhan dag gi bsam pa ni dper na mthun pa'i mtshan nyid rnams chos la byed pa med do // 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: The principal factor is a homogeneous cause of the principal factor and of the characteristics.

original: chos kyi mtshan nyid dag la yin te /
analyzed: chos kyi mtshan nyid dag la yin te /
translated: The characteristics are a homogeneous cause of the principal factor and of the characteristics.

original: de'i phyir de dag chos kyi lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin par mi 'dod pa de bzhin du de dag gi mtshan nyid rnams kyang mtshungs par @179a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag chos kyi lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin par mi 'dod pa de bzhin du de dag gi mtshan nyid rnams kyang mtshungs par @179a * //
translated: Therefore, just as they are not asserted to be coemergent causes of phenomena, they are not coemergent causes of minds and mental factors.

original: ldan pa dag kho na la byed pa yin gyi sems la ni ma yin pas de dag sems kyi lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu ma yin gyi sems ni de dag gi rgyal po lta bu yin pas lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin no snyam pa yin no //
analyzed: ldan pa dag kho na la byed pa yin gyi sems la ni ma yin pas de dag sems kyi lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu ma yin gyi sems ni de dag gi rgyal po lta bu yin pas lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin no snyam pa yin no //
translated: Since they function only in relation to concomitant states, they are not coemergent causes of minds and mental factors. But minds and mental factors are coemergent causes of those characteristics because they are like kings.

original: gal te sa mang po pa bcu'i mtshan nyid bzhi bcu pa gang dag yin pa de dag sems kyi lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin par mi 'dod na de lta na rab tu byed pa'i gzhung dang 'gal bar 'gyur te /üîΩ'di ltar rab tu byed pa las ni /
analyzed: gal te sa mang po pa bcu'i mtshan nyid bzhi bcu pa gang dag yin pa de dag sems kyi lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin par mi 'dod na de lta na rab tu byed pa'i gzhung dang 'gal bar 'gyur te /üîΩ'di ltar rab tu byed pa las ni /
translated: If you do not assert that the forty characteristics of the ten universal mental factors are coemergent causes of minds and mental factors, then you would contradict the Subcommentary, which states:

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po sdug bsngal gyi bden pa nas lam gyi bden pa'i bar 'di dag las 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu can yin la 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu ma yin pa ni du /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po sdug bsngal gyi bden pa nas lam gyi bden pa'i bar 'di dag las 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu can yin la 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu ma yin pa ni du /
translated: From among these four noble truths, how many are causes of the afflicted view of the self but are not the afflicted view of the self?

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu yin la 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu can ma yin pa ni du /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu yin la 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu can ma yin pa ni du /
translated: How many are the afflicted view of the self but are not causes of the afflicted view of the self?

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu can yang yin la 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu gang yin pa ni du /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu can yang yin la 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu gang yin pa ni du /
translated: How many are both the afflicted view of the self and causes of the afflicted view of the self?

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu can yang ma yin la 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu yang ma yin pa ni du zhes dri ba byas pa dang lan btab pa /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu can yang ma yin la 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu yang ma yin pa ni du zhes dri ba byas pa dang lan btab pa /
translated: How many are neither the afflicted view of the self nor causes of the afflicted view of the self?

original: 'gog pa'i bden pa dang lam gyi bden pa gnyis ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu can yang ma yin la 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu yang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i bden pa dang lam gyi bden pa gnyis ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu can yang ma yin la 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu yang ma yin no //
translated: The truths of cessation and path are neither causes of the afflicted view of the self nor the afflicted view of the self.

original: gnyis la ni bye brag yod de /
analyzed: gnyis la ni bye brag yod de /
translated: The remaining two truths are of two types.

original: sdug bsngal ba dang kun 'byung ba'i bden pa dag la ni rnam par dbye ba yod do //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba dang kun 'byung ba'i bden pa dag la ni rnam par dbye ba yod do //
translated: The truths of suffering and origin are differentiated.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How so?üîΩThe truth of suffering is threefold:

original: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu can yin la 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu ma yin pa yang yod /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu can yin la 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu ma yin pa yang yod /
translated: that which is caused by the afflicted view of the self but is not a cause of the afflicted view of the self;

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu can yang yin la 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu yang yin pa yang yod /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu can yang yin la 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu yang yin pa yang yod /
translated: that which is caused by the afflicted view of the self and is also a cause of the afflicted view of the self;

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu can yang ma yin la 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu yang ma yin pa yang yod pas mu gsum pa yin te /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu can yang ma yin la 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu yang ma yin pa yang yod pas mu gsum pa yin te /
translated: and that which is neither caused by the afflicted view of the self nor a cause of the afflicted view of the self.

original: mu gnyis pa ni med do //
analyzed: mu gnyis pa ni med do //
translated: The second possibility does not exist.

original: de la 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu can yin la 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu ma yin pa ni sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i phra rgyas pa dang da ltar byung ba rnams dang de dag mtshungs par ldan pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bden pa ma
analyzed: de la 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu can yin la 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu ma yin pa ni sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i phra rgyas pa dang da ltar byung ba rnams dang de dag mtshungs par ldan pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bden pa ma
translated: That which is caused by the afflicted view of the self but is not a cause of the afflicted view of the self is the truth of suffering that is past and present and the negative tendencies that are to be abandoned by the path of seeing the truth of suffering and the truth of suffering that is concomitant with them.

original: gtogs pa dang / @179b kun 'byung ba mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i phra rgyas kun du 'gro ba 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba rnams dang de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bden pa ma gtogs pa dang / 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bden pa ma 'ongs pa ma gtogs pa dang /
analyzed: gtogs pa dang / @179b kun 'byung ba mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i phra rgyas kun du 'gro ba 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba rnams dang de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bden pa ma gtogs pa dang / 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bden pa ma 'ongs pa ma gtogs pa dang /
translated: That which is not excluded is the afflicted truth of suffering that is other than those, except for the pervasive negative tendencies that are to be abandoned by seeing the truths of cessation and path, the pervasive negative tendencies that are to be abandoned by seeing the truths of origin and cessation, the truth of suffering that is concomitant with the afflicted view of the self and the truth of suffering that is concomitant with the afflicted view of the self in the future.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i chos rnams kyi skye ba dang rga ba dang gnas pa dang mi rtag pa nyid dam ma gtogs pa de dag las gzhan pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bden pa nyon mongs pa can gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i chos rnams kyi skye ba dang rga ba dang gnas pa dang mi rtag pa nyid dam ma gtogs pa de dag las gzhan pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bden pa nyon mongs pa can gang yin pa'o //
translated: That which is excluded is the truth of suffering that is other than those, except for the arising, aging, enduring and impermanence of those phenomena concomitant with the afflicted view of the self.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu can yang yin la 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu yang yin pa ni ma gtogs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu can yang yin la 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu yang yin pa ni ma gtogs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: That which is not excluded is that which is caused by the afflicted view of the self and is also a cause of the afflicted view of the self.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu can yang ma yin la 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu yang ma yin pa ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu can yang ma yin la 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu yang ma yin pa ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'o //
translated: That which is neither caused by the afflicted view of the self nor is a cause of the afflicted view of the self is the afflicted truth of suffering.

original: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa ji lta bar kun 'byung ba'i bden pa yang de dang 'dra'o zhes bshad de /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa ji lta bar kun 'byung ba'i bden pa yang de dang 'dra'o zhes bshad de /
translated: The truth of origination is like the truth of suffering.

original: rab tu byed pa'i gzhung yin no //
analyzed: rab tu byed pa'i gzhung yin no //
translated: This is the text of the chapter.

original: de'i don rnam par dbye ba'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i don rnam par dbye ba'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to analyze its meaning, it is said:

original: sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i phra rgyas 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa bcu po 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba gang dag yin pa de dag kyang ma gtogs pa yin la /
analyzed: sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i phra rgyas 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa bcu po 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba gang dag yin pa de dag kyang ma gtogs pa yin la /
translated: The ten negative tendencies that are to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering, such as the afflicted view of the self, which are past and present, are excluded.

original: phra rgyas bcu po de dag dang / mtshungs par ldan pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bden pa tshor ba la sogs pa yang ma gtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: phra rgyas bcu po de dag dang / mtshungs par ldan pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bden pa tshor ba la sogs pa yang ma gtogs pa yin no //
translated: The truth of suffering concomitant with those ten negative tendencies, such as feeling, is also excluded.

original: 'dir ma gtogs pa ma yin pa gang zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'dir ma gtogs pa ma yin pa gang zhig yin zhe na /
translated: What is not excluded here?

original: phra rgyas par de dag nyid ma 'ongs pa dang / de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bden pa tshor ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: phra rgyas par de dag nyid ma 'ongs pa dang / de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bden pa tshor ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The future ones and the truth of suffering associated with them are negative tendencies.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bden pa ma 'ongs pa ma 'ongs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bden pa ma 'ongs pa ma 'ongs pa yin te /
translated: The future truth of suffering associated with the afflicted view of the self is future.

original: de ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bden pa ma 'ongs pa ma gtogs pa dang zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ma gtogs par 'jog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bden pa ma 'ongs pa ma gtogs pa dang zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ma gtogs par 'jog par 'gyur ro //
translated: It is not included because it is said, ‚ÄúExcept for the future truth of suffering associated with the afflicted view of the self.‚Äù

original: de dag gi thob pa dang skye ba la sogs pa ma gtogs pa ma yin pas mi brtsal lo //
analyzed: de dag gi thob pa dang skye ba la sogs pa ma gtogs pa ma yin pas mi brtsal lo //
translated: It is not calculated because its obtainment and arising and so on are not excluded.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang de dang @180a * //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang de dang @180a * //
translated: The arising and so on of the afflicted view of the self and

original: mtshungs par ldan pa'i chos rnams kyi skye ba la sogs pa ni ma gtogs pa yin te /
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pa'i chos rnams kyi skye ba la sogs pa ni ma gtogs pa yin te /
translated: the phenomena associated with it are excluded.

original: de dag ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i chos rnams kyi skye ba dang rga ba dang gnas pa dang mi rtag pa nyid dag ma gtogs pa zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ma gtogs par 'jog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i chos rnams kyi skye ba dang rga ba dang gnas pa dang mi rtag pa nyid dag ma gtogs pa zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ma gtogs par 'jog par 'gyur ro //
translated: They are not included because it says, ‚Äúexcept for the arising, aging, enduring, and impermanence of the afflicted view of the self and the dharmas associated with it.‚Äù

original: de lta bas na re zhig phra rgyas ma 'ongs pa dang de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bden pa ma gtogs pa las gzhan pa ni /
analyzed: de lta bas na re zhig phra rgyas ma 'ongs pa dang de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bden pa ma gtogs pa las gzhan pa ni /
translated: Therefore, first, the future negative tendencies and the truth of suffering associated with them are excluded.

original: de dag las gzhan pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bden pa nyon mongs pa can zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de dag las gzhan pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bden pa nyon mongs pa can zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The truth of suffering that is other than those is called afflicted.

original: de ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu can yin no //
analyzed: de ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu can yin no //
translated: It is caused by the afflicted view of the self.

original: 'di la rgyu 'jig tshogs la lta ba yod pas na 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu can yin te /
analyzed: 'di la rgyu 'jig tshogs la lta ba yod pas na 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu can yin te /
translated: It is caused by the afflicted view of the self because the cause, the afflicted view of the self, exists in this truth of suffering.

original: skal pa mnyam pa'i rgyu dang kun du 'gro ba'i rgyus 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skal pa mnyam pa'i rgyu dang kun du 'gro ba'i rgyus 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is caused by the afflicted view of the self because it is the cause of past and present afflicted views of the self through the power of the homogeneous cause and omnipresent cause.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu ni ma yin te /üîΩchos ma 'ongs pa skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu'am kun du 'gro ba'i rgyur rnam par gzhag pa ni med do //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu ni ma yin te / chos ma 'ongs pa skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu'am kun du 'gro ba'i rgyur rnam par gzhag pa ni med do //
translated: The afflicted view of the self is not a cause of the afflicted view of the self.üîΩNor is it a homogeneous cause or a pervasive cause of future afflicted view of the self.

original: 'di la lhan cig 'byung ba'i phyir rgyu'am mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu yang mi srid de /
analyzed: 'di la lhan cig 'byung ba'i phyir rgyu'am mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu yang mi srid de /
translated: Nor is it possible that it is a co-existent cause or a concomitant cause of the afflicted view of the self, because it does not occur simultaneously with the afflicted view of the self.
