original: tshogs pa gcig la 'jig tshogs la lta ba gnyis med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshogs pa gcig la 'jig tshogs la lta ba gnyis med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For two afflicted views of the self do not occur in the same group.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang 'jig tshogs la lta ba lhan cig 'byung ba'am mtshungs par ldan pa ni med do //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang 'jig tshogs la lta ba lhan cig 'byung ba'am mtshungs par ldan pa ni med do //
translated: The afflicted view of the self does not occur simultaneously or as a concomitant of the afflicted view of the self.

original: mthar 'dzin par lta ba la sogs pa dang lhan cig 'byung ba'am mtshungs par ldan pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: mthar 'dzin par lta ba la sogs pa dang lhan cig 'byung ba'am mtshungs par ldan pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor does it occur simultaneously or as a concomitant of the afflicted view of the extreme, etc.

original: tshogs pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshogs pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are different groups.

original: 'di dag gi ldan pa ma yin pa thob pa dag dang skye ba la sogs pa yang ma gtogs pa ma yin pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag gi ldan pa ma yin pa thob pa dag dang skye ba la sogs pa yang ma gtogs pa ma yin pa yin no //
translated: The obtainment of these and their birth, etc., are not excluded.

original: de dag ni ma gtogs pa las gzhan pa yang yin la nyon mongs pa can yang yin te /
analyzed: de dag ni ma gtogs pa las gzhan pa yang yin la nyon mongs pa can yang yin te /
translated: They are afflicted states that are different from those that are omnipresent.

original: de dag kyang kun du 'gro ba'i rgyus sngar skyes pa'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu can yin gyi 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag kyang kun du 'gro ba'i rgyus sngar skyes pa'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu can yin gyi 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu ni ma yin no //
translated: They are caused by the former afflicted view of the self that is generated by the cause of omnipresent states, but they are not the cause of the afflicted view of the self.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: re zhig thob pa rnams ni shing ljon pa'i phyi shun dang 'dra bar de kun du 'gro ba dag gi phyir rol na 'dug pa yin pa'i phyir kun du 'gro ba yin par rnam par mi gzhag @180b go //
analyzed: re zhig thob pa rnams ni shing ljon pa'i phyi shun dang 'dra bar de kun du 'gro ba dag gi phyir rol na 'dug pa yin pa'i phyir kun du 'gro ba yin par rnam par mi gzhag @180b go //
translated: Obtainment is not posited as omnipresent because it is like the outer bark of a tree, for it exists externally to the omnipresent states.

original: kun du 'gro ba med pa'i phyir 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu ni ma yin no //
analyzed: kun du 'gro ba med pa'i phyir 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not the cause of the omnipresent afflicted view of the self because it is not omnipresent.

original: kun du 'gro ba skye ba la sogs pa ni grub pa'i mtha' las /
analyzed: kun du 'gro ba skye ba la sogs pa ni grub pa'i mtha' las /
translated: Birth and so on are asserted to be omnipresent because it is said in the Abhidharmako≈õa:

original: de dag dang ni lhan cig gang //
analyzed: de dag dang ni lhan cig gang //
translated: Those that arise simultaneously with them

original: 'byung de 'ang kun 'gro thob ma gtogs //üîΩzhes 'byung ba'i phyir kun du 'gro ba yin bar ni 'dod mod kyi /
analyzed: 'byung de 'ang kun 'gro thob ma gtogs //üîΩzhes 'byung ba'i phyir kun du 'gro ba yin bar ni 'dod mod kyi /
translated: are also omnipresent, except for obtainment.

original: de dag sems dang sems las byung ba bzhin du sems dang sems las byung ba ma 'ongs pa rnams kyi kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de dag sems dang sems las byung ba bzhin du sems dang sems las byung ba ma 'ongs pa rnams kyi kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu ni ma yin te /
translated: They are not omnipresent causes of future minds and mental factors, like minds and mental factors.

original: rang gi mtshan gzhi la byed pa lhur len pa nyid kyis gtso bo ma yin pas sems dang sems las byung ba gzhan la kun du 'gro ba'i skyes bu'i byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan gzhi la byed pa lhur len pa nyid kyis gtso bo ma yin pas sems dang sems las byung ba gzhan la kun du 'gro ba'i skyes bu'i byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the activity of the person is not primary with respect to other minds and mental factors, since they are engaged in their own activity.

original: skye ba la sogs pa de dag kun du 'gro bar rnam par gzhag pa ni rang gi rgyud kyi kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba la sogs pa de dag kun du 'gro bar rnam par gzhag pa ni rang gi rgyud kyi kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The reason they are posited as omnipresent is that they are omnipresent causes of their own continuum.

original: de lta bas na bstan bcos kyi don ni de dag 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu ma yin no zhes bya bar snang ngo //
analyzed: de lta bas na bstan bcos kyi don ni de dag 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu ma yin no zhes bya bar snang ngo //
translated: Therefore the meaning of the treatise appears to be that they are not the cause of the afflicted view of the self.

original: 'o na skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu go ci ste ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu go ci ste ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why are they not homogeneous causes?

original: skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyur rnam par gzhag pa yang skyes bu byed pa la ltos pa yin te /
analyzed: skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyur rnam par gzhag pa yang skyes bu byed pa la ltos pa yin te /
translated: The establishment of something as a homogeneous cause depends on the activity of the person.

original: chos gang zhig skyed pa la skyes bu byed pa dang ldan pa de ni de'i skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: chos gang zhig skyed pa la skyes bu byed pa dang ldan pa de ni de'i skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin te /
translated: Any cause that generates a result is a homogeneous cause.

original: skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ji ltar 'dod par rnam par 'jog pa'i khungs ni 'di kho na yin no //
analyzed: skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ji ltar 'dod par rnam par 'jog pa'i khungs ni 'di kho na yin no //
translated: This is the only source for positing homogeneous causes as asserted.

original: bye brag tu bshad pa las kyang 'di skad du /
analyzed: bye brag tu bshad pa las kyang 'di skad du /
translated: The great treatise on differentiation mentions:

original: mig ni mig gi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: mig ni mig gi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: The eye is the homogeneous cause of the eye.

original: lha sbyin gyi mig ni lha sbyin gyi mig gi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin te /üîΩg-yas pa ni g-yas pa'i yin la /
analyzed: lha sbyin gyi mig ni lha sbyin gyi mig gi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin te / g-yas pa ni g-yas pa'i yin la /
translated: The eye of Devadatta is the homogeneous cause of the eye of Devadatta.üîΩThe right eye is the homogeneous cause of the right eye.üîΩThe left eye is the homogeneous cause of the left eye.

original: g-yon pa ni g-yon pa'i yin pa nas mig gi rdzas ni mig gi rdzas gzhan gyi bar du yin la /
analyzed: g-yon pa ni g-yon pa'i yin pa nas mig gi rdzas ni mig gi rdzas gzhan gyi bar du yin la /
translated: The substance of the eye is the homogeneous cause of the substance of the eye.üîΩThe substance of the eye is not the homogeneous cause of the substance of the ear and so on.üîΩExternal barley is the homogeneous cause of external barley.

original: phyi rol gyi dag la yang nas ni nas kyi yin la s'a l'a ni s'a lu'i bar du yin no zhes bshad de /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi dag la yang nas ni nas kyi yin la s'a l'a ni s'a lu'i bar du yin no zhes bshad de /
translated: External barley is not the homogeneous cause of external rice and so on.

original: gal te lung du ma bstan pa nyid du mtshungs pa'i phyir mig thams cad mig thams cad bkyi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin par 'dod na ni nge skad du khyad par du bshad par yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te lung du ma bstan pa nyid du mtshungs pa'i phyir mig thams cad mig thams cad bkyi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin par 'dod na ni nge skad du khyad par du bshad par yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If you accept that all eyes are homogeneous causes of all eyes, because they are similar in being neutral, then this would not be an explanation of their distinction.

original: de lta bas na de dag ni 'jig tshogs pa lta ba'i rgyu ma yin no zhes bya bar khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na de dag ni 'jig tshogs pa lta ba'i rgyu ma yin no zhes bya bar khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: Therefore you should understand that they are not causes of the afflicted view of the self.

original: gzhan dag na re rnam par bshad pa 'di ni lhag ma dang bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re rnam par bshad pa 'di ni lhag ma dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: Others say: This explanation is incomplete.

original: de lta bas na ma @181a * //
analyzed: de lta bas na ma @181a * //
translated: Therefore,

original: gtogs pa ni phra rgyas de dag skye ba la sogs pa dang bcas pa dang de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i chos rnams yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: gtogs pa ni phra rgyas de dag skye ba la sogs pa dang bcas pa dang de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i chos rnams yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: the remaining factors are those that arise together with those negative tendencies and the phenomena concomitant with them.

original: grub pa'i mtha' las /üîΩde dag dang ni lhan cig gang //
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' las / de dag dang ni lhan cig gang //
translated: The treatise Attainment of Knowledge states:üîΩThose that arise together with them

original: 'byung de'ang kun 'gro thob ma gtogs //
analyzed: 'byung de'ang kun 'gro thob ma gtogs //
translated: and those concomitant with them, except for obtainment.

original: zhes 'byung ba'i phyir chos sngar skyes ba de dag kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu'am skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba na chos dang de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa rnams kyi skye ba la sogs pa lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba gang dag yin pa de
analyzed: zhes 'byung ba'i phyir chos sngar skyes ba de dag kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu'am skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba na chos dang de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa rnams kyi skye ba la sogs pa lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba gang dag yin pa de
translated: When those previously arisen phenomena become the homogeneous cause or omnipresent cause of those phenomena, then the arising of those phenomena and those concomitant with them become coemergent causes.

original: dag dang bcas te 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dag dang bcas te 'gyur ro //
translated: They are concomitant with those.üîΩTherefore it says,

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'jig chogs la lta ba dang de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i chos rnams kyi skye ba dang / rga ba dang gnas pa dang mi rtag pa nyid dag ma gtogs pa zhes 'byung ngo //üîΩde lta bas na skye ba la sogs pa yang kha cig ni ma gtogs pa yin la /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'jig chogs la lta ba dang de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i chos rnams kyi skye ba dang / rga ba dang gnas pa dang mi rtag pa nyid dag ma gtogs pa zhes 'byung ngo // de lta bas na skye ba la sogs pa yang kha cig ni ma gtogs pa yin la /
translated: except for the arising, aging, enduring and impermanence of the afflicted view of the self and those phenomena concomitant with it.

original: de las gzhan pa ni ma gtogs pa ma yin pa yin no zhes bya bar khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa ni ma gtogs pa ma yin pa yin no zhes bya bar khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: Therefore you should understand that some arising and so on are excluded and some are not excluded.

original: rigs pa ni 'dir gang gi phyir rigs pa yin pa de'i phyir yin pa'i khong du chud par bya bar blta ba yin no //
analyzed: rigs pa ni 'dir gang gi phyir rigs pa yin pa de'i phyir yin pa'i khong du chud par bya bar blta ba yin no //
translated: The reason is to be understood as ‚Äúbecause it is a reason‚Äù here.

original: kun 'byung ba mthong bas spang bar bya ba dag kyang kun du 'gro ba 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba gang dag yin pa dang de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bden pa tshor ba la sogs pa ni ma gtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: kun 'byung ba mthong bas spang bar bya ba dag kyang kun du 'gro ba 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba gang dag yin pa dang de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bden pa tshor ba la sogs pa ni ma gtogs pa yin no //
translated: Also, those that are to be abandoned by seeing the truth of origin are the past and present pervasive states and the truth of suffering that is associated with them, such as feeling, are excluded.

original: kun 'byung ba mthong pas spang bar bya ba ma gtogs pa ma yin pa gzhan gang zhig yin zhe na /üîΩkun du 'gro ba ma 'ongs pa gang dag yin pa dang de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bden pa tshor ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: kun 'byung ba mthong pas spang bar bya ba ma gtogs pa ma yin pa gzhan gang zhig yin zhe na / kun du 'gro ba ma 'ongs pa gang dag yin pa dang de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bden pa tshor ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: What other states are not excluded?

original: de ni ma gtogs pa ma yin pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni ma gtogs pa ma yin pa yin no //
translated: Those that are not excluded are the future pervasive states and the truth of suffering that is associated with them, such as feeling.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa kun du 'gro ba ma yin pa dus gsum pa yang rung ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa kun du 'gro ba ma yin pa dus gsum pa yang rung ste /
translated: Attachment and so on that are not pervasive states and those that are in the three times are not excluded.

original: gang dag yin pa dang de dag thams cad kyi thob pa gang dag yin pa de dag kyang ma gtogs pa ma yin pa yin no //
analyzed: gang dag yin pa dang de dag thams cad kyi thob pa gang dag yin pa de dag kyang ma gtogs pa ma yin pa yin no //
translated: and the obtainment of all of them is not excluded.

original: skye ba la sogs pa ni phyogs gcig gi ltar na ni ma gtogs pa ma yin pa nyid do //üîΩphyogs cig shos kyi ltar na ni kha cig ni ma gtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: skye ba la sogs pa ni phyogs gcig gi ltar na ni ma gtogs pa ma yin pa nyid do // phyogs cig shos kyi ltar na ni kha cig ni ma gtogs pa yin no //
translated: As for birth, etc., in one sense they are not excluded.

original: kha cig ni ma gtogs pa ma yin no //üîΩkun 'byung ba mthong bas spang bar bya ba ma gtogs pa ma yin pa @181b 'di thams cad ni kun du 'gro ba'i rgyus 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu can yin te /
analyzed: kha cig ni ma gtogs pa ma yin no // kun 'byung ba mthong bas spang bar bya ba ma gtogs pa ma yin pa @181b 'di thams cad ni kun du 'gro ba'i rgyus 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu can yin te /
translated: In another sense, some are excluded and some are not excluded.

original: sngar skyes pa'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngar skyes pa'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: All of these are causes of the afflicted view of the self, because they are caused by the afflicted view of the self that arose previously.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu ni ma yin te /
translated: They are not causes of the afflicted view of the self,

original: kun du 'gro ba rnams dang de dag dang lhan cig 'byung ba rnams ni ma 'ongs pa yin pa nyid kyis kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun du 'gro ba rnams dang de dag dang lhan cig 'byung ba rnams ni ma 'ongs pa yin pa nyid kyis kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the pervasive and those that arise simultaneously with them are not pervasive causes, because they are future.

original: kun du 'gro ba ma yin pa 'dod chags la sogs pa ni de dag dang lhan cig 'byung ba tshor ba la sogs pa dang phyogs gcig gi ltar gyi skye ba la sogs pa dang thob pa thams cad ni kun du 'gro ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro
analyzed: kun du 'gro ba ma yin pa 'dod chags la sogs pa ni de dag dang lhan cig 'byung ba tshor ba la sogs pa dang phyogs gcig gi ltar gyi skye ba la sogs pa dang thob pa thams cad ni kun du 'gro ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro
translated: Non-pervasive negative tendencies such as attachment and so on, feeling and so forth that arise simultaneously with them, birth and so on that are similar to one part of them and all obtainment are not pervasive because they are not concomitant with all afflicted states.

original: // 'gog pa dang lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba nyon mongs pa can phra rgyas dang de dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang des kun nas bslang ba skye ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid dag kyang ma gtogs pa ma yin pa yin te /
analyzed: // 'gog pa dang lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba nyon mongs pa can phra rgyas dang de dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang des kun nas bslang ba skye ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid dag kyang ma gtogs pa ma yin pa yin te /
translated: Also, the afflicted states that are objects to be abandoned by seeing the truths of cessation and path and objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation and their concomitant negative tendencies and the entities of birth and so on that are motivated by them are not excluded.

original: de dag ni kun du 'gro ba'i rgyus 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu can yin no //üîΩde dag 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de dag ni kun du 'gro ba'i rgyus 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu can yin no // de dag 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu ni ma yin te /
translated: They are objects that possess the cause of the afflicted view of the self because they are the cause of pervasive negative tendencies.

original: de kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu nyid yin par mi srid pa'i phyir dang / rgyu gzhan yin par mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu nyid yin par mi srid pa'i phyir dang / rgyu gzhan yin par mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: They are not the cause of the afflicted view of the self because it is impossible that they are the cause of pervasive negative tendencies and it is illogical that they are other causes.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu can yang yin la 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu gang yin pa ni ma gtogs pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i rgyu phra rgyas 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba bcu po gangüîΩyin pa de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bden pa dang / phyogs cig shos kyi ltar gyi skye ba la sogs pa gang yin pa de dag ni skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu dang kun du 'gro ba'i rgyus sngar skyes pa'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu can yin no //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu can yang yin la 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu gang yin pa ni ma gtogs pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i rgyu phra rgyas 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba bcu po gang yin pa de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bden pa dang / phyogs cig shos kyi ltar gyi skye ba la sogs pa gang yin pa de dag ni skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu dang kun du 'gro ba'i rgyus sngar skyes pa'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu can yin no //
translated: That which is caused by the afflicted view of the self and is also the cause of the afflicted view of the self is that which is excluded.üîΩThe ten past and present negative tendencies to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering are the cause of the afflicted view of the self.üîΩThe truth of suffering concomitant with them and the origin of the afflicted view of the self that is its homogeneous cause and omnipresent cause that arose previously are caused by the afflicted view of the self.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i skye ba la sogs pa dang de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i skye ba la sogs pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu dang sngar bshad pa'i rgyu dag gis de'i rgyu can yin no //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i skye ba la sogs pa dang de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i skye ba la sogs pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu dang sngar bshad pa'i rgyu dag gis de'i rgyu can yin no //
translated: The origin of the afflicted view of the self and the origin of the afflicted view of the self that is concomitant with it are caused by the afflicted view of the self because they are coemergent causes and the previously explained causes.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu dang sngar bshad pa'i rgyu rnams kyis de'i rgyu can yin no //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu dang sngar bshad pa'i rgyu rnams kyis de'i rgyu can yin no //
translated: Those concomitant with the afflicted view of the self are caused by it through the aforementioned causes and the concomitant cause.

original: de dag kyang de bzhin du 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu yin no //üîΩkun 'byung @182a * //üîΩba mthong bas spang bar bya ba kun du 'gro ba 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa tshor ba la sogs pa dang phyogs cig shos kyi ltar gyi skye ba la sogs pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni kun du
analyzed: de dag kyang de bzhin du 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu yin no // kun 'byung @182a * // ba mthong bas spang bar bya ba kun du 'gro ba 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa tshor ba la sogs pa dang phyogs cig shos kyi ltar gyi skye ba la sogs pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni kun du
translated: They are also the cause of the afflicted view of the self in the same way.üîΩThose pervasive negative tendencies that are objects to be abandoned by seeing the truth of origin and concomitant states such as feeling and those that are the side of origin that are objects to be abandoned by seeing the truth of cessation, such as birth, are

original: 'gro ba'i rgyu kho nas 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu can yang yin la 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu yang yin te de dag gi rgyu yang 'jig tshogs la lta ba sngar skyes pa yin la 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu yang de dag sngar skyes pa
analyzed: 'gro ba'i rgyu kho nas 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu can yang yin la 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu yang yin te de dag gi rgyu yang 'jig tshogs la lta ba sngar skyes pa yin la 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu yang de dag sngar skyes pa
translated: caused by the afflicted view of the self through the pervasive cause alone. They are also the cause of the afflicted view of the self because the cause of those is the previously arisen afflicted view of the self and the cause of the afflicted view of the self is those that arise previously.

original: yin no // sdug bsngal gyi bden pa nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa de dge ba dang / ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu can yang ma yin la 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu yang ma yin te /
analyzed: yin no // sdug bsngal gyi bden pa nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa de dge ba dang / ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu can yang ma yin la 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu yang ma yin te /
translated: That which is not afflicted is virtuous and that which is not obscured and not declared is neither the cause of the afflicted view of the self nor is it the cause of the afflicted view of the self.

original: rgyu rnam pa lnga char mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu rnam pa lnga char mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is impossible that it be any of the five types of causes.

original: 'dir ni skyed par byed pa'i rgyu'i dbang du bya ba yin gyi thun mong yin pa'i phyir byed rgyu'i rgyu ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dir ni skyed par byed pa'i rgyu'i dbang du bya ba yin gyi thun mong yin pa'i phyir byed rgyu'i rgyu ni ma yin no //
translated: Here, the generating cause is meant, but it is not the active cause because it is common to all.

original: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu yang rung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu yang rung ba ma yin te /
translated: It is also not the cause of karmic maturation.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba ni bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa nyid kyis rnam par smin pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba ni bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa nyid kyis rnam par smin pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the afflicted view of the self is obscured and not declared and thus it does not possess karmic maturation.

original: de la 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i chos rnams kyi skye ba dang rga ba dang gnas pa dang mi rtag pa nyid dag ma gtogs pa zhes bshad pa gang yin pa de dang 'gal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i chos rnams kyi skye ba dang rga ba dang gnas pa dang mi rtag pa nyid dag ma gtogs pa zhes bshad pa gang yin pa de dang 'gal bar 'gyur te /
translated: That would contradict the explanation in the Abhidharmako≈õa that states, ‚ÄúExcept for the arising, aging, enduring, and impermanence of the aggregates and the phenomena concomitant with the afflicted view of the self.‚Äù

original: gal te 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i skye ba la sogs pa lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin par mi 'gyur na ni de dag ma gtogs par 'jog par yang mi 'gyur ro //üîΩgang dag ma gtogs pa de dag ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu can yang yin la /
analyzed: gal te 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i skye ba la sogs pa lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin par mi 'gyur na ni de dag ma gtogs par 'jog par yang mi 'gyur ro // gang dag ma gtogs pa de dag ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu can yang yin la /
translated: If arising and so on concomitant with the afflicted view of the self were not coemergent causes, they would not be posited as except for that.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu yang yin no //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu yang yin no //
translated: Those except for that are both caused by the afflicted view of the self and are causes of the afflicted view of the self.

original: 'o na ni gang dag de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i chos rnams kyi zhes de skad du mi 'don pa de dag gi ltar na rab tu byed pa'i gzhung ji ltar 'gal bar 'gyur zhes khong nas drang bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'o na ni gang dag de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i chos rnams kyi zhes de skad du mi 'don pa de dag gi ltar na rab tu byed pa'i gzhung ji ltar 'gal bar 'gyur zhes khong nas drang bar bya'o //
translated: But if you do not recite the passage that states, ‚ÄúExcept for those concomitant with the afflicted view of the self,‚Äù then how does the Abhidharmako≈õa passage contradict the text of the treatise?

original: de dag ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i skye ba dang rga ba dang gnas pa dang / mi rtag pa nyid dag ma gtogs pa zhes de skad du 'don te /
analyzed: de dag ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i skye ba dang rga ba dang gnas pa dang / mi rtag pa nyid dag ma gtogs pa zhes de skad du 'don te /
translated: They are called ‚Äúthe arising, aging, enduring, and impermanence of the afflicted view of the self,‚Äù but they are not the characteristics of the afflicted view of the self.

original: de skad du smra ba de dag gi bsam pa ni de dag gi mtshan nyid rnams ni de dang mtshungs par ldan pa dag kho na la byed kyi /
analyzed: de skad du smra ba de dag gi bsam pa ni de dag gi mtshan nyid rnams ni de dang mtshungs par ldan pa dag kho na la byed kyi /
translated: The intention of those who speak in this way is that the characteristics of those concomitant with the afflicted view of the self are the characteristics of the afflicted view of the self.

original: 'jig tshogs @182b la lta ba la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs @182b la lta ba la ni ma yin te /
translated: But they are not the characteristics of the afflicted view of the self itself.

original: de'i phyir de dag na de'i lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu ma yin no snyam pa 'di yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag na de'i lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu ma yin no snyam pa 'di yin no //
translated: Therefore they are not coemergent causes of the afflicted view of the self.

original: de dag gis kyang de skad du gdon par bya zhes bya ba ni de skad du ma bton na nyes te /
analyzed: de dag gis kyang de skad du gdon par bya zhes bya ba ni de skad du ma bton na nyes te /
translated: They should be stated in that way means that if they are not stated in that way, there is a fault.

original: de'i phyir de dang mtshungs par ldan pa rnams kyi zhes bya ba 'di gdon dgos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de dang mtshungs par ldan pa rnams kyi zhes bya ba 'di gdon dgos te /
translated: Therefore this must be stated: ‚ÄúThey are the characteristics of those concomitant with the afflicted view of the self.‚Äù

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba ni de dang mtshungs par ldan pa rnams kyi bdag nyid lta bur don dmigs pa dang bya ba gcig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba ni de dang mtshungs par ldan pa rnams kyi bdag nyid lta bur don dmigs pa dang bya ba gcig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the afflicted view of the self is the object and action of those concomitant with the afflicted view of the self, like the self.

original: de lta bas na bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyi bsam pa ni ji ltar mtshan nyid de dag de dang mtshungs par ldan pa de rnams kyi lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin pa de bzhin du 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i yang yin no snyam pa yin noüîΩ// yang na don gyis de ltar go bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni kha che ba rnams na re 'jig tshogs la lta ba smos pas 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa rnams kyang smos pa'am skabs kyi tshul gyis na de dag gis de dang mtshungs
analyzed: de lta bas na bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyi bsam pa ni ji ltar mtshan nyid de dag de dang mtshungs par ldan pa de rnams kyi lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin pa de bzhin du 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i yang yin no snyam pa yin no // yang na don gyis de ltar go bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni kha che ba rnams na re 'jig tshogs la lta ba smos pas 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa rnams kyang smos pa'am skabs kyi tshul gyis na de dag gis de dang mtshungs
translated: Therefore the intention of the Vaibhasikas is that just as those characteristics are coemergent causes of those concomitant states, so too they are coemergent causes of afflicted view of the self.üîΩOr it should be understood to mean that by implication,

original: par ldan pa rnams kyi zhes bya ba de ltar go bar bya'o zhes zer gyi /
analyzed: par ldan pa rnams kyi zhes bya ba de ltar go bar bya'o zhes zer gyi /
translated: the Kasmiri Vaibhasikas say that by mentioning afflicted view of the self, it should be understood that those concomitant with afflicted view of the self are also mentioned or that by context, those concomitant with it are mentioned.

original: nyi 'og pa dag ni ma yin no zhes ston par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: nyi 'og pa dag ni ma yin no zhes ston par byed pa yin no //
translated: But this is not the case for the Aparntakas.

original: de ni lhan cig 'byung ba yang yin no zhes bya ba ni sems pa la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: de ni lhan cig 'byung ba yang yin no zhes bya ba ni sems pa la sogs pa yin te /
translated: It is also a coemergent cause means that it is intention and so on.

original: sems pa la sogs pa dang mtshan nyid rnams ni sems kyi lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yang yin la de dag ni lhan cig 'byung ba yang yin no //
analyzed: sems pa la sogs pa dang mtshan nyid rnams ni sems kyi lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yang yin la de dag ni lhan cig 'byung ba yang yin no //
translated: and the characteristics such as the mind‚Äôs formative forces are coemergent causes of the mind and they are also coemergent.

original: chos kyi mthun pa'i mtshan nyid rnams zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni chos kyi skye ba'i skye ba la sogs pa ni lhan cig 'byung ba yin gyi /
analyzed: chos kyi mthun pa'i mtshan nyid rnams zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni chos kyi skye ba'i skye ba la sogs pa ni lhan cig 'byung ba yin gyi /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe characteristics of the primary elements that produce derivative form‚Äù means that the arising of the primary elements that produce derivative form is a coemergent cause of derivative form.

original: bskal pa'i phyir lhan cig 'byung pa'i rgyus rgyu ni ma yin te /
analyzed: bskal pa'i phyir lhan cig 'byung pa'i rgyus rgyu ni ma yin te /
translated: However, the primary elements are not a coemergent cause of derivative form because they are not simultaneous with it.

original: de dag ni skye ba la sogs pa la byed kyi chos la ni ma yin no //üîΩde dag phan tshun dang zhes bya ba ni mthun pa'i mtshan nyid de dag skye ba la sogs pa la byed pa'i phyir phan tshun lhan cig 'byung ba yin gyi /
analyzed: de dag ni skye ba la sogs pa la byed kyi chos la ni ma yin no // de dag phan tshun dang zhes bya ba ni mthun pa'i mtshan nyid de dag skye ba la sogs pa la byed pa'i phyir phan tshun lhan cig 'byung ba yin gyi /
translated: The primary elements are the cause of derivative form through their function as the cause of birth, but they are not the cause of derivative form through their function as a coemergent cause.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúthe characteristics of the primary elements‚Äù means that the arising of the primary elements is a coemergent cause of the characteristics of the primary elements.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúthe characteristics of derivative form‚Äù means that the arising of derivative form is a coemergent cause of the characteristics of derivative form.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúthe characteristics of the primary elements and derivative form‚Äù means that the arising of the primary elements and derivative form is a coemergent cause of the characteristics of the primary elements and derivative form.

original: lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyus rgyu ni ma yin no //
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyus rgyu ni ma yin no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe characteristics of the primary elements and derivative form‚Äù means that the arising of the primary elements and derivative form is a coemergent cause of the characteristics of the primary elements and derivative form.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúthe characteristics of the primary elements and derivative form‚Äù means that the arising of the primary elements and derivative form is a coemergent cause of the characteristics of the primary elements and derivative form.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúthe characteristics of the primary elements and derivative form‚Äù means that the arising of the primary elements and derivative form is a coemergent cause of the characteristics of the primary elements and derivative form.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúthe characteristics of the primary elements and derivative form‚Äù means that the arising of the primary elements and derivative form is a coemergent cause of the characteristics of the primary elements and derivative form.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúthe characteristics of the primary elements and derivative form‚Äù means that the arising of the primary elements and derivative form is a coemergent cause of the characteristics of the primary elements and derivative form.

original: chos ni gtso bo yin pa'i phyir de dag gi lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: chos ni gtso bo yin pa'i phyir de dag gi lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe characteristics of the primary elements and derivative form‚Äù means that the arising of the primary elements and derivative form is a coemergent cause of the characteristics of the primary elements and derivative form.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúthe characteristics of the primary elements and derivative form‚Äù means that the arising of the primary elements and derivative form is a coemer

original: de ni rgyal po dmag la chas pa rang gi 'khor bran dang bcas pa thams cad khrid par byed pa de bzhin du 'jug go //
analyzed: de ni rgyal po dmag la chas pa rang gi 'khor bran dang bcas pa thams cad khrid par byed pa de bzhin du 'jug go //
translated: Just as a king who is setting out on a military campaign takes his retinue and servants with him, so too does the mind take its concomitant factors with it.

original: sems kyi rjes su 'jug pa'i mthun pa'i mtshan nyid rnams dang zhes bya ba @183a * //
analyzed: sems kyi rjes su 'jug pa'i mthun pa'i mtshan nyid rnams dang zhes bya ba @183a * //
translated: The characteristics of the mind‚Äôs concomitants that are conducive to its activity

original: ni bsam gtan dang zag pa med pa'i sdom pa dag gi mthun pa'i mtshan nyid rnams kyang de kho na bzhin du sems kyi lhan cig 'byung ba yin gyi lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyus rgyu ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ni bsam gtan dang zag pa med pa'i sdom pa dag gi mthun pa'i mtshan nyid rnams kyang de kho na bzhin du sems kyi lhan cig 'byung ba yin gyi lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyus rgyu ni ma yin no //
translated: are also the mind‚Äôs co-arisen factors, just as the characteristics of the absorptions and the uncontaminated vows are the mind‚Äôs co-arisen factors, but they are not co-arisen causes.

original: nyid ces bya ba'i sgra ni don rab tu bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyid ces bya ba'i sgra ni don rab tu bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù is used to indicate that they are also co-arisen factors.

original: de dag phan tshun dang zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'brang ba'i mthun pa'i mtshan nyid rnams lhan cig 'byung ba yin gyi lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyus rgyu ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag phan tshun dang zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'brang ba'i mthun pa'i mtshan nyid rnams lhan cig 'byung ba yin gyi lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyus rgyu ni ma yin no //
translated: The characteristics of the mind‚Äôs concomitants that are conducive to its activity are also co-arisen factors, but they are not co-arisen causes.

original: rgyur byas pa'i gzugs thogs pa dang bcas pa phan tshun dang zhes bya ba ni rdul phra rab rdzas brgyad la sogs pa la gzugs dang dri dang ro dang reg bya'i mtshan nyid ni phan tshun lhan cig 'byung ba yin gyi lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyus rgyu ni
analyzed: rgyur byas pa'i gzugs thogs pa dang bcas pa phan tshun dang zhes bya ba ni rdul phra rab rdzas brgyad la sogs pa la gzugs dang dri dang ro dang reg bya'i mtshan nyid ni phan tshun lhan cig 'byung ba yin gyi lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyus rgyu ni
translated: Form derived from the elements that is impeded is mutually coexistent cause.

original: ma yin no //
analyzed: ma yin no //
translated: The characteristics of form, smell, taste, and tactility that are in the eight substances of the most subtle particle and so on are mutually coexistent cause, but they are not coexistent cause by way of being coemergent cause.

original: thogs pa dang bcas pa smos pa ni thogs pa med pas bstsal ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: thogs pa dang bcas pa smos pa ni thogs pa med pas bstsal ba'i phyir te /
translated: The term impeded is stated because it excludes the unimpeded.

original: thogs pa med pa rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid bsam gtan dang zag pa med pa'i sdom pa rnam pa bdun lta bu ni phan tshun lhan cig 'byung ba yang yin la lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyus rgyu yang yin no //
analyzed: thogs pa med pa rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid bsam gtan dang zag pa med pa'i sdom pa rnam pa bdun lta bu ni phan tshun lhan cig 'byung ba yang yin la lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyus rgyu yang yin no //
translated: The seven types of unimpeded form that is the nature of nonindicative states, such as the absorptions and uncontaminated vows, are both coexistent cause and coemergent cause.

original: thams cad 'byung ba dag dang lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni rgyur byas pa'i gzugs thogs pa dang bcas pa'am /
analyzed: thams cad 'byung ba dag dang lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni rgyur byas pa'i gzugs thogs pa dang bcas pa'am /
translated: All that arises from the elements is like the elements.

original: thogs pa med pa yang rung bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin du 'byung ba rnams dang lhan cig 'byung ba yin gyi lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyus rgyu ni ma yin no //
analyzed: thogs pa med pa yang rung bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin du 'byung ba rnams dang lhan cig 'byung ba yin gyi lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyus rgyu ni ma yin no //
translated: Or else, it is not a co-existent cause, even though it arises simultaneously with the aggregates, like the self.

original: thob pa dang ldan pa'i chos kyi thob pa lhan cig skyes pa rnams kyang lhan cig skye mod kyi lhan cig 'byung ba yin gyi lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyus rgyu ni ma yin no //
analyzed: thob pa dang ldan pa'i chos kyi thob pa lhan cig skyes pa rnams kyang lhan cig skye mod kyi lhan cig 'byung ba yin gyi lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyus rgyu ni ma yin no //
translated: The possession of a dharma and the possession of the possession of that dharma arise simultaneously, but the possession of the possession of a dharma is not a co-existent cause of that dharma.

original: thob pa sngar dang phyis skye ba rnams la ni lhan cig 'byung ba nyid mi srid pa'i phyir lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu nyid du thal ba med pas lhan cig skyes pa zhes khyad par du byas pa yin no //
analyzed: thob pa sngar dang phyis skye ba rnams la ni lhan cig 'byung ba nyid mi srid pa'i phyir lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu nyid du thal ba med pas lhan cig skyes pa zhes khyad par du byas pa yin no //
translated: The possession of a dharma that arises earlier or later is not a co-existent cause of that dharma, because it is impossible for it to arise simultaneously with it.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'bras bu dang rnam par smin pa dang rgyu mthun pa du ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'bras bu dang rnam par smin pa dang rgyu mthun pa du ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Because the effect, the ripened effect and the effect of equal outflow are not multiple.

original: 'di ltar de dag ni shing ljon pa'i phyi shun bzhin du rgyu mthun pa tha dad pa'i phyir thob pa dang ldan pa dang lhan cig skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu gcig pa yang ma yin la /üîΩsems med snyoms par 'jug pa dag //
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag ni shing ljon pa'i phyi shun bzhin du rgyu mthun pa tha dad pa'i phyir thob pa dang ldan pa dang lhan cig skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu gcig pa yang ma yin la / sems med snyoms par 'jug pa dag //
translated: They are not similar results, because they are not homogeneous, like the outer skin of a plantain tree.

original: 'phen byed ma yin thob pa'ang min //
analyzed: 'phen byed ma yin thob pa'ang min //
translated: They are not results of conscious effort, because they are not mind.

original: zhes 'byung ba'i @183b phyir rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu gcig pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ba'i @183b phyir rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu gcig pa yang ma yin no //
translated: They are not projecting results, because they are not karma.üîΩThey are not results of karmic maturation, because they are not non-conscious meditative attainments.

original: rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu gcig pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu gcig pa yang ma yin te /
translated: They are not similar results, because they are not homogeneous.

original: rgyu tha dad pa'i phyir thob pa rnams kyi rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu ni rgyu mthun pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: rgyu tha dad pa'i phyir thob pa rnams kyi rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu ni rgyu mthun pa kho na yin no //
translated: The similar result of obtainment is only homogeneous, because its cause is different.

original: sems kyi rjes su 'jug pa rnams kho na dang 'bras bu dang rnam par smin pa dang rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu gcig par 'dod kyi thob pa rnams dang ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sems kyi rjes su 'jug pa rnams kho na dang 'bras bu dang rnam par smin pa dang rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu gcig par 'dod kyi thob pa rnams dang ni ma yin no //
translated: It is asserted that only those that are concomitant with the mind are similar results, results of karmic maturation and results of conscious effort, but not obtainment.

original: de dag ni sems dang lhan cig spyod pa'i ngang tshul can te lhan cig spyod par ngang tshul can te lhan cig spyod par byed pa'i tshul can yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni sems dang lhan cig spyod pa'i ngang tshul can te lhan cig spyod par ngang tshul can te lhan cig spyod par byed pa'i tshul can yang ma yin no //
translated: They are not in the mode of co-occurring, nor in the mode of co-occurring together.üîΩAll of these are suitable,

original: de thams cad kyang rung mod kyi zhes bya ba ni re zhig gang lhan cig 'byung pa'i rgyus rgyu yin par de ni lhan cig 'byung ba yang yin no zhes bya ba rgyas par bshad pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de thams cad kyang rung mod kyi zhes bya ba ni re zhig gang lhan cig 'byung pa'i rgyus rgyu yin par de ni lhan cig 'byung ba yang yin no zhes bya ba rgyas par bshad pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: but first, whatever is a cause by way of co-originating cause is also co-originated.

original: sa bon la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni myu gu dang sdong bu dang 'dab ma la sogs pa bsdu'o //
analyzed: sa bon la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni myu gu dang sdong bu dang 'dab ma la sogs pa bsdu'o //
translated: The term ‚Äúseed, etc.‚Äù includes sprout, stem, leaf, etc.üîΩThe mode of this is not apparent,

original: tshul 'di mi snang zhes bya ba ni lhan cig 'byung ba dag gi rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po'i mtshan nyid kyi tshul mi snang ba ste /
analyzed: tshul 'di mi snang zhes bya ba ni lhan cig 'byung ba dag gi rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po'i mtshan nyid kyi tshul mi snang ba ste /
translated: the mode of the characteristics of the state of cause and effect of co-originated things is not apparent.

original: sa bon snga la myu gu 'phyi ba dang / bsnun pa snga la sgra 'phyi ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa bon snga la myu gu 'phyi ba dang / bsnun pa snga la sgra 'phyi ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the seed is prior and the sprout is later, and because the striking is prior and the sound is later.

original: dper na mar me dang 'od dag dang myu gu dang grib ma dag lta bu yin no zhes bya ba ci zhe na /
analyzed: dper na mar me dang 'od dag dang myu gu dang grib ma dag lta bu yin no zhes bya ba ci zhe na /
translated: What is the relationship?

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: The relationship of cause and effect.

original: mar me yang 'od dang bcas par 'byung gi /'od med par ma yin la myu gu yang nyin par skye ba nyid na grib ma 'byung mod kyi /
analyzed: mar me yang 'od dang bcas par 'byung gi /'od med par ma yin la myu gu yang nyin par skye ba nyid na grib ma 'byung mod kyi /
translated: A lamp arises together with its light, not without light. A sprout arises in the daytime, and a shadow arises together with the sprout.

original: 'on kyang mar me yang 'od kyi lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin la /
analyzed: 'on kyang mar me yang 'od kyi lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin la /
translated: However, a lamp is the homogeneous cause of its light.

original: myu gu yang grib ma'i yin pa de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: myu gu yang grib ma'i yin pa de dang 'dra'o //
translated: A sprout is the homogeneous cause of its shadow.

original: re zhig dpyad par bya'o zhes rgyas par 'byung ba la pha rol pa'i bsam pa ni dpe 'di ma grub po snyam pa yin no //
analyzed: re zhig dpyad par bya'o zhes rgyas par 'byung ba la pha rol pa'i bsam pa ni dpe 'di ma grub po snyam pa yin no //
translated: The opponent‚Äôs intention is that this example is not established.

original: tshogs pa sngar byung ba mar dang snying po la sogs pa kho na mar me 'od dang bcas pa 'byung ba'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: tshogs pa sngar byung ba mar dang snying po la sogs pa kho na mar me 'od dang bcas pa 'byung ba'i rgyu yin te /
translated: The collection of oil, wick, and so on that existed previously is the cause of the arising of the lamp and its light.

original: mar me dang 'od kyi rgyu ni tshogs pa de kho na yin gyi 'od kyi rgyu mar me yin par ni mi 'dod do //
analyzed: mar me dang 'od kyi rgyu ni tshogs pa de kho na yin gyi 'od kyi rgyu mar me yin par ni mi 'dod do //
translated: The cause of the light is just that assemblage, but the lamp is not asserted to be the cause of the light.

original: de bzhin du myu gu grib ma dang bcas par skye ba la /
analyzed: de bzhin du myu gu grib ma dang bcas par skye ba la /
translated: Similarly, when a sprout arises together with its shadow,

original: yang tshogs pa sngar byung ba sa bon dang nyi ma la sogs pa kho na brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: yang tshogs pa sngar byung ba sa bon dang nyi ma la sogs pa kho na brjod par bya'o //
translated: just that previous assemblage of causes, such as the seed, the sun, and so on, should be stated as the cause of the shadow.

original: nges par zhes bya ba ni gang zhig yod na chos gang zhig nges par yod pa yin gyi ma nges pa ni ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: nges par zhes bya ba ni gang zhig yod na chos gang zhig nges par yod pa yin gyi ma nges pa ni ma yin pa'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúcertainly‚Äù means that when something exists, a phenomenon certainly exists, but it is not uncertain.

original: de ni rgyu yin zhing cig shos ni rgyu dang ldan pa yin te /üîΩ'bras bu'i @184a * //
analyzed: de ni rgyu yin zhing cig shos ni rgyu dang ldan pa yin te / 'bras bu'i @184a * //
translated: That is the cause, and the other is endowed with the cause.

original: chos yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: chos yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúthe phenomenon that is the effect‚Äù is the shadow.

original: lhan cig 'byung ba'i chos dper na 'byung ba bzhi dang sems dang sems kyi rjes su 'jug pa rnams dang mtshan gzhi dang mtshan nyid rnams kyang gcig yod na thams cad yod la gcig med na yang thams cad med pas rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po rigs pa
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba'i chos dper na 'byung ba bzhi dang sems dang sems kyi rjes su 'jug pa rnams dang mtshan gzhi dang mtshan nyid rnams kyang gcig yod na thams cad yod la gcig med na yang thams cad med pas rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po rigs pa
translated: Coemergent phenomena are, for example, the four primary elements and the mind and mental factors that arise simultaneously with it, and also the characterized phenomena and their characteristics. If one exists, all exist and if one does not exist, all do not exist.

original: yin no // re zhig lhan cig 'byung ba rnams ni rung na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni lhan cig 'byung ba rnams la ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por 'dod de /
analyzed: yin no // re zhig lhan cig 'byung ba rnams ni rung na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni lhan cig 'byung ba rnams la ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por 'dod de /
translated: The reason for this is that coemergent phenomena are asserted to be causally related,

original: dper na mig ni mig ge rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig skye yang de skye ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba lta bu yin na /
analyzed: dper na mig ni mig ge rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig skye yang de skye ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba lta bu yin na /
translated: for example, the eye exists simultaneously with eye consciousness but it is the cause of that consciousness arising.üîΩHow can it be tenable that they are mutually related?

original: phan tshun du go ji ltar rung ste mig gi rnam par shes pa ni mig de'i rgyu yin no zhe na smras pa /
analyzed: phan tshun du go ji ltar rung ste mig gi rnam par shes pa ni mig de'i rgyu yin no zhe na smras pa /
translated: The eye consciousness is the cause of the eye.

original: yod dam med na de dag dang ldan pa'i gtan tshigs de nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: yod dam med na de dag dang ldan pa'i gtan tshigs de nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: If it exists or does not exist, it is the reason for possessing them.

original: yod pa dang med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: Because it exists and does not exist.

original: sems pa la sogs pa yod na sems yod pa'i phyir dang med na yang med pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: sems pa la sogs pa yod na sems yod pa'i phyir dang med na yang med pa'i phyir la /
translated: This means that if intention exists, then mind exists, and if it does not exist, then mind does not exist.

original: de dag kyang sems kyi rgyu yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de dag kyang sems kyi rgyu yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: And those are the causes of mind.

original: de lta na 'o na ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gal te gcig yod na thams cad yod la thams cad yod na yang gcig yod pas de'i phyir phan tshun rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yin na ni //
analyzed: de lta na 'o na ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gal te gcig yod na thams cad yod la thams cad yod na yang gcig yod pas de'i phyir phan tshun rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yin na ni //
translated: If that is so, then if one exists, all exist, and if all exist, then one exists. Therefore, if they are reciprocal causes and effects,

original: 'dod na dbang po med pa yi / phra rab rdul phran rdzas brgyad do //
analyzed: 'dod na dbang po med pa yi / phra rab rdul phran rdzas brgyad do //
translated: then if one atom exists without faculties, then all eight substances would exist.

original: zhes 'byung bas rgyur byas pa'i gzugs med na mi 'byung ba gzugs dang ro dang / dri dang reg bya'i ngo bo nyid kyang phan tshun der thal bar 'gyur te phan tshun lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes 'byung bas rgyur byas pa'i gzugs med na mi 'byung ba gzugs dang ro dang / dri dang reg bya'i ngo bo nyid kyang phan tshun der thal bar 'gyur te phan tshun lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: If that is so, then form, taste, smell, and tactility that do not occur without primary elements would also be mutually derived from each other, because they would be mutually coemergent causes.

original: 'byung ba rnams dang yang rgyur byas pa'i gzugs dang lhan cig lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'byung ba rnams dang yang rgyur byas pa'i gzugs dang lhan cig lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and the primary elements would be co-existent causes with the form derived from the elements.

original: sems kyi mthun pa'i mtshan nyid la sogs pa yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni sems kyi rjes su 'jug pa'i mthun pa'i mtshan nyid rnams kyang bsdu'o //
analyzed: sems kyi mthun pa'i mtshan nyid la sogs pa yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni sems kyi rjes su 'jug pa'i mthun pa'i mtshan nyid rnams kyang bsdu'o //
translated: And the characteristics of the mind‚Äôs concomitants, etc. The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes the characteristics of the mind‚Äôs concomitants that are in conformity with the mind.

original: sems la sogs pa dang zhes bya ba 'dir yang sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni sems kyi rjes su 'jug pa dag dang yang phan tshun rgyu nyid du thal bar 'gyur bar bstan to //
analyzed: sems la sogs pa dang zhes bya ba 'dir yang sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni sems kyi rjes su 'jug pa dag dang yang phan tshun rgyu nyid du thal bar 'gyur bar bstan to //
translated: And the mind, etc. The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù indicates that the mind‚Äôs concomitants would also be reciprocal causes.

original: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgra 'di nyid kyis thob pa lhan @184b cig skyes pa rnams dang thob pa dang ldan par yang der thal bar 'gyur ro zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgra 'di nyid kyis thob pa lhan @184b cig skyes pa rnams dang thob pa dang ldan par yang der thal bar 'gyur ro zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù should also be applied to the co-existent acquisition of the acquisition.

original: dbyu gu gsum phan tshun stobs kyis gnas pa bzhin du zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dbyu gu gsum phan tshun stobs kyis gnas pa bzhin du zhes bya ba la /
translated: Like three sticks supported mutually.

original: phan tshun stobs kyis gnas pa ni gcig gi mthus gcig gnas pa ste /
analyzed: phan tshun stobs kyis gnas pa ni gcig gi mthus gcig gnas pa ste /
translated: Mutual support means that they exist through the power of each other.

original: dbyu gu gsum phan tshun stobs kyis gnas pa bzhin du'o //
analyzed: dbyu gu gsum phan tshun stobs kyis gnas pa bzhin du'o //
translated: They are like three sticks supported by each other.

original: ji ltar dbyu gu gsum ste /
analyzed: ji ltar dbyu gu gsum ste /
translated: How are they like three sticks?

original: dbyu gu gsum phan tshun stobs kyis gnas pa de bzhin du lhan cig 'byung ba sems dang sems las byung ba rnams rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbyu gu gsum phan tshun stobs kyis gnas pa de bzhin du lhan cig 'byung ba sems dang sems las byung ba rnams rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as three sticks supported by each other exist, so too the mind and mental factors that arise simultaneously are established as cause and effect.üîΩThis should be investigated here.

original: re zhig ci 'dir dpyad par bya'o zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni 'di yongs su brtag par bya ba ste /
analyzed: re zhig ci 'dir dpyad par bya'o zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni 'di yongs su brtag par bya ba ste /
translated: This should be investigated, that is, this should be analyzed.

original: dpe 'di ma grub bo snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: dpe 'di ma grub bo snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: The example is not established.

original: dbyu gu gsum lhan cig 'byung ba de dag gi stobs te /
analyzed: dbyu gu gsum lhan cig 'byung ba de dag gi stobs te /
translated: The power of those three sticks that arise simultaneously is the power of their simultaneity.

original: lhan cig 'byung ba'i stobs des dbyu gu rnams gnas sam /
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba'i stobs des dbyu gu rnams gnas sam /
translated: Do the sticks exist through the power of their simultaneity?

original: 'on te tshogs pa snga ma'i dbang gis de ltar 'byung /
analyzed: 'on te tshogs pa snga ma'i dbang gis de ltar 'byung /
translated: Or do they arise in that way through the power of a prior collection?

original: 'on te ji ltar sngon 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa'i spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi tshogs pa'i dbang gis lhan cig gnas pa de kho na bzhin du phyis kyang phan tshun brten pa rnams 'byung ba yin /
analyzed: 'on te ji ltar sngon 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa'i spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi tshogs pa'i dbang gis lhan cig gnas pa de kho na bzhin du phyis kyang phan tshun brten pa rnams 'byung ba yin /
translated: Or else, just as the collection of general characteristics of the primary elements and that which is derived from the primary elements coexist through the power of the collection, in the same way, later on, the mutually dependent things arise.

original: de la gzhan yang cung zad yod do zhes bya ba ni phan tshun gyi stobs kho nar ma zad do zhes ston par byed do //
analyzed: de la gzhan yang cung zad yod do zhes bya ba ni phan tshun gyi stobs kho nar ma zad do zhes ston par byed do //
translated: Moreover, there is something else that exists in that, in order to demonstrate that it is not only through the power of mutual dependence.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na smras pa /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na smras pa /
translated: Why is that?

original: srad bu ste dbyu gu gsum gyi chings ma yin no //
analyzed: srad bu ste dbyu gu gsum gyi chings ma yin no //
translated: It is not a binding of three sticks with a string.

original: gzer bu ni phur bu zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzer bu ni phur bu zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: A peg is a stake.

original: rten par byad pas ni 'og nas so //
analyzed: rten par byad pas ni 'og nas so //
translated: It is supported below.üîΩAnd those means those coexistent things have other causes, such as the homogeneous cause, the omnipresent cause, the cause of karmic maturation and the enabling cause, like a string and so on.

original: de dag la yang zhes bya ba ni lhan cig 'byung ba de dag la yang skal ba mnyam pa dang kun du 'gro ba dang rnam par smin pa dang byed rgyu'i rgyu srad bu la sogs pa lta bu gzhan dag kyang yod pas lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu
analyzed: de dag la yang zhes bya ba ni lhan cig 'byung ba de dag la yang skal ba mnyam pa dang kun du 'gro ba dang rnam par smin pa dang byed rgyu'i rgyu srad bu la sogs pa lta bu gzhan dag kyang yod pas lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu
translated: Therefore, the coexistent cause is not a distinct cause.

original: nyid grub po //
analyzed: nyid grub po //
translated: and the virtuous are the virtuous.

original: nyon mongs pa rnams ni nyon mongs pa can rnams kyi yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams ni nyon mongs pa can rnams kyi yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: The afflicted are the afflicted.

original: nyon mongs pa can ni mi dge ba dang bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa rnams yin te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can ni mi dge ba dang bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa rnams yin te /
translated: The afflicted are the nonvirtuous and the obscured-neutral.

original: de dag ni nyon mongs pa can nyid du spyir skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu nyid yin no //üîΩdes na mi dge ba rnams kyang mi dge ba rnams kyi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin zhing bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa rnams @185a * //
analyzed: de dag ni nyon mongs pa can nyid du spyir skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu nyid yin no // des na mi dge ba rnams kyang mi dge ba rnams kyi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin zhing bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa rnams @185a * //
translated: They are the homogeneous cause of the afflicted in general.

original: kyang bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa rnams kyi yin la /
analyzed: kyang bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa rnams kyi yin la /
translated: Therefore nonvirtuous states are the homogeneous cause of nonvirtuous states and obscured-neutral states are the homogeneous cause of obscured-neutral states.

original: mi dge ba rnams bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa rnams kyi yang yin zhing bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa rnams kyang mi dge ba rnams kyi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi dge ba rnams bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa rnams kyi yang yin zhing bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa rnams kyang mi dge ba rnams kyi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Nonvirtuous states are the homogeneous cause of obscured-neutral states and obscured-neutral states are the homogeneous cause of nonvirtuous states.

original: lung du ma bstan pa rnams ni lung du ma bstan pa rnams kyi yin no zhes bya ba ni ma bsgrigs la lung du ma bstan pa rnams kyi yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //üîΩlung du ma bstan pa'i gzugs te /
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa rnams ni lung du ma bstan pa rnams kyi yin no zhes bya ba ni ma bsgrigs la lung du ma bstan pa rnams kyi yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // lung du ma bstan pa'i gzugs te /
translated: Undetermined form is the homogeneous cause of the five aggregates.

original: lung du ma bstan pa'i gzugs kyi phung po ni phung po lnga po dag gi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin la tshor ba la sogs pa phung po bzhi ni khyad par du 'phags pa'i phyir gzugs kyi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ma yin te /
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa'i gzugs kyi phung po ni phung po lnga po dag gi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin la tshor ba la sogs pa phung po bzhi ni khyad par du 'phags pa'i phyir gzugs kyi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ma yin te /
translated: Undetermined form is the homogeneous cause of the five aggregates because it is inferior. The four aggregates of feeling and so on are not the homogeneous cause of form because they are superior.üîΩThe Abhidharmakosa states,

original: mnyam dang khyad par can gyi yin //
analyzed: mnyam dang khyad par can gyi yin //
translated: They are the homogeneous cause of that which is equal and superior.

original: zhes 'byung ba dman pa'i skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu khyad par can yin par ni mi 'dod do //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ba dman pa'i skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu khyad par can yin par ni mi 'dod do //
translated: But it does not assert that an inferior homogeneous cause is superior.

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i gzugs ni mngon par bya ba las byung ba'i phyir mnyam pa dang khyad par can yang yin pas /
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i gzugs ni mngon par bya ba las byung ba'i phyir mnyam pa dang khyad par can yang yin pas /
translated: Since virtuous and nonvirtuous form arise from manifest karma, they are equal and superior.

original: de'i skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ni bzhi po yin no //
analyzed: de'i skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ni bzhi po yin no //
translated: Therefore the homogeneous cause of those is the four.

original: nur nur po ni nur nur po la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni mngal na gnas pa'i gnas skabs lnga po nur nur po dang mer mer po dang nar nar po dang mkhrang 'gyur dang rka lag 'gyus pa'i gnas skabs dag dang / skyes pa'i gnas skabs lnga po byis pa dang gzhon nu dang lang tsho dang dar la babs pa dang rgas pa'i gnas skabs dag ste /
analyzed: nur nur po ni nur nur po la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni mngal na gnas pa'i gnas skabs lnga po nur nur po dang mer mer po dang nar nar po dang mkhrang 'gyur dang rka lag 'gyus pa'i gnas skabs dag dang / skyes pa'i gnas skabs lnga po byis pa dang gzhon nu dang lang tsho dang dar la babs pa dang rgas pa'i gnas skabs dag ste /
translated: The child is the homogeneous cause of the child, the youth is the homogeneous cause of the youth, the adult is the homogeneous cause of the adult, and the aged is the homogeneous cause of the aged.

original: de ltar bcu po de dag ni gnas skabs bcu po de dag ni skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin te /üîΩnur nur po ni nur nur po gzhan gyi yin pa nas rgas pa'i par gyi yin no //
analyzed: de ltar bcu po de dag ni gnas skabs bcu po de dag ni skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin te / nur nur po ni nur nur po gzhan gyi yin pa nas rgas pa'i par gyi yin no //
translated: Thus these ten are the homogeneous causes of the ten stages.üîΩThe embryo in the first stage of kalala is the homogeneous cause of the embryo in the same stage of kalala.

original: mer mer po ni mer mer po gzhan gyi yin pa nas rgas pa'i bar gyi yin no //
analyzed: mer mer po ni mer mer po gzhan gyi yin pa nas rgas pa'i bar gyi yin no //
translated: The embryo in the second stage of arbuda is the homogeneous cause of the embryo in the same stage of arbuda.

original: de bzhin du rgas pa ni rgas pa kho na'i bar du yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du rgas pa ni rgas pa kho na'i bar du yin no //
translated: Similarly, the aged is the homogeneous cause of the aged.

original: ris mthun pa cig la ni re re phyi nas te re re bor nas brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: ris mthun pa cig la ni re re phyi nas te re re bor nas brjod par bya'o //
translated: In a single class affiliate, each is the homogeneous cause of the subsequent one, excluding each preceding one.

original: ris mthun pa rnam pa mthun pa gzhan dag tu ste /
analyzed: ris mthun pa rnam pa mthun pa gzhan dag tu ste /
translated: They are homogeneous causes of those of similar type in other realms.

original: gang gi tshe mi'i skye ba nas mi'i skye ba kho nar skye ba de'i tshe ni /üîΩgnas skabs bcu char yang gnas skabs bcu po dag gi yin te rgas pa'i gnas skabs kyang gnas skabs gzhan bcu char gyi bar du yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe mi'i skye ba nas mi'i skye ba kho nar skye ba de'i tshe ni / gnas skabs bcu char yang gnas skabs bcu po dag gi yin te rgas pa'i gnas skabs kyang gnas skabs gzhan bcu char gyi bar du yin no //
translated: When one is born as a human and only as a human,üîΩthen all ten stages are homogeneous causes of all ten stages.

original: rgas pa'i @185b gnas skabs de ni skad cig ma bzhin du ni tshe 'di'i rgas pa'i gnas skabs kyi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: rgas pa'i @185b gnas skabs de ni skad cig ma bzhin du ni tshe 'di'i rgas pa'i gnas skabs kyi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: The stage of aging is a homogeneous cause of the ten stages, up to and including the stage of aging in this life.

original: 'di'i tha ma ni tshe rabs gzhan gyi nur nur po la sogs pa gnas skabs bcu char gyi'ang skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin no zhes bya bar khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di'i tha ma ni tshe rabs gzhan gyi nur nur po la sogs pa gnas skabs bcu char gyi'ang skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin no zhes bya bar khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: The final moment of the stage of aging is a homogeneous cause of the ten stages, such as the embryo and so on, in other lives.

original: phyi'i dag la yang nas ni nas kyi yin la zhes bya bar rgyas par 'byung ba ni nas ni nas kyi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin gyi s'a lu'i ma yin la /
analyzed: phyi'i dag la yang nas ni nas kyi yin la zhes bya bar rgyas par 'byung ba ni nas ni nas kyi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin gyi s'a lu'i ma yin la /
translated: One should understand that external barley is a homogeneous cause of barley and not of rice.

original: s'a lu yang s'a lu kho na'i yin gyi nas kyi ni ma yin no //
analyzed: s'a lu yang s'a lu kho na'i yin gyi nas kyi ni ma yin no //
translated: Rice is the homogeneous cause of rice, not of barley.

original: de lta na 'dis ni lung du ma bstan pa nyid du mtshungs kyang rang gi rgyud kho na'i skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu nyid yin gyi skyed pa'i mthu med pa'i phyir rgyud gzhan gyi ni ma yin no zhes ston par byed do //
analyzed: de lta na 'dis ni lung du ma bstan pa nyid du mtshungs kyang rang gi rgyud kho na'i skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu nyid yin gyi skyed pa'i mthu med pa'i phyir rgyud gzhan gyi ni ma yin no zhes ston par byed do //
translated: This shows that, although they are similar in being neutral, they are the homogeneous cause of their own continuum, but not of another continuum, because they lack the power to generate.

original: 'das pa'i 'byung ba chen po rnams ni ma 'ongs pa'i 'byung ba chen po rnams kyi rgyu dang bdag po yin no zhes 'byung ba ni rgyu'i rkyen dang bdag po'i rkyen no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: 'das pa'i 'byung ba chen po rnams ni ma 'ongs pa'i 'byung ba chen po rnams kyi rgyu dang bdag po yin no zhes 'byung ba ni rgyu'i rkyen dang bdag po'i rkyen no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: The past primary elements are the cause and the dominant condition of the future primary elements. This means the causal condition and the dominant condition.

original: cig car 'byung ba med pa'i phyir lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yang ma yin no //
analyzed: cig car 'byung ba med pa'i phyir lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yang ma yin no //
translated: They are not coemergent causes because they do not occur simultaneously.

original: de nyid kyi phyir dang sems dang sems las byung ba ma yin pa'i phyir mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir dang sems dang sems las byung ba ma yin pa'i phyir mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu yang ma yin no //
translated: They are not concomitant causes because they are not minds or mental factors.

original: kun du 'gro ba ma yin pa'i phyir kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu yang ma yin no //
analyzed: kun du 'gro ba ma yin pa'i phyir kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu yang ma yin no //
translated: It is not a pervasive cause because it is not omnipresent.üîΩIt is not a cause of karmic maturation because it is neutral.

original: lung du ma bstan pa yin pa'i phyir rna par smin pa'i rgyu yang ma yin pas shugs kyis na skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu kho na yin no zhes bya bar shes so //
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa yin pa'i phyir rna par smin pa'i rgyu yang ma yin pas shugs kyis na skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu kho na yin no zhes bya bar shes so //
translated: Thus it is understood by implication that it is a homogeneous cause.

original: gal te 'dra ba rnams kyi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin na /
analyzed: gal te 'dra ba rnams kyi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin na /
translated: If similar states are homogeneous causes,

original: de lta na phyis skyes pa yang sngar skyes pa'i skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de lta na phyis skyes pa yang sngar skyes pa'i skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin par 'gyur zhing /
translated: then later states would be homogeneous causes of earlier states.

original: lhan cig skyes pa yang lhan cig skyes pa'i yin par 'gyur la /
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa yang lhan cig skyes pa'i yin par 'gyur la /
translated: Concomitant states would be homogeneous causes of concomitant states.

original: ma skyes pa yang ma skyes pa'i yin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: ma skyes pa yang ma skyes pa'i yin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: And nonarisen states would be homogeneous causes of nonarisen states.

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: de dag kyang thams cad ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag kyang thams cad ni ma yin no //
translated: Not all similar states are homogeneous causes.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: sngar skyes rnams /
analyzed: sngar skyes rnams /
translated: Earlier states are homogeneous causes of later states.

original: sngar skyes pa 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin pas shugs kyis nam 'ongs pa ni skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ma yin no zhes bshad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sngar skyes pa 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin pas shugs kyis nam 'ongs pa ni skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ma yin no zhes bshad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since past and present states that have already arisen are homogeneous causes, it is implicitly explained that future states are not homogeneous causes.üîΩThus past states are homogeneous causes of past and present states.

original: de ltar na 'das pa rnams ni 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba rnams kyi yin no zhes bya ba ni 'das pa sngar skyes pa @186a * //üîΩrnams ni 'das pa phyis skyes pa rnams kyi yin no zhes rnam par phye ste bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na 'das pa rnams ni 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba rnams kyi yin no zhes bya ba ni 'das pa sngar skyes pa @186a * // rnams ni 'das pa phyis skyes pa rnams kyi yin no zhes rnam par phye ste bshad par bya'o //
translated: Past states that arose earlier are homogeneous causes of past states that arose later.

original: 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba rnams ni ma 'ongs pa rnams kyi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin gyi /
analyzed: 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba rnams ni ma 'ongs pa rnams kyi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin gyi /
translated: Past and present states are homogeneous causes of future states.

original: ma 'ongs pa rnams ma 'ongs pa rnams kyi yin no zhes ni ma bshad pas de'i phyir skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ma 'ongs pa med do zhes bya bar khong du chud do //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa rnams ma 'ongs pa rnams kyi yin no zhes ni ma bshad pas de'i phyir skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ma 'ongs pa med do zhes bya bar khong du chud do //
translated: But it is not explained that future states are homogeneous causes of future states. Therefore it is understood that future states are not homogeneous causes.

original: nam yang ma yin no zhes bya ba ni nam yang rgyu ma yin pa ma yin no zhes bya bar skabs dang sbyar te /
analyzed: nam yang ma yin no zhes bya ba ni nam yang rgyu ma yin pa ma yin no zhes bya bar skabs dang sbyar te /
translated: Never not a cause means never not a homogeneous cause.üîΩThis is the context.

original: rgyu yin pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rgyu yin pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that it is a cause alone.üîΩTherefore, he thinks that future states are homogeneous causes.üîΩThe meaning of the statement that it is never not a causeüîΩis that it is a cause alone.

original: de lta bas na skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ma 'ongs pa yod do snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ma 'ongs pa yod do snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: The meaning of the statement that it is never not a cause is that it is a cause alone.üîΩThe meaning of the statement that it is never not a cause is that it is a cause alone.üîΩThe meaning of the statement that it is never not a cause is that it is a cause alone.üîΩThe meaning of the statement that it is never not a cause is that it is a cause alone.üîΩThe meaning of the statement that it is never not a cause is that it is a cause alone.

original: lhan cig 'byung ba dang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la lhan cig 'byung ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang / rnam par smin pa'i rgyu dag las dgongs pa ni thugs la dgongs pa ste /üîΩdes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba dang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la lhan cig 'byung ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang / rnam par smin pa'i rgyu dag las dgongs pa ni thugs la dgongs pa ste / des gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The meaning of the statement that it is never not a cause is that it is a cause alone.üîΩThe meaning of the statement that it is never not a cause is that it is a cause alone.üîΩThe meaning of the statement that it is never not a cause is that it is a cause alone.üîΩThe meaning of the statement that it is never not a cause is that it is a cause alone.üîΩThe meaning of the statement that it is never not a cause is that it is a cause alone.üîΩThe meaning of the statement that it is never not a cause is that it is a cause alone.üîΩThe meaning of the statement that it is never not a cause is that it is a cause alone.üîΩThe meaning of the statement that it is never not a cause is that it is a cause alone.üîΩThe meaning of the statement that it is never not a cause is that it is a cause alone.üîΩThe meaning of the statement that it is never not a cause is that it is a cause alone.üîΩThe meaning of the statement that it is never not a cause is that it is a cause alone.üîΩThe meaning of the statement that it is never not a cause is that it is a cause alone.üîΩThe meaning of the statement that it is never not a cause is that it is a cause alone.üîΩThe meaning of the statement that it is never not a cause is that it is a cause alone.üîΩThe meaning of the statement that it is never not a cause is that it is a cause alone.

original: lhan cig 'byung ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang / rnam par smin pa'i rgyu dag las dgongs nas gsungs pa de'i phyir nam yang rgyu ma yin pa ma yin no zhes gsungs pa la nyes pa med de bstan pa 'di ni phal che'i dbang du mdzad par bzhed do //
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang / rnam par smin pa'i rgyu dag las dgongs nas gsungs pa de'i phyir nam yang rgyu ma yin pa ma yin no zhes gsungs pa la nyes pa med de bstan pa 'di ni phal che'i dbang du mdzad par bzhed do //
translated: The meaning of the statement that it is never not a cause is that it is a cause alone.üîΩThe meaning of the statement that it is

original: tha ma'i gnas skabs de las dgongs nas zhes bya ba ni ma 'ongs pa tha ma'i gnas skabs de las dgongs nas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: tha ma'i gnas skabs de las dgongs nas zhes bya ba ni ma 'ongs pa tha ma'i gnas skabs de las dgongs nas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúfrom the perspective of its final state‚Äù means from the perspective of its final state in the future.

original: de'i bsam pa ni dus gsum char na yang rgyu yin no snyam pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i bsam pa ni dus gsum char na yang rgyu yin no snyam pa yin no //
translated: The intention is that it is a homogeneous cause in all three times.

original: de yi de ni lan du mi rung ste //
analyzed: de yi de ni lan du mi rung ste //
translated: That is not a suitable response.

original: zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni smra ba de'i lan du mi rung ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni smra ba de'i lan du mi rung ba'o //
translated: This is the response to that statement.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar chos de skye ba'i gnas skabs kyi sngon rol na skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ma yin pa las phyis yin pas te /
analyzed: 'di ltar chos de skye ba'i gnas skabs kyi sngon rol na skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ma yin pa las phyis yin pas te /
