translated: The path of meditation of lower level is superior to the path of meditation of higher level since it is enhanced by the remaining causes.üîΩThe path of seeing is not a homogeneous cause of the path of meditation because it is not a cause of the same status.üîΩThe path of meditation of lower level is equal or superior to the path of meditation of higher level in terms of the small of the small and so on, since it is enhanced by causes that are similar or dissimilar to it.

original: khyad par can ni rgyu'i rnam pa lhag ma re res rgyas par byas pa'i phyir ro //üîΩdad pas rjes su 'brang ba'i la ma ni drug gi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin no zhes gang bshad pa ji ltar na dad pas rjes su 'brang ba'i lam chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i lam gyi skal pa mnyam pa'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: khyad par can ni rgyu'i rnam pa lhag ma re res rgyas par byas pa'i phyir ro // dad pas rjes su 'brang ba'i la ma ni drug gi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin no zhes gang bshad pa ji ltar na dad pas rjes su 'brang ba'i lam chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i lam gyi skal pa mnyam pa'i rgyu yin te /
translated: The path of meditation of lower level is superior to the path of meditation of higher level since it is enhanced by the remaining causes.

original: de gnyis rgyud gcig lam mngon du 'gyur ba ni med do zhe na /
analyzed: de gnyis rgyud gcig lam mngon du 'gyur ba ni med do zhe na /
translated: The path of seeing is not a homogeneous cause of the path of meditation because it is not a cause of the same status.üîΩThe path of seeing is not a homogeneous cause of the path of meditation because it is not a cause of the same status.üîΩThe path of seeing is not a homogeneous cause of the path of meditation because it is not a cause of the same status.üîΩThe path of seeing is not a homogeneous cause of the path of meditation because it is not a cause of the same status.üîΩThe path of seeing is not a homogeneous cause of the path of meditation because it is not a cause of the same status.üîΩThe path of seeing is not a homogeneous cause of the path of meditation because it is not a cause of the same status.

original: de'i phyir rgyud gcig la dad pas rjes su 'brang ba dang chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i lam dag mi srid mod kyi byung ba ni ma 'ongs pa'i rgyu yin no zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyud gcig la dad pas rjes su 'brang ba dang chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i lam dag mi srid mod kyi byung ba ni ma 'ongs pa'i rgyu yin no zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, although it is impossible for the paths of faith-followers and Dharma-followers to exist in one mindstream, it is said that what has occurred is the cause of what has not yet occurred.

original: mi srid pa ni 'dir mngon du mi 'gyur ba la bya'o //
analyzed: mi srid pa ni 'dir mngon du mi 'gyur ba la bya'o //
translated: Here, impossible means not manifest.

original: med pa la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: med pa la ni ma yin te /
translated: It does not mean nonexistent,

original: dbang po rtul po rnams la yang dbang po rtul po'i lam bzhin du bdag nyid kyi dbang po rnon po'i lam dag kyang yod do //üîΩmthong bas thob pa dang dus kyi rnam par grol ba'i lam dag ni gal te dbang po 'pho bar byed na /
analyzed: dbang po rtul po rnams la yang dbang po rtul po'i lam bzhin du bdag nyid kyi dbang po rnon po'i lam dag kyang yod do // mthong bas thob pa dang dus kyi rnam par grol ba'i lam dag ni gal te dbang po 'pho bar byed na /
translated: because even those of dull faculty possess the path of sharp faculty, just as those of sharp faculty possess the path of dull faculty.

original: de'i rgyud la mngon du 'gyur yang srid do //
analyzed: de'i rgyud la mngon du 'gyur yang srid do //
translated: The paths of those obtaining results by insight and those liberated according to circumstances may manifest in their mindstreams if they upgrade their intellectual faculty.

original: de lta bas na dad pas rjes su 'brang ba'i lam byung ba ni chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i lam mi skye ba'i chos can dang dad pas mos pa dang mthong bas thob pa dang dus kyi rnam par grol ba dang dus dang mi sbyor bar rnam par
analyzed: de lta bas na dad pas rjes su 'brang ba'i lam byung ba ni chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i lam mi skye ba'i chos can dang dad pas mos pa dang mthong bas thob pa dang dus kyi rnam par grol ba dang dus dang mi sbyor bar rnam par
translated: Therefore the path of one who follows by faith does not generate the path of one who follows by the dharma.üîΩüîΩOne who is resolute in faith, one who obtains results by insight, one liberated according to circumstances, one liberated regardless of circumstances and one who is liberated by wisdom are respectively calledüîΩ

original: grol ba'i lam ma 'ongs pa skye ba'i chos can nam mi skye ba'i chos can mnyam pa dang khyad par can rnams kyi ci rigs par skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: grol ba'i lam ma 'ongs pa skye ba'i chos can nam mi skye ba'i chos can mnyam pa dang khyad par can rnams kyi ci rigs par skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: Therefore the path of one who is a follower of faith that has arisen is an equivalent homogeneous cause of the future path of one who is a follower of reality that has not arisen and is an equivalent homogeneous cause of the future path of one who is a follower of faith, one who obtains results by insight, one liberated according to circumstances, one liberated regardless of circumstances, whether they have arisen or not.

original: slob dpon dbyig bshes na de ni @193a * //
analyzed: slob dpon dbyig bshes na de ni @193a * //
translated: Master P≈´r·πáavardhana says:

original: gang gi tshe dad pas rjes su 'brang ba la sogs pa'i dbang po 'pho bar byed cing chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i lam la sogs pa mngon du byed pa na dad pas rjes su 'brang ba'i lam byung ba chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i lam ma byung
analyzed: gang gi tshe dad pas rjes su 'brang ba la sogs pa'i dbang po 'pho bar byed cing chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i lam la sogs pa mngon du byed pa na dad pas rjes su 'brang ba'i lam byung ba chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i lam ma byung
translated: When one who is a follower of faith upgrades their intellectual faculty, if they manifest the path of one who is a follower of reality and so on, the path of one who is a follower of faith that has arisen is an equivalent homogeneous cause of the future path of one who is a follower of reality that has not arisen and is an equivalent homogeneous cause of the future path of one who is a follower of faith, one who obtains results by insight, one liberated according to circumstances, one liberated regardless of circumstances, whether they have arisen or not.

original: ba dang / mthong bas thob pa'i lam gyi rgyu yin no zhes zer te /
analyzed: ba dang / mthong bas thob pa'i lam gyi rgyu yin no zhes zer te /
translated: and the cause of the path of seeing.

original: de ni dad pas rjes su 'brang ba'i dbang po rnams 'pho ba med pas rigs pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de ni dad pas rjes su 'brang ba'i dbang po rnams 'pho ba med pas rigs pa ma yin gyi /
translated: That is not logical, because the faculties of one who is a follower through faith are not transferred.

original: dad pas mos pa la sogs pa ni 'pho bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dad pas mos pa la sogs pa ni 'pho bar 'gyur ro //
translated: But one who is devoted through faith and so on can transfer.üîΩThose obtained from birth are the cause of those obtained from birth.üîΩThose obtained from birth are the cause of those obtained from birth.

original: sbyor ba las bzhes bya ba las sbyor bas grub pa ni sbyor ba las byung ba dag ste /üîΩsbyor ba las byung ba dag pa ni /
analyzed: sbyor ba las bzhes bya ba las sbyor bas grub pa ni sbyor ba las byung ba dag ste / sbyor ba las byung ba dag pa ni /
translated: Those arisen from the cause of application are the cause of those arisen from the cause of application.üîΩThose arisen from the cause of application are the cause of those arisen from the cause of application.üîΩThose arisen from the cause of application are the cause of those obtained from birth.üîΩThose arisen from the cause of application are the cause of those arisen from the cause of application and those obtained from birth.üîΩThose obtained from birth are the cause of those obtained from birth.

original: skyes nas thob pa can bsal ba'i phyir ro //üîΩ'dod pa na spyod pa'i thos pa las byung ba rnams zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi bka' thos pa las nges par byung ba gang dag yin pa de dag ni thos pa las byung ba'o //
analyzed: skyes nas thob pa can bsal ba'i phyir ro // 'dod pa na spyod pa'i thos pa las byung ba rnams zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi bka' thos pa las nges par byung ba gang dag yin pa de dag ni thos pa las byung ba'o //
translated: Those obtained from birth are the cause of those obtained from birth.üîΩThose arisen from the cause of application are the cause of those arisen from the cause of application and those obtained from birth.

original: bsams pa las byung ba rnams ni bsams pa las byung ba rnams kyi yin te zhes bya ba ni bsams pa las byung ba rnams kho na'i yin gyi /üîΩmnyam dang khyad par can gyi yin //
analyzed: bsams pa las byung ba rnams ni bsams pa las byung ba rnams kyi yin te zhes bya ba ni bsams pa las byung ba rnams kho na'i yin gyi /üîΩmnyam dang khyad par can gyi yin //
translated: Those obtained from birth are the cause of those obtained from birth.üîΩThose arisen from the cause of application are the cause of those arisen from the cause of application and those obtained from birth.üîΩThose obtained from birth are the cause of those obtained from birth.üîΩThose arisen from the cause of application are the cause of those arisen from the cause of application and those obtained from birth.üîΩThose obtained from birth are the cause of those obtained from birth.üîΩThose arisen from the cause of application are the cause of those arisen from the cause of application and those obtained from birth.üîΩThose obtained from birth are the cause of those obtained from birth.üîΩThose arisen from the cause of application are the cause of those arisen from the cause of application and those obtained from birth.üîΩThose obtained from birth are the cause of those obtained from birth.üîΩThose arisen from the cause of application are the cause of those arisen from the cause of application and those obtained from birth.üîΩThose obtained from birth are the cause of those obtained from birth.üîΩThose arisen from the cause of application are the cause of those arisen from the cause of application and those obtained from birth.üîΩThose obtained from birth are the cause of those obtained from birth.üîΩThose arisen from the cause of application are the cause of those arisen from the cause of application and those obtained from birth.üîΩThose obtained from birth are the cause of those obtained from birth.üîΩThose arisen from the cause of application are the cause of those arisen from the cause of

original: sbyor byung de gnyis kho na'i yin //
analyzed: sbyor byung de gnyis kho na'i yin //
translated: They are the result of both preparatory and natural states.

original: zhes 'byung ba'i phyir thos pa las byung ba rnams kyi ni ma yin no //üîΩbsgoms pa las byung ba ni med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i khams mnyam par gzhag pa ma yin pa'i phyir bsgoms pa las byung ba dag med do //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ba'i phyir thos pa las byung ba rnams kyi ni ma yin no // bsgoms pa las byung ba ni med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i khams mnyam par gzhag pa ma yin pa'i phyir bsgoms pa las byung ba dag med do //
translated: They are not the result of learning, because there is no learning in the formless realm.üîΩThey are not the result of meditation because there is no meditation in the formless realm.

original: bsams pa las byung ba ni med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bsams pa las byung ba ni med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: They are not the result of contemplation because there is no contemplation in the formless realm.

original: bsams pa las byung ba med pa'i gtan tshigs ni gang gi tshe de dag sems par rtsol ba de kho na'i tshe de dag gi ting nge 'dzin nyid nye bar gnas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: bsams pa las byung ba med pa'i gtan tshigs ni gang gi tshe de dag sems par rtsol ba de kho na'i tshe de dag gi ting nge 'dzin nyid nye bar gnas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The reason why there is no contemplation in the formless realm is that when they strive to contemplate, at that very time their concentration itself is present.

original: de dag kyang zhes bya ba ni thos pa las byung ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de dag kyang zhes bya ba ni thos pa las byung ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: They are also the result of learning.

original: chung ngu'i chung ngu dag ni thams cad kyi yin la zhes bya ba ni chung ngu'i chung ngu dag ni mnyam pa chung ngu'i chung ngu gzhan dag dang khyad par can chung ngu'i 'bring po la sogs pa gzhan brgyad kyi yang yin pas thams cad kyi skal baüîΩmnyam pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: chung ngu'i chung ngu dag ni thams cad kyi yin la zhes bya ba ni chung ngu'i chung ngu dag ni mnyam pa chung ngu'i chung ngu gzhan dag dang khyad par can chung ngu'i 'bring po la sogs pa gzhan brgyad kyi yang yin pas thams cad kyi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: The smallest of the small is the homogeneous cause of all because it is the homogeneous cause of the other eight types that are equal or superior to it, such as the other type that is the smallest of the small, the medium of the small and so on.üîΩThe medium of the small is the homogeneous cause of eight.

original: chung ngu'i 'bring po dag ni brgyad kyi yin te zhes bya ba ni rnam pa chung ngu'i chung ngu dor te de ni dman pa'i phyir @193b ro //
analyzed: chung ngu'i 'bring po dag ni brgyad kyi yin te zhes bya ba ni rnam pa chung ngu'i chung ngu dor te de ni dman pa'i phyir @193b ro //
translated: The medium of the small is the homogeneous cause of eight types, excluding the smallest of the small because it is inferior.

original: lugs ni de lta'o zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste chung ngu'i chen po ni bdun gyi yin la /
analyzed: lugs ni de lta'o zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste chung ngu'i chen po ni bdun gyi yin la /
translated: The system is as follows: The greatest of the small is the homogeneous cause of seven.

original: 'bring po'i chung ngu ni drug gi yin pa nas /
analyzed: 'bring po'i chung ngu ni drug gi yin pa nas /
translated: The smallest of the medium is the homogeneous cause of six.

original: chen po'i chen po ni ngo bo gcig pa chen po'i chen po gzhan dag gi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu'i bar du yin pa ste /
analyzed: chen po'i chen po ni ngo bo gcig pa chen po'i chen po gzhan dag gi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu'i bar du yin pa ste /
translated: The greatest of the great is the homogeneous cause of one type that is equal to it, the other greatest of the great.

original: de dang de dag ni dman pa yin pa'i phyir snga ma snga ma rnams ni dor bar bya'o //
analyzed: de dang de dag ni dman pa yin pa'i phyir snga ma snga ma rnams ni dor bar bya'o //
translated: Because they are inferior, the former are abandoned in favor of the latter.

original: skyes nas thob pa can gyi dge ba'i chos rnams zhes bya ba la skye bas thob pa ni skyes nas thob pa'o //
analyzed: skyes nas thob pa can gyi dge ba'i chos rnams zhes bya ba la skye bas thob pa ni skyes nas thob pa'o //
translated: The phrase virtuous qualities obtained from birth refers to virtuous qualities that are obtained from birth.

original: de 'di dag la yod pas skyes nas thob pa can dag go //
analyzed: de 'di dag la yod pas skyes nas thob pa can dag go //
translated: They are called those obtained from birth because they are obtained from birth.üîΩAll nine stages are homogeneous causes for each other.

original: rnam pa dgu po thams cad phan tshun du skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin te zhes bya ba ni chung ngu'i chung ngu rnams nas chen po'i chen po rnams kho na'i bar gyi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin la chen po'i chen po ni chung ngu'i chung nguüîΩrnams nas chen po'i chen po rnams kyi bar gyi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa dgu po thams cad phan tshun du skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin te zhes bya ba ni chung ngu'i chung ngu rnams nas chen po'i chen po rnams kho na'i bar gyi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin la chen po'i chen po ni chung ngu'i chung ngu rnams nas chen po'i chen po rnams kyi bar gyi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: The small-small stage is a homogeneous cause for the small-small stage up to the great-great stage. The great-great stage is a homogeneous cause for the small-small stage up to the great-great stage.üîΩThey are homogeneous causes for those of equal or superior stage, but not for those of inferior stage, because they are not the homogeneous cause of those that are not obtained.

original: mngon par 'du byed pa las byung ba ma yin pa'i phyir mnyam pa dang khyad par can dag kho na'i ni ma yin te /
analyzed: mngon par 'du byed pa las byung ba ma yin pa'i phyir mnyam pa dang khyad par can dag kho na'i ni ma yin te /
translated: They are not homogeneous causes for those that are not obtained, because they are not obtained through preparation.

original: skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu mngon par 'du byed pa'i las byung ba'i 'bras bu ni dman pa yin par mi 'dod kyi mngon par 'du byed pa med pa las byung ba'i ni ma yin no //
analyzed: skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu mngon par 'du byed pa'i las byung ba'i 'bras bu ni dman pa yin par mi 'dod kyi mngon par 'du byed pa med pa las byung ba'i ni ma yin no //
translated: The result of the action that arises from the homogeneous cause is not asserted to be inferior, but it is not the result of the action that arises from the nondiscerned cause.üîΩAlso, the afflicted is similar to that.üîΩBecause it does not arise from exertion, all nine types are the homogeneous cause of each other. Therefore all that arise previously are the homogeneous cause of all that arise later in their own level.

original: nyon mongs pa can rnams kyang de dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba ni brtsal ba las byung ba ma yin pa'i phyir rnam pa dgu po thams cad phan tshun du skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin pas sngar byung ba thams cad kyang rang gi sa pa phyis 'byung ba
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can rnams kyang de dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba ni brtsal ba las byung ba ma yin pa'i phyir rnam pa dgu po thams cad phan tshun du skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin pas sngar byung ba thams cad kyang rang gi sa pa phyis 'byung ba
translated: All that arise later are the homogeneous cause of all that arise previously in their own level.üîΩAll that arise later are the homogeneous cause of all that arise simultaneously in their own level.

original: thams cad kyi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: thams cad kyi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin te /
translated: All that arise simultaneously are the homogeneous cause of all that arise simultaneously in their own level.

original: 'di la mnyam pa dang khyad par can nyid la ltos pa ni med do //
analyzed: 'di la mnyam pa dang khyad par can nyid la ltos pa ni med do //
translated: In this context, there is no consideration of the equal or superior.

original: de dag ni go rims bzhin du bzhi dang gsum dang gnyis dang gcig dag gi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin no zhes bya ba la rnam par smin pa las skyes pa ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa la sogs pa bzhi'i skal pa mnyam pa'i rgyu
analyzed: de dag ni go rims bzhin du bzhi dang gsum dang gnyis dang gcig dag gi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin no zhes bya ba la rnam par smin pa las skyes pa ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa la sogs pa bzhi'i skal pa mnyam pa'i rgyu
translated: The second, arisen from enhancement, is a homogeneous cause of three: those arisen from enhancement, those arisen from preparation and those arisen from the elements.üîΩThe third, arisen from the elements, is a homogeneous cause of two: those arisen from the elements and those arisen from preparation.üîΩThe fourth, arisen from preparation, is a homogeneous cause of one: those arisen from preparation.üîΩThe second, arisen from enhancement, is a homogeneous cause of three: those arisen from enhancement, those arisen from preparation and those arisen from the elements.

original: yin no // spyod lam pa dag ni sprul pa ni spyod lam pa la sogs pa gsum kho na'i yin gyi rnam par smin pa las skyes pa rnams kyi ni ma yin te /
analyzed: yin no // spyod lam pa dag ni sprul pa ni spyod lam pa la sogs pa gsum kho na'i yin gyi rnam par smin pa las skyes pa rnams kyi ni ma yin te /
translated: The third, arisen from the elements, is a homogeneous cause of two: those arisen from the elements and those arisen from preparation.

original: de dag ni mngon par 'du byed pa las byung ba ma yin pa nyid kyis dman pa'i phyir ro //üîΩbzo'i gnas pa dag ni gnyis kyi yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni mngon par 'du byed pa las byung ba ma yin pa nyid kyis dman pa'i phyir ro // bzo'i gnas pa dag ni gnyis kyi yin no //
translated: The fourth, arisen from preparation, is a homogeneous cause of one: those arisen from preparation.üîΩThe second, arisen from enhancement, is a homogeneous cause of three: those arisen from enhancement, those arisen from preparation and those arisen from the elements.

original: sprul pa dag ni sprul pa rnams @194a * //üîΩkho na'i yin gyi gong ma rnams kyi ni ma yin te /
analyzed: sprul pa dag ni sprul pa rnams @194a * // kho na'i yin gyi gong ma rnams kyi ni ma yin te /
translated: The third, arisen from the elements, is a homogeneous cause of two: those arisen from the elements and those arisen from preparation.üîΩThe fourth, arisen from preparation, is a homogeneous cause of one: those arisen from preparation.üîΩThe second, arisen from enhancement, is a homogeneous cause of three: those arisen from enhancement, those arisen from preparation and those arisen from the elements.üîΩThe third, arisen from the elements, is a homogeneous cause of two: those arisen from the elements and those arisen from preparation.

original: snga ma snga ma dag ni chos mngon par 'du byed pa med pa las byung ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snga ma snga ma dag ni chos mngon par 'du byed pa med pa las byung ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The fourth, arisen from preparation, is a homogeneous cause of one: those arisen from preparation.üîΩThe

original: sprul pa'i sems bsam gtan bzhi'i 'bras bu 'dod pa na spyod pa yang yin te zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan bzhi po dag gi 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: sprul pa'i sems bsam gtan bzhi'i 'bras bu 'dod pa na spyod pa yang yin te zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan bzhi po dag gi 'bras bu ste /
translated: Also, the emanation mind is the result of the desire realm and the four absorptions.üîΩThe emanation mind of the desire realm is the result of the first, second, third and fourth absorptions.

original: sprul pa'i sems 'dod pa na spyod pa ni bsam gtan dang po dang gnyis pa dang gsum pa dang bzhi pa'i 'bras bu yin pas rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: sprul pa'i sems 'dod pa na spyod pa ni bsam gtan dang po dang gnyis pa dang gsum pa dang bzhi pa'i 'bras bu yin pas rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: It is of four types.

original: de yang go rims bzhin du bzhi dang gsum dang gnyis dang gcig dag gi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin no zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: de yang go rims bzhin du bzhi dang gsum dang gnyis dang gcig dag gi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin no zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: It is the homogeneous cause of four, three, two and one, respectively.

original: bsam gtan dang po'i 'bras bu ni bsam gtan dang po dang gnyis pa dang gsum pa dang bzhi pa'i 'bras bu'i ste /üîΩbzhi'i skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin no //üîΩbsam gtan gnyis pa'i 'bras bu ni bsam gtan gnyis pa dang gsum pa dang bzhi pa'i 'bras bu'i ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po'i 'bras bu ni bsam gtan dang po dang gnyis pa dang gsum pa dang bzhi pa'i 'bras bu'i ste / bzhi'i skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin no // bsam gtan gnyis pa'i 'bras bu ni bsam gtan gnyis pa dang gsum pa dang bzhi pa'i 'bras bu'i ste /
translated: The result of the first absorption is the homogeneous cause of four: the result of the first, second, third and fourth absorptions.üîΩThe result of the second absorption is the homogeneous cause of three: the result of the second, third and fourth absorptions.

original: gsum gyi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: gsum gyi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: The result of the third absorption is the homogeneous cause of two: the result of the third and fourth absorptions.üîΩThe result of the fourth absorption is the homogeneous cause of one: the result of the fourth absorption alone.

original: bsam gtan gsum pa'i 'bras bu ni bsam gtan gsum pa dang bzhi pa'i 'bras bu'i ste gnyis kyi yin no //
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum pa'i 'bras bu ni bsam gtan gsum pa dang bzhi pa'i 'bras bu'i ste gnyis kyi yin no //
translated: The result of the third absorption is the result of both the third and fourth absorptions.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa'i 'bras bu ni bsam gtan bzhi pa'i 'bras bu gzhan kho na'i ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa'i 'bras bu ni bsam gtan bzhi pa'i 'bras bu gzhan kho na'i ste /
translated: The result of the fourth absorption is the result of the fourth absorption alone.

original: gcig gi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: gcig gi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: It is the homogeneous cause of one.

original: 'dir gang gis de ltar nges pa'i rigs pa ci zhig yod ce na /
analyzed: 'dir gang gis de ltar nges pa'i rigs pa ci zhig yod ce na /
translated: What is the reasoning that ascertains it to be so?

original: rigs pa de bstan par 'dod nas bsam gtan gong ma'i 'bras bu ni bsam gtan 'og ma'i 'bras bu'i ma yin no zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /üîΩsprul pa'i sems 'dod pa na spyod pa bsam gtan bzhi pa'i 'bras bu ni sprul pa'i sems 'dod pa na spyod pa bsam gtan dang po'i 'bras bu nas sprul pa'i sems 'dod pa na spyod pa bsam gtan gsum pa'i 'bras bu'i bar gyi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu
analyzed: rigs pa de bstan par 'dod nas bsam gtan gong ma'i 'bras bu ni bsam gtan 'og ma'i 'bras bu'i ma yin no zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te / sprul pa'i sems 'dod pa na spyod pa bsam gtan bzhi pa'i 'bras bu ni sprul pa'i sems 'dod pa na spyod pa bsam gtan dang po'i 'bras bu nas sprul pa'i sems 'dod pa na spyod pa bsam gtan gsum pa'i 'bras bu'i bar gyi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu
translated: The result of higher absorption is not the result of lower absorption.

original: ma yin no //
analyzed: ma yin no //
translated: The result of the desire realm emanating mind that is the result of the fourth absorption is not the homogeneous cause of emanating minds of the desire realm that are the result of the first absorption up to the result of the third absorption.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: smras pa / skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu mngon par 'du byed pa can te /
analyzed: smras pa / skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu mngon par 'du byed pa can te /
translated: He said: Homogeneous cause is that which is formed.

original: 'bad pa chen pos bsgrub par bya ba'i 'bras bu ni de ltar 'bad pa chen pos bsgrub par bya ba ma yin pa dman pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'bad pa chen pos bsgrub par bya ba'i 'bras bu ni de ltar 'bad pa chen pos bsgrub par bya ba ma yin pa dman pa ma yin te /
translated: The result of that which is established by great effort is not inferior, that is, not established by great effort.

original: 'bad pa'i khyad par ji lta bus bsam gtan dang po nas bsam gtan gsum pa'i bar sgrub par byed pa de lta bu kho nas sgrub par @194b byed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'bad pa'i khyad par ji lta bus bsam gtan dang po nas bsam gtan gsum pa'i bar sgrub par byed pa de lta bu kho nas sgrub par @194b byed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not established by the very same specific effort that establishes the first absorption up to the third absorption.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: 'bad pa'i khyad par ches mchog tu gyur pas sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: 'bad pa'i khyad par ches mchog tu gyur pas sgrub par byed do //
translated: It is established by a specific effort that is far superior.

original: de lta bas na 'bras bu yang 'bad pa'i khyad par mchog tu gyur pas sgrub par byed do zhes bya bar khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'bras bu yang 'bad pa'i khyad par mchog tu gyur pas sgrub par byed do zhes bya bar khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, understand that the result is also established by a far superior specific effort.

original: bsam gtan 'og ma'i 'bras bu ni bsam gtan gong ma'i 'bras bu'i skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin gyi bsam gtan gong ma'i 'bras bu ni bsam gtan 'og ma'i 'bras bu'i ma yin no //
analyzed: bsam gtan 'og ma'i 'bras bu ni bsam gtan gong ma'i 'bras bu'i skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin gyi bsam gtan gong ma'i 'bras bu ni bsam gtan 'og ma'i 'bras bu'i ma yin no //
translated: The result of the lower meditative stabilization is the homogeneous cause of the result of the higher meditative stabilization, but the result of the higher meditative stabilization is not the homogeneous cause of the result of the lower meditative stabilization.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa'i 'bras bu sbyar ba ji lta bar bsam gtan gsum pa dang gnyis pa'i 'bras bu yang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa'i 'bras bu sbyar ba ji lta bar bsam gtan gsum pa dang gnyis pa'i 'bras bu yang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The result of the third meditative stabilization should be applied in the same way, and the result of the second meditative stabilization should be applied in the same way.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs so zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu mngon par 'du byed pa can gyi 'bras bu dman pa ma yin pa de'i phyir gsungs so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs so zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu mngon par 'du byed pa can gyi 'bras bu dman pa ma yin pa de'i phyir gsungs so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Therefore it is said is a general statement.

original: ci zhig gsungs she na /
analyzed: ci zhig gsungs she na /
translated: What is said?

original: zag pa med pa skyes pa zag pa med pa ma skyes pa'i rgyu ma yin pa yod dam zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
analyzed: zag pa med pa skyes pa zag pa med pa ma skyes pa'i rgyu ma yin pa yod dam zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
translated: It is said in detail: ‚ÄúIs there an unarisen uncontaminated dharma that is not the cause of an unarisen uncontaminated dharma?‚Äù

original: zag pa med pa sdug bsngal la chos shes pa skyes pa ni zag pa med pa sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod ba mi skye ba'i chos can rnams kyi rgyu ma yin pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: zag pa med pa sdug bsngal la chos shes pa skyes pa ni zag pa med pa sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod ba mi skye ba'i chos can rnams kyi rgyu ma yin pa lta bu ste /
translated: For example, the uncontaminated perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering is not the cause of the uncontaminated Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering that arises later.

original: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa ni mngon par 'du byed pa can nyid kyis sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dag pas khyad par du 'phags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa ni mngon par 'du byed pa can nyid kyis sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dag pas khyad par du 'phags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering is superior to perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering because it is formed by manifest effort.

original: 'di ltar nyon mongs pa'i bral ba'i thob pa dang lhan cig la skye ba gang yin pa de ni khyad par du 'phags pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar nyon mongs pa'i bral ba'i thob pa dang lhan cig la skye ba gang yin pa de ni khyad par du 'phags pa yin no //
translated: Thus that which arises simultaneously with the obtainment of freedom from affliction is superior.

original: khyad par can thams cad kyang dman pa'i rgyu ma yin pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: khyad par can thams cad kyang dman pa'i rgyu ma yin pa lta bu ste /
translated: For example, all special states are not the cause of inferior states.

original: dper na dgra bcom pa nyid las yongs su nyams pa'i mi slob pa'i lam skyes pa ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang phyir mi 'ong ba'i lam phyis skye ba dag gi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ma yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na dgra bcom pa nyid las yongs su nyams pa'i mi slob pa'i lam skyes pa ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang phyir mi 'ong ba'i lam phyis skye ba dag gi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ma yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the path of no more learning that arises from the degeneration of the state of an arhat is not the homogeneous cause of the paths of once return and nonreturn that arise later.

original: rgyud gcig la nges pa'i zag pa med pa'i chos sngon thob pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni rgyud gcig tu gtogs pa'i sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa ma 'ongs pa skad cig ma dang po kho na la thob pa de dag ni ma
analyzed: rgyud gcig la nges pa'i zag pa med pa'i chos sngon thob pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni rgyud gcig tu gtogs pa'i sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa ma 'ongs pa skad cig ma dang po kho na la thob pa de dag ni ma
translated: The Abhidharmako≈õa states,üîΩThose that are obtained in one continuum are not causes of those that have not arisen.üîΩThose that are obtained in one continuum are not causes of those that have not arisen.üîΩIn this context, the future perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering is obtained in the first moment alone.

original: skyes pa la chos shes pa skad cig ma gnyis pa la skyes pa'i rgyu ma yin te /
analyzed: skyes pa la chos shes pa skad cig ma gnyis pa la skyes pa'i rgyu ma yin te /
translated: Those that are obtained in the first moment are not causes of the future perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering that arises in the second moment.

original: 'di ltar 'bras bu snga ba ni @195a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'bras bu snga ba ni @195a * //
translated: Because there is no result that is earlier than its cause.

original: med do // 'di la ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dag pas sdug bsngal la chos shes pa chos snga ste /
analyzed: med do // 'di la ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dag pas sdug bsngal la chos shes pa chos snga ste /
translated: In this context, the perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering is earlier than the Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering.

original: de ni skyes zin pa'i phyir la de dag ni ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni skyes zin pa'i phyir la de dag ni ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the former has already arisen and the latter has not yet arisen.

original: yang na 'di ltar skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ma 'ongs pa med pa'i yang phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na 'di ltar skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ma 'ongs pa med pa'i yang phyir ro //
translated: Or, in this context, future homogeneous causes do not exist.

original: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa ma 'ongs pa dpag tu med pa zhig thob pa kho na yin gyi skyes pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa ma 'ongs pa dpag tu med pa zhig thob pa kho na yin gyi skyes pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The future perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering is obtained but does not arise.

original: zag pa med pa'i chos sngar skyes pa zhes bya ba gyis par 'byung ba ni gang du ma skyes pa ni skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ma yin no zhes thob pa tsam gyi chos shig dris par zad gyi  chos skyes pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i chos sngar skyes pa zhes bya ba gyis par 'byung ba ni gang du ma skyes pa ni skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ma yin no zhes thob pa tsam gyi chos shig dris par zad gyi  chos skyes pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúpreviously arisen uncontaminated dharmas‚Äù refers to the mere possession of a dharma that has arisen, not to a dharma that has arisen.

original: da ni ci skyes pa yang skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ma yin pa yod dam zhes khyad par gyi ngo bor 'bri ba yin no //
analyzed: da ni ci skyes pa yang skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ma yin pa yod dam zhes khyad par gyi ngo bor 'bri ba yin no //
translated: Now, the question is asked, ‚ÄúIs there a previously arisen dharma that is not a homogeneous cause?‚Äù

original: chen po chung ngu'i lta bu ste zhes bya ba ni khyad par can dman pa'i lta ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: chen po chung ngu'i lta bu ste zhes bya ba ni khyad par can dman pa'i lta ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The example is ‚Äúa great element in relation to a small element,‚Äù which means a superior element in relation to an inferior element.

original: 'di lta ste 'bras bu gong ma las yongs su nyams pa ste dgra bcom pa nyid kyi 'bras bu las yongs su nyams pa'am /
analyzed: 'di lta ste 'bras bu gong ma las yongs su nyams pa ste dgra bcom pa nyid kyi 'bras bu las yongs su nyams pa'am /
translated: For example, when one falls from a higher to a lower fruit, such as when an arhat falls from the fruit of arhatship.

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu las yongs su nyams pa 'bras bu 'og ma mngon du byed pa'i tshe ste phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu mngon du byed pa'am lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu mngon du byed pa'i tshe dgra bcom pa nyid gyi  lam chen
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu las yongs su nyams pa 'bras bu 'og ma mngon du byed pa'i tshe ste phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu mngon du byed pa'am lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu mngon du byed pa'i tshe dgra bcom pa nyid gyi  lam chen
translated: When fully degenerating from the result of nonreturn and manifesting the lower result, when manifesting the result of nonreturn or the result of once return, the path of an arhat is not generated.üîΩ

original: po'i chen po sngar skyes pa gang yin pa de ni phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'am lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu phyis skyes pa'i skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ma yin te /
analyzed: po'i chen po sngar skyes pa gang yin pa de ni phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'am lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu phyis skyes pa'i skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ma yin te /
translated: When one fully degenerates from the result of nonreturn and manifests a lower result, either the result of nonreturn or the result of once return, then any former path of the great of the great stage of a nonreturner is not a homogeneous cause of the result of nonreturn or the result of once return that arises later.

original: dman pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dman pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is inferior.

original: de bzhin du phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu las yongs su nyams pa'i phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'i lam sngar skyes pa gang yin pa de ni lan cig phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu phyis skyes pa'i skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu las yongs su nyams pa'i phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'i lam sngar skyes pa gang yin pa de ni lan cig phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu phyis skyes pa'i skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ma yin te /
translated: Similarly, any former path of a nonreturner that fully degenerates from the result of nonreturn is not a homogeneous cause of the result of once return that arises later.

original: de dman pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dman pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is inferior.

original: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa thob pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i thob pa sngar skyes pa gang yin pa de ni skad cig ma phyi ma dang lhan cig skyes pa ste skad cig ma phyi ma sdug

original: bsngal la chos su shes pa'i bzod pa'i mtshan nyid la sogs pa lam la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa'i bar dag dang lhan cig skyes pa sdug @195b bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i thob pa rnams kyi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ma yin no //üîΩci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: bsngal la chos su shes pa'i bzod pa'i mtshan nyid la sogs pa lam la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa'i bar dag dang lhan cig skyes pa sdug @195b bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i thob pa rnams kyi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ma yin no // ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Obtainment of perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering that arises earlier is not a homogeneous cause of that which arises later, that is, perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering that arises simultaneously with the later moment.

original: de dag ni dman pa'i phyir la de ni khyad par can yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩyang ji ltar na de dag ni dman pa nyid yin la de ni khyad par can nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: de dag ni dman pa'i phyir la de ni khyad par can yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩyang ji ltar na de dag ni dman pa nyid yin la de ni khyad par can nyid yin zhe na /
translated: Obtainment of perseverance for Dharma

original: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa bas ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa khyad par can yin te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa bas ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa khyad par can yin te /
translated: The perseverance for subsequent knowledge of the truth of suffering is distinguished from the perseverance for knowledge of the truth of suffering.

original: des gzhom par bya ba'i nyon mongs pa'i thob pa las rnam par grol ba'i phyir dang / rgyus shin tu rgyas par byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des gzhom par bya ba'i nyon mongs pa'i thob pa las rnam par grol ba'i phyir dang / rgyus shin tu rgyas par byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is liberated from the obtainment of the affliction to be abandoned by that perseverance, and because it is greatly extended by its cause.

original: de lta bas na sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i thob pa rgyus shin tu rgyas par byas pa dag pas kyang sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i thob pa'i khyad par can yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i thob pa rgyus shin tu rgyas par byas pa dag pas kyang sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i thob pa'i khyad par can yin no //
translated: Therefore, the obtainment of the perseverance for knowledge of the truth of suffering is distinguished from the obtainment of the perseverance for knowledge of the truth of suffering because it is greatly extended by its cause.

original: de dag ni dman pa yin te de'i thob pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni dman pa yin te de'i thob pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are inferior because they are its obtainment.

original: gzhan yang rgyu gnyis po de nyid kyi phyir sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i thob pa ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i thob pa skad cig ma dang po la skyes pa bas khyad par can yin la sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i thob
analyzed: gzhan yang rgyu gnyis po de nyid kyi phyir sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i thob pa ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i thob pa skad cig ma dang po la skyes pa bas khyad par can yin la sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i thob
translated: Moreover, the obtainment of knowledge of the truth of suffering is distinguished from the obtainment of the perseverance for knowledge of the truth of suffering that arises in the first moment because of those two causes. The obtainment of the perseverance for knowledge of the truth of suffering is distinguished from the obtainment of the perseverance for subsequent knowledge of the truth of suffering that arises in the second moment because of those two causes.

original: pa de ni dman pa yin no //
analyzed: pa de ni dman pa yin no //
translated: That is inferior.

original: de'i phyir de sngon du 'gro ba skad cig ma phyi ma dang lhan cig skyes pa sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i thob pa gzhan dag kyang rgyus shin tu rgyas par byas pa yin yang dman pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de sngon du 'gro ba skad cig ma phyi ma dang lhan cig skyes pa sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i thob pa gzhan dag kyang rgyus shin tu rgyas par byas pa yin yang dman pa kho na yin no //
translated: Therefore, even though the obtainment of subsequent perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering that arises simultaneously with the latter moment is also enhanced by its cause, it is still inferior.

original: de lta bas na de dag gi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na de dag gi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ma yin no //
translated: Therefore it is not a homogeneous cause of those.

original: mtshungs ldan rgyu ni sems dag dang / sems byung zhes bya ba la /üîΩni zhes bya ba'i sgra ni nges par gzung ba'am /
analyzed: mtshungs ldan rgyu ni sems dag dang / sems byung zhes bya ba la / ni zhes bya ba'i sgra ni nges par gzung ba'am /
translated: Corresponding cause is mind and mental factors.üîΩThe word ‚Äúonly‚Äù in the expression ‚Äúonly mind and mental factors‚Äù is for the sake of emphasis.

original: mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu ni sems dang sems las byung ba dag kho na yin no zhes rim pa gzhan du sbyar ba yin no //üîΩde lta na ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gal te mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu ni sems dang sems las byung ba kho na yin no //
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu ni sems dang sems las byung ba dag kho na yin no zhes rim pa gzhan du sbyar ba yin no //üîΩde lta na ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gal te mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu ni sems dang sems las byung ba kho na yin no //
translated: Or it is used to indicate that the corresponding cause is only mind and mental factors.üîΩIf that is so, then it follows that the obtainment of perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering would not be a homogeneous cause of subsequent perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering.

original: zhes de tsam zhig brjod na ni dus tha dad las skyes pa rnams kyang dus tha dad pa las tha dad pa las skyes pa dag dang lhan cig mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyur thal ba 'gyur la /
analyzed: zhes de tsam zhig brjod na ni dus tha dad las skyes pa rnams kyang dus tha dad pa las tha dad pa las skyes pa dag dang lhan cig mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyur thal ba 'gyur la /
translated: If it is said that they are similar to each other in merely that respect, then it follows that those that arise from different times would be coemergent causes of those that arise from different times.

original: rgyu tha dad pa las skyes pa rnams kyang rgyu tha dad pa las skyes pa dag dang lhan cig mtshungs par ldan @196a * //üîΩpa'i rgyur thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: rgyu tha dad pa las skyes pa rnams kyang rgyu tha dad pa las skyes pa dag dang lhan cig mtshungs par ldan @196a * // pa'i rgyur thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: And it follows that those that arise from different causes would be coemergent causes of those that arise from different causes.

original: dus dang rgyud kyis tha dad pa da dag sems dang sems las byung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: dus dang rgyud kyis tha dad pa da dag sems dang sems las byung ba ma yin no //
translated: Because those that are different in time and continuum are not minds and mental factors.üîΩIf they are similar in aspect and focal object,

original: 'o na ni rnam pa dang dmigs pa gcig pa dag yin no zhes bya ba ni gal te sems dang sems las byung ba dag rnam pa gcig pa ste /
analyzed: 'o na ni rnam pa dang dmigs pa gcig pa dag yin no zhes bya ba ni gal te sems dang sems las byung ba dag rnam pa gcig pa ste /
translated: if minds and mental factors are similar in aspect,

original: sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa gcig pa can dang dmigs pa gcig pa ste /
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa gcig pa can dang dmigs pa gcig pa ste /
translated: they have the same aspect such as blue.

original: sngon po la sogs pa'i dmigs pa gcig pa yin na /
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa'i dmigs pa gcig pa yin na /
translated: If they are similar in focal object,üîΩthey have the same focal object such as blue.

original: de lta na de dag na mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //üîΩde ltar na dus tha dad pa las skyes pa nyid dang rgyud tha dad pa las skyes pa nyid bzlog par 'gyur ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta na de dag na mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no // de ltar na dus tha dad pa las skyes pa nyid dang rgyud tha dad pa las skyes pa nyid bzlog par 'gyur ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: Thus they are homogeneous causes only when they are similar, not otherwise.üîΩThus he thinks that the error of being born from a different time and a different stream is thereby avoided.

original: de lta na yang de nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni dus dang rgyud tha dad pa las skyes pa rnams phan tshun mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: de lta na yang de nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni dus dang rgyud tha dad pa las skyes pa rnams phan tshun mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: Still, the error of being born from a different time and a different stream would occur, because it would follow that those born from a different time and a different stream would be homogeneous causes of each other.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba dus dang rgyud tha dad pa las skyes pa rnams la yang rnam pa dang dmigs pa gcig pa nyid ni srid do //üîΩrgyud tha dad pa las skyes pa rnams la yang thal bar 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni dus tha dad pa las skyes pa nyid gcig pu bstsal bar zad kyi /
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba dus dang rgyud tha dad pa las skyes pa rnams la yang rnam pa dang dmigs pa gcig pa nyid ni srid do //üîΩrgyud tha dad pa las skyes pa rnams la yang thal bar 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni dus tha dad pa las skyes pa nyid gcig pu bstsal bar zad kyi /
translated: It is possible that minds and mental factors born from a different time and a different stream have the same aspect and object.üîΩThe error of being born from a different stream would occur, because it is possible that minds and mental factors born from a different stream have the same aspect and object.

original: mang po zla ba tshes pa la sogs pa la lta ba dag ni sems dang sems las byung ba rnam pa dang dmigs pa gcig pa rnams 'byung ngo //
analyzed: mang po zla ba tshes pa la sogs pa la lta ba dag ni sems dang sems las byung ba rnam pa dang dmigs pa gcig pa rnams 'byung ngo //
translated: Many minds and mental factors arise simultaneously, such as the mind and mental factors that view the moon‚Äôs crescent.

original: rten mtshungs pa can rnams so zhes bya ba ni 'di dag la rten mtshungs shing tha mi dad pa yod pas na rten mtshungs pa dag ste /
analyzed: rten mtshungs pa can rnams so zhes bya ba ni 'di dag la rten mtshungs shing tha mi dad pa yod pas na rten mtshungs pa dag ste /
translated: They are similar supports because they exist as similar, undifferentiated supports.

original: mtshungs pa zhes bya ba'i sgra 'dra ba'i don yin par bzung na ni rigs 'dra ba'i phyir de nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //üîΩphan tshun 'bras bu'i don gyis na zhes bya ba ni ji ltar na 'gron pa rnams phan tshun gyi stobs kyis lhan cig lam du 'gro ba de bzhin du sems kyang sems las byung ba'i 'bras bu yin la /
analyzed: mtshungs pa zhes bya ba'i sgra 'dra ba'i don yin par bzung na ni rigs 'dra ba'i phyir de nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro // phan tshun 'bras bu'i don gyis na zhes bya ba ni ji ltar na 'gron pa rnams phan tshun gyi stobs kyis lhan cig lam du 'gro ba de bzhin du sems kyang sems las byung ba'i 'bras bu yin la /
translated: If the term similar is taken to mean similar in meaning, then it would follow that they are the same.üîΩThey are similar in being mutually resultant.üîΩJust as travelers proceed on a road by the power of each other, so too the mind is the result of mental factors and mental factors are the result of the mind.

original: sems las byung ba yang sems kyi yin pas na phan tshun du 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir don 'dis lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: sems las byung ba yang sems kyi yin pas na phan tshun du 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir don 'dis lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin no //
translated: They are similar in being mutually resultant. By this meaning, they are coemergent causes.

original: mtshungs pa lngas zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni mtshungs pa lnga po rten dang dmigs pa dang rnam pa dang dus dang rdzas mtshungs pa dag gis zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mtshungs pa lngas zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni mtshungs pa lnga po rten dang dmigs pa dang rnam pa dang dus dang rdzas mtshungs pa dag gis zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: They are similar in terms of basis, object, aspect, time, and substance.

original: @196b mtshungs par ldan pa'i don gyis na zhes bya ba ni mtshungs par 'jug pa'i don gyis na mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu yin te /üîΩji ltar phan tshun stobs kyis lam du 'gro ba'i 'gron pa de dag nyid zas dang skom dang khrus dang mal cha dang stan la sogs pa yongs su spyad pa'i bya ba la 'dra bar sbyor ba de bzhin du 'di dag kyang phan tshun mtshungs par ldan pa
analyzed: @196b mtshungs par ldan pa'i don gyis na zhes bya ba ni mtshungs par 'jug pa'i don gyis na mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu yin te / ji ltar phan tshun stobs kyis lam du 'gro ba'i 'gron pa de dag nyid zas dang skom dang khrus dang mal cha dang stan la sogs pa yongs su spyad pa'i bya ba la 'dra bar sbyor ba de bzhin du 'di dag kyang phan tshun mtshungs par ldan pa
translated: They are similar in terms of the meaning of association, that is, they are similar in terms of the meaning of similar engagement.

original: nyid yin no //
analyzed: nyid yin no //
translated: Just as travelers on a road who mutually assist each other are similar in their application to the activities of using food, drink, bathing, bedding, seats and so on, so too they are similar in being mutually concomitant.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gcig med na yang thams cad mtshungs par ldan pas zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gcig med na yang thams cad mtshungs par ldan pas zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore it is said, ‚ÄúEven if one is absent, all are concomitant.‚Äù

original: kun 'gro lnga zhes bya ba ni de dag kun du 'gro ba yang yin la snga ma yang yin pas kun 'gro snga ma yin te /üîΩkun du 'gro ba sngar skyes pa rnams zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //üîΩrang gi sa pa'i kun du 'gro ba'i chos sngar skyes pa rnams zhes bya ba ni phra rgyas kun du 'gro ba 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba rnams te /üîΩnyon mongs pa can nyon mongs pa'i ngo bo nyid dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang kun nas bslang ba phyi ma 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba phyi ma rnams dang ma 'ongs pa rnams kyi kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu yin no //üîΩbshad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni mdzod kyi gnas lnga pa las /
analyzed: kun 'gro lnga zhes bya ba ni de dag kun du 'gro ba yang yin la snga ma yang yin pas kun 'gro snga ma yin te / kun du 'gro ba sngar skyes pa rnams zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // rang gi sa pa'i kun du 'gro ba'i chos sngar skyes pa rnams zhes bya ba ni phra rgyas kun du 'gro ba 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba rnams te / nyon mongs pa can nyon mongs pa'i ngo bo nyid dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang kun nas bslang ba phyi ma 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba phyi ma rnams dang ma 'ongs pa rnams kyi kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu yin no // bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni mdzod kyi gnas lnga pa las /
translated: The five omnipresent mental factors are called omnipresent and prior because they are omnipresent and prior.üîΩThey are called omnipresent and prior because they are omnipresent and prior.üîΩThey are called omnipresent and prior because they are omnipresent and prior.

analyzed: lta dang de bzhin the tshom dang // gang de lhan cig ma 'dres pa'i //
translated: They are called omnipresent and prior because they are omnipresent and prior.üîΩThey are called omnipresent and prior because they are omnipresent and prior.üîΩThey are called omnipresent and prior because they are omni

original: ma rig gang yin kun du 'gro //
analyzed: ma rig gang yin kun du 'gro //
translated: That which is ignorance is omnipresent.

translated: Since it is the common cause of afflicted phenomena, it is omnipresent.üîΩSince it is the common cause of afflicted phenomena, it is omnipresent.

original: de dag gi mthus ni zhes bya ba ni kun du 'gro ba de dag gi mthus ris gzhan pa'i nyon mongs pa 'dod chags la sogs pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag gi mthus ni zhes bya ba ni kun du 'gro ba de dag gi mthus ris gzhan pa'i nyon mongs pa 'dod chags la sogs pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By the power of those means that by the power of those omnipresent ones, other types of affliction such as attachment arise.

original: de dag kyang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de dag kyang gang zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu sdug bsngal @197a * //
analyzed: kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu sdug bsngal @197a * //
translated: The other type that is to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering is the cause of the omnipresent ones.

original: mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i ris gzhan ni kun 'byung ba dang 'gog pa dang lam mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba dag yin no //
analyzed: mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i ris gzhan ni kun 'byung ba dang 'gog pa dang lam mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba dag yin no //
translated: The other type that is to be abandoned by seeing the truth of origin is the cause of the other type that is to be abandoned by seeing the truths of cessation and path.üîΩThe other type that is to be abandoned by seeing the truth of cessation is the cause of the other type that is to be abandoned by seeing the truth of the path.

original: kun du 'gro bas kun 'byung mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i ris gzhan ni sdug bsngal dang 'gog pa dang lam mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba dag yin no //
analyzed: kun du 'gro bas kun 'byung mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i ris gzhan ni sdug bsngal dang 'gog pa dang lam mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba dag yin no //
translated: The other type that is to be abandoned by seeing the truth of the path is the cause of the other type that is to be abandoned by the path of meditation.

original: nyon mongs pa'i ris thams cad du 'gro zhing dmigs pa'am nyon mongs pa'i ris thams cad kyi rgyu'i dngos por 'gyur bas na kun du 'gro ba dag yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i ris thams cad du 'gro zhing dmigs pa'am nyon mongs pa'i ris thams cad kyi rgyu'i dngos por 'gyur bas na kun du 'gro ba dag yin no //
translated: They are omnipresent because they pervade all types of affliction and they are objects of observation or they are the cause of all types of affliction.

original: de nyid kyi phyir nyon mongs pa thams cad ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rtsa ba can yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir nyon mongs pa thams cad ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rtsa ba can yin no //
translated: Therefore, all the defilements have the view of the transitory composite as their root.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba las rab tu skye ba dang / 'jig tshogs la lta ba las kun 'byung ba yin no zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba las rab tu skye ba dang / 'jig tshogs la lta ba las kun 'byung ba yin no zhes gsungs te /
translated: They arise from the view of the transitory composite and originate from the view of the transitory composite.

original: bdag tu 'dzin pa'i sgo nas 'dod chags dang nga rgyal dang khong khro ba la sogs pa kun 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag tu 'dzin pa'i sgo nas 'dod chags dang nga rgyal dang khong khro ba la sogs pa kun 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because attachment, pride, anger, etc., originate through the apprehension of a self.üîΩThe VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas ask: If all the defilements are abandoned by the path of vision, how can the noble ones who are not detached from attachment, etc.,üîΩbe said to be endowed with the abandonment of defilements?üîΩThe VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas think that the defilements of the noble ones are not universal, that is, not related to all the stages, and that they are not the cause of the universal defilements.

original: ji 'phags pa'i gang zag gi nyon mongs pa can gyi chos rnams kyang zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i gang zag gi kun du 'gro ba rnams ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir thams cad spang pa kho na yin la 'dod chags la sogs paüîΩni slob pa rnams kun du spyod de /
analyzed: ji 'phags pa'i gang zag gi nyon mongs pa can gyi chos rnams kyang zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i gang zag gi kun du 'gro ba rnams ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir thams cad spang pa kho na yin la 'dod chags la sogs pa ni slob pa rnams kun du spyod de /
translated: The VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas ask: If all the defilements are abandoned by the path of vision, how can the noble ones who are not detached from attachment, etc.,üîΩbe said to be endowed with the abandonment of defilements?

original: de dag gi 'dod chags la sogs pa de dag ni kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu can ma yin no snyam du sems shing de skad du 'dri ba yin no //
analyzed: de dag gi 'dod chags la sogs pa de dag ni kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu can ma yin no snyam du sems shing de skad du 'dri ba yin no //
translated: The VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas think that the defilements of the noble ones are not universal, that is, not related to all the stages, and that they are not the cause of the universal defilements.

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi chos rnams zhes bya ba ni bye brag tu ma phye ba'i phyir so so'i skye bo dang 'phags pa'i rgyud las skyes pa rnams zhes bya bar shes so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi chos rnams zhes bya ba ni bye brag tu ma phye ba'i phyir so so'i skye bo dang 'phags pa'i rgyud las skyes pa rnams zhes bya bar shes so //
translated: Contaminated phenomena refers to those that arise in the mindstreams of ordinary beings and ƒÅryas because it is not specified.

original: mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i chos rnams kyi rnam par smin pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba 'di ni don yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir smos pa yin gyi 'di dper brjod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i chos rnams kyi rnam par smin pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba 'di ni don yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir smos pa yin gyi 'di dper brjod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The phrase the karmic maturation of phenomena to be abandoned by the path of seeing is stated to complete the meaning, but it is not an example.

original: lung du ma bstan pa'i chos 'dus byas rnams zhes bya ba ni bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa dang ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa rnams bzung ste bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa dag ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa'i chos 'dus byas rnams zhes bya ba ni bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa dang ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa rnams bzung ste bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa dag ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang
translated: The phrase conditioned unobscured neutral phenomena refers to both obscured neutral and unobscured neutral phenomena.

original: mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang / kun nas bslang ba'i chos rnams dang gzugs dang gzugs @197b med pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa can gyi chos rnams so //
analyzed: mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang / kun nas bslang ba'i chos rnams dang gzugs dang gzugs @197b med pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa can gyi chos rnams so //
translated: and the extreme view and that which is concomitant with it and the phenomena motivated by it and afflicted phenomena of the form and formless realms.

original: 'dus byas smos pa ni nam mkha' dang so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa bstsal ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'dus byas smos pa ni nam mkha' dang so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa bstsal ba'i phyir te /
translated: The term conditioned refers to space and nonanalytical cessation because they are neutral states,

original: yang dag lung ma bstan bstan dag / ces 'byung bas de gnyis lung du ma bstan pa yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde la 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa can gyi chos rnams ni ci rigs par 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa de dag nyid skal ba mnyam pa dang kun du 'gro ba dang lhan cig 'byung ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyur gyur pa
analyzed: yang dag lung ma bstan bstan dag / ces 'byung bas de gnyis lung du ma bstan pa yin pa'i phyir ro // de la 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa can gyi chos rnams ni ci rigs par 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa de dag nyid skal ba mnyam pa dang kun du 'gro ba dang lhan cig 'byung ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyur gyur pa
translated: since it is said, ‚ÄúThe neutral is taught to be the revealed and unrevealed.‚Äù

original: dag gis lung du ma bstan pa'i rgyu can yin gyi /üîΩgzhan dag gis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dag gis lung du ma bstan pa'i rgyu can yin gyi /üîΩgzhan dag gis ni ma yin no //
