original: sa gong ma pa rnams ni gzhan dag gis kyang yin no zhes bya ba der ni go sla'o //
analyzed: sa gong ma pa rnams ni gzhan dag gis kyang yin no zhes bya ba der ni go sla'o //
translated: The higher realms are also causes of other realms.

original: ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa rnams ni skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyus bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'i rgyu can yin no //
analyzed: ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa rnams ni skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyus bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'i rgyu can yin no //
translated: The unobscured-non-defined are the cause of obscured-non-defined through the homogeneous cause.

original: mi dge ba rnams ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: mi dge ba rnams ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pa yin no //
translated: The unwholesome are the cause of attachment, etc. in the realm of desire.üîΩThey are also the cause of the afflicted view of the self, etc. through the pervasive cause. This is the example here.üîΩThe wholesome of the realm of desire are the cause of the wholesome of the realm of fine-materiality through the homogeneous cause.

original: de dag kyang kun du 'gro ba'i rgyus 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa'i rgyu can yin te 'dir dper brjod pa ni 'di yin no //
analyzed: de dag kyang kun du 'gro ba'i rgyus 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa'i rgyu can yin te 'dir dper brjod pa ni 'di yin no //
translated: The wholesome of the realm of fine-materiality are the cause of the wholesome of the realm of immateriality through the homogeneous cause.üîΩThe wholesome of the realm of immateriality are the cause of the wholesome of the realm of immateriality through the homogeneous cause.üîΩThe wholesome of the realm of immateriality are the cause of the wholesome of the realm of fine-materiality through the pervasive cause.üîΩThe wholesome of the realm of fine-materiality are the cause of the wholesome of the realm of desire through the pervasive cause.üîΩThe wholesome of the realm of desire are the cause of the wholesome of the realm of desire through the homogeneous cause.üîΩThe wholesome of the realm of desire are the cause of the unwholesome of the realm of desire through the pervasive cause.üîΩThe unwholesome of the realm of desire are the cause of the unwholesome of the realm of desire through the homogeneous cause.üîΩThe unwholesome of the realm of desire are the cause of the wholesome of the realm of desire through the pervasive cause.üîΩThe unwholesome of the realm of desire are the cause of the wholesome of the realm of fine-materiality through the pervasive cause.üîΩThe unwholesome of the realm of desire are the cause of the wholesome of the realm of immateriality through the pervasive cause.üîΩThe unwholesome of the realm of desire are the cause of the unwholesome of the realm of fine-materiality through the pervasive cause.üîΩThe unwholesome of the realm of desire are the cause of the unwholesome of the realm of immateriality through the pervasive cause.

original: mi dge ba rnams so zhes khyad par du ma byas par 'byung ba'i phyir mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang / bsgom pas spang par bya ba rnams 'byung ste /üîΩ'di ni 'dir khungs gnyis pa yin no //
analyzed: mi dge ba rnams so zhes khyad par du ma byas par 'byung ba'i phyir mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang / bsgom pas spang par bya ba rnams 'byung ste / 'di ni 'dir khungs gnyis pa yin no //
translated: The unwholesome of the realm of desire are the cause of the obscured-non-defined of the realm of desire through the pervasive cause.üîΩThe unwholesome of the realm of desire are the cause of the unobscured-non-defined of the realm of desire through the pervasive cause.

original: de dag las gzhan pa sdug bsngal gyi bden pa nyon mongs pa can gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni khungs gsum pa yin te /
analyzed: de dag las gzhan pa sdug bsngal gyi bden pa nyon mongs pa can gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni khungs gsum pa yin te /
translated: The unwholesome of the realm of desire are the cause of the unwholesome of the realm of fine-materiality through the pervasive cause

original: de dag las gzhan pa sdug bsngal gyi bden pa nyon mongs pa can ni bye brag tu ma phye ba'i phyir mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba rnams gzung ste /
analyzed: de dag las gzhan pa sdug bsngal gyi bden pa nyon mongs pa can ni bye brag tu ma phye ba'i phyir mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba rnams gzung ste /
translated: Other afflicted states of the truth of suffering are not differentiated, so they are taken as objects abandoned by the path of seeing and objects abandoned by the path of meditation.

original: so so'i skye bo rnams kyi bzhin du 'phags pa rnams kyi bsgom pas spang bar bya ba yang kun du 'gro ba'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu can yin gyi 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu ni ma yin no zhes de ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo rnams kyi bzhin du 'phags pa rnams kyi bsgom pas spang bar bya ba yang kun du 'gro ba'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu can yin gyi 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu ni ma yin no zhes de ni bshad zin to //
translated: It has already been explained that, like those of ordinary beings, the objects abandoned by the path of meditation of ƒÅryas are the result of the pervasive afflicted view of the self, but they are not the cause of the afflicted view of the self.üîΩIf they are the result of nonvirtuous and neutral causes, but not only the result of nonvirtuous causes,

original: 'o na btags pa'i bshad pa ni zhes bya ba ni gal te mi dge ba lung du ma bstan pa'i rgyu can dag kyang yin gyi mi dge ba'i rgyu can 'ba' zhig ni ma yin na /
analyzed: 'o na btags pa'i bshad pa ni zhes bya ba ni gal te mi dge ba lung du ma bstan pa'i rgyu can dag kyang yin gyi mi dge ba'i rgyu can 'ba' zhig ni ma yin na /
translated: then the commentary on the compendium of Abhidharma would not exist.

original: btags pa'i bshad pa yod de /
analyzed: btags pa'i bshad pa yod de /
translated: The commentary on the compendium of Abhidharma states:

original: 'phags pa'i gang zag 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba las @198a * //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i gang zag 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba las @198a * //
translated: ‚ÄúIf ƒÅryas who are free from attachment to the desire realm

original: yongs su nyams pa de las dang por nyon mongs pa can gyi sems pa mngon du byed pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ji ltar drang /üîΩbtags pa'i bshad pa'i don ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba las yongs su nyams pa'i che ni 'phags pa'i gang zag gi sems pa lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyus mi dge ba'i rgyu can kho na yin gyi lung du ma bstan
analyzed: yongs su nyams pa de las dang por nyon mongs pa can gyi sems pa mngon du byed pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ji ltar drang / btags pa'i bshad pa'i don ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba las yongs su nyams pa'i che ni 'phags pa'i gang zag gi sems pa lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyus mi dge ba'i rgyu can kho na yin gyi lung du ma bstan
translated: The first is when one manifests an afflicted mind from that complete degeneration.üîΩThe meaning of the explanation of the designation is that when one degenerates from freedom from attachment to the desire realm, the nonvirtuous mind that arises simultaneously with the mind of an ƒÅrya is a cause of the mind of an ƒÅrya through being a coemergent cause and a concomitant cause, but it is not a cause of the neutral mind because the afflicted view of the self and extreme view have been abandoned.

original: pa'i rgyu can ni ma yin te 'jig tshogs dang mthar 'dzin par lta ba dag spangs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin par 'gyur ro snyam pa'i bsam pa 'dis rgol bar byed do //
analyzed: pa'i rgyu can ni ma yin te 'jig tshogs dang mthar 'dzin par lta ba dag spangs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin par 'gyur ro snyam pa'i bsam pa 'dis rgol bar byed do //
translated: This is the intention of the opponent.

original: bye brag tu smra bas de ni rgyu ma spangs pa la dgongs nas gsungs pa yin gyi zhes bya ba smos te btags pa'i bshad pa 'di ni lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu las dgongs shing thugs la dgongs nas gsungs pa yin te
analyzed: bye brag tu smra bas de ni rgyu ma spangs pa la dgongs nas gsungs pa yin gyi zhes bya ba smos te btags pa'i bshad pa 'di ni lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu las dgongs shing thugs la dgongs nas gsungs pa yin te
translated: This explanation of the term is stated from the perspective of the coemergent cause and the concomitant cause,

original: / sems pa de'i rgyu mthong bas spang bar bya ba 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa ni mthong ba'i lam gyis spangs zin pa'i phyir btags pa'i bshad pa las ma gsungs so //
analyzed: / sems pa de'i rgyu mthong bas spang bar bya ba 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa ni mthong ba'i lam gyis spangs zin pa'i phyir btags pa'i bshad pa las ma gsungs so //
translated: because the cause of that volition, such as the afflicted view of the self that is to be abandoned by the path of seeing, is already abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: mi dge ba rnams dang dge ba'i chos zag pa dang bcas pa rnams zhes bya ba ni mi dge ba rnams ni zag pa dang bcas pa kho na yin pas bye brag tu ma byas so //
analyzed: mi dge ba rnams dang dge ba'i chos zag pa dang bcas pa rnams zhes bya ba ni mi dge ba rnams ni zag pa dang bcas pa kho na yin pas bye brag tu ma byas so //
translated: Nonvirtuous and virtuous contaminated phenomena are called contaminated because nonvirtuous states are contaminated alone.

original: dge ba dag ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: dge ba dag ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Virtuous states are of two types:

original: zag pa dang bcas pa dag kyang yin zag pa med pa dag kyang yin pas de'i phyir dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa gang dag yin pa de dag rnam par smin pa'i rgyu yin gyi zag pa med pa dag ni ma yin no zhes bye brag tu
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa dag kyang yin zag pa med pa dag kyang yin pas de'i phyir dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa gang dag yin pa de dag rnam par smin pa'i rgyu yin gyi zag pa med pa dag ni ma yin no zhes bye brag tu
translated: ‚ÄúThose virtuous contaminated phenomena are karmic maturation causes, but uncontaminated phenomena are not.‚Äù

original: byed do // rnam par smin pa'i chos can yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rnam par smin pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //üîΩstobs chung ba'i phyir te sa bon rul ba bzhin no zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni ji ltar sa bon rul ba dag stobs chung ba'i phyir mngon par brlan kyang myu gu skye ba'i rgyur mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du lung du ma bstan pa'i chos
analyzed: byed do // rnam par smin pa'i chos can yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rnam par smin pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // stobs chung ba'i phyir te sa bon rul ba bzhin no zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni ji ltar sa bon rul ba dag stobs chung ba'i phyir mngon par brlan kyang myu gu skye ba'i rgyur mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du lung du ma bstan pa'i chos
translated: Because they possess karmic maturation means because they have the nature of karmic maturation.üîΩBecause they are weak, like rotten seeds.

original: rnams sred par mngon par brlan kyang rnam par smin pa skye ba'i rgyur mi 'gyur te stobs chug ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnams sred par mngon par brlan kyang rnam par smin pa skye ba'i rgyur mi 'gyur te stobs chug ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Just as rotten seeds do not become the cause of sprouts even when moistened by craving, because they are weak, so too neutral phenomena do not become the cause of the arising of karmic maturation even when moistened by craving, because they are weak.

original: zag pa med pa rnams ni stobs dang ldan yang sred pas mngon par ma brlan pa'i phyir rnam par smin @198b pa 'grub par mi byed do //
analyzed: zag pa med pa rnams ni stobs dang ldan yang sred pas mngon par ma brlan pa'i phyir rnam par smin @198b pa 'grub par mi byed do //
translated: Even though uncontaminated states are powerful, they do not generate karmic maturation because they are not moistened by craving.

original: dper na sa bon grung po skam po rnams chu dag gis ma brlan pa'i phyir myu gu 'grub par mi byed pa de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: dper na sa bon grung po skam po rnams chu dag gis ma brlan pa'i phyir myu gu 'grub par mi byed pa de dang 'dra'o //
translated: For example, even though seeds are fresh and moist, they do not generate sprouts if they are not moistened by water.

original: snga ma dag ni rang gi mthu med pa yin no //
analyzed: snga ma dag ni rang gi mthu med pa yin no //
translated: The former are not powerful.

original: gzhan dag ni lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu gzhan med pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu gzhan med pa yin no //
translated: The latter are not complete because they lack other coemergent causes.

original: gang dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni khams gang dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: gang dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni khams gang dang ldan pa ste /
translated: What is meant by ‚Äúendowed with‚Äù is endowed with which realm.

original: ldan pa ma yin pa 'dod pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa zag pa med pa rnams gang dang ldan pa'i rnam par smin pa zhig mngon par 'grub par byed par 'gyur /
analyzed: ldan pa ma yin pa 'dod pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa zag pa med pa rnams gang dang ldan pa'i rnam par smin pa zhig mngon par 'grub par byed par 'gyur /
translated: What karmic maturation is generated by being endowed with the non-associated formative factors of the desire realm and so on, or by being endowed with the uncontaminated states?

original: rnam par smin pa ni ldan pa yin par 'gyur gyi mi ldan pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa ni ldan pa yin par 'gyur gyi mi ldan pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Karmic maturation is generated by being endowed with the formative factors, not by being non-endowed.

original: 'dod pa'i khams la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i chos kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i chos kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are the entities that possess the desire realm, etc.

original: lhag ma rnams ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni lhag ma mi dge ba rnams dang dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa rnams ni rnam pa gnyi ga yin zhing rnam pa gnyis yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni lhag ma mi dge ba rnams dang dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa rnams ni rnam pa gnyi ga yin zhing rnam pa gnyis yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: The remaining are both, because they are both,

original: stobs dang ldan pa dang mngon par brlan pa'i rnam pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba tha tshig go //
analyzed: stobs dang ldan pa dang mngon par brlan pa'i rnam pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba tha tshig go //
translated: because they are both powerful and moistened.

original: de dag ni rnam par smin pa 'grub par byed de /
analyzed: de dag ni rnam par smin pa 'grub par byed de /
translated: They establish the result of karmic maturation,

original: dper na sa bon grung po mngon par brlan pa rnams kyis myu gu mngon par 'grub par byed pa dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: dper na sa bon grung po mngon par brlan pa rnams kyis myu gu mngon par 'grub par byed pa dang 'dra'o //
translated: like moist seeds that establish a sprout.

original: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu zhig ces bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gal te rnam par smin pa zhes bya ba rnam par smin pas na rnam par smin pa'o zhes bya bar ngo bor bsgrub na ni rnam par smin pa'i rgyu zhes drug par bsdu ba yin
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu zhig ces bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gal te rnam par smin pa zhes bya ba rnam par smin pas na rnam par smin pa'o zhes bya bar ngo bor bsgrub na ni rnam par smin pa'i rgyu zhes drug par bsdu ba yin
translated: If the cause of karmic maturation is established as a substance, as in ‚Äúthat which is called karmic maturation is matured, thus it is karmic maturation,‚Äù then it would be included in the sixth case, the genitive.

original: no // 'on te bdag nyid rnam par smin par 'gyur bas zhes las su sgrub na ni de la rnam par smin pa nyid rgyu yin pas rnam par smin pa'i rgyu'o zhes las kyi gzhir bya ba yin no //
analyzed: no // 'on te bdag nyid rnam par smin par 'gyur bas zhes las su sgrub na ni de la rnam par smin pa nyid rgyu yin pas rnam par smin pa'i rgyu'o zhes las kyi gzhir bya ba yin no //
translated: But if it is established as an action, as in ‚Äúit itself is matured,‚Äù then it would be the basis of the seventh case, the dative, since karmic maturation itself is the cause, it is the cause of karmic maturation.

original: des na cir 'gyur zhes bya ba ni des des na nyes pa cir 'gyur zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: des na cir 'gyur zhes bya ba ni des des na nyes pa cir 'gyur zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: What is the problem with that?

original: gal te rnam par smin pa'i rgyu zhes bya bar ngo bo sgrub par bzung na ni mig rnam par smin pa las skyes pa yin no zhes bya bar der mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te rnam par smin pa'i rgyu zhes bya bar ngo bo sgrub par bzung na ni mig rnam par smin pa las skyes pa yin no zhes bya bar der mi 'gyur te /
translated: If the cause of karmic maturation is taken to be established as a substance, it would not be said that the eye is arisen from karmic maturation.

original: mig ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mig ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa ma yin no //
translated: The eye is not arisen from karmic maturation.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What is it then?

original: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu las las zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu las las zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: The cause of karmic maturation is called ‚Äúaction‚Äù because it is the cause of karmic maturation.

original: rnam par smin pa ni rgyu ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa ni rgyu ma yin no //
translated: Karmic maturation is not the cause.

original: 'on te rnam par smin pa nyid rgyu yin pas zhes las su sgrub par gzung na ni /
analyzed: 'on te rnam par smin pa nyid rgyu yin pas zhes las su sgrub par gzung na ni /
translated: But if you maintain that the cause of karmic maturation is called ‚Äúaction‚Äù because it is the cause of karmic maturation,

original: las kyang rnam @199a * //
analyzed: las kyang rnam @199a * //
translated: then since action is also the result of karmic maturation,

original: par smin par 'gyur bas rnam par smin pa yin pa'i phyir mig rnam par smin pa las skyes pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni 'grub mod kyi /
analyzed: par smin par 'gyur bas rnam par smin pa yin pa'i phyir mig rnam par smin pa las skyes pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni 'grub mod kyi /
translated: it is established that the eye is derived from karmic maturation because it is the result of karmic maturation.

original: 'on kyang las kyi rnam par smin pa zhes bya ba der ni mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'on kyang las kyi rnam par smin pa zhes bya ba der ni mi 'gyur te /
translated: But it is not established that it is the cause of karmic maturation.

original: rnam par smin pa ni las kho na la bya'i //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa ni las kho na la bya'i //
translated: Karmic maturation is called ‚Äúaction‚Äù because it is the cause of karmic maturation.

original: rnam par smin pa ni ma yin la /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa ni ma yin la /
translated: But it is not the cause of karmic maturation.

original: las kyi rnam par smin pa zhes bya ba 'dir ni ngo bo sgrub pa'i don du bzhed kyi las su sgrub pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: las kyi rnam par smin pa zhes bya ba 'dir ni ngo bo sgrub pa'i don du bzhed kyi las su sgrub pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Here, the meaning of ‚Äúcause of karmic maturation‚Äù is accepted as the establishment of the nature of karmic maturation, but not as the establishment of action.

original: de lta bas na las kyi rnam par smin pa zhes bya ba der mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bas na las kyi rnam par smin pa zhes bya ba der mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it is not established that it is the cause of karmic maturation.

original: gnyis ka ltar yang rung ngo zhes sngar bshad zin to zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gnyis ka ltar yang rung ngo zhes sngar bshad zin to zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This has already been explained.üîΩThis has already been explained in the AbhidharmaüîΩin the passage:

original: rnam par smin pa las skyes pa dang / rgyas las byung ba nang gi lnga //üîΩzhes bya ba der bshad zin te /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa las skyes pa dang / rgyas las byung ba nang gi lnga // zhes bya ba der bshad zin te /
translated: The five internal are born from fruition and enhancement.

original: der rnam par smin pa'i rgyu las skyes pa ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa ste /
analyzed: der rnam par smin pa'i rgyu las skyes pa ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa ste /
translated: In that passage, that which is born from the cause of karmic maturation is born from fruition.üîΩThe middle word is elided, like in the expression ‚Äúox-cart.‚Äù

original: bar gyi tshig mi mngon par byas pa'i phyir ba lang gi shing rta zhes bya ba lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni ngo bo bsgrub par gzung ba yin no //
analyzed: bar gyi tshig mi mngon par byas pa'i phyir ba lang gi shing rta zhes bya ba lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni ngo bo bsgrub par gzung ba yin no //
translated: This is the establishment of the nature.
